1.content:
Ash never thought this could've happened to him. There he was, less than an Inch tall.

Bout as near as he could tell He'd somehow been transported to a reality where cartoon characters exist, and they are incredibly huge giants to him. Hard to believe? Well if you had told him a week ago he was going to be less than an inch tall and in this situation he wouldv'e asked what you were smokeing and where could he could get some. How he ended up in this mess in the first place is a mystery.

The day had started off so normally, Ash had just finished breakfast and thought, why not go for a walk? It was a nice warm morning, not a cloud in the sky. So he decided to talk a walk down to the lake. To get there you had to walk through a wooded area and right away he should have known something wasn't right. The wooded area was completely quite. At that time of the year and that early in the morning you'd normally hear the sounds of birds and other types of animal activity, but that day it was so quiet Ash could've heard a flea fart.

looking back he couldn't remember much about what happened next. He remember being abruptly picked up off the ground by an invisible force. There was a bright flash of light and the next thing he knew he was lying on my back. Ash opened his eyes. Looking around he knew right away was no longer in the woods.

Where in the hell was he?

(So what cartoon world will Ash be trapped in?)
1.title: The Begining

11.content:
"What the--what's that smell?"

Ash found himself in what looked like a huge synthetic cave. The only source of light was large opening in the ceiling at one end. The floor was he was lying on didn't feel like anything he had ever lied on before. It almost felt like cloth made with once inch thick nylon rope. The whole floor was covered in it.

He felt different, nothing he could put his finger on but something didn’t feel right. He was sure of one thing,he couldn’t lie down forever. The first time he tried to stand up Ash immediately fell straight back down on his ass. After sitting for a moment breathing in the odd smelling air, he tried to sit up again. This time he stayed on his feet.

Taking another look around he noticed the floor wasn't even. There were huge indentations in the floor, as something heavy with a round-ish surface had been pressed into it. And inside the indentations the colour of the fabric was darker, almost blackened. This was an alien environment and yet strangely familiar. Ash noticed something on the floor not far from him. Curious, he walked over to it. At first he didn't quite know what it was but as he looked at it some more he realized he was looking at a huge Number printed in the fabric.

(What was the number?)
11.title: Arthur (PBS)

111.content: So where will this new portal transport Ash?
111.title: A portal suddenly appears

1111.content: Will you enter this world sometime around the first movie, the second, or some other time period?
1111.title: How to Train your Dragon

11112.content:
Before Ash had a chance to look at the fabric, there was another bright flash of light and he was whisked away again. When he came to, he found himself sitting on green ground, with the grass around him growing twice as high as he was.

"Oh my god, oh my god...."

He couldn't believe it. Wooden huts lined up a distance away, and while their designs suggested they were for only a few people, or a singe family at their largest, they had the size of castles from Ash's perspective. A breeze blew through the grass, nearly knocking him over.

"Oh, this is bad," Ash muttered. "I don't even know where I am-"

A distant boom silenced him. Then came another, louder. Then another, even louder, and the ground trembled beneath his feet. Someone was walking towards him! Looking up in awe, Ash watched as a giant approached him, appearing over 400 feet tall to the shrunk boy. It was...
11112.title: How to Train Your Dragon 2

choices: Hiccup ended up taking him home.
Hiccup goes to ask someone else for help.
111121.content:
Ash slowly backed away, staring up in amazement, as the person rounded the corner of the building. It was a tall boy, just out of his teens it seemed, wearing a leather suit of armor. His left foot had been replaced with a metal prosthetic - which Ash realized was rapidly heading for him.

"Hey! Hey, look out!" Ash jumped up and down, trying to get out of the giant's path while at the same time trying to get his attention. He waved his hands above his head. "Down here, hey!"

The ground trembled more and more with each crashing footfall, but as the giant came close he paused, seeming to snap out of his daydream. He looked around, puzzled.

"Down here!" Ash continued to shout.

Finally the giant turned his eyes downward, and finally spotted Ash. His mouth hung open in surprise as he knelt on one knee, placing his palm against the ground as he bent forward, trying to get a better view.

Ash suddenly felt fearful as the giant loomed over him, wondering if he'd made the right choice in getting his attention. This boy was the height of an office building, and his feet were easily eight or nine times as long as Ash was tall.

"What on earth...?"

The giant spoke softly, but his voice still rolled like thunder to Ash. Taking his free hand, he reached down and carefully pushed Ash against his palm using his thumb - a thumb, Ash realized, that was longer and thicker than he was.

The giant stood now, leveling his open palm with the ground, and Ash felt himself pressed against its fleshy surface as he rocketed up to the sky. After the G-forces stopped, he pushed himself into a sitting position, and found himself held close to the giant's chest, covered in leather padding. He looked up at the boy's face - green eyes and a handsome freckled expression, framed with brown hair.

"Who are you?" The giant's voice asked, and Ash had to clap his hands over his ears to stop the cacophony from blowing his eardrums. "Sorry! Sorry..." He whispered this time. "Who are you?"

"I, uh..." He raised his voice. "I'm Ash. I'm...not from around here. I don't know how I got here, some kind of weird portal I guess." He didn't know what else to say - he didn't know if asking "Please don't eat me" would be taken in a way that would end unpleasantly for him.

"Heh," the giant bit his lip, thinking. "That's...unusual. But here, I'll see what I can do with you. I'm Hiccup, by the way." He flashed a smile, before looking up. "I gotta figure out what I'm going to do with you. Come on..."

His armor was held together by three belts around his torso, and underneath one of these belts he slipped Ash. Ash hooked his arms over them, securing himself. His feet didn't protrude out the bottom, but it wasn't too uncomfortable. Now Hiccup began walking again, his up and down motions feeling like a roller coaster to Ash. He was warm, pressed up against the armor, and he could have sworn he heard a gurgle from Hiccup's stomach. Closing his eyes and sighing, he sincerely prayed that he was going to end up okay.
111121.title: Hiccup

choices: Ash loses his grip and falls to the ground
Ash keeps his grip and doesn't fall
1111211.content:
"So, er..." Ash hollered as he clung to Hiccup's belt. "Where are we going?"

"I'm taking you home," Hiccup muttered. "You should be safe there for now, there are a few people around here that you don't want to run into if you're the size you are now."

Ash sighed as he looked at the ground, hundreds of feet below him. The air whipped in his face as Hiccup's steps - his foot was so big it could flatten a city bus in one stomp - boomed far down where he stared.

Hiccup turned a corner around the buildings, leading to what must have been the village center. Ash gasped.

There were more people, yes, all giants to Ash - but there were dragons too. In fact, the dragons were even bigger than the people! If Hiccup was a skyscraper, some of these dragons were an entire city.

"Oh my God!" Ash breathed, and he clutched to the belt even more tightly. He looked on in panic as a large black dragon came bounding up to them.

"Hey Toothless!" Hiccup called out. Oh no, why is he calling it?! Ash thought. The dragon warbled, and butted his head against Hiccup's chest. "Hey, cut it out!" he laughed.

Hiccup felt it only as a playful push, but it jolted Ash. He tried to maintain his grip, but the whiplash made him loosen his hold on the belt. "Oh no, no no no no..." He felt himself slipping out from between the belt and Hiccup's torso...
1111211.title: Through the Village

choices: Hiccup smiles back, and they figure out what to do
Hiccup smirks, a bit evilly...could he have a dark side?
11112112.content:
Ash threw both of his arms forward, making a final desperate bid to cling to his hold. Thankfully, it held, and he pushed himself back into a more stable position.

"Woah there!" Hiccup's hands came down, and his massive fingers felt at Ash. "You alright?"

"Yeah..." He gasped back. "Yeah, just almost fell!"

"I could feel that..." Hiccup breathed a sigh of relief. "Don't want to lose you! Here, Toothless? This is Ash."

Ash watched as the dragon leaned in close and gave a sniff, whipping his hair into a frenzy. Then it snorted, blowing some foul fish-smelling breath on him, and whined in curiosity. It cocked its head to see him better. Ash stared into the eyes, each at least twice as tall as he was.

"Don't worry, Toothless is harmless, aren't ya bud?" He laughed as the dragon gave a gentle lick, inundating Ash with saliva. "Here, come on, I gotta get going home. You play around, I'll come back and get you, alright?"

Toothless seemed to nod in agreement, and bounded off. Ash kept his iron grip on the belt, hardly daring to believe he had just been eye-to-eye with a dragon.

Hiccup kept walking, and the rest of the path home was uneventful. Soon they approached a massive looming structure (which seemed to be just a hut to the giant) and went inside, closing the door.

"Whew!" Ash sighed in relief as Hiccup took him out of the belt, holding him in his warm palm again. "Gee, thanks for finding me and taking care of me, I really appreciate it!" He looked up smiling at the giant.
11112112.title: Just Hang On!

choices: Ask Hiccup to Speak to Gothi
111121121.content:
"Don't worry about it." Hiccup lowered his hand to the table, and Ash clambered off. The giant sat down, his hands folded before his guest and his head hunched over. "So...how exactly did you get like this?"

Ash tried to explain as much as he could, all the while staring up at Hiccup's face. His green eyes were huge, as big as himself! All the time, Hiccup listened patiently.

"Well, I, uh..." he ran his enormous fingers through his hair. "I don't really know what to do to help you. I can talk to Gothi, if you want, but she doesn't have magic like that, I don't think. Otherwise, you could stay with me here?"
111121121.title: Hiccup smiles back, and they figure out what to do

choices: At that moment, a growl comes from his stomach
He wants to play around with you a bit
111121122.content:
The grin on Hiccup's face unsettled Ash, and he clasped his hands in front of him, letting his own smile melt away. "H-Hiccup?"

The giant curled his hand into a fist around Ash, leaving just enough room between the fingers for him to peek his head through the space between the thumb and pointer.Doing so, Ash saw him seizing a massive chair from the equally massive table and wedging it underneath the door handle.

"W-what are you-"

"Just going to have a little fun." The tone in his voice hinted to Ash that this fun was probably only going to be for Hiccup. He drew shades across the windows, leaving a fire in the mantle as the only light in the roomThe giant sat down at the table in a second chair, leering down at his fist. "Did you know when I was younger, everyone used to push me around?"

Ash shook his head, hoping to give him what he wanted.

"Oh yeah. People always just shoving me around!" He flung his hands out at this, keeping his grip on Ash and forcing the poor guy to get jerked up into the air. "Just back and forth: Hiccup sharpen this, Hiccup keep an eye on that, oh you messed this up!" He kept gesticulating wildly, giving Ash whiplash every time he swung his hands. "My point is, everyone was always putting me down, and I didn't really like it."

He released Ash now a few inches above the table - except it seemed like ten feet to the tiny guy. Ash collapsed as he hit the surface, wheezing as he tried to get a grip on his surroundings. Everything was spinning, and his neck hurt from being thrashed around so much...

And now he felt his shirt bunch up between his shoulder blades, and a grip from underneath his armpits. He was lifted into the air by Hiccup, who clutched him with two fingers. Ash stopped in front of Hiccup's face, each brilliant green eye wider across than he was tall. His freckles danced in the firelight, and his mouth curled into a devilish sneer.

"I think it's time for my turn to be top dog."
111121122.title: Hiccup smirks, a bit evilly...could he have a d...

choices: Another flash of light - the portal strikes again!
1111211221.content:
A muffled growl came from Hiccup's stomach - although to Ash, it sounded like a roll of thunder. Both looked down at the noise's source, then at each other.

"No..." Ash shook his head, horror growing in his chest. "No, please-"

Hiccup placed his right foot on the table and leaned back in his chair, crossing his left leg over his right. He brought Ash to look down over his face, and rested his other hand on his gut. He licked his lips.

"No no, please!" Ash thrashed around in the giant's grasp. "You can't do this to me!"

"Why not? I'm hungry," he patted his stomach, "and you're just the perfect bite-size snack for me."

"God, no! I'm not food!"

"I'll see about that." He closed his eyes, and licked his lips again. He let his mouth hang open as he lowered Ash towards his waiting maw.

Ash's shouts and screams did him no good. He came down towards the mouth, where the teeth were half as tall as he was, certainly large enough to pulverize him. He could see the tongue, searching for the coming food, as big as a rug. Beyond that, there was only darkness down to the throat. Hiccup sighed, and a humid stench blew up from his mouth. Ash coughed and gagged as he drew closer, practically able to reach down and kick at the handsome stubble lining Hiccup's chin.
1111211221.title: Hiccup

choices: Hiccup chew Ash - be safe with food!
11112112211.content:
The fingers let go, and Ash falls right on his back atop the waiting tongue. He quickly turns around, the muscle squishing under his hands and knees, as the floor begins to grow steeper. Hiccup is tilting his head back, and as Ash watches, the silhouettes of the teeth frame a view of the wall turning into a view of the ceiling. He clutches closer to the tongue.

Then the teeth close, and everything goes dark.

"No! No! Help!" Hiccup could hear him screaming. The tiny guy hammered against the roof of his mouth, clawed at his teeth, did everything he could to gain his freedom. It very much amused him. With a slight chuckle, he his one hand behind his head, leaving the other on his stomach. Then he really tried to enjoy the little guy's taste. Hiccup could feel his tongue tumbling over the tiny man, tossing him back and forth across his mouth. Rather enjoyable, he thought.

Ash found it not at all enjoyable. He faced off against a foe four times his size, a foe that crashed him against the teeth and pinned him against the hard roof of the mouth. He broke an arm, he was sure of it, and probably a few ribs, not to mention the times his head banged into the teeth so hard that he almost blacked out.

Hiccup began to calm down. The little guy did taste pretty nice, kind of salty and savory. Fabric in the way, but still good. But, it was time.
11112112211.title: Yum!

choices: Ash resigns himself to an unpleasant fate
Ash tries to find some way to get himself out
111121122111.content:
Ash felt Hiccup tilt his head back a bit more, and his tongue arched, pushing Ash against the roof of the mouth. He was dragged along the ridged surface, and saliva began to flood around him. Hiccup also cracked open his mouth a bit, letting a dim light in that let Ash see.

"Oh god..." He realized what was about to happen - he gazed into the dark abyss of the throat. "Oh god, no please, don't!"

With a terrifying squelch, the tongue pushed him forward, and he fell in the throat along with a shower of saliva. The tight muscles, much larger and far more powerful than he was, squeezed in and for a while he could hardly breathe. As he was passed along, the booming of a massive heartbeat grew loud, and then softer, along with an almost deafening sound of breathing.

After a few seconds, which seemed like a hellish eternity, Ash found himself expelled into the stomach, where he landed on his back in the acids. It was pitch black, and the air was close. He tried to take a breath, and felt himself choke on the lack of oxygen.

Hiccup, meanwhile, licked his lips. "Now that made today a little more interesting!" He dropped his feet to the ground, sitting up in the chair again, then stood and walked out the door.

These motions first knocked Ash to the other side of the stomach, then transformed his already treacherous environment into a tremulous pit of death that stirred with every footfall of Hiccup's. Ash realized he didn't have long before he passed out, and he did NOT plan on being someone's lunch today. But was there any hope for him?
111121122111.title: Gulp!

111121122112.content:
Ash felt himself pushed and shoved again, this time being rolled towards the molars. The tongue wedged him into position, and the teeth gripped him from the top and bottom.

"Oh no..."

Hiccup bit down. A short muffled scream was cut off by the burst of liquid in his mouth, like biting into a berry - except this berry had bones, of course, that made a satisfying crunch. The sour iron taste spread in his mouth, and Hiccup realized a bit dribbled from his lips. He wiped it with his fingers, still chewing. He could feel his teeth grinding Ash into a paste, bones being pulverized with each bite, and he knew that the guy was already close to liquefied.

With a thunderous gulp, he swallowed what remained of Ash, and with a sigh rubbed his stomach again.

"That should be a good appetizer," he said. With that, he set both feet on the floor, stood and left to go outside, leaving no one the wiser.
111121122112.title: Crunch!

choices: Giant teen? Tiny civilization? Time for a hostile takeover!
11112112212.content:
A blinding light suddenly made Hiccup vanish from Ash's sight, and he felt relieved. "Oh, thank God, that was too close!"

Now he traveled again to who-knew-where, and found himself...in a shrunken world, where he was the giant?

"What the heck...?"

No no, he wasn't giant. In fact, looking at the buildings, he realized he was back on his own, normally-sized Earth. A cry of joy leapt from his throat - he was home!

But then...why did everything look so small?

That's when he realized that his own feet weren't touching the ground.

Hiccup's were.

With horror, Ash looked up and realized that Hiccup was still holding onto him with two pinched fingers - and towered over the downtown section of the city. Already his feet were blocking traffic, and who knew who was trapped underneath him when he landed.

"Wow...." he whispered. "This...this is even better than I thought!"

Ash felt sick to his stomach as Hiccup grinned and held him up again.

"You know what? I changed my mind. Since you got me here, I'll let you live. Here," he set Ash on his massive shoulder pad, and he had to cling to Hiccup's thick neck to stay standing. "You can watch me have some fun around here." In demonstration, he lifted his prosthetic, which was about as wide across as a bus, and slammed it down on some cars, flattening one and crushing the hood on another. People began running.
11112112212.title: Ash Goes Home!...with a Passenger

choices: He's starting to get full. Now, where is he going to sleep?
111121122121.content:
"Now before anything else," Hiccup licked his lips, "I still haven't gotten around to my snack..."

Ash clung for his life to the giant's neck, thanks a slight scruff that to Ash could be used as a lifeline, as Hiccup bent down and plucked a man from the sidewalk, holding him by his arm. The poor guy was only the length of Hiccup's thumbnail, and was suspended painfully by his arm as he was yanked into the air. Ash could hear him yelling as he was brought up to the giant's face. "Let's see..." Hiccup muttered, and he tilted his head back and dangled the little man above his open mouth. The yells turned to screaming, pleading for his life from the giant.

But it was all in vain. Hiccup just gave a little chuckle, nearly throwing Ash off his feet, before he released the tiny human. Ash looked up and watched as the man plummeted into Hiccup's mouth. There was a tremendous glurk, and Ash could see the bulge in Hiccup's throat as the man was transported to the stomach. Ash felt both terrified and disgusted to see the display going on.

After a few more people had been swallowed whole, Hiccup next picked up a green sedan from the street. It was just a little longer than the length of his thumb, and sat lengthwise across his palm, not extending past his hand. He looked like a kid who had found a Matchbox car.

"Now, what the heck are these?" he asked aloud.

Holding it lengthwise between his thumb and forefinger, he lifted it up to his eyes to peer inside. A grin appeared on his face. "Well what do you know?" He pinched the doors between his fingertips, and with no effort he tore them away. Then he shook the contents of the vehicle into his hand - two men and two women, scrambling to hold onto each other. Hiccup cupped his hand, held it to his mouth, and threw his head back, swallowing them all with another thundering gulp. Without looking, he then crushed the car in his one hand, crumpling it like foil, and dropped it to the ground where it made a deafening crash.

What will happen next?
111121122121.title: First Meal in Reality

111122.content: Was it astride looming over ash?
111122.title: Someone Else

1111221.content:
Ash jumped backed as the person's foot landed right next to him. He stared up to see a gigantic girl in her teens who was wearing light armor. Ash takes a breath and looks up at the giant girl. She didn't look dangerous. Minus almost being crushed unaware, she looks friendly enough to help him. Hey! Could you look down, Please!? He shouts.

The giant girl was in her own world until she heard a small voice. She looked around, but saw no one. I swear i heard someone screaming at the top of their lungs. She said.

Look down! Ash shouted.

Hearing the voice again, she looks down and sees Ash. She gasp in surprise as she saw him. W....What are.... How are.... She stammered. She had to make sure her eyes weren't playing tricks on her, so she got on her knee and picked him and poked him. Her finger was the size of building. She goes wide eyed when she find out your real. After the shock goes away, she rises to full height. Ash held on to her hand as she got up. After it was over, he looked up at the girl.

The girl had an assortment of questions to ask, but she decided to ask the most important ones. Who are you? She said. M-my name's Ash. I'm not from around here. He said. How did you get here? She said. Some portal brought me here. I know it sound crazy, but it's true. You said. And it made you like this? She said. I guess so..... He said. Ash didn't know what else to say. He was a little terrified of this girl.

Ok..... It's crazy like you said. She said. You....don't believe me? He said. It's hard to believe.... But you made yourself known, so you must wanted me to see you. And i'm guess you want me to help you somehow. She said. C.....can you? Is it possible? He said. I'll see what I can do. I'm Astride. Just so you know. Now where to put you? She said. She didn't have any pockets, and she wasn't going to carry you in her hand. She didn't want anyone to know about you just yet. There were only two places left. She could place him in her boot. It wasn't the pleasant of places, it would keep you hidden, and if she was careful with her step, safe. The other place would be....down her chest. Astride had a light blush as she thought about putting him there. It'd be a much nicer place for him and no one would notice. But she had some serious reservation about putting you there. She didn't know if he could be trusted to handle himself properly.

After a minute of thinking, Astride puts him...
1111221.title: Astride

1112.content: I have some other choices.
1112.title: Other choices

112.content:
It was a nine. A huge Number 9. The pieces suddenly fell into place.

"No, it can't be...." Ash said to himself. But there was no other explanation. He was in an impossibly huge shoe. Who in their right mind would make a shoe this big? He looked up though the mouth of the shoe and saw the ceiling of a vast room hundreds of feet above him. It finally dawned on him that he wasn’t in a huge shoe. The shoe was normal size. he was incredibly small.

Ash's heart started to pound, how the hell did this happen? What was going to happen next? Was Rod Sterling going to pop out of nowhere and do a monolog about the Twilight Zone? Or did he do that while Ash was unconscious?

Ash had to get out of there, that much was certain. He didn't want to meet up with the owner of the gigantic foot where. But the more he looked the more he came to the conclusion that the only way out was through the mouth of the shoe and that was way out of reach.

"I should have stayed in bed, but noooo. I had to go for a walk because it was such a nice day. Now my tiny ass was in somebody’s shoe...."

He sat down defeated.

A moment later Ash felt the first vibration.

Faint at first, but then grew in strength. Soon the vibrations were accompanied by muffled thuds that grew louder as the vibrations intensified. he stood and looked skywards, the vibrations traveling through his body. Ash's Jaw hit his chest as an enormous being came into view. He easily recognised the being from a cartoon he once watched, but this was no cartoon the person towering above him looked real. Ever seen those pictures of what cartoon characters might look like in real life? Same thing, only this person wasn't a computer generated character. This was all too real.

(Who was it?)

choices: Jane walks into the liveing room
1121.content:
Never in his life could Ash have imagined that such a huge being could even exist.

No question it was Jane Read, which meant he was in Arthur's house. What was worst, he was in deep trouble.Ash didn't know what she was going to do but she wasn't standing in front of a pair of shoes for nothing.

'Hey! Hey! Mrs Read! Hey! Down here!'

Jane looked down and at first Ash thought she had heard him. His first thought was 'Gee that was easy.' But then he noticed her eyes were directed to something left of his position. He watched as she lifted one sock covered foot and heard the sound of fabric on fabric as she inserted her foot into the shoe. he knew what was coming next and just ran straight for the toe of the shoe. Buy the time he had reached the toe, her foot was already halfway into the shoe.

Ash did the only thing he could do. As Jane's foot settled into the shoe he climbed up onto her sock covered toes and held onto the fabric of the sock as tightly as he could. he could hear the sound of velcro traps and then she took her first step.

THUD!!
THUD!!
THUD!!

Each footstep jarred him so badly Ash thought his arms were going to dislocate. He was doing everything he could to keep his grip on the sock. He hoped she wasn't walking very far.
1121.title: Jane Read (Arthur's Mother)

11211.content:
Damn, this was so easy in all those stories he'd read.

Ash had no Idea where she was heading, but hanging on was becoming increasingly difficult. His fingers were beginning to cramp up. By all rights he should have lost his grip and went flying with the first step Jane took. Must've been the adrenaline. He heard a door open and close. Outdoor sounds. More walking. Was that the sound of a car door opening? Finally, she came to a stop and then everything went twenty degrees and he tumbled away from the toes to almost her ankle. There was a loud rumble and he felt acceleration. The constant rumble told Ash she was driving. Where was another story but he didn't care, it was giving his cramped up fingers a chance to rest.

He struck his hands against Jane’s foot to get the feeling back in them. There was no reaction from her. That didn't surprise him at all. All things considering. He crawled up the length of her foot. Now was the perfect time to escape his shoe prison.Unfortunately when he reached the top of the shoe Ash found that Jane had her Velcro straps so tight he couldn’t squeeze between the tongue of the shoe and her foot to get out. So much for that idea.

It seemed he would be getting to know Jane's foot up close and personal, not that he mind. Despite his predicament he was naturally curious. Even in the dim lighting Ash could tell her foot was very much like a humans even through the sock. Nicely shaped too from what he could tell. He could almost forget this wasn’t a human, not that there was anything wrong with that. What was she suppose to be anyway? An Aardvark he guessed but she didn’t look like one.

Walking across her foot Ash figured it had to be at least twenty to twenty- eight feet across. There was a distinct smell of foot odor and lotion in the air and it was starting to get warm but not too warm. Through air holes in the shoe cool air from the air conditioning kept things comfortable. maybe this wouldn't be so bad after all.

Jane meanwhile had no idea she had a stowaway in her shoe. She drove on with her tiny passenger down town and parked the car in the parking lot of
11211.title: Jane is going shopping

11212.content:
Damn, this was so easy in all those stories he'd read.

Ash had no Idea where she was heading, but hanging on was becoming increasingly difficult. His fingers were beginning to cramp up. By all rights he should have lost his grip and went flying with the first step Jane took. Must've been the adrenaline. He heard a door open and close. Outdoor sounds. Finally, she came to a stop. Thank goodness. His fingers were so stiff he couldn't bend them.

Ash struck his hands against Jane’s foot as hard as he could to get the feeling back in them. There was no reaction from her. That didn't surprise him at all. At his present size, he figured his punches were as effective as a wet noodle. Come to think of it, the wet noodle was probably more effective.

Ash heard a something being opened high above him, sounded like a mailbox. he wasted no time and climbed up the front of her foot to the tongue of the shoe. It took a few moments for his eyes to adjust to the bright light. Looking up at Jane he could see she was checking the contents of the mailbox.

"Bills, Bills, Junk..."

This was so surreal. Here he was no bigger than a ant sitting on the foot of a Person who shouldn't even exist in a real environment. Had to make a quick decision. She was going to be moving again any second, he could stay were he was and hold on as she walked back into the house, or he could get off and take his chances out in the lawn.
11212.title: Checking the Mail

choices: Ash slides back into the shoe
Ash is flung through the air as Jane's foot swings forward.
112121.content:
'Leaveing Jane would be suicide.' Thought Ash 'There are too many things living in the lawn that could kill me. Not to mention the Godzilla sized inhabitants who live in this world.'

Thinking he had a better chance at survival if he stayed indoors Ash decided to stick with Jane for the moment. Problem was his hands were not 100% and he didn’t know if he could hang on anymore. Only one way to find out unfortunately.

Ash grabbed hold off the sock just as Jane turned and headed back to the house. As he had feared his grip was weaker than before and he found himself re-establishing his grip with each step and it was getting harder and harder to grip the over sized fabric. As Jane entered the house his grip failed again and this time his hands were so stiff he couldn’t grab hold of anything.

Ash found himself slipping as Jane lifted her foot to take another step.
112121.title: Stay with Jane

choices: There's a hole in the sock and Ash ends up between her toes
Ash is trapped under Jane's socked toes.
1121211.content:
"Not good! Not Good!"

This was most definitely not the place he wanted to go. Not that he had no choice in the matter.He'd read stories on line where the shrunken person ends up spending a whole day in a normal person's shoe. Sure it sounded like fun on paper but he could not see himself surviving that long, not after what he had just gone through. Every time Jane lifted her foot up to take another step he slid farther and farther down into her shoe. He would scurry back up as much as he could while her foot rested but it was a loosing battle. By the tenth of fifteenth step he was hanging onto her sock covered toes. He knew what was coming next, with her next step he'd be sliding completely off her foot and as she lifted her foot up again He'll be sliding past her toes and under the ball of her foot. And when that foot touched down and Jane puts her full weight on it, his minuscule body would be no match for a body weight roughly equivalent to 60000 tons.

As predicted her foot touched down a sixth time and Ash slid off her foot. Before he could try to climb back up Jane's foot was riseing upward again. He began to slid forward, as he did Jane lifted her toes up and he slid under them.
1121211.title: Ash slides back into the shoe

choices: The Front door (She's headed to daycare)
1121212.content:
Ash slid off Jane’s foot and hung momentarily from her shoe before continueing to side completely off her foot and stumbled to the floor. He sat there for a moment watching her walk away. How could something that big move so quickly?

‘Nah, don’t think about it, just accept it.’ he thought to myself. He looked at his hands, they were going to be sore for the next few days, if he lived that long. The way things were going he’d be lucky to last the next hour.

Not wanting to be caught in the middle of the floor he made his way to the nearest wall. It was a slow progress. All the while Ash was on the look out for The Giant occupants of the house. As he made my way, he couldn’t help but feel a little grateful that the Tibble twins didn’t live there. From what he recalled from the show they were extremly hyperactive. Too much sugar maybe.

The floor began to vibrate again. Ash doubled his efforts to get to the wall and was almost there when the giant came into view. DW was heading upstairs and Ash was in her path. Not wanting to die by four year old he ran as fast as he could and just made it clear as her foot slammed down just a few meters from where he was. Ash thought he was safe until something Heavy and made of cloth landed on top of him. She dropped something a moment later he felt something big encircle himself and the object on top of him, Ash was lifted into the air. He was being picked up! She was on the move again. Where was she taking Him?
1121212.title: Ash falls away from Jane

choices: DW see's Ash and Think's he's a toy
DW see's Ash and screams for Jane
DW see's Ash and thinks he's a Bug
DW see's Ash and is curious
11212121.content:
Ash couldn't see a thing but the cloth pressed around his body but it felt like DW was heading upstairs.

A few moments later and he was placed on top of something. He heard movement, the sounds of play. Ash crawled to the end of the fabric on top of him and peered out at his surroundings. He was in her bedroom on her bed. He looked to be under a sock. A clean one thank goodness. DW sat on the floor playing with a doll and a toy shark facing away from him. He didn't want to be there. No telling what would happen if she happened to see him.

Since she was in front of him Ash decided to crawl in the opposite direction, maybe find a way down the other side of the bed. But as he carefully inched away from her, he heard her get up and walk towards him. With a feeling of dread Ash knew what was about to happen. the sock was suddenly lifted away.
11212121.title: Upstairs to her bedroom

choices: Jane realizes the "Bug" is not a bug at all.
Jane drops the "bug" out the window.
112121212.content:
Ash looked up and saw DW towering him, her eyes wide and her mouth opened. Her reaction was normal for someone her age, and her scream was deafening.

Almost immediately, while His ears were ringing he heard footsteps of someone running towards the room.

A very concerned Jane ran into the room. "DW, what is it?"

Her young daughter pointed to her bed. "B-Bug!"

Jane walked up to her daughter and looked down at Ash. he had no idea what was coming next, but was expecting death. The expression on Jane's face however said the opposite.

"Sweetie, it's just a bug. It can't hurt you. Here, I'll get rid of it for you."

He watched as Jane reached down for him. What could he do? Running was out of a question. She could move much faster than he could run, and there was nowhere to run to. The tips of the thumb and forefinger closed around him, holding Ash in a firm but gentle grip. And as he was lifted off the bed and hundreds of feet into the air Ash was thankful for that. Pressed into her thumb he tried to see what Jane was going to do but just couldn't turn his neck that far. So instead he looked straight ahead at the friction ridges on the thumb.

"Are you going to kill it?"

"No, I'll just drop it out the window."

'Out the Window?! Cripes why don't she just crush me between her fingers and get it over with it!' He knew a fall from the top floor of the house would just turn him into a splatter shape stain on the walkway.

Jane felt the bug between her fingers struggle the moment she said she was going to drop it out the window. Probably just a coincidence but it was enough for her to pause for a moment and look more closely at the bug.
112121212.title: Jane

choices: Jane places him him on the bed.
Jane takes him with to show the rest of the family.
"Keep you in my Pocket for safe keeping."
1121212121.content:
Jane lifted the "bug" closer to her face. She quickly noticed it had only four limbs and a head. Just like a--

"Mom, did you get rid of it?"

Jane turned to her Daughter "looks like I squashed it between my fingers."

"Gross."

"I'm going to wash my hands."

As Jane left the room she placed the tiny creature into the palm of her other hand. It stood still as she carried it down the hall to her bedroom. She closed the door and sat on the side of the bed. She brought it closer to her face, so close that all Ash could see was her two eyes focusing on him. He stood up, he heard her gasp. She was surprised to see the 'Bug' Stand on two legs like a--

"Person." whispered Jane "You're a tiny person. "

A male as far as she could tell from the clothes. She reached out with the tip of her index finger which dwarfed the being in her palm. She watched him back away, she couldn't make out his facial expression but his body language told her he was uneasy.

"I'm not going to hurt you. My name is Jane."

She watched him reach out and touch the tip of her finger. It was amazing to feel the touch of such a tiny hand on her skin.

"Do you understand me?"

She saw him nod and felt two taps.

"Who are you?"

Jane could hear him but couldn't make out what he was saying. Maybe if he were closer to her ear she'd be able to hear him better. But right now, what was she to do with him? She could tell her husband and kids, she was sure they'd want to know. But a part of her, deep down and long forgotten, wanted to have a little bit of friendly fun.

"Do you trust me?"

Two Taps. Yes.

"Okay, Here's what I'm going to do..."
1121212121.title: Who Are You?

choices: Arthur her son came in at first not noticing you
Her daughter came back in and saw you!

She asked calmly as she placed him on the bed on the tip of her pillow where she could easily see him Ash shrugged "My name is Ash and I....I...can't really remember..." She smiled "Pleased to meet you but that's horrible you can't honestly remember how you shrunk to that awful size?" He shook his head "Hmmmm well then Ash was it? You can stay with me for the time being as I'm not sure how Kate will like the idea with me harboring a 'bug' but as long as you stay close by you should be....." There was a sudden and unexpected knock at the door as both of you looked up "Come in." Jane called as you quickly hid just as....
11212121211.title: Jane places him him on the bed.

1121212122.content:
With a shrug Jane moved her hand out to the open window.

"No! No Pl--"

A pity Jane couldn't hear him, if she could she wouldn't have released her grip. Ash slipped out between her fingers and watched the upstairs window reseed from view. He closed his eyes as he fell. He knew he was going to die, and he was too scared to want to see the hard concrete walkway below. He figured at his size his body would simply splatter like an egg, a red smear on the ground that would be trodden into the dust without a proper memorial. He hoped it wouldn't hurt.

But Fate had a different plan for Ash. As he fell, not knowing where he would land, Fern Walters happened to be walking up to the house. Mr. Ratburn had passed out an assignment for the class and Arthur was absent that day so she was bringing him over a copy. Looking straight ahead she didn't notice the spec of a human falling toward her, nor did he notice he was falling toward her since his eyes were closed tight. The big question was, where was he going to land?
1121212122.title: Free Fall

11212121221.content:
He'd expected to hit the unforgiving ground. Instead Ash had ended up in some sort of red material. As he shook off the disorientation , he was shocked to see that he was traveling rather fast away from the Read's home. It took him a few more moments to realize he had landed on someone's head, and another moment to recognize the bow that he'd landed on.

Fern Walters casually walked down the street, heading home after dropping off Arthur's homework. She had new clue she had a hitch hiker as she made her way to her home. As for the hitch hiker himself, Ash was wondering just what the heck he was going to do next. He was sorta safe at the moment but he couldn't very well stay on top of Fern's head forever. Sooner or later she was going to go to bed or a bath or something and he'd end off falling somewhere. Whether he wanted to or not he would have to get her attention somehow.

Looking down he saw that he wasn't that far from her floppy right ear. He could slip in and hopefully she would hear him. Was now the right time though? Maybe he should wait until she was in her room or at least indoors.
11212121221.title: On top of her head

choices: She suddenly reaches a hand to her head to scratch an itch
112121212212.content:
And so he waited. Other than having to hang on for dear life it was a ride unlike any other. He was literately riding the top of a living mountain that was traveling at an incredible speed even though to Fern it was a leisurely walk. As she walked, Ash couldn't help but think how insane the whole situation was. At the same time he had to accept that what was happening was real. The grey follicles of hair/fur he held onto certainly felt real enough. Too real for all of this to be a dream, and he'd had some vivid dreams in his day.

Then there was the fact that he really didn't know how Fern would react. In the cartoon Ash remembered her as being a nice person, but this wasn't a cartoon. He had no idea how she was going to react or do. For that reason alone he was feeling more and more apprehensive the more he thought about it.

Fern, unaware of her passenger, walked on.

After some time had passed she arrived at her destination which ,as Ash discovered, was her home. It looked exactly like in the show, only much much larger. The interior of the house was cooler, which suited Ash just fine as he found the outside world to be humidly warm. Almost unbearably so.

"Mom? Dad? Anybody home?"

When she called out Ash was tempted to plug his ears but couldn't because that would've meant letting go of his grip on the young giant's fur and he didn't want to do that. After calling out to her parents Fern's next stop was the kitchen where she found the note. They were gone out for groceries. It was dumbfounding to Ash how they would leave like that and not lock the front door, it never would've happened where he came from and hadn't happened since the 1950s. Were people that trusting around here?

With her parents gone out, Fern did what she usually did. She got herself a snack. In her case the one she generally went to was a small bowl of
112121212212.title: wait a while

choices: Climb back into the Back Pack
No Time. The bedroom door opens wide (who is it?)
False Alarm the footsteps go past the room
11212121222.content:
Ash opened his eyes. Was he in heaven?

No, not unless heaven was gigantic books and other school supplies. He was clearly in a backpack, but how did he end up in there? The last thing he recalled was falling, hitting something, going for a slide and falling some more. More importantly, who owned the back pack. Looking up at the stack off books he noticed the title of one of them was "The Red Headed League", a Sherlock Holmes Novel. That should've given him some kind of a clue.

Well, he couldn't very well stay in there. Looking about Ash found a hole in side of the backpack near the bottom where the sewing had unraveled a bit. It was small, and probably unnoticeable but just big enough to crawl through. Once out of the backpack he could see he was in a bedroom, A child's bedroom from the look of things. It was tidy and for the moment unoccupied. Ash looked out the window, it was nigh time. His first day in this strange yet familiar world was over, if only he knew which home he was in.

'At least it's not the Tibble Twins', Ash thought.

He had only walked a few feet toward the bed when he felt the ground shake under him. Shit, someone was coming and he didn't want to get mistaken for a bug. If he was even noticeable at all. Ash darted about the room looking for potential hiding places. Under the bed was an ideal choice but climb back into the backpack. The floor was shaking more strongly now. He had to make his choice fast.
11212121222.title: Fern's Bedroom

choices: The slippered foot just misses him.
112121212221.content:
As Ash ran as fast as he could toward the bed he realized a few things.

1) The bed was a lot farther away than he first thought.

2)Based on how strong the floor was shaking there was a less and less chance of him making it under the bed in time.

3) It was too late to turn back and hide in the slipper.

And just as he realized these three things the bedroom door swung open. A powerful gust of air knocked him to the floor. He turned over on his back and looked up and saw who had unintentionally saved him from becoming a splattered stain and brought him home without even knowing it. Fern was Dressed for bed with a glass of milk in one hand. Closing the door behind her she set the glass down at the computer desk slipped her Slippers on her bare feet. It looked to Ash that he might've been luck not to have chosen that hiding spot after all--Until she turned and began to walk toward him. Before he could try to get back up and run she was already upon him. In the Shadow of the young giantess Ash looked up and stared at the massive sole of the slipper as began its downward decent.

That vast white sole with much of the raised pebble pattern worn away with dust and debris falling way from it. There was a split second registration of weight and then he was aware of nothing.

Fern of course felt nothing through the material of her slipper. If she had been barefoot maybe. As it is, she didn't even here the crunch. She went about in her room with most the tiny corpse stuck to the bottom of her slipper; pulverizing it with each step until there was nothing left.

Nothing, but a red stain.

11212121222121.content:
Fern sat down on her bed and slipped off her slippers. She had not been wearing them for long so her feet weren't so sweaty. She swung her legs over on top of the bed and deposited Ash at her feet.

He gazed up and stared passed the grey soles to Fern's face.

"Could you rub them for me, please? They're sooooo sore."

Fern wiggled her toes and moved them closer to Ash.' Stay on her good side' he reminded himself.

"I-I can't reach." He called up. "Could you roll over on your stomach?"

"Okay!"

The bed shook and bed springs creaked and groaned as the Dog Girl rolled over. Ash was Knocked off his feet, but when the Fernquake had finally ended Ash was looking at the soles of two grey feet. He slowly approached them. He had given someone a foot rub before, so he knew how to do it. The question was, where to start?

He shrugged and climbed up onto the toes and made his way to the ball off the foot. Suddenly the foot rocked and he fell face first into the flesh of the sole. He heard Fern giggle.

"Careful Ashy, I'm ticklish."

The toes flexed and wiggled, making wrinkles in the sole. Ash's leg was caught in one such wrinkle but was released as the foot calmed down again.

Ash grumbled under his breath and was about to push himself up to a sitting position when he noticed something different about the surface of the sole. Other than it's color.

Despite having a very human like foot, Fern's foot didn't have the swirly dermal pattern that humans had. Instead her dermal surface was covered in closely set, conical papillae, that of a Dog.

He might not enjoy what he was about to do, but at lease he could study this monster's anatomy. He began to kneed his fists into the sole, not sure if he was doing anything effective. To his surprise he heard Fern sigh approvingly. Her skin must've been more sensitive than he'd first thought.

For the next hour he moved from one point on Fern's Sole to the other. Until finally, exhausted, he had to stop.

"I can't" He gasped " can't do no more."

Suddenly the world turned upside down as Fern rolled over on her back and sat up. She then grasped Ash gently with the toes of the foot he'd been working on in what she called a "Toe Hug".

"Thank You, Ashy. I think you deserve a reward."

What was the reward?

"Excuse me...what?" Ash asked in all too friendly voice. While he was intetiorly screaming.

"I said put your cute and soft little face on my soles and smell them for awhile. They need some air~"The.beagle girl teased as she wrinkle her soles."It will be even better,you plant some kisses~"

You thought for a moment. If you decline her,she probably going to think you're playing hard to get. But you really don't want what she said.l(Even though she is pretty cute..for a giant beagle"

1121212122212131.content:
A Fernquake later Fern was back on her stomach and Ash was back on her sole. Smell, and kiss. How is that a reward? He had smelled her foot enough when he was massaging them, and came to the conclusion that they were not as bad as one might think. Sure there was a smell, but not the stomach turning kind.

He thought the best way to do what was asked as part of his "Reward" was to simply lay on his stomach and Kiss from that position. He didn't want to do it, but he didn't want to enrage a giant that could turn him into a paste with the very foot he was laying on.

'Here goes nothing,' He thought and gave his first kiss.

The texture of the skin when his lips touched it was not what he had expected. The Dermal surface had a different feel to it compared to when he touched it with his fingers. Maybe it had to do with the thickness of the skin of his lips compared to his fingertips. He kissed again and breath in her sent. He felt the sole flex approvingly.

The Warmth emanating from the sole felt good on his aching muscles. He was exhausted. Not just from the foot rub he gave Fern, but also the events of the day. Despite his best efforts he had a hard time keeping his eyes open.

Fern became a little concerned when Ash stopped kissing. She turned and looked at her sole. She could hear the faint but distinctive sound of snoring.

'Poor little guy is tuckered right out' she thought as she carefully picked him up so she wouldn't wake him. She deposited him into a sock and hung the sock off a bedpost for safe keeping. Then she shut the light off and went to bed herself.
1121212122212131.title: Learning to like the Job

11212121222121312.title: A weird nightmare,or something else?

112121212221213122.content:
As he ran forward, it seemed as though his movements were sluggish. But that couldn't be right. He never thought of himself as an athlete but he could move faster than what he was doing. The closer he got to Grown up Fern's feet the more they loomed and towered over him. The toes slowly flexed in anticipation. All the while, the countdown continued.

"Five, four, three, two..."

He would have made it, had the foot he was running too shifted back, making him run further.

"...One. Awww, you didn't make it. Yes, I know I cheated. Please forgive me."

The foot slid forward again, and Ash was face first into the grey flesh of the heel before he was knocked on his back. Staring upward his gaze followed the contours of the sole up to the toes.

"Common Ashy, you mustn't keep me waiting."

Ash scrambled to his feet, still staring up the length of the sole. What was she expecting him to do? The only part of her foot he could reach was her heel. Tentatively he reached out and started kneading the flesh. the skin was tougher than it was with her younger self. He wondered if Fern was even feeling is affords.

"No, that's not what I want." Her voice announced somewhere beyond the wall of grey flesh. "Don't you remember?"

Ash was perplex. He really didn't have a clue.

"You must be getting forgetful in your Old Age."

"Old Age?" what was she talking ab---

It was then Ash noticed his hands. They were the hands of an old man. He looked at his body, it too belonged to an old man. He had barely time to register this bit of knowledge when a annoyed sigh got his attention.

"Never mind, I'll do it myself."

Suddenly colossal digits folded around him as Fern picked him off the table with her toes. Then she lowered him to the floor, but did not lift her foot off him.

"Let me tell you more about my Day."

Fern began to resit to him how her day went, but he wasn't listening. For the moment, his attention was on the colossal toes that were having their way with him.

Grown Fern Moaned "I really do love these sessions with you, Ashy. You make my tired soles feel so good."

He was released for a moment, and then she switched to her other foot and repeated the process.

"Ah, you've finally woken---"
1121212122212131221.title: The Dream Continues

1121212122212131222.content:
Ash opened his eyes and sat up. It took a few minutes for his eyes to adjust to the dim light. He looked himself over quickly. To his relief he was his youthful self. He looked around. Where the hell was he? It took a few minutes of staring at cloth walls to figure out that he was in a sock. It smelled of foot sweat and moisturizer. Couldn't she have at least put him in a clean sock?

About as near as he could tell the sock was hung on something. Maybe a knob or the bed post. He couldn't tell.

He laid back and stared upward. He thought of the dream. Was that his fate? To spend his whole life being a foot toy to monsters? Did he have a choice? If he managed to escape from the room, who's to say the next giant he met up with would treat him better or worst?

Only one way to find out.

Ash began climbing up to the mouth of the sock, and promptly slid back down to the toe. After six attempts the closest he was able to get was about half way. The angle was just too steep. He sighed. It was so much easier in the movies.

If up wasn't an option, what about down? Ash crawled about the toe of the sock and found what he was looking for. There was a hole in the sock just big enough to allow him to get through. He thought maybe this was the way out.

That is until he looked down.

It was a good hundred feet to the floor below and nothing to cushion his fall but the hard floor.

'So much for that' he thought and moved away from the hole.

Defeated he resolved to get as much rest as he could before morning. He was going to need it for whatever Fern had planned for him. He thought about that as he drifted back to sleep. He thought of her as a monster, yet the most she had done was make him give her a foot rub. If that was the most the planned for him maybe it won't be so bad.

He was awoken a few hours later to the sound of an alarm. Ash heard Fern shutting off her alarm clock and getting out of bed. Then he heard her approaching the sock. There was a Tug and the sock was lifted upward.

You was rudely awaken from your oh sweet dream,and was brought back this cruel reality. You saw Fern giggling cutely over your groggy form,you saw that Fern was wearing something radically different for school.

She was wearing a baggy and purple t shirt,medium length yellow overral like skirt with pink lilles on it. And finally,a old pair of brown flipflops that had alot of plastic flowers on it.

"There's going to a major heatwave today,And I decided to wear these things. You like it..A-ashy" the dog bashful said while trubbing her arm.

"It's..cute" you slowly said,and for once you were telling the truth. The outfit was...very...cute...if you ignore the giant bratty dog monster that was wearing it.

"Thank you Ash"Fern slowly said as her face lit up. She then grabbed her backpack,and opened it up. "Come on Ashy,Let's go to school together." The girl sweetly said,but only making you more pissed off.

With a sigh,you got in the backpack.And you and fern start your journey.

================
Yet another time skip
=================

It was finally after school,And you had to deal with Fern having those big monsters tea-no mocking you all day. Which..she's doing right now. But luckily,the hole the zipper made was big enough for you get out of the backpack. You notice that you were in some type of library. But before you enjoy you sweet freedom. A voice of a young kid broke your hopes and dreams.

What was the voice saying?

"Wow,...small boy!" A surpised and excited whisper of an girl about year older than Fern. Gulping,you turn around show..poodle with cuddle hair and a bow on top?

"Why he's for the tonight slumberparty?" The poodle quietly ask the bagle. As she is stealing a few glances at fern's barefeet(which you and fern notice)

Fern whisper into Prunella,and a excited and overjoyed grin appeared on the poodle's face. "Why wait until tonight?The bigfoot empress wants her feet pampered now!"the poodle happily whispered as the color drained from ash's face.

"The big foot empress huh."Fern sweetly but quietly chuckled. Which you notice that Prunella face lit up when she chuckle."What's does make me and Francine ?

"Your my second in command,the bigfoot princess!"Prunella almost cooed at the bagle. "And Francine's..the bigfoot orge"Prunella bluntly finished.

"l don't know Prunella,people will see us.."Fern cautiously whisper to the poodle and changing the subject. Which you agreed for a entirely ifferent reason. "Oh come on Ferny,the library's practically empty today.And with this long day of school and this heatwave. Don't you want to relax and be pampered?" The poolde softly whisper to the other dog,(while her blush is getting redder.)

Fern thought it over for a few minutes. And she finally made her mind up,and said...
112121212221222.title: The kinks and crushes of a Poodle.

choices: "I think he might be enjoying this"
1121212122212221.content:
"But we have to be careful." Fern said giving in.

Prunella squealed "Lets go over in the corner behind that bookshelf. There's a table there."

Ash wanted to say "Hey, don't I have a say in this?" but it was perfectly clear that he didn't. A moment later he was under the table. He considered running, but when he did math he concluded that there was no way he'd be able to outrun the two giants. Better to just get this over with and be done with it. He looked about. Ferns grey feet at one end, and at the other....

At the other end was, up to that moment, the longest pair of feet he had ever seen. Prunella had a thin frame, which made her feet appear even bigger. Like Fern the top of her feet were covered in fur that had a smooth appearance. The soles were bare, and had the same dermal surface as Fern. Above his head, he heard more whispering.

"Okay, I don't see anyone. Lets make it look like we are reading."

Fern picked a book off the nearby shelf. It was one she had read before but that didn't matter. Prunella could barely contain herself.

"We better make this quick." said Fern "We don't want to draw too much attention."

"I just want to feel him under my feet for a few minutes." said Prunella "Nobody will see a thing. Is he still there?"

Fern glanced under the Table and Nodded.

Prunella's foot shot forward and the next thing Ash knew he was under her long toes. They wiggled all around him, and then they were being rubbed up against him. He was being played with as though he were a pebble. At least he was thankful of two things. Her soles were soft, and she was being gentle.

"Ohhhh, he feels so good under there." Sighed Prunella.

"Don't hurt him," Fern warned.

"I won't" The poodle girl assured "---"
1121212122212221.title: "Okay, you win" (Ash loses)

choices: Ash pretends to be a toy
Ash tries to get Fern's attention.
112121212222.content:
Dressed for bed with a glass of milk in one hand, Fern Walters stepped into her bedroom. Closing the door behind her she walked past her back pack and set the glass down at the computer desk. Slipping her Slippers on her bare feet she walked over to her bed to retrieve her favorite book before sitting down in font of her computer. Opening a note book she began writing. She had a week to finish this assignment, but she wanted to get a head start on it.Hidden inside her back pack the only thing Ash was aware up was the sound of footfalls and the rumble through the floor. He was tempted to see who had saved him from becoming a red splatter on the walkway, but he really had no idea what was going on out there? Suppose whoever it was, was getting undressed? He knew from the items in the room that this was a kid, and that was territory he certainly DID NOT want to go. Better to hide until lights out, then he could move about more fr--

The back pack suddenly lurched upward. Knocked onto his back, books rocking dangerously back and fourth around him, Ash looked upward as a huge hand reached toward him. "Where is that Eraser?" he heard from out side as huge fingers felt about. Ash remained motionless, his breath quick, his heart pounding. Then the tip of the index finger found him. The hand paused for a moment, the finger tip pressed into him . It was clear the owner of the hand was trying to figure out what he was. Then he was pinched between that finger and a thumb and lifted upwards.
112121212222.title: Climb back into the Back Pack

1121212122221.content:
"What's this?"

Fern held the object closely studying it. A toy man? Where had it come from? She hadn't even seen a toy like that before.

"You know, you look so life like to me." She grinned as she spoke to it. " I can't believe toys this small are this detailed! You look so amazing!"

‘And I will hug him and squeeze him, and pet him, and name him George…’ Ash thought. Fern began to gently rub him between her thumb and finger.

“You feel squishy too. I wonder what you’re made out of.”

Ash had to admit it felt good. Almost like a full body massage, rubbing out all the tension from his limbs. He began to relax.

Fern was starting to become more and more curious of this little toy, this was a real mystery to her. She'd never seen a toy like this in any store and how had it ended up in her backpack? Did Muffy buy it from somewhere overseas and slipped it in for her to find? She had spent an entire half hour examining it, and looking all over the little guy's body. It wore real clothes and everything, and this toy seemed very life like...

"Well, where ever you came from, you're mine now." she finally said.
1121212122221.title: A toy

11212121222212.content:
As much as Fern wanted to play with this interesting toy she decided that getting her assignment done was more important. So she sat the toy man next to her glass of milk and continued her school work.

As for Ash, he was perfectly still except for his eyes which he was certain were much too small for her to notice their movement. What the heck was he going to do? Also she was very careful when it came to hold him and such he couldn't rule out the possibility of her breaking this "Toy". He scanned about for a way off the desk and could find none, just as well as any movement by his part would be detected and then he'd have to deal with a freaked out four hundred foot tall young Giantess.

He sighed to himself and resolved to sit perfectly still as Fern worked away.

According to the digital clock on the desk, an hour past by the time she closed her books and put her pencil down. Ash felt a cramp in his leg and he had a terrible itch but still he would not move. Fern stretched and reached out a hand toward him. He braced himself as a thumb and finger grasped him and he was lifted upward. Standing up from her desk, she walked over to:
11212121222212.title: Work before play

choices: Fern Hear's something but not sure where it's coming from.
1121212122222.content:
As soon as Fern had lifted her hand out of her backpack Ash began to struggle and yell up to her. He hoped being a dog she'd also have the hearing dogs were famous for. Unfortunately his struggling was the first thing Young Fern took notice of, her first reaction was that she'd grabbed onto a bug. Her second reaction was to tause what she was holding away from her. Too bad she hadn't noticed where it had landed.

Ash landed with a splash and dove down deep under the surface. It was s struggle to swim back up to the surface in the freezing liquid. He'd already had the sensation of rising but he'd also been aware that the glass he was in was also beginning to rise.

He broke the surface, coughing on milk. It took several quick blinks to get the milk out of his eyes. Then he became aware of the warm air that was blasting down on him from above.A chill that was not caused by the milk ran through his body and he looked up. Fern was holding the glass so close that her mouth had become Ash's whole world.

With only seconds left, Ash began to scream for his life.
1121212122222.title: Attempt Failed

choices: Fern begins to play with whatever is in her mouth
11212121222221.content:
If his cries were heard, they were ignored.

The glass began to tip towards the opening mouth. What happened next might've taken seconds but for Ash it slowed to eternity. The milk began to flow into Fern's slightly opened mouth as soon as the lip of the glass touched her bottom lip. Even as he vainly tried to swim against the flow he kept his face towards the abyss he was being drawn closer and closer to. He could see milk flowing toward the throat and the tongue rising and falling with every audible "Gulp".

In a last desperate act to save himself, Ash reached up and grabbed at the upper lip as he was sucked passed it. He managed to get a grip and for a moment he was on the boarder between life and death. Then the flow of milk stopped, then he was pressed against warm soft flesh as the mouth closed and the glass with withdrawn. Pinned between her lips Ash remained perfectly still. He hoped he would be unnoticed and that when Fern opened her mouth to take another drink he could jump clear. Maybe land on her chest.

That was before the monstrous tongue appeared from inside the mouth and he was licked inside.

In total darkness and on the verge of panic, Ash decided that now was the right time to make peace with his maker.
11212121222221.title: Fern takes a drink

choices: Fern's Mother starts to leave (It's too late to run)
112121212223.content:
Standing in the doorway and towering over Ash, Fern's mother was holding a basket of freshly washed and folded laundry. The basket in her arms obscured her vision of the floor and so she didn't see the tiny speck that was backing away from her. In fact, her attention was on the bed where she planed to put the basket down in order to put away her daughter's clothes.

Her first step into the room nearly covered half the distance between herself and Ash. She moved so quick that he had only time to turn and run in the opposite direction before her other foot swung over his head and came down in front of him. The displacement of air combined with the impact tremor sent Ash scrawling across the floor. He stood up, trying to get his bearings while Fern's Mother calmly placed the basket down on the floor and proceeded to put laundry where it belonged. It didn't take long for Ash to realize he couldn't out run the giantess.

He had to think fast. He had been lucky when she had walked into the room but he couldn't be sure his luck wouldn't run out when she walked out of the room. He had to get clear of her path. He looked about quickly. The Bed was no longer an option, but there was still the backpack. The desk was a bit further away, but there was a chance he just might be able to make it.

With no time to think it through Ash darted for
112121212223.title: Doria Walters

choices: Her cellphone starts to ring distracting her
1121212122231.content:
Ash gasped as he tried to catch his breath. He had Just made under the computer desk just as the the Giantess turned and exited the room. Damn he was more out of shape than he thought. He really had to work on his cardio. He had just gotten his breath back and had been conscious of one set of footfalls receding when a second pair, less powerful, approached. The door once again swung open and he saw a pair of bare feet covered in short gray fur.

Dressed for bed with a glass of almond milk in one hand, Fern Walters stepped into her bedroom. Closing the door behind her she the glass down at the computer desk. Slipping her Slippers on her bare feet she sat in font of her computer. Opening a filer document she began typing. With her homework finished she was doing what she enjoyed the most, writing stories. This one was giving her some trouble and she hadn't been back to work on it for a while. She hated writer's block, especially when she was so close to finishing a story.

Under the desk, Ash found himself between two slipper covered feet. He looked upward following the ankles and legs to the lower half of the giant incarnation of Fern. Beyond that he could hear the clicking of fingers on a keyboard. To say that Ash wasn't frightened would be untrue. You couldn't be this close to a living being so huge and feel fear. After all, She was like a god to him. Or would that be goddess? He'd think about that later. Right now he was more concerned about what to do next. The slipper covered foot on his right shifted suddenly making him jump. He yelped.

The typing on the keyboard stopped.

Ash held his hands over his mouth, cursing himself. He wasn't prepared to make himself known. He didn't even know enough about this young giantess to even know how the hell she'd react to him. The Chair rolled away from the desk. Ash's heart dropped as Fern looked under her desk for the source of the sound.
1121212122231.title: Under The Desk

Had he hesitated he doubted he would've made it back there in time. He had only been conscious of one set of footfalls receding when a second pair, less powerful, approached.

Dressed for bed with a glass of almond milk in one hand, Fern Walters stepped into her bedroom. Closing the door behind her she walked past her back pack and set the glass down at the computer desk. Slipping her Slippers on her bare feet she walked over to her bed to retrieve her note book before sitting down in font of her computer. Opening the note book she began writing. She had a week to finish this assignment, but she wanted to get a head start on it.She hated to rush at the last minute and often wondered why her friends and classmates did so. It was better to get it done and over with than to hand in poor work.

Hidden inside her back pack Ash pondered what to do. Now that his breath was back he was tempted to see who had saved him from becoming a red splatter on the walkway. He knew who it was, he had recognized her mother. The problem was that he couldn't see outside the backpack and could only hear what was going on. He really had no idea what this younger giantess was doing. Suppose she was getting undressed? That was territory he certainly DID NOT want to go. Better to hide until lights out, then he could move about more fr--

The back pack suddenly lurched upward. Knocked onto his back, books rocking dangerously back and fourth around him, Ash looked upward as a huge hand reached toward him. "Where is that Eraser?" he heard from out side as huge fingers felt about. Ash stumbled, fell, and crawled backwards to avoid the groping fingers of the hand .
1121212122232.title: The Backpack

1121212122234.content:
Fern's Mother put away the last of her daughter's freshly washed clothes and, after picking up the laundry basket, turned and headed back out the door. Her foot steps were swift. And deadly.

Ash had started to run, but the shoe covered foot was upon him before he could make more than three steps. The heel struck with enough force that the impact knocked him off his feet. Then there was a brief sensation of weight and pressure before he wasn't aware of anything. Fern's mother didn't even feel the tiny human's skeletal structure give way and pulverized Within seconds by the unforgiving weight of the giantess. Some of what was left of him was trapped in the treads of the sole of the shoe while the rest was nothing more than a red stain was left on the floor, and stayed there until it was washed away during the spring cleaning.

No one knew that he had lived at all.
