1121213.content:
Three things occurred in the span of a few seconds. One, Arthur and his friend Buster were walking downstairs toward Jane. Two, Jane's leg began it's forward swing. Three, Ash finally lost his grip. The result was Ash flying hundreds of feet into the air towards Arthur and Buster who approaching quickly. Throughout the out of control tumbling the micro human could see that he was arching upward above their heads and, if the gods were in his favor, he would begin a downward decent almost on top of one of them.

What he couldn't be sure of was which one or where exactly on their person he'd land. At that point that was the very least of his worries.
1121213.title: Ash is flung through the air

choices: Ash flies through the open window of the Limo
112122.content:
Perhaps fear clouded his judgement, but he just didn’t want to be around this Giant being, .

Ash slid off the shoe and into the jungle that was the lawn. The ground was wet like the floor of a rainforest maybe. The sounds of insects were alien to him. He almost expected Yoda to pop up somewhere, after what had already happen today it wouldn’t have surprised him.

The ground shook as Jane turned and headed back toward the house. He watched her walk away until she disappeared out of view. With nothing else to do he began to wander through the lawn thinking about what his next move would be. After an hour he stopped and sat on a rock.

He heard something behind him.

Ash turned and to his horror a Preying Mantis stood over him. Instintively he picked up a stone to try to defend himself. At that moment a there was a loud fluttering of wings and something big pitched down behind the Mantis. He managed to catch a glimpse of a yellow beak and the Mantis was gone. A moment later the huge bird was airborne again. Ash was beginning to regret not sticking with Jane. The lawn was full of dangers, and it was about to get even more dangerous.

He suddenly heard the roar of an engine. The ground beneath him began to shake; the wind began to pick up. The sound was getting closer. It reminded him of the sound of a—

Lawnmower!

'Stupid! Stupid! Stupid! Why the hell didn’t I consider someone might mow the lawn?' Ash soon saw the monstrous machine being pushed by Mr. Read. Knowing he had to find place to hide out fast he started to run but it was already too late. Hurricane like winds lifted him off the ground; Ash was sucked towards the blades of the mower and blown clear. Tumbling head over heels through the air he had no idea where he was going to land. What he didn't know either was that the blast from the mower was sending him hurdling away from the Read's house towards the road. At that moment A limousine was driving down the road. It's back seat occupant, Muffy Crosswire had the window open so she could feel the breeze. At the same time Sue Ellen Armstrong was also walking down the street. The Question was were would Ash Land?
112122.title: It's the lawn for me.

1121221.content: The limousine had air conditioning so Muffy really didn't need to have the window rolled down, but it was a nice day and the breeze felt good on her face. Sipping her ice tea through a straw she closed her eyes and with her eyes closed she didn't see the Micro human tumbling through the air towards the open window. Falling into the window Ash landed--
1121221.title: Limo  ride

choices: Muffy continues to sip away at her Ice Tea
Muffy feels something on her mouth.
11212211.content:
On an episode of Man vs Wild Bear Grills jumped into the freezing waters of a Siberian lake wearing nothing but his socks and underwear. The very moment Ash hit the Ice tea he was given a taste of what that sensation might've felt like. In fact he was lucky his heart didn't stop from the shock, it could still happen as blood drained from his limbs to try to keep his internal organs warm.

Gasping for air just above the surface of the ice tea he looked through the clear glass at Muffy's hand pressed against it, noting that she had very human like dermal swirls on her palm and fingers. Kind of amusing what one pics up on when one is bobbing around in a fridged liquid. His attention didn't stay at her hand however, gazing upward he looked into the content face of Muffy Crosswire. He could tell right away she hadn't noticed his splash landing.

He felt everything rise upward as the glass was lifted up toward her face, her mouth opened slightly to grasp the end of a straw. Before he could even attempt to cry out Ash was pulled downward by a sudden undertow. Even if he had the strength in his arms and legs he doubted he'd be able to fight against the pull of the suck-age. Desperately he grasped the rim of the straw with numbing hands for a quick moment before shooting up into the straw. The upward momentum abruptly stopped, he was inside the straw now, bobbing up and down, the tea splashing up against the smooth walls of the straw. With nothing to grip onto and no feeling in his fingers to to grip anything he knew next time he'd have no way of stopping the ride. He looked and through the top of the straw watched as Muffy's lips parted.

'N-no--"

Ash felt the air escape his lungs. His ears popped from the sudden change of pressure and he was rocketed upward with ice tea just behind him. Muffy had taken just a small sip that time but it was enough to suck the micro explorer into her hot and humid mouth. Foundering in a mixture of Ice tea and saliva Ash clung desperately at any hand hold he could find it and in the darkness of the Mouth he found on on the tip of Muffy's tongue.
11212211.title: This really Sucks

choices: Find a pocket to hide in.
11212212.content:
Disoriented from the fall it too Ash a few moments to get his bearings. When he realized where he was he was momentarily filled with fear until he noticed the young giant hadn't noticed his untimely arrival. She simply looked out the window of the limo and occasionally sipped her ice tea, Ash was thankful not to have landed in that. Standing up on the thick fabric of her skirt, he contemplated what to do next.

The Read house was miles away by now, not that being there would make any difference in his current situation, He'd seen enough TV shows about shrunken people to know that shouting didn't work as well as everyone thinks. That left two options, climb the young giant and get closer to her ear or hide in pocket somewhere and come up with a better plan.
11212212.title: What's the next move?

She begins to tap her foot
11213.content:
Jane walked casually into the living room. She had a lot of work to do on her computer and she thought it would be a good idea to do it now and get it done and over with.

Ash was thankful when she came to a stop. Any longer and he would've lost my grip. From somewhere outside the shoe he heard the sounds of a computer coming on. Odds are she'd be there a while and now was the perfect time to escape his shoe prison. He crawled up the length of her foot but unfortunately when he reached the top of the shoe Ash found that Jane had her velcro straps so tight he couldn't squeeze between the tongue of the shoe and her foot to get out. He was trapped.

With no other options he climbed back down to the toe of the shoe, since it seemed he would be getting to know Jane's foot up close and personal whether he wanted to or not. Despite his predicament he was naturally curious. Even in the dim lighting Ash could tell her foot was very much like a humans even through the sock. Nicely shaped too from what he could tell. He could almost forget this wasn't a human, not that there was anything wrong with that. What was she suppose to be anyway? An Aardvark he guessed but she didn't look like one.

Walking across her foot Ash figured it had to be at least twenty to twenty- eight feet across. There was a distinct smell of foot odor and lotion in the air and it was starting to get really warm.

Suddenly'.
11213.title: Jane walks into the liveing room

112132.content:
Ash sat down on Jane’s foot, wondering what to do next.

He couldn’t remain there. It was starting to get real warm in the shoe; the humidity was also rising. This was a big concern. If he remembered my Discovery Channel correctly if the humidity were to reach 100% his body would not be able to cool itself down, if that were to happen, he’d have five minutes before organ shut down. He hope he wasn’t remembering it correctly.

Ash felt the huge tendon underneath him twitch. Suddenly the foot lifted and slammed down, it lifted again and repeated the action. "Ah, crap she's tapping her foot. Like my luck wasn’t great to begin with but now…"

He was bounced about from the tips of her toes, to up toward her ankle with out any chance to grab a hold of anything to stop his momentum. Finally Jane’s foot settled back down on the floor and was still again.

'That’s it. I have to find a way out of here before she kills me!',

Getting out through the mouth was impossible, so Ash had to try to get Jane to take her sneaker off. Easier said than done. Getting on his knees he raised both fist over his head and struck her foot as hard as he could. There wasn’t even a twitch. After several more tries it soon became clear that punching wasn’t going to cut it. Most of his blows were being absorbed by the thick fabric of her sock. What ever was left wasn’t being registered.

Wipeing away the sweat from his forehead, Ash noted It was becoming unbearably hot. He had to get out fast. Ash suddenly remembered he had a pocketknife. It wasn’t very big but it turned out to be just sharp enough to cut a through the sock and expose the bare skin of Jane’s foot. It took him ten minutes to cut a hole big enough in her sock to put his hand through.

‘Okay, Brain’ Ash thought to myself ‘now what?’

He didn’t want to hurt her. Nor did he want to piss her off. So what He did next was crucial. Ash figured he could poke her with the tip of the knife, not to hurt her, just to irritate her enough to get her to investigate. Or he could run his fingers over her skin and hope to get the same result.

11213211.title: yes

choices: "I'm going to take you up stairs"
"I'm taking you over to the stereo."
112132111.content:
Air!

Fresh Glorious Air!

Then free fall!

Then landing on something warm, soft, smelled of hand lotion....

Hand Lotion?

Ash rolled over on his stomach and traced the dermal ridges of the light brown skin with the tip of his own finger. He heard a gasp from above, and with a deep sense of dread he rolled over and stared into the startled and amazed face of Jane Read.

Jane looked down into the palm of her hand at the tiny creature she was holding. She'd gotten over her initial surprise and dropped her sneaker back on the floor, slipping her foot back into it in case someone where to walk by and ask why she had only one sneaker on. Upon looking more closely at what she was holding she came to the definitive conclusion that this was no insect she held. It might've been small, but not small enough for her to not to see the pants and shirt it was wearing. It made a noise as it fell out of her sneaker, a barely audible scream. She knew that insects didn't make vocal sounds due to the lack of vocal cords. She extended the tip of her finger towards it. Immediately it began to scramble away from it. But why? She wasn't going to hurt it, she just wanted to---

Oh! It suddenly dawned on her. Of course! The tip of her finger easily dwarfed the tiny creature. Even the tip of her finger would be an intimidating sight. She wasn't entirely sure if a creature so small was intelligent, but then intelligence didn't necessarily require mass. She hoped it could understand her. She raised her hand carefully, just a little higher.

"I'm not going to hurt you." she spoke quietly. "I just want to touch you."

She extended her finger again, this time the creature did not move. She touched as lightly as she could, after all she didn't want to crush it after making this much progress. She could feel the tiny chest rise and fall, the feel of breath on her skin. And something else, something lower--

Oh!

'Well, I guess "it" is a he.' Jane thought to herself 'I hope I haven't embarrassed him.'

Still, the thought of having this much power over a male intrigued her. Even excited her. But she had to put those thoughts aside, for the moment at least. She felt three taps against her fingertip and then then felt what was no doubt a tiny hand press up against the underside of the fingertip as though to say 'How do you do', The closest thing to a handshake that could ever be made between them.

'Nice to meet you too.' She thought as she lifted her finger away. If he understood her, than it was most likely that he also spoke her language. Communication would be difficult if Jane couldn't hear him. Jane though, how could she solve this problem? She thought for a moment then addressed the tiny in her hand.
112132111.title: In the Hand of a Goddess

choices: A small cardboard box (make a house)
1121321111.content:
Jane lifted her hand and tilted her head so her hair hung down into her palm. She hoped this wouldn't be too difficult for him. At first she thought he, whoever he was, was reluctant to try. Then she felt a light tug on her hair, so light that if she hadn't been concentrating on it she probably wouldn't have noticed. She stayed in this position until she could feel him climb up into her outer ear. She recalled stories of insects crawling into people's ears and wishing at that moment not to have recalled it.

"Can you hear me?"

"Yes!." she said smiling warmly "My name is Jane Read."

"Hello, Jane Read. My name Is Ash."

"Nice to meet you."

"Nice to meet you too. Though this is a rather unusual circumstance to meet."

Unusual indeed. Here she was having a conversation with someone tiny enough to sit in her ear. "I hope I didn't embarrass you when I touched you."

"To be honest I was afraid you'd be angry." said Ash "I mean, I do my best to exhibit self control but at that moment it had other plans."

"Don't be silly, I know it doesn't take much to get them started. I probably pressed down too hard or something."

"I must congratulate you though on being able to feel something that small-- Well what I mean is, It's perfectly portioned to my body---"

Jane Giggled. "It's Okay I know what you mean. Ash, how you ended up in my sneaker?"

***

And that's all I can tell you. I apologize for having to use my knife but I couldn't stay in your sneaker much longer."

"You poor thing, it's a good thing I didn't decide to go for a Jog. If I did jog."

"You and me both." said Ash "You'd be washing my stain out the next time you did laundry. Ms Read, I could really use some help here."

"I'm afraid I can't help you return to whatever world you came from." said Jane, a sadness in her voice." I've never heard of anything like this happening before. Nothing beyond what I saw in Saturday Morning cartoons."

"That's not what I mean. I need a place to stay. "

"Oh, is that all? You didn't really think I'd make you leave? Ash, I wouldn't do that. Where would you go, the back yard? You wouldn't survive an Hour! Hang on, I'm going to get up now."

"Woah!"

The world inside Jane's ear shifted as she stood. There was a rocking motion as She took careful steps. Outside the ear, the world moved quickly. "Where are you taking me?"

"Upstairs. I need to check on my Daughter. And I think I may have something you can live in."

"Do you have many children?"

"I have three children, ages eight, four and one." said Jane "And a Husband."

'Husband.' Ash thought . A bit disappointing. But so far this Jane had a lot of similarities to her cartoon counterpart."Are they here Now?"

"The Baby is upstairs taking her nap, the oldest is still in school and the other is in a daycare. My Husband is on a delivery." Jane walked upstairs to her Daughter's room and peeked inside. The Child was still asleep in her crib. Satisfied that all was well, she made her way to the bedroom she shared with her husband. For Ash, the ride was surreal. He'd ridden an elephant once, he was six years old and had gone to see a circus. This was like that, but on a much larger scale, and Jane looked much better than that elephant.

"Here we are."

He saw her hand return to the side of her ear. What a lovely hand she had. Climbing down through her hair and into the palm once more Ash Sat while Jane Lowered her hand to a night stand where she instructed him to climb off. He watched her open her closet and take a box down from a top shelf.

"This should work just fine for you."
1121321111.title: "Climb into my ear"

11213211111.content:
"It's not much, but I think I can make something out of this."

Jane Lowered her hand to show Ash what she'd found. It was a box, not much larger than a big Matchbox. "I think I can cut a few holes in it, and I have a few things you can use as bedding. Not exactly all the comforts of home but it's the best I can do for now."

"It'll do. Thanks." said Ash, then remembered she couldn't hear him.

It took twenty minutes for the Giantess to turn an old box into a house. Ash watched her with a feeling of security. Here he was, the size of an Ant, under the care of a creature that could only exist in a cartoon and yet here she was making a house for him. Finally, she announced "All Done!" and placed her creation in front of him. It wasn't much, but he liked it. It would be like roughing it outdoors without leaving the comforts of home. He stepped inside to have a look around. A moment later, fingers closed around the box and lifted it carefully upwards. A great eye peered into one of the windows.

"You look so cute in there." said Jane. Ash took a bow which made her giggle."I'll put you up on this shelf above the bed and I'll get some food for you."

The eye went away and the the box house was raised further upward until it finally settled on a level surface. The fingers went away and Ash walked up to the window. Jane smiled at him before turning and walking out of the bedroom. Ash watched her leave thinking to himself.

'No, get those thoughts out of your mind.' he thought. 'She's a married woman.'

She'd been so kind to him, If he dared to do what he thought of doing, that wasn't how to repay her kindness. That kindness could turn into something ugly if she found out, an angry woman is one thing but an angry woman who could crush you under her thumb was quite another. He stepped out of the box house and stood among towering pictures at the landscape before him. It was like living in a penthouse apartment. Well, he always wanted one of those. He looked over the edge of the shelf to the bed below. Jane's pillow was directly below him. If he could find a way to get down there....

'Stop it!' h thought to himself. Why was he thinking this way? Could he stop himself from acting out these desires? He had to get it off his mind. Yes, that's what he'll do. He just had to be busy that's all. He went back inside the box house.In the corner Jane had placed soft looking materials. He went right to work on making them into a bed.
11213211111.title: A cardboard home

choices: Jane rolls over on her back
Jane swats at what tickled her cheek
112132111111.content:
He couldn't sleep.

It had been a few hours since the lights had gone out. Jane had discretely checked in on him before her husband came into the bedroom. He could tell from the deep breathing that they were asleep. He wished he could've done the same, and one would think after a day like he had that he would be exhausted. That wasn't the case though. His mind was racing of thoughts he should not have dared think, but now that his head was filled with those thoughts he couldn't get them out of his head.

He got up out of the bedding he made for himself and began to pace the floor of his cardboard home. Maybe physical activity would help.

Nope.

He sighed. Well, it was worth a try.

With no other ideas coming to mind, Ash stepped outside his cardboard home to the edge of the shelf. He gazed down over the edge. Jane slept on her side, her head resting on her pillow directly below him, the moonlight illuminated her peaceful features. Under the covers her body stretched out like a mountain rang. It was driving him nuts.

'Don't do it' the voice of reason in his head warned.

He chose to Ignore it. Going back into his home he retrieved the rope he made from a piece of Fabric Jane had given him. He unraveled the material for less deviant intentions but now it would serve a different purpose. Tying an end to a large figurine he threw the rest over the edge. At first he though he wouldn't have enough but by the time his rope unraveled he was relieved to see that the end touched Jane's jawline with feet to spare. Ash tugged on the rope to make sure it would hold his weight, and once he was sure it would hold he climbed out over the edge of the shelf into thin Air. His heart raced with anticipation as he climbed down toward his goal. He had been so focused on his decent he didn't notice that the end of his rope was swaying back and forth, brushing against Jane's cheek. Ash was had only a foot or so to go when he heard the bed springs groan.
112132111111.title: Night time adventure

choices: Jane's mouth suddenly opens underneath him.
Ash makes his way into Jane's hair.
Jane was awake and feeling Ash on her body
1121321111111.content:
Ash closed his eyes. Imagining what a sight he must be dangling at the end of a rope wearing nothing but his underwear. He wish he had at least worn pants but he hadn't been thinking clearly.

'Please don't wake up, please don't wake up'

There was a moan and a blast of air from below. For a very long time, it seemed like forever, he didn't move a muscle. Then he opened his eyes and looked down.

Jane's closed mouth was directly below him. He looked at the rest of her face. She was still asleep. Her eyelids were closed, warm puffs of moist air blew out of her nostril slits. That was close.

'Go Back' the voice in the back of his head said.

Again he chose to ignore it and continued his decent. The moment his bare feet touched the skin of her lips was one he swore he wouldn't forget. The warmth and texture of the flesh was indescribable. It felt good. Down in his neither regions it felt good.

He knew it was wrong. In his mind somewhere he felt guilty for taking advantage of a sleeping woman, no matter the difference in species or size. That wasn't the person he was raised to be. But at that moment he wasn't thinking clearly. It wasn't the head on his shoulders that was in charge. Right then and there he felt like a kid left alone in a toy store.
1121321111111.title: Jane rolls over on her back

1121321112.content:
Jane raised her hand to the external Microphone on the computer and turned the volume to maximum. She Hoped it would be sensitive enough. She watched the tiny walk across her palm toward the microphone and stop in front of it. This was incredible. His footsteps felt light against her skin.

"Can you hear me?" A voice came over the computer speakers "Oh! I guess you can."

"Hello." she said smiling warmly "My name is Jane Read."

"Hello, Jane Read. My name Is Ash."

"Nice to meet you."

"Nice to meet you too. Um, I hope you don't take this as an odd request but could you raise your other hand so I can see your Palm?"

Jane smiled and did as she was asked. Though any other time this would've been an odd request, she hand a feeling why Ash had asked that of her.

"You have very lovely hands." said Ash "I'm sorry, it's just that from my position I can't really tell."

"Why thank you. Ash, may I ask how you ended up in my sneaker?"

***

And that's all I can tell you. I apologize for having to use my knife but I couldn't stay in your sneaker much longer."

"You poor thing, it's a good thing I didn't decide to go for a Jog."

"So am I." said Ash "You'd be washing my stain out the next time you did laundry. Do you live here alone? I can't tell for sure but this place looks too big even for you."

"I have two Children." said Jane "And a Husband."

'Husband.' Ash thought . Well, so far this Jan had a lot of similarities to her cartoon counterpart."Are they here?"

Jane shook her head. "My kids are in school and my Husband is on delivery. Ash, would you like me to show you around my home? I have some time before they come home. No one will see you."

"Yes, I would. Thank you."

"Okay. Hang on."

Jane stood up and stepped away from the computer. The motion knocked Ash on his butt, and he decided to stay that way as standing would not be advised.

"I'll show you--"
1121321112.title: "Speak into this Microphone"

11213212.content:
Ash poked the exposed skin with the knife but didn't get so much as a twitch. The temperature was steadily increasing, with time running out he drove the knife down hard. Too hard. The blade pierced the flesh and sank deep.

"OUCH!"

The foot inside the shoe lifted upward propelling Ash up to the ceiling of the sneaker. It was the last thing he was aware of before he was crushed between it and the foot underneath. As Jane removed her sneaker to see what had hurt her Ash's body was dragged along until he was nothing more than a stain. Jane grumbled and reminded her self to call the exterminator.
11213212.title: no

1122.content:
"Oh, this can't be real..."

Miss Flynn towered over Ash like a skyscraper. She was dressed in her nurse uniform and from the look on her face was in a pretty good mood. The voice in the back of his mind was telling Ash to move, to jump up and down, and to yell for help. But he was too much in awe to do anything. He watched her glance to the left and heard her wiggle her foot into the shoe beside him; she looked like she was having some trouble.

'Wouldn't be happening if the laces were looser' he thought.

Satisfied she turned her attention to her other shoe. Ash broke out of the trance he was in the second before Miss Flynn's nylon covered foot blocked out his view of the outside world. He didn't know if he could make it to the toe of the shoe in time so he grabbed onto the nylon stocking and held on as she wiggled her foot into the shoe. Thank God for Adrenaline.

As her foot settled into the shoe, Ash used what sparing seconds he had to climb up onto her stocking covered toes. He grabbed the netting of the stocking as tightly as he could before she took her first step.

THUD!!
THUD!!
THUD!!

Each footstep jarred Ash so badly he thought his arms were going to dislocate. He was doing everything He could to keep his grip on the Nylon. Ash hoped she wasn’t walking very far. There was a pause as the front door opened. Then there was more walking and he heard the sound of a car door opening. Ash felt Miss Flynn climb into it and heard the door close. A few seconds later there was a loud roar as the Car’s engine came to life. The foot suddenly went on an angle as it settled on the accelerator.
1122.title: Miss Flynn (School Nurse)

choices: Ash makes it back to the Nursing station
11221.content:
Ms *Barbra Flynn sipped her coffee as she waited for the traffic light to turn green. Another day at Lakewood Elementary. Another day of scraps and bruises, and the occasional upset stomach. But it pays the bills and there were worst jobs to be working.

The light turned green. Pressing down on the accelerator she continued to the school. She wiggled her toes. She loved these sneakers. Too bad she had to wear dress shoes for the next eight hours. Fifteen minutes and two more stop lights later Ms. Flynn parked in her usual spot and walked into the school. By the time she arrived at the school classes had already begun. Her shift didn't start until the first morning recess. Upon entering the nursing station she slipped her sneakers off while finishing her morning coffee. She didn't notice her passenger hanging onto her nylon covered foot as it settled on the floor, nor did she see him slid off and run clear.

Well, it wasn't quite a run, it was more like a stagger. With the constant THUD and the bone jarring impact of each foot fall Ash had just barely survived the journey. Free of the sneaker, all he wanted to do was get as far away as he possibly could and he didn't care where he was going or if it was rational or not. He saw a door, and as he ran closer he could see that there was just enough space to crawl under. What he found on the other side was a vast hallway. A school hallway. He was in a school. Highschool, or Elementary? He had a feeling he'd find out soon enough.

It was sooner than he thought as suddenly there was an ear piercing ringing.

"Gahhhh!" Ash cried out.

The rumble began before the sound ended. Then the doors to the classrooms opened as students stepped out into the hallway. Giant Students. Heading toward him in both directions but none of them looking down at the floor. Ash's blood went cold. He wasn't too far from the Nurse's station, but he was still out in the open. He turned and tried to run back but the floor shook with multiple foot falls making it almost impossible.

He yelled "Help me!" Not that it could be heard over the collective giggles and conversations of the students. Of all of the students there were three who seemed to be homing in on his position. Fern Walters who was coming in from the left, Francine Frensky walking in from the right and just behind her, It was just a question of which one was going to get him first.

* Decided to give Mr Flynn a first name as her first name hasn't been reveled.
11221.title: She's going to the school

choices: Ash decides to hitch a ride
Ms Flynn steps out of the nursing station
Ash gets stepped on by another student
112212.content:
A sneaker wearing foot came down just in front of him and Ash found himself suddenly laying on his back staring up at the ceiling. Buster Baxter stood over him for a moment before he stepped over and passed him. The door to the nursing station was still some distance away, he'd be lying if he thought he was going to make it, but he had to try---

THOOOMB

Another near miss. This time it was Binky Barnes. The heavy set on/off bully lumbered pass. What the hell was Ash just laying around for?!

He scrambled back to his feet as another earth shaking footstep slammed close to him; bring him to his knees. This time it was the Teacher, Ratburn.

'I'm not going to make it.' Ash thought to himself.

Fern Walters walked down the corridor of the school just like she had for the last four years. Seeing Francine ahead of her she smiled and waved. She wasn't looking down as she walked, why would she? If she had, she might've noticed the speck scurrying directly in her path. But she hadn't, and so she swung her foot forward.

The loafer covered appendage hung for a moment, then began it's downward arc toward him. With the floors shaking as if in an earthquake, Ash ran/stumbled as fast as he could manage. But in his heart he knew he didn't have a chance in hell in avoiding her descending foot.

A shadow in the shape of a loafer fell over him. There was a great displacement of air and he was knocked to the floor, and then milliseconds seconds later the foot landed on top of him.

Ash opened his eyes. What? He was still alive! As the brown loafer lifted away he realized why. By sheer luck he had found himself in the gap between the raised heel and the rest of the sole. Quickly he stood up and continued to run, he would check his underwear later. He was still not quite out of the woods yet. There were still other students in the hallway. And they were all out to get him whether they knew it or not.
112212.title: Death by Fern...or is it?

1122121.content:
He scrambled back to his feet as another earth shaking footstep slammed close to him; bring him to his knees. This time it was the Lunch Lady Mrs. MacGrady . The door to the nursing station was still some distance away, he'd be lying if he thought he was going to make it, but he had to try---

THOOOMB

Another near miss. This time it was Tough Customers member, Rattles. The on/off bully lumbered pass.

'Screw this!.' Ash thought to himself. He needed an alternative and fast!

He looked about. Not all the students were walking. Some were standing by their lockers while others were just standing around talking. A plan began to formulate

THOOOMB

Another near miss.

'Okay, okay' Ash thought quickly, ' Maybe if I can climb up on a sneaker or shoe I'll be safe.'

Or at least safer. Better to be on top of a foot than underneath. It was probably not the safest or smartest plan in the world, but hell what choice did he have? He'll be stain on the floor if he stayed where he was. Looking about he saw several candidates.

The closest was Tough Customers member Molly MacDonald, her worn sneakers would be ideal for climbing. A bit farther away talking to Prunella Deegan was the blind rabbit girl Marina Datillo. Her dress shoes were not ideal, but there was a chance he could either climb either her footwear or Prunella's. Further down but closer than the Nursing station was Ladonna Compson. Her sneakers were newer but the cuff of her jeans were folded in a way that would make the perfect place to ride. In the opposite direction was the kid they called "The Brain." He wasn't too far away, but it didn't look like he was going to be standing around much longer.

Ash had to think fast.
1122121.title: Any Port in a Storm

11221212.content:
Ash ran for all he had toward the towering Rabbit girl. In spite of the traffic and the near misses he managed to make it, but as he got closer and closer to Marina, the more imposingly larger she got. He gazed upward; damn she was tall for her age.

The sole of her shoe was at least six feet thick, and it took everything he could to pull himself up onto the extended edge of it. That’s when he discovered that this wasn’t going to be as hard as he’d thought it would be. No it was going to be a lot harder than he’d thought it would be. The surface of this dress shoe was almost smooth. There was almost nothing to get a grip on.

“Oh you’ve got to be kidding me!” Ash exclaimed.

Meanwhile, Marina and Prunella were in the middle of their conversation about Henry Skreever when the blind girl thought she heard a voice. Very faint, but distinct.

“You okay?” Prunella asked.

“Oh! I’m sorry. What were you saying?” The conversation continued until she heard the voice again.

“There’s gotta be a way to get up there!”

At this point Marina’s attention was divided on the conversation and the voice. Despite it being faint it sounded close at the same time. Very close. Almost as though it were.....

“Please don’t move your foot yet!”

The Floor! It was coming from the floor below her! Was this some kind of a trick or practical joke? Marina sniffed the air; there was something down there alright, though she didn’t know what it was.

"Well, we'd better get going before we get scolded again." Prunella joked.

"I'll be there in a minute,"said Marina.

She waited until her friend's footsteps had faded away, then she focused all of her attention on the voice coming from the floor. It didn't sound like anyone she knew from the school. Or anyone in the city she knew for that matter. It was beginning to sound desperate, labored.

Then there was heavy panting and a sigh of relief. Then through the thin sock she wore Marina felt something crawl onto the back of her foot.

She couldn't stay any longer, so with careful and memorized steps Marina went to class.
11221212.title: Marina

11221214.content:
Ash ran for all he had toward the towering Rabbit girl. In spite of the traffic and the near misses he managed to make it, but it wasn’t until he arrived did he really fathom Ladonna’s size. He gazed upward; this was not going to be as easy as he’d thought.

The sole of the sneaker was a good six feet thick, and it took all he had to pull himself up onto the ledge. Then he had to inch his way along the side of the sneaker to a spot where the incline wasn’t as steep. To do that, he had to press his body against the canvas material. Heat radiated outward, it was almost soothing. But he couldn’t stop. Ladonna could start walking at any moment.

When he made his way around to the toe of the sneaker, Ash began to climb. But it was slow going, too slow. The canvas material wasn’t exactly the ideal climbing method and from all the running he was almost exhausted. It was that moment that, without knowing it, Ladonna gave Ash an assist.

Ladonna took a step forward. The impact sent Ash flying into the air where he landed square on the toe of the sneaker. She took another step, again he was air born. This time he landed on the laces of the sneaker. A third step sent Ash over and into the cuff of her jeans. Oblivious of the tiny hitchhiker the rabbit girl walked down the hall way.

When she finally stopped, Ash finally had a chance to catch his breath. Looking up from where he lay he followed the shape of the leg to the desk above. So she was in class. This was quite a mess he’d gotten himself into. The idea that this might be all a coma induced dream did occur to him, but he dismissed it. No dream was ever this vivid, and his sore muscles were proof enough that this was no dream.

Climbing up over the edge of the cuff he looked about. There were a few he recognized. Most had almost crushed him underfoot. They didn’t look exactly like the cartoon characters. Take a two dimensional character and make it three dimensional. Then make it as though it could exist in the real world. That character would still resemble the two dimensional version. At the same time look completely different.

He slid back down to the bottom of the cuff as class began. Ash pondered for a moment, Should he leave Ladonna and go out on his own? No, he’d had a taste of venturing out on his own and it almost got him killed. He was safer with where he was. But would he be safer with someone else? He was thinking ahead to shelter food and water. It would be easier if he were in a house without a second floor.

Trouble was that line of thought was that he didn’t know and couldn’t have known which home was two floors and which were one. Well, except for Muffy. That was a given. But who was to say that these flesh and blood giants lived exactly like the cartoon counterparts they mimicked?
11221214.title: Ladonna

choices: Look around the room some more
112212141.content:
After thinking it over, he decided it was better to stay right where he was. He’d work out the problems of food and water later. In the meantime, he would catch up on his education.

Hours later Ladonna stepped into her room and dropped her book bag next to her bed. As she did so, Ash climbed over the cuff of her jeans, slid the length of the heel of her sneaker, ran under the bed until he was sure he wouldn’t be seen, and promptly relieved himself.

He wasn’t what you call proud of taking a piss right on the floor, but the amount was so small compared to everything else that it wouldn’t be noticeable. He’d been holding his water since he’d hitched his ride. You’re probably wondering, if his pee was so insignificant why didn’t he go earlier? Simple, he didn’t want to be rolling around in it when Ladonna started walking. Riding the cuff of her pants legs was like being in an amusement park ride without the safety traps.

Pulling up his shorts, Ash looked back out from under the bed. By this point Ladonna had slipped her sneakers off and was walking about her bedroom. Maybe getting ready to do homework, or getting ready to take a shower, or simply putting things away. He could see through the stretched material of the socks that her feet were humanoid rather than paw like. That would make a bit of sense when it came to walking upright. Ash watched on.

He felt uncomfortable. He wasn’t exactly into voyeurism and it didn’t feel right to be watching this giant in her private moments. He had to tell himself this was about survival and not self gratification. For one thing, He had to figure out what kind of a person Ladonna was. Did she have fear insects or get disgusted over something crawling on her. He had no plans to try to get her attention just yet, but if he had to and she had a phobia it wouldn’t turn out very well for him.

Squish first, ask questions later.

There was also some scientific curiosity. Ash was no scientist but everything he’d seen so far was a slap in the face of everything he was taught was impossible. A Rabbit evolved humanoid was impossible, a three hundred foot tall rabbit humanoid would’ve collapsed under its own weight, how does that explain Ladonna? It didn’t.

Eventually Ladonna stepped out of the room, closing the door behind her. He waiting to make sure she wouldn’t be coming back, and then walked out from under the bed. The room was tidy, and clean in addition to being vast. There were no crumbs that he could see. He’d have to look elsewhere for food but he had expected that.

Ladonna’s discarded sneakers lay nearby. One was tipped on its side. Curiously, Ash decided to take a closer look. It probably wasn’t the smartest thing to do. After all he’d just barely survived his journey in Ms. Flynn’s sneaker. But there was no danger here; Ladonna was most likely not going to be back for a while.
112212141.title: Six Hours Later

choices: Ladonna quickly grabs Ash, and bombards him with countless questions.
Ash tries to fake being a toy...only making Ladonna mad.
Suddenly Ladonna's name is called from the other side of the house.
1122121411.content:
Call him crazy, but Ash can't help but feel enthralled by the very things that could have ended his fragile life on so many occasions, Yes it was more than a little weird, he knows that too well and kinda scares him in all honesty. But despite it all of the red flags glaring at him, Ash slowly lumbered towards the shoe. A bold if not fool-hardy part of his psyche figuring it couldn't hurt to give the things some much-needed investigation.

A smaller more sane part of his brain is practically nagging at him. Practically saying that it is a fucking shoe. And he can't help but agree with that, But he didn't get a chance when he reached the objects of his less than cautionary curiosity. The opening of beckoned him with a faint warmth, it was oddly comforting...in some weird morbid fashion. The closest one on was haphazardly thrown on its side, allowing for easy access inside. As Ash stumbled in, instantly he smelled a noticeable odor of fair potency-making him lightly cough. The best he could describe it was like cracking open a bag of stale cheddar and vinegar flavored Fritos..and the vinegar is the main attraction. But after getting used to it, Ash couldn't help but smelt something synthetic. That and judging the fact that the imprint of her foot was barely and the discoloration was light seem to suggest that the sneakers are fairly new and she just began to wear them.

With his left hand outstretched and touching the mildly damp fabric, Ash quietly began to continue his trek.

``Ash Webler, explorer of footwear`` Ash chuckled to himself just because of the sheer absurdity of all this. As he reached what had to be the toe section. He faintly saw five indentations of where her toes must rest. ''For something improbable to all known laws and science, her feet so...human-like..."

With the disturbing likeness becoming more and more apparent, he turned around and walked to the back to the hole of the shoe. Finding that his wanderlust was fairly satisfied for now. But he stopped and looked to find the tongue was directly above his head. With the light of the room's light, he looked up and saw the shoe number, it was a simple seven, with the silhouette of a rabbit right beside it. Causing him to nearly trip.

"I supposed that proves that these guys do have some of the "natural" biological quirks of their "real" counterparts than I previously thought...and rabbits do have big feet." And with a shake of his head, he walked out of the shoe just when the door suddenly. Ladonna was thee...with her green eyes wide as saucers as she stared at Ash's frozen form. The room suddenly grew quiet as they both just stared at each other. The wrinkling of Ladonna's nose was sending information to her brain, telling her Ash was indeed real and very much alive...

What happens next?
1122121411.title: Curiosity killed the..nah,too easy

choices: Ash gets sucked into Ladonna's mouth
Ash gets pinned between Ladonna's lips
1122121415.content:
It was night. Twelve hours since whatever happened, happened. Twelve hours since he’d last ate and drank. Ash sat against the leg of Ladonna’s bed and sighed. Above him the Giant rabbit girl was asleep. He had watched her until she decided to change for bed, and then looked away. Hell hath no fury like a woman’s scorn, but there’s no fury like a giant’s that can squash you like a bug. Besides, he wasn’t into that sort of thing anyway.

Ladonna hadn’t gone to bed right away, after an hour or so of sitting on her bed she had crept out of her room, sometime later she returned with a plate of food and a glass of milk. From the sounds he heard as she ate in bed they were cookies. Now the lights were out, and he was waiting until he heard the tell tale signs of sleep. When he was certain Ladonna was asleep, he wandered the sides of the bed until he saw the corner of a blanket touching the floor. Ten minutes later, and exhausted, he reached the top. Ash made a mental note that he really needed to work on his cardio. Climbing a blanket is not as easy as it was in those stories he’d read.

Ash’s plan was simple, collect any crumbs he might find and leave. He had no desire to hang out up there any longer than he absolutely had to. But when he got up there, and saw that giant lying there asleep, something sparked his curiosity. He wanted to get a closer look. He approached Ladonna carefully. Ladonna lay on her back. Ash’s eyes never left her face as he climbed up onto her chest. As it turned out most of the crumbs were around the area of her chest so that worked out for him. Leaving them for now, he made his way to her face.

It was a face that had human and rabbit characteristics. There was fur on her face, but it was short. Her nose was like a Rabbits. Her mouth hung slightly opened. Other than the two oversized incisors that protruded out from under the upper lip, Ladonna’s mouth was very human. Curiously Ash carefully climbed up her chin and up onto her bottom lip. There was enough light in the room to allow him to see the interior.

Rabbits are Herbivores, so their teeth have evolved to eat plant matter. But Ladonna’s teeth were omnivore in nature; able to consume both plant and animal. This was unexpected. Other than the scale, her mouth was like that of your typical eight years old. He was about to crawl back off her bottom lip when Ladonna’s mouth suddenly opened wider. There was a huge suction which was making it difficult for Ash to hang on. It didn’t take much for Ash to realize that he was caught in the path of a yawn. The tongue dropped and the throat opened wide as if expecting him to fall into the mouth at any moment. And as his grip began to fail it looked as though it just might happen!
1122121415.title: Later that night

112213.content:
Ash caught a glimpse of something out of the corner of his eye, Turning and looking up he saw a monkey like student.

"F-Francine!?"

Francine Frensky walked down the corridor of the school just like she had for the last four years. She wasn't even looking down as she swung her foot forward.

The sneaker covered appendage hung for a moment, then began it's downward arc toward him. With the floors shaking as if in an earthquake, Ash ran/stumbled as fast as he could manage. Had he not been panicking and had kept his cool he would not have run straight ahead of the colossal monkey girl. Had he ran to the left or to the right there might've been a chance that he would've avoided her descending foot.

Then he became aware of the shadow in the shape of a sneaker. There was a great displacement of air and he was knocked to the floor, and then he was aware of nothing at all as milliseconds seconds later the foot landed on top of him. Thousands of pounds encased in rubber and cloth reduced him to paste with a wet but barely audible squish.

Francine down the hall to the next class unaware of what she had done. What remained of Ash was further pulverized by other students before being washed away that evening by the Janitor.

In his world, Ash became a missing persons case. One of many that would occur in the years that followed.
112213.title: Death by  Frensky

112214.content:
Ash caught a glimpse of something out of the corner of his eye, Turning and looking up he saw a monkey like student.

"F-Francine!?"

She wasn't even looking down as she swung her foot forward. The sneaker covered appendage hung for a moment, then began it's downward arc toward him. With the floors shaking as if in an earthquake, Ash ran/stumbled as fast as he could manage. There was a great displacement of air and he was knocked to the floor. There was a loud THUD as the sneaker wearing foot touched the floor. It remained there for a brief second and then it lifted off again.Ash sighed in relief.

Then he became aware of the shadow in the shape of a sneaker, and then he was aware of nothing at all as seconds later the foot of another student landed on top of him. Thousands of pounds encased in rubber and cloth reduced him to paste with a wet but barely audible squish.

Beulah McInnerny followed Francine down the hall to the next class unaware of what she had done. What remained of Ash was further pulverized by students before being washed away that evening by the Janitor.

In his world, Ash became a missing persons case. One of many that would occur in the years that followed.
112214.title: Death by Beulah

choices: Madison Compson ( Ladonna Compson’s older sister.)
1123.title: Who was it?

choices: He goes towards the mother..for reasons...
Suddenly another woman walked over him, Apparently she has a guest.
To take his mind off the woman...Ash decides to explore the house.
1123231.content:
Ash stood there slacked-jaw as the giant woman. The glimpse of the massive mother was brief as she apparently grabs something and went off somewhere. The resulting quakes only got more and more distant.

Like an animal possessed, the fifteen-year-old scrambled and try to climb out of the shoe. Roughly ten minutes passed, and he somehow managed to get out of the shoe. Ash huffed and puffed and turned back at his former prison. Noting that it's a belonged to someone his age or younger. Not the titan he just saw.

As he walks a bit, he saw the mentioned woman. She was laying on the couch and reading a novel. Interestingly enough, his eyes were on her bared feet. They looked very large....and plump. As the dust hardened skin made little wrinkles. Ash shook his head and looked down to his crotch. His nether regions were certainly getting excited at the sight.

"...I never got turned on by feet before. But why.. all sudden now?" Ash shook his head and blushed as he pondered. Maybe it was a ability that the creatures in this world that has was making him feel this way? It seemed that way because everytime he tried to take his eyes off of them, they keep finding themselves looking back.

Ash groaned as he walks in a circle, trying to clear his confused mind.

But what happens next?
1123231.title: Must be something in the air...

choices: Ash reaches Lavern's feet without incident
Someone shows up and sits on the couch
Ash decides to climb up onto Lavern's shoulder to see what she's reading
11232311.content:
Ash looked across the gulf between the loafers and their owner. To her scale there was a distance of maybe five or six feet. For his scale, the space was in the hundreds of feet. And he was going to traverse it for what? Just so he could get closer to those large plump soles?

The monkey woman, or woman of monkey evolutionary decent, was still reading her novel. She slowly flexed her feet as if to say "Come on up Ashley, Lets have some fun."

He made his choice. He looked both directions to make sure no one else was going to show up, and started running. His eyes were on her face. In his minds eye he pictured her catching a glimpse of him running towards her. He could see her frown and put her book to one side. She stands to her full height and takes two thundering steps toward him before lifting one foot into the air and dropping it down on top of him.

In his mind, she did that. But in reality she didn't notice him at all. He was beyond her notice. And so Ash arrived at the sofa uninjured but out of breath. He gazed up. So close, and yet so far away. How was he going to get up there?

It looked to Ash that he had no chance of getting up there. Then he saw the book bag propped up against the couch. Trouble was, it was at the end toward the giant monkey woman's head, not at her feet. He'd have no choice but to risk being seen. Still, his prize awaited him.

It took Ash fifteen minutes to scale the book bag. Not bad for someone who was inexperienced. While he caught his breath, Ash noticed a hot and humid wind coming from above. It was the monkey woman's breath. Her eyes were still intently on her novel, while south his goal beckoned him. He looked at her face, that was Monkey and yet not. He looked and her dark brown eyes and her broad mouth that could swallow him like a grain of rice. It was incredible.
11232311.title: Like a Moth to a flame

choices: Ash climbs up among the toes of the foot
112323111.content:
Ash traversed the length of the Giant Monkey woman without much incident. There was that one point where she had slightly rolled her shoulders that caused a tremor that almost made him jump out of his skin, but for the most part the walk to his goal was uneventful. He'd been completely unnoticed by the giant Which he wasn't complaining about. He really didn't want to be noticed.

Ash gazed down the length of the mighty landscape that was Lavern. The woman wasn't what you'd call obese. Bulky might be a better term, she carried her weight evenly though out her mighty frame. Nice childbearing hips too, from what he could see. And then of course there was his goal which he was getting closer and closer to reaching. The backs of her feet were covered in a fur that wasn't exactly coarse and grew shorter as it got closer to her toes. The toes were round and thick. Unpainted, but the nails were short and clean. As he was about to walk around to the other side of the enormous extremities Ash glanced back the way he came. Lavern was still reading her book. He smiled and walked around to the soles of the massive feet.

And what a site beheld him. These were meaty soles to be certain. They appeared tough, but not calloused. They were wide and powerful. An odd way to describe a woman's foot, but when that woman is hundred's of feet tall how else do you describe them? As she wiggled her toes, the soles would wrinkle and dust that had been picked up from the floor fell away.

Now that he was there, Ash wasn't sure what to do next. Like the Dog that had caught the car, he didn't know what to do now that he'd caught it. The ache in his groin was giving him some ideas though.

Tentatively Ash reached out and touched the sole of the foot. It felt amazing. He withdrew his hand and peaked out from behind the foot. It didn't seem that his touch had been noticed. Ash decided to become bolder. He pressed his entire body into the sole of her foot. The heat generating from out of the living flesh felt soothing. The oder wasn't as strong as one might think. He could smell soap, so she had showered recently.

Even pressing up against the sole of the foot appeared to go unnoticed. Ash decided it was time to have fun.

What happens next?
112323111.title: Lavern's feet

choices: ...place him near her feet. Since he likes them so much...
...show him to the girls. They are going love him.
...her daughters come in the living room before she does anything.
112323112.content:
'It's too late to quit now. Ash wobbly stood on her shoulder, looked at his prizes that seem to be like distant mountains in a plain. Gigantic and intimidating. And now the question of the hour is how will he get to these mountains.

The boy slowly sat down of the woman, dumbfounded at what to do next. Consequently, as the giant slightly rolled her shoulders, to Ash this seemed like an earthquake.

Causing him rolled like a snowball on a hill on the woman's upper chest. Ash's descend stopped with...a cushiony land. As he tried to stand up, he found that his footing was slightly moist and squishy...and there were two large brown rounded cliffs near him.

"....I'm on her boobs." Ash's cheeks inflamed as he wobbly attempted to walk on the squishy surface. Like a great pioneer of yesteryears, ash gazed at the mighty landscape that was Lavern. The woman had a noticeable belly, it wasn't anywhere near to the point of obesity but it wasn't an hourglass figure. Despite wearing pants normally that usually hides a woman like her curves, her hips had the right amount of childbearing. Not overly big...but still nice. And finally...it was her feet. His inexplicable attraction to them come back, causing his groin to came back after thoughts about them ringed through his mind once again.

"Um..Hello there." The confused voice caused him to completely stopped what he is doing. Slowly, Ash found himself staring at the befuddled face of Lavern. "...What are you doing?"

"...I..I just lost as you see, I suddenly just pop up here, and decided to explore...and g-get help. I guess..I got lucky...huh." Ash quickly told a "half-truth" with a forced chuckle. The giant mother blankly looked at the teenager, she could buy that...but the woman is also the proud mother of two daughters. So she knows when a teenager isn't telling her everything.

Ash began to sweat as the monkey woman just...looked at him. Seconds passed as Ash decided to release his flood gates.

"And also I...get close to your feet!" Ash blurted and the quickly closed his eyes and winced.

"Oh, I...see." It was Lavern turn to blush, she instantly knew what he truly meant. She was young once too...and she did things she definitely isn't proud. A part of her was definitely more than a little bit angry, how would you feel that a strange boy was going to live out his fantasies through you?

But a part of her was kinda flattered did he was attracted to her. Sure her husband is still very attracted to her and loves her dearly. But it was kinda nice seeing someone Catherine's age go to such lengths. The mother made a half smirk at the wincing teen.

"Well thank you for being honest. But I think we both know I can't simply leave you unpunished." Lavern dryly toned which Ash slowly nodded. The corners of her lips seemed to curl up a little as she grabs Ash...

What happens next?
112323112.title: So close yet so far

11232312.title: Suddenly another woman walked over him, Apparen...

choices: Ash crawls under the door on his side of the hallway
Ash Darts over to door number 1
Ash Darts over to door Number 2
Ash gets halfway across and a door opens
11232313.content:
"I-I gotta get out of here!" Ash muttered to himself. Leaving the mature monkey woman with her large plump feet where she laid on the couch he decided to explore the Apartment.

He just had to get away from her.

Not that he thought she was ugly, on the contrary he though she looked attractive. Well, attractive for a gigantic monkey woman. If he were to describe her, Ash would've said that she resembled the Ape woman from that planet of the Apes remake he saw once. It wasn't an exact description but close. His real reason for wanting to move away from her was that his lust and survival instincts were at war with one another . He never considered himself a pervert, but just being in her presence was making him think things and clouding his judgement as arousal often will.

He wandered down into a hallway, keeping to the wall. He saw three huge doors. Two were on one side of the hallway, one was on his side. All three had gaps large enough for him to crawl under if he chose. He didn't like being out in the open, but he wasn't sure if going into one of those rooms was a good idea either.
11232313.title: Exploring the Apartment More temptations

choices: He going to see just what so special about this things!
He is going explore this room, and just find a distraction.
He didn't get the chance when someone enters the room!
112323131.content:
{i'}Mary, let's see what is behind door number one!.... I gonna stop watching the price is right' Ash internally mused as he scampered under the first door. Purely choosing it because of how close it was to him. Said scampering was rather short-lived as he entered a bedroom. It was filled with sports merchandise with more feminine things hidden in subtle clusters. Soon a gust of some sharp acidic odor of great strength has greeted his poor nose, making his misfortune belly flipping and flopping like a flipping constantly flipping in this stomach. It was like soured cabbage being boiled in a vat of extra strength vinegar. But that uncanny feeling when he first saw that monkey woman returned with vengeance in spite of his innate disgust and dismay. The culprit of such a malodorous force, a used sock with its fabric crusted with dirt and yellow, judging the gentle heat wafting off of it like a dying campfire. Outright exhibiting that it was very recently worn.

"Just fucking nasty."Ash cupped his poor virgin nostrils as his legs scampered away from the offending article of clothing. Which he was immediately greeted by an equally powerful perfume of sweat and dirt. Courtesy of also recently used clothes just thrown haphazardly on the floor. Something he also does to his own room often.

This just makes him want to clean it up...prevailed if he actually survives this bizarre event and managed to go back to his reality. But the thought was soon as it was formed as his attention was directly on the direction of the bed. On top was another monkey-woman-monster. Judging from her youthful voice and lack of wrinkles on her young face, he says that she is roughly two to three years older than him. Which he himself is a sixteen-year-old freshman in high school.

"She has to be her daughter doubt about it..." Ash muttered as he got closer to get a better look at the room's owner. Her brown hair was very long and shaggy, to the point where bangs covering her eyes as she scribbles had to be her homework of the day. Just like the lady in the other room, this chick had the same thick hips, big backside in yellow shorts, medium-sized perky cleavage covered by a red t-tank top. But while she has a similar body shape, she is more muscularly lean and having less fat than her mother. But another thing she has in common with her mother was her feet. Which was thick and big in a sense of width and girth instead of length. Despite their size, they were a little smaller than the mature woman's.

The short toes showed off their heftiness as scrunched up every now and again, causing the expansive dusty soles to form countless little wrinkles. Her hard dry heels that had little cracks near the ridge rubbed against each other at a slow pace. Producing a sound commonly heard when you pressed two pieces of sandpaper together. The only thing Ash could do is helplessly twitched his right eyebrow.

"....I'm now pretty sure that these monsters have some bizarre ability to make somebody like me get the hots." Ash only laughed to himself with no mirth whatsoever. This world is just mocking him at this point...it has to be.

What will the brave adventurer do?
112323131.title: A barrel of musky teenage monkeys

1123232.content:
A few minutes Earlier.

"Kanda! Amandat! Nosferatos! Amantos! Akadiv! Kanda!"

Rubella Deegan sat barefoot on the floor of her parent's attic and recited an incantation over and over again. Before her was an old book she had acquired though the local occult store. She was attempting to summon forth an entity known as a Hu-Mon, but so far the only thing she was able to conjure up was a bit of wind. That in itself was promising, but nothing else seemed to be happening.

Rubella sighed, maybe she was mispronouncing a word.

She closed the book and stood up. Prunella would be home from school soon and her mother would be back before she knew it and Rubella would have to make up an excuse as to why she wasn't at school herself. Summoning an entity from another world just wouldn't cut it as far as excuses go.

Rubella padded over to where she had placed her shoes. She considered putting her socks back on, but considering she wasn't going very far it didn't matter. She could've left the attic barefoot if she chose to do so, but she needed a free hand to hold the railing. As she began to slip her foot into her shoe she thought she saw something scurry further into the shoe. Much too small to be a mouse and it didn't look like any bug she'd ever seen before. Either way, it couldn't stay in there. If a bug she would throw it out the attic window.


Ash looked up, awestruck at the towering colossus before him. A part of his mind was trying to rationalize what he was seeing. It's a hallucination. You hit your head and your dreaming all this. The rest of his mind remain unconvinced and started to run to the toe section of the shoe (For he know knew that's what it was) as an enormous bare foot was raised over him. He stopped when he realized that the foot was no longer being inserted into the shoe. Had the giant creature seen him?

He got his answer a moment later when a sudden lurch upward knocked him to insole of the shoe. His ears popped and his world tipped 360 before he found himself in free fall. When he had gotten his bearings, Ash found himself laying face first on a vast tan surface. The pattern and texture of the surface told him where he was. He took a deep breath and turned over on his back.

Ash was staring up into the face of the colossal creature. He'd been dumped into it's hand. No, Her hand. As he could tell now that this was a female. A poodle like appearance, with curly orange hair and a gold earring with an emerald in her right ear. A purple headband, a white blouse with fringes at the end of the sleeves, a black and gray sleeveless jacket with flowers,and two pairs of green necklaces.

Rubella starred at the creature in the palm of her hand. It was a Hu-Mon. A lot smaller than what she had been expecting, but a Hu-Mon nevertheless.

"I-I did it." she said to herself, then smiled broadly."I DID IT!"

She was so excited she kissed the tiny creature. Then quickly checked to see if it was okay. She felt she had to sell someone of her accomplishment, But was it too soon? What if it suddenly vanished? She'd look like a fool. Placing the Hu-Mon in her vest pocket she left the attic and headed for her room.
1123232.title: Rubella The Great and Powerful

choices: Rubella wants to test Ash's durability, and she had perfect method.
Rubella makes Ash do a bunch of task, and tries to bribe him.
Rubella quickly hides Ash, because Prunella decided to be nosy.
11232321.content:
Yeah...she is going to keep the lil'guy a secret. The world simply isn't ready to see such an arcane wonder. That and Prunella will hog him all to herself and probably claim responsibility for summoning him.

And she can't have that now can't she?

The seventeen-year-old poodle jumped to her bed and took out the younger boy out. He just looks so dumbstruck, it was pretty funny! She would totally take a picture!

"Hu-Mon! I Rubella Deegan summoned you from the mythical realm of Nova Gaea! From here on you be my familiar..." As the pompous poodle continues to yap about weird stuff that he pretty sure she made up. Ash looked at her up and down. The girl looked like a cat lady in the making and one that likes to smoke a peculiar plant. It would certainly explain her rambling. His eyes looked down her feet, the big appendages were lengthy and have a long arch. The toes were long and had little pieces of lit between them.

' That explains the smell from earlier...' With his cheeks slightly inflamed, Ash looked up only to see Rubella coyly smirking at him!

"You got a foot fetish." Rubella's calm voice was a matter of fact. One that was laced with smugness.

"Wait...N-no I don't!" Ash was quick to deny the accusation.

"You do too"

"Nuh huh!"

"Huh huh!"

"Oh really?" Rubella giggled as her right ring finger approach Ash. Causing him to stumble backward. The finger gently stroked on his crotch. Ash shivered as Rubella's smirk grown into a full-blown grin. Her finger instantly removed from the area, and she looked down at her "familiar".

"Unless the books at school are wrong. I say you got pretty excited down there!~" The poodle singsonged while Ash defiantly looks away. An effort to save what little dignity he has left. The poodle's grin only widens.

What happens next?
11232321.title: The wizard's appentince

choices: Turn's out Ash wasn't so durable after all
Rubella takes a few light steps around the bedroom
Rubella's Mom calls her down for supper
Rubella decides to go for a walk.
112323211.content:
Rubella reached over the edge of the bed. Ash could see she was holding a well worn sandal. He didn't want to, but asked "What are you doing with that?"

"Oh this is just for a little durability test." Rubella stated matter of factually. She turned the sandal so Ash could see the darkened worn pattern made by her feet "You're going to lay down about here and I'm going to wear this sandal."

"w-What?" Ash couldn't believe she was serious. He did the math in his head, and found he sucked at math. But he knew this giant must weigh tons. "I'll be crushed!"

"Hu-Mon!" Rubella spoke sternly "I can tell I'm going to have some trouble with you. So we can do this the easy way, or the hard way. The easy way, you lay down like the good little Hu-Mon I know you are, or I can tape you down. The choice is yours, so what will it be? The easy way, or the hard way?"

Ash gulped. Neither way seemed that appealing. But since adhesive tape might leave him without his skin when she removed it, and even though this could kill him, he decided it was best to say on her good side.

"I'll be good, lets do it the easy way."

Rubella beamed and deposited Ash onto the worn insole of the Sandal. Ash lay somewhere in the middle of where her instep would be and looked up into the face of this giant. He hoped he was more durable than he thought as the sandal was lowered to the floor next to the other one. Rubella, with deliberate slowness, slipped her foot into the sandal. As her toes slid over Ash, she paused to give him a gentle rub with her big toe. The reaction was as she expected and she giggled as she continued to slip her foot in.

Above Ash was a ceiling of flesh and bone. Then the ceiling pressed down around him. Molding around his body. Dermal ridges that were somewhere between human and canine came into full detail. With the weight on his body Ash was having trouble breathing. He wondered if this giant could feel his breath on her skin? He wondered if she could feel something else that was poking against her sole against his will though the shorts he wore.

Then Rubella stood up.
112323211.title: Durability test

113.content:
It was an eight. A huge Number eight.

"No, no. I'm not where I think I am...." Ash said to himself. "I mean, that would be just crazy right? There's no way in hell I'm in a giant shoe. This has to be a mistake."

Ash looked up though the opening in the ceiling and saw blue Sky above him, If he hadn't also noticed the Bench towering above him and the large blades of grass that were just visible above the mouth of the sneaker he would've thought he had somehow ended up on the set of the "Honey I shrunk the Kids" Remake. Listening he could hear voices echoing in the distance, the sounds of splashing like the roar of a stormy sea crashing against the side of a cliff.

"Okay, now I believed it. I'm in a huge sneaker. Or maybe the sneaker is normal size and I'm incredibly small".

Well no time to think about that, He had to find a way out. Ash did not want to meet up with whoever or whatever was big enough to wear it, at the same time he didn't particularly like his odds once he got out of the sneaker either. The more he looked though the more he came to the conclusion that the only way out was through the mouth of the sneaker. And that was way out of reach. There wasn't even a loose thread to climb up. He swore in Frustration

Then he felt the first vibration.

Faint at first, but then grew in strength. Soon the vibrations were accompanied by muffled thuds that grew louder as the vibrations intensified. Ash looked skywards, the vibrations traveling through his body. His Jaw hit his chest as an enormous being came into view. He easily recognized the being from a cartoon used watched, but this was no cartoon the person towering above him flesh and blood.

Who was it?
113.title: Size Eight

114.content:
It was a 7. A huge Number 7.

"Wait as sec.....No, that can't be...." Ash said to myself.

As impossible as the whole thing sounded there was no other explanation. He was in a shoe. An impossibly huge shoe, but a shoe nonetheless. He looked up though the mouth of the shoe and saw the ceiling of a vast room hundreds of feet above his head. looked like the shoe wasn't the only thing that was huge. Or was he tiny?

"No, no. This has to be a dream." said Ash "I must've hit my head and I'm still unconscious, That has to be it. Well, If this is a dream, it's the most vivid I've ever had."

Dream or not Ash didn't feel comfortable being there. If the shoe was this big he didn't want to meet up with who ever wore it. But no matter how hard he looked he couldn't find a way to get out. He was beginning to think this wasn't a dream. If it were, he would've climbed out like Spider-Man. Insead he was trapped.

Then he felt a vibration.

Faint at first, but then grew in strength. Soon the vibrations were accompanied by muffled thuds that grew louder as the vibrations intensified. He looked skywards, the vibrations traveling through is body. An enormous being came into view.

"You've got to be kidding me...."

He easily recognised the being from a cartoon he used to watched, but this was no cartoon the person towering above him looked all too real.

(Who was it?)

choices: Ash decides to explore Arthur's sneaker some more
1141.content:
Arthur Read towered over him, a four hundred foot tall eight year old. Ash fully expected him to put his shoes on at any second, but that's not what happened. Instead he reached down and with one hand picked up both shoes. The shoes tilted as he picked them up sending Ash sliding to the toe of the shoe he was in. Arthur started walking, were he was going Ash had no Idea. Probably to the front door where he'd be putting his shoes on and turn him into a stain on the bottom his sock.

He heard a door opened. 'This is it' thought Ash. As shoes were placed on the floor, the shoe he was tipped on its side. A moment later he was in almost total darkness as the door was closed. He was in a closet. Ash couldn't believe his luck. He climbed out of the shoe thankful to be free of it, and thankful Arthur didn't wear it.

As his eyes adjusted to the dark Ash could see other pairs of shoes in the closet as well as coats hanging high above his head. This whole situation was scary. It was one thing to watch it in a Disney movie, but it was a completely different experience when it happens to you.

For the moment though, he was safe. If he was going to stay that way he needed a plan. Ash had to try to figure out how to get home while trying to avoid getting underfoot. Easier said than done. Getting on his hands and knees he looked out through the crack under the closet door. Ash didn't see anyone. He began to contemplate whether or not to leave the safety of the closet and look around or stay right where he was and wait for a better time.
1141.title: Arthur

11411.content:
There was no way he was staying in that Closet. Who knew what would’ve happened if another Giant were to show up. Looking around to make sure the coast was clear Ash darted under the door and started to run across to the far wall.

At least that’s how it started. He was in okay shape but he soon found myself out of breath trying to run that distance. Ash settled for walking as fast as he could while gasping for air.

"If I ever make it out of this I'm going to take up jogging".

Ash was about half way between the closet and his goal when the Doorbell rang. He Felt the Tremors again, they were in quick succession as if someone was running.

“I’LL GET IT!!”

"Shit! Arthur's coming back!" Ash thought as he looked up in time to see the Giant bounding down the stairs toward him.

THOMBOOOM!!!

His right-socked foot slammed down almost on top of Ash as he ran past him, the tremor knocking him off his feet. Shaking away the cobwebs Ash turned his head towards the front door.

Buster Baxter stepped into the house. 'Great' he thought,'another Giant to make things more complicated than they already are'.

He looked to be holding something in his right closed hand. Buster opened his hand to show Arthur what he had.

“That’s amazing!” He said “I’ve never seen anything that before! It’s so small!”

What the Hell was he talking about? Ash couldn’t see what was in his hand.

“Let’s go upstairs.”

Both Giants thundered toward him, neither one looking down or watching where they were walking. Ash wanted to follow them to see what they had; only problem he couldn’t get up the stairs. He could get a ride on one of them. Buster’s shoelaces were untied; He figured he could grab a hold of one of the laces. Arthur’s socks looked to be easy to get a grip on. If he could get a grip, and if he could keep his grip.
11411.title: Leave the closet

choices: Crawl under the door to Arthur's Bedroom
114112.content:
His Heart was pounding in his chest. Arthur was almost upon him. Ash had to time this right or there would be no second chance. The friends paused only for a moment in front of the stairs, and with a rush of adrenaline Ash I quickly leaped and landed on Arthur's right foot just above the toes. Ignoring the odor, He quickly grabbed handfuls of the thick rope like material that made up the sock and held on tight.

Arthur didn't notice a thing. As he took his first step up the stairs it soon came apparent to that holding onto the giant foot wasn't going to be any easier than it was with Jane. With every step he was thrown upward and then bounced around as the foot made contact with a step. It was good thing there wasn't much in his stomach or he would have thrown up by the time Arthur had reached the top of the stairs. Still, he also also noted despite the bouncing around that this was quite an experience for him as he I could feel the muscles and tendons flex under him each time Arthur prepared to take a step.

Arthur and Buster walked down a hallway and stopped in front of his bedroom door. Quickly, Ash slid off the foot and rolled clear of the Giants. He watched as they entered the bedroom closing the door behind them. Alone in the hallway, He wondered what to do next. He was curious to know what Buster had found, and yet he was also curious of the other rooms on the top floor. Specifically the one occupied by Jane and her Husband.
114112.title: Jump on and Hang on

11412.content:
Better safe than a stain. Things were looking a bit too busy out there so Ash just decided to hang out in the closet and watch the world go by. Sure it didn't smell the best at ground level but it was a hellova lot safer than being out in the open.
