The Doorbell rang. He watched as Arthur let Buster into the house, that's when he noticed Arthur was wearing shoes. So that's why he didn't put them on. But wait a sec, who's shoe had Ash been in if it wasn't his? Oh well, maybe it was his dress shoes or something. As he watched them walk away, Ash began to think of his immediate future. He didn't know how he got here, but he was coming up with a theory. And he didn't know if he could ever get back. There was a real possibility he'd be spending the rest of his life there, however long it would be. If he wanted to survive here, Ash knew he wouldn't be able to do it on his own. He had been lucky so far, but it was only a matter of time before his luck ran out and he ended up crushed under some giant's foot.

He had to get help. Problem was, getting someone's attention wasn't going to be easy. And then there was the question of whose attention should he be trying to get? The Adults would be Ideal, but they were much larger than the children. And the children were smaller but would they be mature enough to deal with? Arthur or his friend’s maybe, but D.W? Most likely not, how much maturity would a four or five year old have? Not much if he remembered his own childhood correctly.

So those were his choices, either he tried to get help from the parents or the kids.
11412.title: Wait a while

114122.content:
Well, the best place to get Arthur's attention would be the confines of his bedroom ,but Damn. That was going to be harder than he thought.

Each step to the upstairs level had to have been 25 to 40 feet high, and there were 12 of them. Getting down wouldn't be too much trouble because of the way each step was designed, but going up was going to be a bitch. Unless he could get a ride up there. If he could jump on someone's foot as they walked upstairs he/she could just carry him up, all he had to do was grab on and hold on tight.

"Nah, that would never work."

Not far from the stairs Ash saw a laundry basket, inside he saw clean cloths neatly folded. No doubt someone would be dropping them off to various rooms in the house, including any rooms upstairs. he could easily hide among the articles of clothing without being detected, as least he thought so, heck he'd been here almost a half hour and none of them seemed to have notice him yet.

He began to feel the floor boards vibrate, someone was coming. Looking around to make sure the coast was clear, Ash ran to the laundry basket. It was a wicker basket and it was easy to climb up into it, well easier compared to trying to climb up a set of giant size stairs. He jumped in and crawled under several articals of clothing, a few moments later he could here Giant size footsteps. He heard Jane Humming a tune to herself and his ears popped and was suddenly propelled upward as Jane picked up the basket.

Hidden under the clothes Ash had no clue where he was going. He knew He was going up stairs, which is were he wanted to go, but what the final distination was he had no idea. There was a pause, a door opened, and Jane walked into a room. He felt the Laundry basket placed on a surface. Suddenly He felt weight on top and under him as Jane's hand closed around the peice of clothing underneath and on top of him.

It was a tight grasp, the grip was forceing the wind out of his lungs. Jane was completely unaware that she was crushing Ash between her fingers, if she had she would've been very sorry about it. Luckily it was only momentary as she placed the two articals of clothing into a dresser drawer. She closed the dresser but in her rush to get things done, the drawer was left slightly opened. Waiting for Jane to leave, and also to get his breath back, Ash climbed up over the edge of the dresser drawer. He was definetly in a bedroom. But who's bedroom?
114122.title: Arthur or His Friends

11413.content:
Well, as interesting as a bunch of shoes were, it was also not the best place to be. And so Ash left the confines of the closet and after several hours had found his way under the living room couch. It was a much more sheltered area and unless someone lost the remote no one was going to look under there. It would do for now. Maybe he'd finally get to see a full episode of Bionic Bunny for once and see what the big deal was.

FOOM....FOOM....FOOM

Someone was coming. With great caution Ash looked out to see who it was.

The youngest of the Read children, DW walked into the living room to watch TV and was making a Beeline to the Couch. So intent on doing this that she didn't notice the Tiny human scampering back under it. From underneath , Ash watched as DW sat down on the floor, her back against the front of the couch. She picked up the Remote and Turned the TV on. He heard the opening theme of a familiar TV show.

"Bob and Millie Frazier, average young New Yorkers who attended a party in the country last night and on the way home took a detour. Most of us on waking in the morning know exactly where we are; the rooster or the alarm clock brings us out of sleep into the familiar sights, sounds, aromas of home and the comfort of a routine day ahead. Not so with our young friends. This will be a day like none they've ever spent--and they'll spend it in the Twilight Zone."

'That's exacly where I'm spending it,' Ash thought.

He sat down for a moment. This was a crazy situation no question about it. Here he was an inch tall, give or take, in a world where the characters of a cartoon show on PBS existed. And not only do they exist but they're Ginormous.

A noice broke his train of thought. Sounded like a chip bag being opened. He heard something loud being eaten and suddenly an open bag of cheese doodles was placed just infront of him. Ash's Stomach growled. How long had it been since he'd eaten last? He sure wouldn't mind getting something to eat, but just to get a peice of a cheese doodle ment going into the bag and getting out before DW desided to eat some more. Ash didn't want to get caught.

Or worst, eaten.
11413.title: Later that day

choices: Yell. Try to get her attention
No Time, She opened her mouth wide
114132.content:
The bag was on it's side, Making getting into it easy for Ash .As quietly as he could he crept into the bag, the smell of cheese making him really hungry. He spied a cheese Doodle by itself and tried to pick it up. The thing was heavier than Ash thought it would be. Suddenly his world tipped forward and he found himself being lifted up into the air. Partially covered by cheese Doodles, I looked up to see a huge pudgy hand enter the bag.

It picked up a doodle beside Ash and disappeared out of view. Heard the sounds of loud chewing a gulp and the hand returned. This time it quickly grabbed a doodle on top of Ash and disappeared again. Ash Hoped DW would put the bag back on the floor. When the hand returned The fingers were outstretched. It wasn't going to pick up just one this time.

"Oh shi--"

DW reached into the Bag of doodles and grabbed a handful of the cheesy snack food. Her attention was directed to the TV and she didn't see Ash among the cheese doodles she was holding. He was almost at eye level with the young child's mouth. A chill went through him as the the Giant swallowed.
114132.title: Taking a Risk

1141322.content:
Ash always knew he would die sooner or later, He just never thought he'd go like this.

DW's mouth opened before Him. The smell of cheese that made him hungry earlier now blew over him in a wave of hot humid breath, the tongue dropped and the throat opened as though inviteing him in. As second later and he was dumped unceremoniously onto the quivering tongue among the cheese doodles before being engulfed in darkness. Then the chewing began and with every crunch he was taused about inside the mouth. The noise of the doodles being crushed into a pulp was deafening. He hoped it would end quick as was shoved onto a row of teeth. They rose upward to meet the teeth above and--

DW paused as she tasted blood in her mouth. 'Must've bit my tongue or something,' she though. Thinking nothing of it she continued chewing her mouth full of Cheese Doodle and swallowed.

The irony of it was as DW dropped the bag of Cheese Doodles back on the floor one rolled out of the bag and under the couch.
1141322.title: No Time, She opened her mouth wide

choices: She Feels Ash, But not in a good way.
Ash suddenly slips into a hole in Francine's sock
she Feels Ash, but ignores him
1142.content:
Francine Alice Frensky towered over Ash. Only eight years old she was at least 460 feet tall. She was humming the herself but Ash didn’t recognize the tune.

“Help! Help Me!!! Hey! I’m down here in your shoe!!”

Francine glanced down, but only to guide her foot into one of her well worn shoes—the one he was in.

“Wait! No! STOP!!!!”

An old worn sock covered the foot tightly, Ash could see distinctly the shape of her toes. He tried to run but she was inserted her foot quicker than Ash could run and he felt the crushing weight of her foot on his body. He was dragged to the toe of the shoe. As her foot settled in the shoe Ash was trapped under her toes. He could here her laceing up the shoe. Desperated not to end up being turned into a greesey paste he began kicking and punching her foot as hard as he could. He knew the odds of her feeling him wasn’t very good but he had no other options.
1142.title: Francine

choices: Francine Looks more closely at the "Bug"
Francine tauses the "Bug" into the waste basket
Francine takes the "Bug" outside and sets him free
Francine realizes this is no bug
11421.content:
"Hey, What is that?"

The huge foot on top of Ash was still for a moment. He didn't know if she had felt him or not but he was hopeful. He heard laces being untied. a moment later the foot lifted off him and was pulled out of the shoe.

'Yes! She felt me!'

Things were quiet for a moment or two. Then the shoe was lifted into the air. It was tipped on a sharp angle and Ash found myself sliding towards the heel of the shoe where a huge hand was waiting to catch him.

***
Francine felt something moving under the toes of her right foot.

'Probably a bug,’ she thought as she began to untie her shoe. 'Oh well, can't leave it in there.'

She checked the bottom of her foot and didn't find anything so she picked up her shoe and dumped out whatever was in it into her hand. At first nothing came out, but then something small landed in her palm.

***
Lying almost in the centre of her palm Ash stared up at his captor. He was brought closer to her face, her breath blowing down on him. At least it was fresh, would’ve been bad if it had the smell of spoiled milk or something. But her breath was the least of his worries, he was in the hand of a gigantic anthropomorphic eight year old and Ash had no Idea what she was going to do.

Looked up into her face, her look told Ash she wasn't sure what he was; at least she didn't appear to be frightened or angry.
11421.title: Francine meets Ash

choices: Ash tries to explain what happened
Ash decides to take advantage of the situation
Ash is interrupted before he can say anything
114211.content:
Francine opened the top dresser drawer and took out a magnifying glass there was something about this bug that didn't seem right at all. Under magnification she was surprised by what she saw. It had two arms, two legs. It wore clothes. Though it looked different there was no doubt she had a tiny person in her hand.

'Do you understand me?' She asked.

The person nodded 'Yes'

She smiled. This was so amazing. 'Can you speak?'

The person began shouting something, but she couldn't quite make it out.

'Hold on.'

***

Ash felt the hand underneath him rise. She was bringing him closer to her head. Turning her head to the right she moved her hair away with her other hand to reveal her ear. Ash knew what she had in mind.

'Climb in, but don't go too far or I wont be able to get you out.'

Good advise. Ash climb up over the fleshy ring of her ear and peered down her ear cannel. It was a tunnel made of flesh that ended in darkness, but he wasn't planning to go that far in.

'Can you hear me now?'

'Yes. Who are you? Where did you come from?'
114211.title: Francine Looks more closely at the "Bug"

choices: Maybe not such a good idea
1142111.content:
“Name’s Ash. And I am from another dimension. At least that’s the best way to describe it. I wish I could tell you how I got here but I don’t know. One moment I'm home and the next I'm here. All I know is if you hadn’t felt me…”

“I don’t want to think about that.” Francine said quietly.

“It’s all right kid, don’t worry about it. It didn’t happen, that’s the important part. What’s your name?” Ash knew who she was, but didn’t want to reveal that just yet.

“Francine.”

“Nice to meet you. Am I still on planet Earth?”

“Yeah.”

“Well, at least that’s the same.”

“FRANCINE, BREAKFAST IS READY.”

“Coming! Look, I gotta go. Are you going to be okay up here or do you want to come with me?”
1142111.title: Tell her The Truth

choices: Ash grabs onto a strand of hair
Ash lands in Francine's cereal (Francine noticed him fall in)
11421111.content:
"O-Okay. I'll just hide here in your Ear."

Francine began to stand up. The sudden movement caused Ash to fall on his back in the cusp of the Ear.

"Sorry" she said "I'll try to move more carefully."

"Okay, but try to be natural about it. If you walk about all stiff like that and they'll ask questions."

"Okay"

"I'll just stay quiet. If you were to talk to me it would look as though you were talking to yourself."

Francine slipped her sneakers back on and opened the door to her bedroom. From inside her ear Ash watched through thick ropes of hair as the world outside opened up. Ash thought that riding on a giant this large was almost akin to riding the sand worm from Dune. The moment Francine walked into the kitchen area of the apartment and he saw the rest of the family Ash let out a gasp of astonishment. He had thought Francine to be the largest creature he had ever seen in his life. Her family towered over her. It was almost too much for his mind to process.

Francine decided that it was best to simply ignore her passenger and sat down with her family at the table. She poured herself a bowl of what passed as lucky charms in this reality and took part in the morning conversation. As for Ash, he was quite content to be the quiet observer. Though to be fair, he could only observe one side if her head. From his perspective through the thick hair he could only make out Francine's sister eating her own bowl of cereal. The first loud "CRUNCH" of Francine's first spoonful of cereal being eaten startled Ash. He had no idea it would be so loud. For some reason between observing Catherine eat and listening to the crunching of Francine's chewing he was reminded of Honey I shrunk the Kids. He watched a spoonful of cereal lifted out of the bowl and enter Catherine's smiling mouth and envisioned himself trapped in that spoon. It made him feel fearful, and yet strangely excited.

Suddenly Francine turned her head to talk to her father. It was something Ash wasn't prepared for and he found himself falling head first over the side of the ear.
11421111.title: Observing the Family

114211114.content:
The moment she heard the faint "Plop" Francine knew what had happened. A quick nonchalant glance into her half eaten bowl of cereal confirmed it. There was her little visitor clinging to a cereal bit. Great, now what was she going to do?

"Is there something wrong, Francine? " Her mother asked.

"Oh no, everything's fine. What was that you were saying?" Francine dipped her spoon into her cereal. Everything was FAR from fine. What was she going to do? She couldn't get him out. Not with her family watching. She scooped up a load of cereal in the corner of her bowl, away from Ash. At least this way he'll know she wasn't intentionally trying to eat him.

Down in the bowl, and beyond the hearing capability of the giants, Ash was screaming. He had screamed a profanity on the way down and a swear word caught in his throat as his body hit the cold milk. Breaking the surface he reached for and held onto the closest sugary bit of marshmallow cereal. He was wiping the milk from his eyes in time to see the spoon dive into the milk some distance away and rise up with cereal. He looked up and saw it disappear into Francine's mouth. He cried out, but his voice was too far away to be heard. What he'd been picturing just moments before was now coming true. It was honey I shrunk the kids, but he didn't have a dog to save his ass!

It wasn't until the second or third spoon full that Ash began to realize he didn't have anything to fear. Francine was looking down and deliberately missing him. He relaxed. She knew he was there. He began to enjoy the show. After all, it wasn't every day you got to see someone eating cereal from the perspective of the cereal.

Francine's mind was racing for a solution. She was running out of cereal to eat, and she still had to get Ash out of her bowl. Every idea she came up with wouldn't work. Unless...

'Sorry Ash.' she thought as she lowered the spoon for her last spoon full.

Ash never thought for a moment that Francine would actually scoop him up. Though he had no idea how he was getting out of her bowl, the last thing he considered was that she'd have no choice. So it came to quite a surprise when the spoon descended and he was lifted upward. He was in her spoon, just him and a lone marshmallow bit. The last thing in her bowl now in her spoon. Francine's huge primate mouth filled his vision. He saw her jawline move up and down as she finished chewing the previous mouthful of cereal. There was a loud gulp.

"Francine, you could've just drank that down with the milk." He heard her Sister say.

The mouth in front of him smiled and replied. "You know they say, the last bites the best.”

Ash let out a scream that was barely heard by the 8 year old 'Sorry Ash' Francine thought as she opened her mouth.

To Ash, it was a sight of awe and Terror. Teeth three times his size, a huge tongue dipped down as if to accept this new treat, and beyond a gaping abyss.

The spoon scraped against enamel as it entered the interior of the mouth and everything went dark. As the spoon slid out from underneath him he was pressed up against the roof of the mouth. His ears popped as the air pressure changed and there was a loud gulp. He then felt the jaw rise up and down as Francine pretended to chew.

Rising from the table, Francine picked up her bowl and as she walked away pretended to drink the rest of her milk. She then quietly poured out the milk into the sink before placing the bowl and spoon into the dishwasher. She then
114211114.title: Waiter, there's an Ash in my cereal.

11421112.content:
“I think I’ll stay here if it’s all the same with you.” Ash told her. “Seeing one giant has been nerve-wracking. I’m not ready to meet a whole family of them. Is there someplace you can put me where that’s out of the way?”

He felt her head turn “I can put you up on the shelf. You should be alright there until I come back.”

Her hand came back to her ear. Climbing into it Ash was carried up to the first level of shelving that was above her desk. A moment later he climbed over the tip of Francine’s tilted hand and onto the shelf.

“I’ll be back in a while. There should be enough places to hide if anyone comes in here”

“Hide? Whom should I be hiding from?” Ash called up, unfortunately he was out of her hearing range and she was already out the door, closing it behind her.

"Who would’ve thought my day was going to turn out like this".

This was so surreal; standing on that shelf was almost like standing on top of a skyscraper. The Scale was absolutely incredible, and this was just one room. What was the rest of this world like? Ash noticed there were two beds in the room, if he remembered the cartoon correctly and if this reality followed any continuity of the cartoon, Francine had an older sister named Catherine. He couldn’t recall her age but did remember she stood a good two feet taller than Francine.

Ash felt a vibration. Someone was coming but the tremors were different this time. Whoever was making them was bigger than Francine. He may have jinxed himself thinking about her sister, she was probably coming back here.

‘I suppose I should hide’ he thought. But wasn’t necessary? From the scale of everything he could be right out in the open and wouldn't be noticed. And at this height he had no worries of being stepped on.
11421112.title: Maybe not such a good idea

114211121.content:
Ash decided it was best to stay hidden. After all he didn't know how someone else might react to his presence. So he stayed hidden behind a stuffed toy on Francine's shelf. He stayed there as whoever it was entered the room, sat down at the desk just below him and ate what sounded like cereal. He could hear the pages of a book being turned occasionally. This went on for about twenty minutes, after that he heard whoever it was get up and leave, a while after that he heard someone else enter the room.

"Ash? Where are you?"

With a sigh of relief he ran out from behind the stuff toy to find Francine had placed a scrap of bread on the shelf for him with a cap full of water. He was starting to think of himself as a pet of sorts.

"This was the best I could do. I didn't want anyone to notice I was bringing this stuff up." she explained as Ash walked up to her. "I hope you're okay with that."

Knowing She couldn't hear him Ash simply gave her a thumbs up and hoped her eyesight was good enough to make out his thumb, he doubt it though.

"look, I have to go to school and I have five minutes to catch the bus." said Francine "I'd take you with me but I'm afraid I might lose you so you'll have to stay in my room. Are you okay with that?"

Ash nodded. It would be better to remain in the safety of her bedroom than to face a school full of students.

"Okay, I'll see you later."

With that, the Young Giant left the room. This was starting off to be one heck of a day.
114211121.title: Hide

choices: Catherine is asleep in her Bed (Possible distination)
1142111211.content:
'What?' Ash thought as he looked about the darken room. Night had fallen, in fact according to the digital clock on the bed stand it was after one in the morning. Well, how the heck did that happen? True it wasn't far fetch for him to have slept through the day, but why hadn't he awoken when Francine had come home, and why hadn't she woken him up?

He walked up behind a potted plant to relieve himself. He'd rather not do it on a bookshelf but considering the miniscule amount he doubt it would be noticed. As he walked behind the plant he found a note written 12 x 25 foot piece of paper :

*Gone to a friends house for the night, Left a string so you can climb down to the floor. Watch out for Catherine.
-Francine*

Well that explained why Francine was nowhere to be seen, but why hadn't she told him herself? Maybe there was no time and she couldn't find him quickly enough. Upon relieving himself Ash found the string where she'd placed it. Tied securely to a pressed in thumbtack it did indeed go all the way to the floor, and to make sure he wouldn't get hurt if he happened to fall she placed a fuzzy slipper at the bottom.

'Great, more foot where' he thought, not that be mind, he was beginning to like being small enough to be in one. In fact he was beginning to realize the full potential of his situation. Walking toward the front of the shelf he looked about to see if he was alone.
1142111211.title: Night Time Exploration

choices: Walk around to the left side of the bed
Walk around to the right side of the bed
11421112112.content:
Someone was asleep in the bed next to Francine's, someone who was bigger than Francine. Though he couldn't see the the face, the head of hair left no guesswork as to the identity of the person. Catherine Frensky lay on her side with her back facing Ash. From the sound of her breathing he could tell she was in deep sleep.

"So I slept through Francine moving about but also Catherine getting ready for bed?" he thought out loud. He didn't have to worry about waking anyone up, heck at his size he could shout and not be heard from that distance. The more he looked at her the more intrigued he became, the more he wanted to take a closer look.

'Oh no you don't' said the voice of reason.

'What?'

'She's 15'

'She's also close to four hundred feet tall, what's your point?'

'I know what you are thinking. You want to go and get closer to her.'

'Why shouldn't I? It's not like I'm going to violate her or anything. This is strictly scientific.'

'Scientific? Yeah right.'

'Okay hotshot, how often to people get a chance to checkout a giant anthropomorphic?'

'... point taken... Very well, but we need ground rules.'

'Shoot'

'Number 1, No checking out anything of personal nature'

'Agreed. I'm curious, not perverted'

'Number 2, first sign of trouble you get the hell away.'

'Agreed. Live to fight another day.'

Now that he was done arguing with himself, it was time to make his way down. That turned out to be easier than he'd though. Ash had never been good as far as his upper body strength went, but now for some reason he was surprisingly easy to scale down the thread to the floor below. Maybe it was like how ants could carry more than their body weight or something. Upon reaching the floor, his next task was to climb up onto Catherine's bed. That wouldn't be easy. He'd have to take a look around the bed to see what was the best way to go.
11421112112.title: Catherine

choices: Catherine slides her foot under the covers.
114211121121.content:
To say Ash was nervous was an understatement. His Adrenaline rush was so high he couldn't stop shaking. With his eyes adjusted to the darkness, he made his way toward the Catherine's bed. What would've been a quick walk normally was a now a long journey that took him a good twenty minutes. In all this time, the young giantess shifted in her sleep twice and made Ash jump both times. It also gave Ash a way up. When she shifted in her sleep that last time just enough blanket touched the floor, and when he arrived Ash didn't hesitate to use it to climb upward. This turned out to be a little harder than climbing down. So much so that by the time he reached the top he was out of breath.

The first thing Ash saw when he reached the top was a bare foot sticking out from under the covers.

This was an instrument of destruction as far as Ash was concerned, still he thought it was worth checking out. The room was dark, but Ash's eyes had adjusted to the shadows just enough to make out much of the details. While the foot was covered in fine short hair the sole was completely hairless. Toes were stubby but broad and the rest of the sole was wide. As he got closer he noticed dermal swirls similar to humans on the unblemished skin of the sole. Even from 15 feet away he could feel the heat radiating from the limb. There was an Oder there as well, but not as unpleasant as one would expect, it would seem Catherine had showered prior to going to bed.

Tentatively, Ash reached out and touched a toe. The skin felt soft with a warmth similar to clothes out of a dryer. When there was no reaction from the sleeping Giantess, he decided to climb up on top of the sole. A risky thing to do, no question, but it was something he felt compelled to do. He noted as he slowly made his way to the ball of the foot that he was so lite that he didn't even make an indentation in the skin. When he reached the ball of her foot Ash lay face first with his arms and legs outstretched as though he were trying to hug the foot. The heat radiating outward soothed Ash's aching muscles. He wondered why Francine had warned him about Cath--

Suddenly the foot shifted and he tumbled down toward the toes of the foot, he landed in the underside of her second toe as her toes began to curl.
114211121121.title: The left side of the bed

choices: Francine's Mom comes into the room to clean/dust
Catherine Comes home early (Not feeling well)
1142111212.title: So what Happens?

choices: She bumps her knee on the desk as she stands up
She stands up and retrieves the book without incident
She Stands up and looks Ash right in the eye
She stands up and gets the feeling that she's being watched
114211122.content:
Ash saw nothing to fear from such a high place. So he stood on the edge of the shelf and watched as the door opened.

Catherine Frensky walked into the bedroom she shared with her younger sister. She had some last minute studying to do before she went to school so she brought her breakfast with her, a bowl of cereal. She was sure Francine wouldn’t mind her use of her desk for a while. She placed the bowl down and went to get her book bag.

Ash watched her put the bowl down and walk over to her bed. How something so big so move so quickly, it was like Planet of the Apes meets Godzilla. She sat down placing her book bag beside her. She pulled out a book and opened it to a certain chapter. Ash edged his way to the very edge of the shelf and look down.

He watched her quietly as she flipped the pages of her schoolbook, slowly eating spoon full after spoon full of her breakfast. After a while she closed the book and put it back in her backpack. Ash watched her frown as she began looking through it. It seemed she was looking for another book but it wasn’t there. She looked over to her bed. There it, on her nightstand where she had left it the night before.
114211122.title: Don't Hide

choices: Ash makes it to the spoon
Catherine Suddenly sees something in her bowl
Catherine suddenly realizes she's late (Leaves Bowl unfinished)
1142111221.content:
The desk was meant for someone a bit shorter and as she stood up to retrieve it she banged her knee against the underside of it. The vibration shook through the shelf above, and like that idiot in so many stories Ash had read he had been standing at the very edge of the of shelf at that very moment. He lost his balance and fell forward. He doubted Catherine even heard his cowardly scream as he fell head first into her half eaten breakfast.

Mind numbing cold was the first sensation Ash felt. In the back of his mind he was thankful this had happened halfway through her meal, if he had struck something solid he probably wouldn’t have survived the fall.

Honey I Shrunk the Kids was definitely coming to mind. Unlike the kid in the movie there wasn’t any dog here to save his ass. But the kid didn’t have a way out of the bowl—and Ash did.

Catharine had left the spoon in the bowl for his convenience. All he had to do was get to it and climb up it to safety, providing he could get his numbing extremities to move quickly enough before she came back. If he couldn’t he hoped his death came quick and he was brain food.
1142111221.title: She bumps her knee on the desk as she stands up

11421112212.content:
Retrieving her book, Catherine returned to the desk and sat down. Opening her book to the right chapter she picked up her soon and continued eating her breakfast. She frowned at the problem she had to memorize and also at the fact that her cereal had begun to go soggy. So focused on her studies that she didn't notice the tiny person floundering and loosing a battle within her bowl. Ash knew he was going to die. The ice cold milk did it's job on his limbs and with the last of his strength he pulled himself up onto a bit of cereal. He considered just slipping under the surface of the milk and breath in. Drowning would be a far better death than being chewed, swallowed and dissolved. He just couldn't bring himself to do it. There was a flash of silver and a splash as the spoon dove down from above and scooped up cereal and delivered it to a waiting mouth. The chewing and swallowing process hadn't even begun when the spoon returned. This time scooping up Ash.

There was a blur of movement and an assent that made his ears pop. He found himself weakly staring at an enormous mouth. At that close distance it was the only part of her he could see, and he stared in a combination of terror and fasination. At the moment the lips were closed but moved with the jawline as Catherine chewed. To Ash it was as though the teen was showing him his fate. Then with a loud GULP the mouth opened. If this had been a Saturday Catherine would've been more inclined to eat more slowly, to enjoy her breakfast.

But not today.

There was a rush forward. Ash got only a glimpse of the inside of the mouth before he was deposited inside it. It went dark as the mouth closed and suddenly the spoon was gone. Ash landed face first on a rippling tongue. The heat radiated from the muscle returning strength to his limbs and rising his core temperature. It was ironic that Catherine was saving and ending his life at the same time.
11421112212.title: Extra bit of protein

choices: Catherine gets ready to go to school
Catherine begins to drink the Milk from the bowl
114211122121.content:
0.00000003%

That's about the only odds Ash gave for himself as he was taused about in the darkness of Catherine's mouth. Occasionally there's was a flash of light as the lips slightly parted from time to time. Surpriseingly enough, he hadn't been pulverised into pulp buy the crushing teeth, thus far. He had been painfully knocked against them but for whatever reason he had not landed on them. It wasn't just the crushing teeth he had to contend with, no that would've been slightly easier to deal with than the inability to breath. The most he'd be able to do was short breaths. Every time he opened his mouth he swallowed a combination of Saliva, Milk, and pulpy cereal. Not exactly the nicest combination in the world. All of which occured in a span of less than 30 seconds. Even if he survived not being chewed he knew there was no way to survive being swallowed.

But Fate had other Idea's for Ash as he suddenly found himself slipped under the huge tongue. Moments later there was a powerful custion and a loud Gulp. He had survived. His ears were ringing like mad but he'd survived. But that didn't mean much to the Micro. He might've avoided being chewed , swallowed and disolved but he was still trapped in and enourmouse mouth and up to his neck in Saliva. He had no backup, no plan, no weapons worth a damn, and nothing to lose but his life.

"Oh my gosh! I'm going to be late!"

The Voice was deafening from inside the mouth. Ash covered his ears as the tongue violently moved with each syllable.
114211122121.title: What are the odds of surviving this?

choices: She Begins to feel it move (Instant spit out!)
114211122122.content:
Catherine had just started studying page 405 when she started to notice something odd about that last spoonful of cereal. She had chewed once or twice before she noticed a funny flavor. Her tongue immediately isolated the flavor to be coming from something that didn't seem to be a cereal bit. Pinning it to the roof of her mouth, she swallowed the partially chewed cereal. Now she probably would have just spat out whatever it was that was in her mouth, except for one thing.

She kinda liked it's taste.

Plus it was helping her with her studying. So, not caring for what it was, she began to play with the object in her mouth.

Ash suddenly felt himself pinned to the roof of Catherine's mouth. The tongue, with it's thousands of tingling taste buds, molded around him. Moments later there was a powerful suction and a loud Gulp. He had survived. His ears were ringing like mad but he'd survived. This left him confused of course. She had pinned him to the roof of her mouth so she could swallow the cereal, why? As if in response to his question, Catherine began to probe him with the tip of her tongue. It was slow and deliberate act. Taste receptors fired off as they made contact with exposed skin.

Gulp.

She had swallowed access saliva that had built up, the probing continued. Then more frequent swallowing. It suddenly dawned on Ash what was happening.

Catherine sucked on the object, enjoying the flavor while at the same time finishing the last of her studies. She was as ready as she was going to be to do that test. As she began to stand, it occurred to her that maybe she should spit out the object in her mouth just to see what it was. After a moment she decided to-
114211122122.title: Catherine tastes something funny

choices: She slammed her hand down on top of Ash
She quickly scoops Ash up into her hand.
She Gently picks Ash up between her thumb and fingers
She leans in closer to get a better look at Ash
1142111222.content:
Catherine stood and retrieved her school book. Sitting back down she opened it and continued to eat her breakfast and study. Little did she know someone was studying her as well. Though the cartoon made her look like her younger sister there were differences. The small beauty mole on her cheek for example. The darker color of her eyes, the texture of her hair. Her sent which was more perfumed. Well that was expected after all. She was a teenage girl.

Finishing her breakfast Catherine drank the remaining milk out of the bowl and looked at her watch. She quickly put her books away and stood up to leave. As she did she looked up at the shelf and directly at Ash. Her eyes focused on him and went wide. Her mouth dropped open and then she lifted a hand twice as large as Francine's, the palm facing Ash.
1142111222.title: Catherine and Ash

choices: I think we should still tell  Mom and Dad
Okay, He'll be our  secrete  for now
11421112222.content:
A split second there was a blur of motion and then the massive hand was upon him, huge fingers closed around him pressing him into the swirly ridges of the palm. How could something so big move so fast? Trapped in her closed fist the only light was what was streaming in from between her fingers. Ash was scared to say the least. What was she going to do with him? He felt the hand raise up and away from the shelf and rotate so that the palm was pointing up toward the ceiling.

Catherine looked at her closed fist for a moment. She wasn't the squeamish type and wouldn't have any problem crushing this little thing and washing her hands afterwards. But she wanted a closer look first.

Ash blinked several times to get used to the light again and looked up into the face of the Frenskies's oldest daughter. She was looking and him, not with distain but with mild curiosity. She was wondering why the "Bug" was just sitting there and not trying to escape? Had she hurt it? No, she didn't think so. It just sat there as though waiting her next move.

Slowly Catherine extended the index finger of her other hand toward Ash. His heart raced as it approached, the tip of it alone was big enough to crush him if she chose to do so.

"Don't hurt him!"

Catherine turned to see Francine in the doorway. "Him? How do you know this bugs a Him?"

"He's not a bug." her younger sister explained handing Catherine the Magnifying Glass, "See for yourself."

Catherine's already large features expanded under the magnification of the Magnifying Glass. Her eyes focused on Ash as they studied him intensely. Much to her surprise and amazement she had to conclude what her sister was telling her."

"Can...Can he speak?"

"He can speak but you have to bring him close to your ear, His voice isn't that loud."

"I can imagine not." Catherine looked at Ash, one of his fingers was barely the thickness of one of the friction ridges of her palm. "Where did you find him?"

"He was in one of my sneakers."

"Lucky for him you weren't wearing your lucky socks. You could've gassed him to death. Francine, we have to tell someone about him."

"We can't! Not yet!" Francine protested "I've watched enough Alien movies to know that the government will take him away and do who knows what to him."

Catherine pursed her lips. Her sister had a point. After a moment's thought she finally said--
11421112222.title: At Catherine's Mercy

choices: He thought it might be better to stay where he was.
114211122222.content:
Overall, the living arrangement between Ash and the two sisters turned out to be a good deal. Of course there were some ground rules, one of them being that he wasn't allowed to watch them undress or change clothing. Well, he had no problem with that rule. He was a gentleman when it came to stuff like that. Besides, if he'd got caught he was a dead man. When you are as small as the tip of a finger the last thing you want to do is piss off your room mates, especially when they can crush you under that said tip of a finger.

He established a home among a potted cactus which provided shelter and a place where he could relieve himself. His first home was a TeePee like structure made of paper and match sticks. A few months later he upgraded to a cabin made of match sticks. The heads of course were removed due to fire hazards. Some cotton for bedding and two bottle caps of water that served as his drinking and bathing.

Did it bother him that he lacked any major technology? Yes. But he had Francine or Catherine to help him in that regard. He couldn't use their computer so they became his hands. All he had to do was speak into a mic and they'd do the rest.

As Months passed, he found out a few things in regard to Francine. For one, unlike her cartoon counterpart, she had never owned a cat, nor had she ever had the desire to own one.

"Why should I have a cat? I have you." she once joked.

When The Sisters were away in school or other events, Ash stayed out of sight. He didn't want the parents to find him. As big as Francine was and was bigger Catherine was to her, so much larger was their Mother and Father. Countless times he'd watch their Mother walk into the room to vacuum or dust or drop off laundry. He really didn't know how she or her husband finding out about a real live tiny alien life form living in their daughter's bedroom. He hoped it would turn out okay, but in a worst case scenario it wouldn't go well for him.

Sometimes when no one was in the Apartment he'd explore. So far though he'd limited his wandering to just the Bedroom, then one day he decided to venture out even further. He waited long enough to make sure the cost was clear. Then he made his decision.
114211122222.title: Like Three's Company

1142112.content:
All things considering, living with Giants had it's advantages. Granted there were a lot of disadvantages like the lost of independence but the advantages outweighed the disadvantages.

Despite his protest Francine felt it was best to show Ash to her friends rather than keeping him a secrete like he'd wanted. She had invited them all to see the visitor from another world. it was a meeting that both fascinated and scared Ash to his very core.Naturally they were all fascinated with him. They looked at him as though he were some exotic mouse or whatnot. The attention made Ash uncomfortable, but given the situation he supposed it was a natural reaction. Because they all had difficulty hearing him, Francine had placed him in font of a microphone that she had hooked up to her stereo. Upon hearing his story, one of them named Buster suggested Alien involvement. His friends scoffed at him until Ash pointed out that techincly he himself was Alien to this world and all things considering they couldn't rule out Alien activity. At that point though, the biggest issue was what to do with Ash.

There was no way Francine could keep her little friend a secret for very long. Remembering the snake incident from a few months prior they worked out a plan that would have Ash moved about and living with all of them. Arthur would have Ash a few days, then Buster, then Muffy and so on. The Living arrangement turned out to be very profitable. Not only was there an exchange of information in regard to culture and societies but it also allowed Ash to become an explorer of sorts. Whether it was the objects in the room or the person he was staying with. Even something as ordinary as a sock became something worth exploring. Course, all the while he stayed in the confines of the bedroom he was sharing and for a while that was enough to satisfy his curiosities. But over the period of a month, he was beginning to build up enough of a nerve to take it to the next level.

After considerable thought, he decided it was time to do so. And On this day, he was staying with:
1142112.title: Fast Forward a few Months

choices: "....you could climb me, I know you like that!"
"....or you could walk around, while I'm walking at the same time."
114211211.content:
(Author's note: Like the Muffy chapters, Sue Ellen will be aged up as well....around the age of 18.)

Ash looked at himself in the broken piece of Mirror. Not much had changed in the years. Well, aside for the longer hair and the loin cloth around his waist. His Shorts, shoes and T-shirt had long ago worn out. But, so long as he remained in a warm place he was perfectly fine. The hair, Now that had been a problem for him. How to cut it? Conventional scissors were out of the question, and the idea of having hair growing down to the cheeks of his backside didn't appeal to him at all. The solution came to him one day when he'd been out in the lawn exploring. He had come across a sliver of glass and he immediately knew exactly what he'd do with it. After adding a handle so he wouldn't cut himself he was left with something that could cut his hair perfectly. Not as close as he had wanted, but enough to manage it. He also used it to manage his facial hair, though at first he did cut himself a few times until he had gotten enough practice. Now it was second nature.

Ash always did enjoy the company of Sue Ellen. She was a very creative girl, very positive, and the fact she had traveled the world and still had plans to do so, added to her personality. He enjoyed her company so much, she really didn't have to do much of anything, just being around and listening to her was enough for him.

Sitting on the edge of the room, inside his wooden box that Sue Ellen had given him, Ash sat on his miniature chair, reading whatever small literature he had lying around-or at least his size-while waiting for her friend to get back home from school. The box had been altered moderately to resemble an adobe home. Small furniture of his size were placed around to his liking, while a door was carved to the side and some windows for air ventilation were made on the top of the walls.

The books he had around were actually made by Sue Ellen's mother, who had a stock of miniatures lying around from her journeys. A perfect gift for him as he was impressed by the detailing of the pages and how articulate it was.

Suddenly he felt massive tremors approaching, shaking his home and appliances. For every one that came, he would jump in his chair, fall down, only to be lifted up higher by the next shake.

"HEY ASH, I'M HOME!" A thundering voice came, vibrating the walls of his home. Standing up from the ground and fixing his chair, Ash stretched as he walked out his front door. There stood Sue Ellen, all of her. She had age well into her teens, growing taller than most girls and being quite athletic as well. Sure she wasn't muscular but she was more agile than most people.

Her longs sported a blue skirt as she wore some sandals along with green anklets; following her get up, she had a similar cool blouse along with her tan jacket. Her hair had also grown longer along the years, going down her back but still keeping it in her familiar pig tail style.

Slumping her backpack unto her bed, she looked down to find her tiny friend already in front of her. She waved at him as she spoke, "Hello there tiny friend! I am ready for another set of fun. Ratburn's been easy on us for the week, all my homework is done, and so far...well I got nothing planned that I remembered."

Ash smiled, he was content with the news; that meant more time being spent with Sue Ellen than waiting for her to finish any assignment she had. "So what did you have plan?" Ash screamed back up, as he wasn't as fortunate to have a microphone like he did with Muffy.

"Well..." Sue Ellen placed a hand finger under her chin, "I do have some things in my mind..."
114211211.title: Sue Ellen

choices: Sue Ellen begins to walk barefoot around Ash
Ash takes the oppurtunity and runs up to the abandoned sandals
1142112112.content:
"I think I'll take the latter!" Ash yelled back up.

"Alright then," Sue Ellen chirped, "By all means proceed, but be careful, you wouldn't want to be stuck again~" She teased as she stuck out her tongue.
Ash just laughed as he jogged away from his adobe and passed in between her legs. The flooring around her room was difficult to terrain, instead of regular wood or panels, she had carpet installed.

This didn't help with him moving as he would struggle with the fabric to run, or even walk, plus the added accumulation of dirt would usually catch him as he would go unto a sneezing parade. Nevertheless, this did not bother him as long as he spent time with Sue Ellen. He just enjoyed being with her, and how much taller she was compared to every other girl-not to say he didn't enjoy their company either-but he found hers to be a bit more.

After a few more minutes of jogging, Ash had made a very reasonable distance between him and the adobe. He panted heavily as a shadowed loomed over.

THUD!

A huge blue sandal slammed next to him as a breeze was created. "Careful down there," Sue Ellen teased as she slowly brought her other foot close to Ash. She dragged as long as she could, making every movement of her toes and every crevice of her sandal visible to the small boy as she took another step.

THUD!

Ash felt the familiar breeze once more, and could not help but smile. Standing straight, he began to jog once more; catching up to Sue Ellen's left foot as she lifted her right foot once more and stepped in front of him. He stared in awe as she hovered over him, hands on her hips and peering playfully down at him. He loved as every step she took, moved in synchronization with her leg as she lifted it up, and brought it down on the carpet, creating the boom and breeze he came into familiarity.

THUD!
A few running steps
THUD!
A few more
THUD!
And soon he was out of breath as the giantess walked even more.

Sue Ellen would walk away from him and towards him as well. Ash would see the sole of her foot rise from the sandal as she lifted it up gracefully to fall down on a far away area that would have taken him hours to reach. He then would see Sue Ellen's strides as well, covering more than what he could do even if he went full force. Miles of land for him, covered in seconds-although it was only a few feet for her.

When she stepped over him, it was a terrifying benevolence as one foot would fly over him, the crevices of her blue sandals filling his view as they descend away and another equally large foot passing by him as well. It filled him with thrill and excitement as she did that and only more so as Sue Ellen had sat down, slowly removing her flip flops...
1142112112.title: "....or you could walk around, while I'...

choices: The Maid came in to clean
Muffy came back with Francine (Sleep Over)
Flash forward years to the future
114211212.content:
When it came to staying with Muffy, living in a cardboard box house wasn't good enough. She went out of her way to provide Ash with the comfort SHE was accustom to. While he had no problem camping out in something made of cardboard or glued together Popsicle sticks, Muffy had provided him with a Mansion made to his scale. When her father inquired on why she needed such a doll house she had told him she had developed a fondness for a train set and would've liked to have a few houses to go with it. When asked why so small she simply said "So it won't take up a lot of room."

Her father had provided her with more than a few. By the time it was all said and done he had provided her with a community scaled to his size complete with cars and plastic people. It set up on a table just in front of her bedroom window and train station was set up and the tracks circled the houses before coming back to the station. It reminded Ash of that Twilight Zone Episode about that couple and that Giant girl. When he later Told Muffy about it she was rather amused.

"No kidding." she said listening with a miniature microphone/speaker in her ear.

"Seriously they spent the whole time looking about this disserted town all the while hearing a little girl giggling. They had no idea until the very end."

"Well, what happened?"

"Well, a shadow fell over them and this huge hand appeared and scooped them up."

"Like this?"

Muffy unexpectedly reached down, fingers closed around Ash and picked him up out of the miniature town. The next thing he knew he was sitting in the middle of the palm of her hand staring up at Muffy's much closer face.

"Y-Yeah." He said "Just like that."

"So then what happened?"

"Well her mother told her she had to put them back and that it was time for dinner."

"Like this."

Muffy Lowered her hand back to the miniature town and placed Ash back down where she had scooped him up. Dusting himself off , he looked back up at her.

"Yeah, JUST like that."

"So then what happened?"

"Not much, they started running away and the narrator said something about drinking and driving."

Muffy Frowned disappointed. "Is that all?"

"I'm afraid so. They could only squeeze so much into a half hour episode and each week it would be different so the series never went back to continue the story. If I were to guess, I suppose they couple spent the rest of their days being pets or playthings for that not so little girl. "

*Knock Knock"

"Miss Muffy, it's time to go to school."

"Be right out Bailey." Muffy looked down at Ash ."You'll be fine till I get back,right?"

"Oh sure," said Ash."No Problem."

"Okay," said Muffy removing the earpiece. "See you later."

Ash watched her go and then glanced about the room, feeling very very small.
114211212.title: Staying with Muffy

choices: Stay with Ash and have her new idea of fun.
Take Ash with him and let him experience her Girl's Night Out
1142112123.content:
(Author's note: In the version I'm writing, Muffy and most of the younger female cast will be around their late teens. So as of now, she will be 19 instead of her 10 year old self from the show.)

Ash looked at himself in the broken piece of Mirror. Not much had changed in the years. Well, aside for the longer hair and the loin cloth around his waist. His Shorts, shoes and T-shirt had long ago worn out. But, so long as he remained in a warm place he was perfectly fine. The hair, Now that had been a problem for him. How to cut it? Conventional scissors were out of the question, and the idea of having hair growing down to the cheeks of his backside didn't appeal to him at all. The solution came to him one day when he'd been out in the lawn exploring. He had come across a sliver of glass and he immediately knew exactly what he'd do with it. After adding a handle so he wouldn't cut himself he was left with something that could cut his hair perfectly. Not as close as he had wanted, but enough to manage it.

He felt the floor shake. He turned to the bedroom door in anticipation.

The gigantic door could be heard being open. From it, Muffy's titanic form walked in. Each of her steps produced an earthquake to Ash as she walked over to the model community. Of course knowing her presence as soon as she opened the door, Ash was waiting on the center of town as she watched her get get closer. Her hips moving subtly as she knelt down and picked up her microphone.

"Hey Ash, you there?" She asked cheerfully as she scanned the area for her little friend.

"Yeah I'm in the park!" He responded as he waved at her. "I realized you were coming so I came all the way out here."

"Well it's not really hard for you to know that," She teased as she made herself more comfortable as she walked away from the model, still talking through it however.

"How was school?" Ash asked.

"Ugh..same old, same old," She sounded exhausted by the question, "Ratburn gives us a lecture, a very long and boring one, Brain answers most of it, and in the end we sit around just to waste time basically." At this point she had gone inside her huge closet to change from her school attire into something more relaxing.

"Sounds like fun," Ash responded sarcastically.

"Tell me about it," Muffy responded, "I really can't just wait to graduate and take over Daddy's business." She struggled a bit to keep contact as she was changing and trying to keep the microphone well adjusted. "I mean I know I need to learn and things, but I already got my place in life, I'm all set! All I need to do is wait for the end of the year and finally I will be done."

She had come out as she was wearing a very expensive and fashionable shirt along with some designer jeans and shoe wedges. "But enough talk about that, the weekend is her and I'm ready to party!"

"Oh you heading out somewhere?" Ash asked as he saw her friend emerged and her familiar tremor steps approaching him.

"Sure!" She had not knelt down as she was looking at Ash directly from her current height. Ash just kept looking up and up at the towering Muffy as her hands were on her hips and her breasts covered her face from his view point. Muffy meanwhile only smirked as she saw the tiny speck of a friend down on her city.

Like most of her friends, she was surprised when Francine had discovered the little man around. And she had taken a liking to him.
She couldn't explain it, but just the sheer size difference between her and him, really invigorated her; so much so that she always jumped in glee when it was her turn to spend some time on him. And as for Ash, well he enjoyed spending time with her as well; since he had a real bed to sleep in and an actual place to live in-even though it was under Muffy's roof.

"Well I was planning to go out," Muffy interrupted the silence between them, "but I could stay if you want me to~" She winked at him as he began to blush.

He was behind a tree and hoped that she hadn't noticed, but luck was not on his side as the gargantuan girl had picked up before he even had hidden. "Or you could take me with you?" Ash suggested coming out of hiding. "I really don't want to hold you up from whatever you were doing, wouldn't really be fair to you."

"Hmmm," Muffy thought as she took one arm under her breasts, while the other on her chin. Thinking for a moment, she decided to....
1142112123.title: Muffy came back alone.

choices: "Lets start with you tending to my feet!"
"I think you should run if you don't want to get stuck under my shoes!"
11421121231.content:
"You know what? I can go out at any time, right now I want to have some fun of my own."

"You sure?"

"Positive," She affirmed as she walked over to her door and locked it up. "Now....what to do with you?" Her look had become devious, a look that Ash had been familiar with ever since he had been alone with Muffy. He gulped as he saw her walk towards him.

The tremors were slow but powerful, she placed every footstep in front of her like that of a tight rope artist. They increased in massiveness as she approached his villa, his heart began to race as her wedges were engulfing his view.

"So... Ash," Muffy asked.

"Y-y-yeeesss?" He asked nervously.

"Do you want to have some fun?" Her shoe had landed next to the villa as the earth shook, causing him to fall down.

"W-W-what tyyppee of...fun?" He asked.

"Oh you know," She hovered her other shoe over him, "The usual type."

Ash knew what Muffy was talking about. Since he meet her, Muffy was a fan of using Ash like a little helper for her. She loved hovering over him and using her vast size to intimidate him. She enjoyed it, and in a sense so did Ash, but he did have to admit she did get a little carried away from time to time.

Standing up, Ash looked up as the huge sole of Muffy's wedge was in front of him, "O-okay...what do you want to do?"
11421121231.title: Stay with Ash and have her new idea of fun.

choices: He chooses to pamper her instead
He chooses to let her be more dominant.
114211212311.content:
"Let's start with you tending to my feet!" Muffy cheerfully said as she moved her shoe unto the left side of the villa. Ash's eyes opened wide as he knew what she meant by that. "Come on out then, I'm waiting~" She teased as she tapped her left wedge unto the ground, causing shakes for poor Ash as he tried to get up, only to fall down after taking a few steps.

After much hassle, he made it to the edge of the villa as the mountainous Muffy waited for him, she peered down, giggling to herself as she saw his minuscule form struggling to walk over her tapping. She adored it, always, every single time she watched over him.

Nevertheless, Ash had made it and was now standing next to her wedge shoe; able to look at the rough details of it as the cork made for it could be use as a climbing gear for him-skills he had picked up after many....situations.

"You made it, excellent," Muffy gleamed as she placed her other leg next to him, enclosing him in between her feet. "Now...how would you like to serve me Ash?" She began to twist her foot in place by her tippy toe, as she continued, "Would you like to pamper me on my nails? Powder my feet-the way you know I like~"
Ash began to blush as he was beginning to become excited by such options.
"Or maybe you would like for me to do something else?~ Perhaps....having a few steps here and there," Her eyebrows cocked up as she finished, leaving a very red Ash to talk.
114211212311.title: "Lets start with you tending to my feet!"

1142112131.title: Fern

11421121312.content:
Ash looked at his reflection in a piece of Mirror . He hadn't changed much in the past eight years aside for the longer hair and the loin cloth around his waist. With his knife fashioned from a sliver of glass he looked like he should be swinging from vines. That's what happens when getting clothing in your size is impossible.

He was waiting for Fern to return from High school in a home she had woven together like a basket. She said the design was based off of a hut in a book she had read though when Ash inquired of the title of the book he found he had never heard of it before. One of the many differences between the this world and the one he'd left behind. He had found many differences in the literature. With the possible exception of Shakespeare, apparently he was equally dreary in both worlds.

Fern had grown some from the time Francine had introduced her to him, and it wasn't just her height. She wasn't as shy as she was back then, and she'd become a rather remarkable author in her own right. One of her best short stories, one based off of Ash was getting published as part of an anthology Book.

There's was still a few hours of waiting so he decided to take a quick nap. He was more of a night time person these days anyway. Night was the only time where he could move about in relative safty except for the times when everyone had gone out and he had the place to himself. He climbed up into his hammock, and it seemed like he'd only closed his eyes for a few moments before he was awaken to the Familiar Rumble in the floorboards announcing someone's arrival. Even after all these years the feelings he felt towards seeing giants hadn't changed.
