The Door Opened It was her Mother (Unaware)
The Door Opened. Catherine's back from Collage (unaware)
11421121321.content:
Ash looked at himself in the broken piece of Mirror. Not much had changed in the years. Well, aside for the longer hair and the loin cloth around his waist. His Shorts, shoes and T-shirt had long ago worn out. But, so long as he remained in a warm place he was perfectly fine. The hair, Now that had been a problem for him. How to cut it? Conventional scissors were out of the question, and the idea of having hair growing down to the cheeks of his backside didn't appeal to him at all. The solution came to him one day when he'd been out in the lawn exploring. He had come across a sliver of glass and he immediately knew exactly what he'd do with it. After adding a handle so he wouldn't cut himself he was left with something that could cut his hair perfectly. Not as close as he had wanted, but enough to manage it.

Today he was waiting for Francine to return from High school. Her older sister, Catherine,was off to collage. It hadn't been easy for Francine to keep Ash a secret from her older sister but they managed it. Now that she was gone, he had free range of the Bedroom she and Catherine had shared.

He felt the Familiar Rumble in the floorboards announcing someone's arrival. Even after all these years the feelings he felt towards seeing giants hadn't changed.
11421121321.title: The Future

choices: She stands up and teases Ash about his size
She grabs Ash and makes him walk on her body
114211213211.content:
The massive wooden door opened, creating rumbling and sound distortion, as the massive figure of Francine appeared. Ash always stared in awe at how humongous everyone was, even after 8 years of living in this world, his amazement never changed.

Francine walked in, wearing her usual red sneakers accompanied by her regular jeans. She wore a red tank top-holding her quite impressive breasts and her muscular arms-accompanied by a pixie cut hair style. Years of being an athlete and physical activity lead to her developing quite an amount of muscle mass on her. It wasn't overbearing but it was enough for her to accomplish the requirement of the sports she played.

And today was no different, Francine had come in exhausted from practice-hence the top instead of a shirt-as she was sweaty all over. Still she looked down, as it was customary for her, looking for her tiny friend along the floor.

It didn't take long as Ash used the sliver of glass to reflect some light as Francine sighed in relief as she was glad she knew where he was. It had been quite a few close calls that she almost stepped on Ash, the first incident being when she first found him, along with many other ones-mostly involving Catherine.
There was one time she recalled that Catherine just strutted inside the room, when Francine was having some of her playtime with him. Lying down on the floor, she had Ash in front of her face as Catherine had walked in front of her sister, placing her newly purchased boots in front of her, to brag about them.

Both of them had no time to react as Catherine's boot had engulfed Ash in a second while Francine was in shock at what had happened. Catherine began to bra twisting her boot in place, while Frannie was holding in the tears and anger against her sister. Meanwhile Ash was in panic as darkness had consumed in him and he thought it was the end of him; luckily, he had just being standing somewhere the grooves of the boot were going to land. He was safe, but the movement wasn't making it any less terrifying as he thought he was dead. He was pushed, shoved, and hit with the sole of the boot as Catherine bragged and then removed it to bring in her other.

In that split second, Francine had grabbed Ash in her hands and moved her closely to him as Catherine was unaware of the situation. After she had left, he had been bruised badly, but so far he was fine. Francine had felt such a relief as she was glad he wasn't dead.

Sitting on her bed, she sighed heavily remembering such event. She was glad Catherine was gone for the most part. Yes she loved her, but with Ash around, it was a hassle to keep him hidden and acting normally. But now that she was out to college, things were relatively easy now-except for the sudden appearance of her parents-but other than that, piece of cake.

She removed her sneakers as she tossed them into the corner, Ash watched carefully as he didn't move from where he was. The huge building sized shoes were always a scare to him, then again everything was, but he found it deadly when she launched them at such speed. Something that big didn't need to move even faster! Still he waited as he observed Francine patiently.

She continued to take off her socks, which were soaked in sweat, as she threw them into her laundry basket. The sweat on her muscles glistened her body, making Ash to stare even more-and starting to get red under all his hair. He had seen her friend grow into a fine lady, which made it awkward for him as she had taken care of him for such a long time.

Meanwhile, Francine laid down as she stretched her body on her bed. With the relief of her shoes off, she wiggled her toes on the hard floor, as she waited for her body to cool down. "Hmmm," she thought for a moment, she had a few minutes before hoping in for a shower. Her mind drifted towards Ash as she begin to form thoughts of what to do to pass the time...
114211213211.title: The Door Opened. Francine is Back

1142112132111.content:
Francine watched as Ash made his way toward her feet, and when she though he was close enough so that she could hear him she stood up and placed her hands on her hips.

“Hey short stuff”

‘Short stuff, huh’ Ash thought. Francine sometimes teased him about his height, never in a malicious way of course but it had become something of a game to them. One he often lost.

“Oh, Hey!” He yelled “What Beanstalk you just climbed down from?”

“The one on the way to Smurf Village.”

“Really? What was the weather like up there?”

“Nice and sunny, but you probably wouldn’t know what that’s like being in my shadow and all.”

Francine reached down and scooped Ash between her fingers. Early on Ash had been afraid she’d accidentally crush him between her fingers, now she was so used to holding him that it had become second nature.

“That’s better, I don’t have to yell so hard.” Said Ash, patting Francine’s fingertip “How was practice?”

“Brutal, The new coach that took over is a real dictator.” Francine sighed blowing warm humid air toward Ash “Oops! Sorry!”

“Nah, it’s Okay. Minty Fresh! You look tired though.”

“He’s doubled the drills since we are getting close to the tournament.” Francine sat back down on her bed and pushed back stray locks of hair from her face.

“I’d like to see you play sometime”

Francine smiled “Maybe I can get Muffy to smuggle you in. You’ll be my little cheer leader. So, what were you up to while I was gone today?”

“You know me, I have ways to keep occupied. Your Older sister might be away, but it’s never a dull moment when you’re Mom’s around.”

“Hope you are not taking any unnecessary risks.”

“Of course not, but I did get stuck under the sofa while your Mom was watching General Surgeon. Michael’s the father by the way.”

Francine Chuckled and placed Ash on her pillow “I’m off to get a Shower. Then you and I are going to do something.”

Ash as he watched Francine pick up a towel and leave the room. He wondered what Francine had in mind.
1142112132111.title: Hello Shorty

choices: Francine brings her foot down, forcing him to drink
11421121321111.content:
Ash waited as Francine left, feeling every tremor of each step as she made her way into her personal bathroom. A very good convenience, considering everything else. Still, as usual, he climbed down the sheets of her bed as he was impatiently determined to check something for himself. As he walked forward, traversing shoes, old magazines and some very old toys, he made it to the front of the bed as he looked and saw what he was looking for.

A footprint.

Her footprint.

Ash gulped a bit as he looked at in fine detail. It was drying up for sure but it would have taken sometime nonetheless as the leftover sweat from Francine, left a perfect indentation of it.

She was enormous, that one was for a fact, but it had dawned on Ash’s mind for a while that he probably hadn’t grasped how enormous she was. When they met all those years long ago, she was around 460 feet, to him at least, through the easy sum up of ratios. But now….she probably had either doubled that or easily had surpassed that already. She was big, he couldn’t doubt it, as he walked alongside the drying up print, giving up in counting the steps it took him to make one of hers, as it ended and far away the other one began.

And what was worse, or good, she wasn’t done. She was only eighteen and he knew aging and height didn’t end until she was 21, or maybe even a little later. She was going to get BIG, very; and it was probably his paranoia, but he felt he was getting shorter. He couldn’t tell why he felt like that, or show evidence, but when he didn’t know where his head ended and his hair started, it was hard to tell his true height after all this time.
He wasn’t afraid of it, for sure, but he was….overwhelmed a bit. And that was only Francine, he hadn’t even thought of the other girls: Muffy, Fern, Sue Ellen, and every other lady friend he encountered. He sighed a bit, out of relief and acceptance, guess it was just a sign that..everyone was getting older and taller-literally.

Still his focus on the thought was snapped as the door to the restroom roared as out came Francine, fully refreshed after her shower. “AAAAAAAAAAaaaahhhhhhhh!” She exclaimed, deafening Ash a bit, only to follow by a series of earth shaking tremors. Francine relaxed as the shower did her well, her jeans replaced with some soft pants and a new red top on her after taking off the sweaty one. She looked down as she saw Ash’s glass glimmer down on the floor. She rolled her eyes as she dried her hair. Sometimes she wondered if he intentionally got himself into trouble or wanted to be stepped on purpose.

Still, as she looked down, she was starting to get an idea as she was getting closer. “Hey shorty, got some water for you,” she joked as her feet were quite close to Ash.

“Oh?” He asked as he stood up a bit after all the shaking, “Where are at, High stuff?”

Francine only hovered her foot over him, still wet from the shower as some droplets hanged onto her toes and sole. Ash gulped a bit as he knew what she was doing. “Well? Not going to drink?” She asked, flexing her toes as a drop fell near Ash, splashing him and leaving him completely drenched, while he was still red in the face.
11421121321111.title: Watery Source

choices: Staying with Muffy (Exploring Her Mom's shoe)
114211213211111.content:
"You know, it's not nice to tease me like this."

"You know you like it."

"Not as much as you think. Still, I suppose in this case I'll make an exception." Ash knelt down and scooped up a glop of water. That was something he never got used to either. With the size of his hands water here had so much of a surface tension that he could pick it up. In the early days he'd been worried his body would not be able to absorb the water. Turned out that was surprisingly no trouble at all. "At least it's water, not sweat."

"Gross, I'd never do that." said Francine as she went to where her Bathrobe hung. She went behind the closet door and emerged dressed in her Bathrobe and slipped on her slippers."I might tease you a bit, but foot sweat? No way. Sounds Nasty."

"It Is." said Ash as he noted the taste of the water. It wasn't quite clean, there were some traces of soap and of course Francine, but it was drinkable.

"And Just HOW do you know that?"

"The hard way."

That got Francine's attention. Kneeling over the tiny human, she carefully plucked him off the floor and deposited him into her hand. "WHEN did this happen?"

"Lets see," said Ash thinking for a moment "It was right around your 16th Birthday. It was right around the time Fern figured out I had a thing for...Lower extremities."

Francine smiled at the memory. Fern had always seemed to find Ash wandering around and sometimes inside footwear, her Mother's Dress shoes, Sandals, but it wasn't until she was older that it clicked it. If it had been Francine, Ash would've been Horribly teased about it but Fern had more compassion for this tiny traveler from another world. She broke it to him Gently that she knew. What she didn't tell Ash was that she told all the girls before she broke the news to him. They all agreed (Francine reluctantly) that they would not let on that they knew. Instead, they would minutely tease him by doing foot stuff. Exposing a sole or wiggle a toe in his direction, That sort of thing. But always innocently. It ended when Ash Realized that the young ladies knew. That didn't stop the shenanigans though.

"So what happened?"

"I was--"
114211213211111.title: He drinks voluntarily, playing along

choices: Millicent is there, but unaware of him.
She's not there, but her shoes are neatly stacked though.
1142112132111112.content:
“It was during one of Muffy’s many slumber parties,” Ash explained, Francine immediately began rolling her eyes as she could already imagine the situation. “Specifically, that sweet 16 sleep over bash-”

“Yes, yes, I remember,” Francine joked as she sat down crossing one leg over wanting to hear the story. Like in regular fashion there was ripple effect flashbacking to the time Muffy was insistent on making Francine a party regardless if she wanted to or not. For weeks she had asked her friend, pleaded with her, even was offering to host it, if she just threw it. Francine, not wanting to get too formal with events at the time, reluctantly agreed on one condition. Well two.

Girls only.
And Ash could also come along.
Muffy not wanting to waste any chance to tease her minute friend, agreed. And so a few days later the birthday bash of sleep overs came. All their lady friends went to it, Fern, Sue Ellen, Prunella, etc, as the party went on into full swing, just like when they were younger! Only this time they had their special guest, one they always so fond off.

During this time however, Ash had more to fill on his plate than before. Pairs of enormous shoes, socks, clothes and all sorts of female attire littered the ground! Not to mention that he had to avoid the massive soles of the girls as they continued walking on by, danced with him in the middle, even purposefully missed stepping on him to see the red on his face. Course this was when he was still oblivious to the girls knowing of his secret, but nonetheless his reaction was priceless to them.

And as the party went on, much to what Francine remembered, she did point out, that at some point they had lost track of him. Ash gulped as he continued, that this is the part he was getting to and the same one to answer her question.

Evidently, he had gone away from the girls to catch a breather. At some point, near stomp experiences had really tired him out. Regardless this lead him to be in an area, well, unknown to him. As many times as he had been in the Crosswire household, he never had fully explored it. One it was too big, and two, all he knew was what Muffy had showed him on her lone tours, and even then she had him on a leash as immediately they would go back to her room.

This time however, curiosity got the best of him as he wanted to explore and if possible find one room he knew had to exist.

Millicent Crosswire’s room. A.k.a Muffy’s Mum.

He had used the walls as a form of labyrinthian maze. It was a bit of a side project he had years in the making, whenever he had stayed with Muffy. The reasoning for this project was an even older flashback, within the flashback, as he had recalled one of the early memories of him staying with Muffy. As she had left him alone for a few moments in her small mint village, her mother had come in, looking for her, and then eventually, looked at the toy village. Ash, who had clothes back at this moment, was walking outside the streets when he was forced to pretend to be one of the many small figure models in order to not be caught.

Millicent had walked inside the small villa however, each step shaking each building, foundation, the models of people, even him. He tried to stay still but only would jerk as a booming heel would come down. He heard her mom laugh, teasing at how small the village was compared to her, not out of harm towards her daughter, but genuinely enjoying the size difference.

“If I were this big,” He heard her boom, “I think I would enjoy all the little people looking up at me,” She snickered, taking another step as it boomed, making Ash fly up and land directly on top of her heel. He had even screamed as he landed with a, "OOoofff!" As he covered his mouth immediately and looked up and up, to noticed the matriarch of the household look down on him. There was a sly curiosity in her face, a sly smirk, investigating eyes and even a need to reach down, yet the noise of Muffy coming back cut that short as she simply shook Ash off as she walked out of the village; but not before giving a sly wink as she left.

And now back to the original story.

Ash had spent years formulating this plan as he had a mental map of the house as he continued walking alongside the walls, making distance and record time as he didn't have to crawl through carpeted floor. He passed the familiar path towards Muffy's room, crossed off the paths that took him towards the kitchen and pool areas. Even crossed out where the servants lived as well, as he headed one way and one way only. Towards the massive oaken door that appeared to be the head house room, he gulped as he walked in through the crevice. Years of planning and marking out and he was right, this was the correct place but to his surprise...
1142112132111112.title: Into the Dungeon

choices: Millicent Picks Ash up (he pretends he's a toy)
Millicent begins to play with whatever is under her foot.
Millicent picks Ash up (Discovers he is a tiny person)
11421121321111121.content:
"I should've turned around and made my way back, and I would have had it not been for one thing."

"I have a pretty good guess what that one thing was" Francine smirked.

"And your guess would be right."

Ash reflected on the moment he saw her sitting at her sitting at her night table combing her hair. His heart had leaped into his throat when he noticed that she had tucked her bare feet under the chair she was sitting on.

Her soles were pointed in his direction.

Call it obsessive, hormonal, or whatever, Ash was drawn to a pair of soles like a moth to a flame. Not knowing how much time he had, or if he might be too late, he made his way though the carpet. As he did so, he studied his goal closely. Millicent pampered her feet, Ash could tell that right away. He also noticed she had a more narrower foot with toes that were longer and not as round. His heart was beating fast as he got closer and closer; All the while Millicent continued to get ready for bed.

Finally he was there. Despite the danger Ash crept up toward one vast sole. Feeling the heat being given off by the bare limb he extended one shaky hand and touched skin. It was warm, as expected, but also had a texture that was not unlike leather. He slipped his fingers between the dermal swirls and gave the skin a slight squeeze.

Suddenly everything went dark as the wall of flesh he was studying fell upon him pressing him into the carpet and pushing the air out of his lungs. The incredible weight threatened to crush him.

Then above he heard "Hmmm?"
11421121321111121.title: Millicent's admirer.

choices: She decides to walk about the bedroom
She begins to play with Ash with her toes
114211213211111211.content:
The mountain of flesh and bone lifted away, Ash was able to take one breath before two mounds of flesh closed around him. The air was squeezed out of his lungs and he was lifted upwards.

"What's this?" Millicent examined the object she had felt under her foot. Ash didn't move a muscle. He didn't dare. He'd never before been held by an Adult giantess. She was so huge that up close he could only see parts of her face. A cheek, and the eye that stared at him. The pupil focus intently on him.

Millicent examined the object. It was one of the figurines from Muffy's toy village. How did it get in here? She was about to get up and bring it back to her daughter's room when she paused and looked at the figure again. Then she smiled.

"Come to visit your Giantess?"

'What?' thought Ash. 'Did she know?'

"I'm flattered, but it's not gentlemen like to arrive unannounced. I Shall have to punish you."

Punish?

"Since you ardor my Foot so much, why don't you have more time with it? Would you like that?"

Millicent picked up a slipper and dropped Ash into the heel section where he slid and tumbled to the toe section. The slipper was the fuzzy kind with a fuzzy but used interior. It also had a smell to it. Why wouldn't it have one? It was Millicent's favorite pair and he had often watched her wear them. He never thought he'd find himself inside one. He felt the slipper descend to floor level. Then the light dimmed and vanished as Millicent maneuvered her foot into the slipper.

Millicent felt the figure under her toes and smiled to herself. If only this was a real tiny person. To feel him struggling under her toes would be quite a sensation. She sighed and wiggled her toes slowly as she leaned back in her chair.
114211213211111211.title: Millicent Picks Ash up (he pretends he's a ...

Ash whispers yes, but luckily not a peep was heard.
1142112132111112111.content:
She then stood up, her whole weight shifting from her bottom to her soles as Ash felt it. It wasn't the first time he would be underfoot, in fact he had a history with it, but during those years he would find out he was quite resilient to pain or strain or anything that could be thrown at him. But Millicent was different, she was.....mature.

As she stepped on him, diligently of course, he could feel the rough course skin of her sole come all over him, to be released and then be smacked by her toes, keeping him in a warm tight spot as she walked around her room, feeling her small passenger as she had a pleased smile on her face. "Ooh little people are so easy to catch." She teased, taking another step and another as she made her way to her closet, to her mirror, then back to her chair and then paced around. "I would love to have a colony of all of you," She informed, relishing her fantasy as she applied a bit of pressure. "Just have small servants living around their little town only to have me appear and make it more interesting.

She lifted her foot, putting her toes in place so all her weight would be on him as he fought the urge to yelp but the amount of weight was getting to the point he could barely resist himself. "Of course I would be kind and gentle, and playful. Instead of cruelly destroying everything in my path, I would only apply the softest of steps I can give," She informed, making him feel more aroused. "Why do I want to waste life? I want toys and servants, not whatever that would be," She said quite meaningfully as she rubbed him a bit with the ball of her foot.

"Don't you agree?" She said with a small giggle.

Lift him up high and see if he starts flailing
11421121321111121112.content:
"Guess Mrs. Crosswire was having fun with you," Francine teased him as she had laid down in her bed, Ash next to him as she heard the tale. She poked him with a finger as she said that, getting another blush from the small man.

"Hey..." He said already red again, "It wasn't like I had a choice," Moving her finger away from his face only to have a clear look to her breasts. He blushed as he looked away quickly.

"So then what happened?" Francine asked.

"Well..."

As Millicent had her toes on him, Ash had only whispered silently, "Yes," to himself as he could already envision the massive Crosswire back home. Comparing herself to buildings and making short work of their impressive height no less.

Luckily she didn't hear the wording but that did not mean he was safe from harm just yet. Slowly did the woman slip her foot out of her slipper, leaving a faint warm essence as he stood there breathing heavily as he was grateful for such situation. But the moment of peace lasted shortly, after Millicent tipped the shoe over and out he came. Trying very carefully not to fling around, but it was difficulty given the speed he was coming out.

As he landed, he gave an "OOoofff," small yet noticeable by the woman, making her eyebrow lift up, but she ignored for the moment as she looked down on him, way down. And he looked up, way up, to see her standing before him in her full glory. Hands on her hips as she smirked at his puny body. "Now what to do with such a devoted servant?" She teased as she tapped her foot in place, making vibrations all across his body as he shook in the ground. "Do I step on him with my callous sole? Or do I take him and show him....the more interesting parts of me?"

This made Ash blush, immensely, something Millicent caught as she saw the little toy, turn red all of a sudden. This was making her suspicions true, but she needed to know for sure. If she did an action, and if her hunch was correct, a reaction to it would occur. But the question was, what did she decided to do next?
11421121321111121112.title: Ash whispers yes, but luckily not a peep was he...

choices: She can't keep the act up and start's laughing
Ash got some explaining to do
114211213211111211122.content:
Ash watched as Millicent reached down toward him. He noted the lines of her palm as the tips of her thumb and index finger closed on his foot. With carefulness unexpected from someone so huge she picked him off the floor. Dangling from one foot he gazed downward and watched as the floor receded away. His back was to her as she lifted him up to eye level, but he could sense her eyes studying him. He was trying very hard not to noticeably breathe and remain limp. Had she heard him when he was dumped out of the slipper?

To answer that question, Millicent lifted him up past her head as high as she could. Ash’s heart pounded in his chest. This was the highest anyone had ever held him.

And then he was in freefall. Involuntarily he screamed as the floor rushed out to meet him. Suddenly, he was surrounded by warm flesh as Millicent caught him as he was falling past her face.

“I knew it!”

Millicent held up her closed hand triumphantly. She knew there had to be a reason behind Muffy wanting that miniature town. All this time she had a little friend.

She considered what to do next. She wasn't angry, she couldn't be even if she wanted to be. This was a dream come true for her. Where did he come from? Where there any more like him?
He wasn't struggling in her grasp, in fact He wasn’t moving at all. She wasn’t holding him too tight to restrict movement. Maybe he was still trying to pass off his guise as a toy. Or he was too frightened to move.

Frighten, that gave her an idea. Maybe he'd be more willing to explain himself if he was fearful of her wrath. Why not? After all it worked with her oldest son whenever he got in trouble. She quietly cleared her throat.

“There’s no point in pretending now.” She addressed the occupant of her closed fist in her stern mother voice. “I’m opening my hand, don’t try anything foolish.”

She was right, Ash knew it. The Gig was up. As the fingers uncurled he slowly stood and faced her.

He swallowed. Millicent looked pissed.
114211213211111211122.title: The Truth revealed.

choices: She decides to loosen up a bit
She decides to still be dominating
1142112132111112111222.content:
As Ash trembled before her, terrified of her piercing eyes, Millicent was laughing internally as she saw his small cute face before him. "Awwwww, so adorable. Now keep it cool, still act." She reminded herself again as she stared once more for a few more seconds before speaking. "Well? Or are you just a mute?" Ash once again shaking from the fearful look did not what to say. It was one thing to have been in a situation where the girls teased him, but here he genuinely felt terror as he was certain Millicent would have done worse to him if he didn't speak.

Without further to do, he gulped, and said, "N-n-no-o-o, I'm very c-c-capable of speaking," He said stuttering, shaking as he finished as he still felt the aura of anger emitting from Millicent. Meanwhile she was having more than a laugh inside her head, but professionally didn't break character as she asked.

"And you have been prancing around my home?" It was more of a demand now.

"Yes," He said meekly.

"With my daughter?"

"Yes."

"For how long?"

"..." He stood quiet before he could even think of a response, "For a very long time." He said. Millicent only stared as she had quite hoped to hear that answered. This confirmed her suspicion of this not being the first time they met but also confirmed that under all jurisdiction, she had control over this.....prize.

Smirking she then said. "Well then, I guess you have had quite the peeping adventures." This made Ash blush as she only laughed at his action. "My, my, one to be so easily red," She leaned in a bit as she whispered, "I adore that." Turning the poor boy even redder.
1142112132111112111222.title: The Truth Explained

11421121321111121112221.content:
"And are there any other's like you scurrying about?"

"No, ma'am. Just me."

Just him? Impossible. Unless he came down in a spaceship or something. Millicent studied the figure she held. Despite his size she could tell he was practically wearing rags.

"How did you get here then?"

"I-I don't know how to answer that question."

Millicent lifted her hand closer so her face dominated the tiny creature's view of the world "Don't know, or WON'T TELL ME?"

Ash cowered backward and stumbled falling on his backside. "Ma'am p-please I don't know how I got here, I swear! All I know is that I was walking down a path at the local park and then I'm here. "

Ash's head was between his legs. Had he looked up, he would've seen Millicent's expression soften. The last question had visibly upset the tiny creature and She hadn't meant to upset him so badly. She decided she'd been "angry" long enough.

"What is your name?"

"Ash Ma'am."

"Ash, You know who I am then. You know What I like out of a little man."

Ash nodded. After what had happened when she thought he was a toy, it was quite clear what she liked out of a little man.

"Then I think it's time to carry out your punishment."

'Here it comes' Ash thought.

"You are --
11421121321111121112221.title: She decides to loosen up a bit

114211213211111211122211.content:
"A Servant." She said with a tone of pride and glee. Ash gulped, not sure what to think of it, but he had not time to respond as Millicent continued instructing. "Every time from now on, whenever you are within my daughter's care, you will leave her room and join up here with me. Unless otherwise." She let the words ring in his ears as he stood attentively to her orders. "Think of it as...payment for all these years of me, inadvertently taking care of you. And before you say anything, I think that village is more than you get out of others."

He gulped, knowing she had gotten him there so far.

"To continue on," She said, "You will be performing tasks that I require to feel fresh, young, and overall pleased with. When she was sure her daughter and her friends were doing okay, Millicent continued to her bedroom. When she arrived, she sat at the edge of her bed and began to remove her joggers
114211213211111221.title: Run on the tread Mill

choices: Laverne is here to look for something
Laverne is her to get ready to clean the room
114211213212.content:
The massive door boomed open as Francine's mother, Laverne Frensky, walked in. Ash had seen her before, from times that she would come in to clean, or times he would walk around the apartment-hidden of course.

The mature woman had entered the room. Ash quickly running under the bed before she could even get a look at him. From there he observed her. She was wearing a yellow sweater, with beige pants, and similar color loafers. Although her age was higher, she had matured quiet nicely into it. Her body still was beautiful to look at, her breasts were still quite perked, her curves still showing, and her legs still as strong.

Ash did have to admit the lady was quite attractive, but he wouldn't dare come out with it. Reasons being Francine could get angered that Ash had the hots for her mom, and that maybe the mother of the house wouldn't be too kind of having a small peeper looking where he wasn't supposed to.

He sighed as he waited under the bed, feeling the all familiar rumbling of her steps as she want about on her business.
114211213212.title: The Door Opened It was her Mother (Unaware)

choices: A sock Lands On Ash and Laverne picks Ash and Sock Up.
1142112132121.content:
Ash watched her casually walk toward the bed. He considered for a moment to back up further under the bed, but decided that he was at a safe enough spot to watch the show. Which it what it was whenever Laverne, or anyone else showed up. It always impressed him how powerful these beings were despite only going about their daily lives. Had he been born 5000 years ago and transported to this world he would’ve considered them the gods of Olympus.

Laverne walked up to her daughter’s bed to collect some discarded articles of clothing. Being older certainly hadn’t changed some of her youngest daughter’s habits, though she wasn’t as bad as she once was. Little did she know that there was someone admiring her right Loafer. When Ash had arrived, they were Brand new. Now eight years later, they were worn and had been repaired a time or two. She should’ve thrown them out by all rights, but Laverne had found them to be quite comfortable. Oftentimes she’d found it very hard to find footwear that was comfortable on her feet. It was her feet that Ash was thinking of at that moment.

He’d seen her bare foot a time or two in the years he spent at the apartment and it was no mystery where which side of the family her Daughters got there foot shape from. A wide sole with short round toes. He had often wanted to get closer but he didn’t dare. Not when she was sitting on the couch watching TV or even while she slept. The risk of being caught was always on his mind no matter how fevered it got, her loafers on the other hand was something he was willing to get closer to. It wasn’t until lately that they looked worn enough to climb into.

Ash stepped out from under the bed and gazed upward past the Loafer, the beige pants and yellow sweater. While Laverne’s attention was on collecting an article of clothing off the bed he gave the Loafer a departing Hug and vowed he would soon find his way inside it.
1142112132121.title: Collecting Landry

choices: Next Morning He Slept too long
11421121321211.content:
It was near one in the morning before Ash ventured out of Francine's bedroom. While she had gone to bed early, her parents had stayed up to watch the late, late, late show. He waited under Francine's bedroom door and watched them walk past before he made his move.

His heart raced with eager anticipation as he made his way down the hall to the joined Kitchen and living room and ultimately to the mat at the front door. There placed neatly next to two other pairs of shoes and sneakers were Laverne's old Loafers. He could make out the distinguishable outline of the footwear and In the darkness of the apartment they loomed like ancient monoliths,. While it was a bit dark to really see the interior that well, it wasn't a concern to him according to his plan. He'd been around long enough to know the habits of these colossal beings. Her Husband always left at 5 am every morning and Laverne didn't get up for a whole two hours later. Tonight his goal was to spend the night in one of the loafers and explore more of the interior when it was light enough to see.

There was a reason why he hadn't thought of doing something like this up until now. Getting into one of these was relatively easy, getting out was another story. He'd only checked out the inside of Francine's sneakers a few times and never on his own. Each time he did venture to explore his only way out was with help. Unless you were dealing with fuzzy slippers or you had retractile barbs in your fingertips like some Spider-Man there was no way to climb the curved walls of the inside of a pair of footwear.

The Loafers were a different matter. One day he had seen Laverne slip one off to scratch an itch. It tipped on it's side and he could see that there were loose threads and worn material on the inside they would make it easier to get out off.

Ash stood in front of the towering footwear. When Laverne had collected laundry from her Daughters room earlier that day he'd decided that her right loafer was the most ideal candidate as the material had cracked and worn enough to make hand and foot holds. With great anticipation he started to climb. First up the seven foot of rubber sole, then onto the faded toe of the loafer. He rested for a moment, then jogged up the length to the opening. There was still warmth radiating out from the insole, no doubt that would be a bit damp as well. The smell was....Not too bad, he guessed. She sprayed them with some odor eater once a week. It was dark inside, too dark to see any detail, but that was okay. There would be time later for that. He felt for, and found a loose thread. Taking hold of it, he climbed down into the Loafer.

The thread didn't go all the way down, but enough for him to drop the rest of the way unharmed. He landed on the worn insole and was glad he had decided to leave his glass blade in Francine's room . He had no desire to land on that. Ash walked towards the toe section feeling the texture of the damp leather under his feet. As he walked he noted the rather deep groves in the insole, though he couldn't see them he got the impression that they were very deep from years of walking. Ash's heart raced, there would be a distinct shape of Laverne's Foot to be viewed early tomorrow Morning.

When he reached the toe, he laid down. First on his back and then on his stomach. Even though he was almost too excited to sleep, he knew he had too. He didn't want to oversleep after all. After eight years of giants walking about he had gotten used to the rumbling tremors each of their footsteps made.
11421121321211.title: Loafer Exploring

114211213212111.content:
8 years of pheromones were deposited into the material that made up the insole of the loafer. Ash had been exposed to these the potent chemicals all night long. So when he awoke the next morning to the floor shaking and Lavern's husband leaving the apartment to go to work, He was feeling more than his usual self. As a matter of fact, he was in a state of euphoria like he had never felt before.

In without realizing it he had spent the night in the deep crater that had been made by her big toe. He breathed in, even through the smell of the old Loafer he could smell fresh coffee brewed. Lavern would be up in a while, he wasted no time. With the light of early morning illuminating the interior he was able to finally see what he'd been waiting a long time to see.

As he had expected the impression of Lavern's foot was really imprinted into the insole, especially since she would sometimes wear them without socks. He could make out the shape of her five toes, the ball of her foot and her heel. He ran his hand across the surface of the darkened leather, this was as close as he'd ever come to physical contact with Francine's Mother. The crater he sat in was deep too, about three or four feet at it's lowest point he figured. the massive crater that had been made by the ball of her foot was even deeper. It was no wonder why he had to walk "uphill" at some point.

He stood up and gazed up at the ceiling above his head. Even there, there was wear and tear. The marks made by her toes rubbing up against the material above when she walked was clearly visible here as well. Some of the material had begun to hang down and at one spot he could see where it hanged down to the point Lavern had torn it off for the sake of comfort.

Without realizing he was doing it, Ash had removed his loincloth.

He walked down to where ball of Laverne's foot rested. He dropped to his knees, and then fell on his stomach. The battered and darkened material felt amazing on his lower regions, he was about to release this pent up desire when he noticed something on the insole just in front of his face. It was enough to clear his mind a bit.

There was a stain a rust colored stain.

And something else. Something something so pulverized that it was barely recognizable. And he saw hair.

Ash got to his knees and backed away. He couldn't say for certain that what he was looking at was what was left of a human being. It just as easily been something else. But the thought of Laverne, all this time, walking around smiling all the while she was unawarely pulverizing someone underfoot...

Maybe it was time to leave...
114211213212111.title: Early Morning  Exploreing

choices: Catherine notices a faint glimmer, thus finding the glass
She continues on to look around as she makes herself more comfortable at home.
114211213213.content:
The door rumbled and Ash eye's widen at the sight. Low and behold there she was, Catherine Frensky, the much older, much taller, much of everything sibling of Francine. He stood in place struck with fear. He believed he had seen the last of her, yet there she was...and walking straight at him.

Ash quickly reacted as he ran away, barely missing a brown boot stepping on him as the hurricane of it flew him across the ground, only to land near the post of the bed. Catherine stretched as she was exhausted from the ride from her college to back home. She was glad to come back, but all she wanted to do now was to rest.
She was wearing a black jacket with a navy blue shirt underneath, her jeans shown signs of not being washed, while her brown biker boots adorned her feet. Her hair was still done in her usual pony tail, although it was longer than the last time Ash saw her.

Catherine let her bag fall down unto the ground, causing a massive earthquake for Ash. She walked around the room, looking if anything had change. For the most part, everything was still fine except for Francine's stuff being more to her side of her room then staying where they should belong. Still she enjoyed being back at home and having a break from her exams.

Unknown to her, the small Ash kept observing as he moved from his post towards Francine's bed and hopefully her desk. It was a difficult task as Catherine covered miles in seconds. Still Ash continued on as he tried to keep himself hidden. Just then he realized something, the glass he had with him, it was gone!

Searching frantically for it, he spotted it...at the last place he was. All the way over to where Catherine was standing. He gulped as he knew he would never make it without being caught, but he feared that she would spot it.

He silently walked back towards the edges of the bed as he prayed Catherine would not find his latest tool, or worse.
114211213213.title: The Door Opened. Catherine's back from Coll...

choices: Catherine leaves the shard on top of Francine's desk
She decides to toss it in the waste basket, in the kitchen
1142112132131.content:
Catherine kept walking, noticing the new awards that her little sister had gotten and her quite impressive record of college letters on the desk. Sure she was still in high school, but she couldn't help but be proud of her already. So young and already getting so many awards and recognition, she sighed with happiness, she was sure proud.

Meanwhile Ash was noticing his tool from far away, if he had sprinted he would reach it, but then the problem was, what happened when he needed to be back, he doubted heavily that Catherine wouldn't spot him, and then....who knew. He gulped, cursed a bit, but waited. He was going to stay put until either Francine came or Catherine left. Nevertheless, he felt the tremors once more as Catherine turned and-"Hey what's this?!" His heart sank as he heard the words.

He looked as the massive fingers of the older sister came down unto his glimmering tool, and with a small push, were gone as well. He was devastated by it, A simple tap and his tool was gone. He fought every instinct to do something foolish as he bit his tongue and hoped that the worst wouldn't happen yet. On the other hand, Catherine was looking at the small glass she had found on the floor and was confused by it.

It was shaped like a blade, well technically a glass shard could be that, but what was stranger to her was that it had a handle warped around the end, almost as it was dedicated to be some form of weapon. She looked at it intensively as it was quite small. She scoffed a bit as she imagined someone using this. They would have to be incredibly small to be able to use such small thing. But the question now remained, what would she do with it? She was guessing it was one of Franny's school projects but then again, why would she need such a small thing? She questioned as Ash looked from below, hoping his precious blade would be spared.
1142112132131.title: An Odd Discovery

choices: Try to find another one later
1142112132132.content:
He watched as she turned and walked toward Francine’s desk, cutting off Ash’s chance to get there. But he was still safe under her bed. The only real problem was in order to retrieve his glass he’d have to go out into the open. Fortunately and unfortunately he remembered Catherine’s Habits. Catherine in her younger teen years was the exact opposite of her younger sister, who was a bit of a Tom boy. Ash had observed her many times from a distance and there was one particular habit of hers that had kept him from getting caught by her more than once.

Catherine never looked down when she walked. It was something he had observed from a lot of people, including her mother. Ash suspected the only reason why Francine looked down was because she had to be on the lookout for someone smaller than her running about on the floor. This was also a disadvantage because the risk of getting stepped on was very high.

Catherine sat down at the computer desk and began to undo the buckles of her biker boots. It had been a 10 hour drive by bus and it was going to feel good to get them off her feet. Ash decided that now would be the best time to retrieve his glass.

Catherine slipped off her boot and wiggled her nylon covered toes. She loved her Biker boots, but she found her feet got very hot when she wore them. Then one day her friend Angie had suggested wearing nylons. It worked like a charm. She placed her foot on the hardwood floor, the coolness felt great on the sole of her foot. While she was unbuckling the other boot, Ash was darting toward his glass. He was only moments away from retrieving the it when the other boot slipped off and Catherine stood up.
‘Shit! SHIT!’ he thought as she strode toward him, oblivious to his presence.

Then Ash’s heart was in his throat as he saw his glass blade disappear under a nylon foot with a floor shaking THUD. He didn’t expect the glass to be broken, but he did expect to hear a loud “OW!!!” followed by swearing and all hell breaking loose. But instead when the foot lifted away all he saw was a damp spot in the outline of Catherine’s Foot. For a quick moment he thought he’d be next, instead the foot swung past him. As it did he noticed his precious tool had stuck into the fibers of the Nylon Stocking!

Catherine sat down on her old bed and stretched out onto it. 10 hours on a bus was tiring, at it would be a little while before her mother would announce supper was ready, so she decided to take a nap.

Though Ash couldn’t see it, he could see it reflecting in the sunlight beaming in through the window. His glass was in the center of the ball of Catherine’s right foot. Of all the luck, what was he going to do now? It might've been possible to replace it if he could find another sliver of Glass but he had found that piece by chance. The only reason why was because someone had broken a drinking glass at a BBQ one summer and not all of the glass had been collected. After all this time he didn't know if he could find another one. There was another option but it was a risky venture. As much as he did and didn’t like the idea of getting so close, he could climb the bed and retrieve the glass. Getting up there wouldn't be a problem, the old ladders made of thread were still there behind the head rest. But to get his glass, he would have to get onto Catherine's Foot.
1142112132132.title: Blissfully Unaware

choices: Catherine's toes start to twitch, she's waking up!
Catherine rolls over on her side
11421121321321.content:
As he climbed the Ladder to the top of Catherine's old bed he kept repeating in his head that this was a crazy idea. He recalled the strange look Francine had given him when he suggested stetting up the ladders. She understood wanting one for her own bed, but why her sisters?

"You never know." had been his answer. She had just shrugged and made the ladder, which had been hidden behind the head rest and held in place by a thumb tack.

Truth be told he had wanted the ladder because he had wanted to get a closer look at her sister. At the time she was almost twice the height of her younger sister and he had wanted to see what someone that big looked like up close. Well, that plan never actually happened as he had had so many close calls with Catherine over the years that he had decided it was better to be safe than sorry. So for the most part the ladder was collecting dust until now. About half way up he noted her breathing slowing down, Ash recognized it as a sign of falling asleep. Good, sneaking about would be easier, not that he expected to be heard but he certainly didn't want to be seen.

When he reached the top of the bed, Ash took a moment to rest and survey the landscape. It was a good thing Catherine had decided not to climb under the covers as it would've made things harder than they already were. When he was certain she was asleep, he crept out from behind the pillow and jogged down the length of her body to her right foot. There he stopped and gazed at the awesome sight.

He had only seen the soles of Catherine's feet a few times, he thought they looked amazing and it looked like they had only gotten better as she had grown into womanhood This was the closest though he'd ever been. He soon realized with a grin that he was about to get a whole lot closer than he had ever thought possible. His gaze followed the wide heel up the arch or the foot toward the wide ball of the foot and round toes. There , near the very to of the Ball of her foot was his glass knife. Dislodging it from the nylon fibers of the stocking didn't look so hard to do, he just had to climb up to get it.

His heart started to race, this was so amazing and crazy at the same time. Never in his dreams did he think he'd ever get an opportunity like this. He would not waste it.

Despite some fatigue he felt in his muscles and the smell of a foot that had been in a biker boot for ten hours, as was smiling from ear to ear. A part of him still couldn't believe he was doing this, He only wished he had time to enjoy himself. The Nylon was thin, if his climbing were to tickle the huge sole it could spell certain doom, and maybe he should've spent more time concentrating on not being detected and less time enjoying the sights. A moment later was a foot or so away from his glass knife.

11421122.title: One of the Boys

choices: It's DW (she reaches for the  Miles M.52 turbojet model)
It's Jane (she's dusting the  Miles M.52 turbojet model)
114211222.content:
Staying with the Aardvark was interesting. Okay, maybe interesting might not be the best word to use. Dangerously covert might fit the experience. Ash had to be constantly hiding from Arthur's Parents. After the incident with the snake they were a bit more on guard for unusual behavior from Arthur. The only safe zone he had until everyone was asleep was Arthur's Bedroom. His Father rarely went in and his Mother, Jane only came in to dust and vacuum and put clothes away. It was always an event when she'd arrive.

He watched her from the inside of the model of the Miles M.52 turbojet, watched as she moved about. He had feelings that he never had before or would've normally had. He had thoughts of wanting to be closer to her. To touch her. But that would be a death sentence, so why would he think that way? What Ash didn't know was that it was biological. His body was reacting to pheromones being produced by Jane. Fortunately He only felt the way when she was around, every other time he was his normal self.

And then there was Arthur's little sister DW.

Four years old and nothing more terrifying for a bug size human. She was unpredictable She would enter Arthur's bedroom at times Ash couldn't predict. He had a few close calls, once she had almost spotted and twice he'd nearly been stepped on by her. It had gotten to the point where he was forced to stay inside the Miles M.52 turbojet model until Arthur came home from school. He felt like a prisoner.

The Bedroom door Opened
114211222.title: Arthur

114211223.content:
Ash found out quickly why he was given the Nickname "The Brain." When it came to staying with "The Brain" it was all about science. Even when it came down to sleeping arrangements. His home consisted of a plastic electronic box complete with LED lighting that gave just enough light as to not blind him. He had even devised two way communication through a microphone and headphone speaker. All of which he'd done himself.

When Ash stayed with "The Brain." he spent most of the time compairing notes, what was different between the two realities and what was different. It came down to things working out about even technology wise, cultures, but when it came down to television that's when the similarities ended.

"No, we don't have a Bionic Bunny." said Ash speaking through a microphone. "The closest we have is a Superhero called Superman."

"Interesting." Brain mused and took notes."Is he Bionic?"

"Far from it. He's from another planet. He gets is power from The Sun. His cells store Solar Energy."

"So why isn't he called "Sun-Man?""

Ash though for a moment "I don't know. I guess it's because his feats were considered super and the name stuck. Brain I've been doing some thinking. About how I got here."

"Yes?"

"Now, keep in mind this is all speculation and probably for science fiction than anything else. Have you ever blown Bubbles?"

"Sure I have."

"Good, picture every reality, every dimension, as these bubbles floating about and minding their own business. Then one bubble comes in contact with another. Where they meet a hole forms in the barriers between the two. No, not a Hole. A door."

Brain thought for a moment. "It sounds like something out of Sci-Fi. Then again that might explain the suction you felt. Contents from one Dimension/reality coming in from one to another. You think the two realities are still touching?"

"Unlikely, remember I woke up in Francine's sneaker, if this door was still opened I would've jumped back through. No. It's closed all right. At least that one. Who's to say it won't open somewhere else to another reality. I've have read of people simply disappearing right in front of witnesses never to be seen again."

"You think you're stuck here then? Forever?"

"Maybe. But enough about that. You said you had an experiment you'd like to try?"

"Only with your consent. Its --"

Suddenly the Phone downstairs rang. Ash heard someone answer it."

"It's for you. I think it's Buster."

"Be right down Mom." Brain looked at Ash."Be right back."

When the young giant returned he could barely contain himself.
114211223.title: A Theory

1142113.content:
“Okay.....my name is Ash. Where I come from is a little hard to explain, so bare with me. I'm from what could be best described as another dimension or reality. Honestly I wish I could tell you how I got here, but I haven't the foggiest idea."

"You don't know how you got here?"

"Hey, it wasn't like I planned this in advanced. It was all rather abrupt. One minute I'm enjoying a lovely walk on a walking trail though the park, and the next I'm in your sneaker about to be walked on. Almost Ironic when you think about it."

Francine was quiet for a moment, processing what she had been told. Finally she spoke.

"So you don't even know how to get back, do you?"

"Not a clue. I mean, I don't even know if there's even a way back. For all I know this could be a freak incident. A billion to one occurrence. You know, It's just occurred to me I don't know who you are. What’s your name?”

Ash of course knew who she was, but didn’t want to reveal that just yet. He needed to know more about this world.

“Francine. Francine Frensky”

“Nice to meet you. I'd shake your hand, but that's impossible. I have so many questions. Am I still on planet Earth?”

“Yeah.”

“Well, at least that’s the same. If you don't mind me asking, where where you going before I happened?"

"I was headed for---"
1142113.title: Ash tries to explain what happened

11421135.content:
"The Living room? Do you normally put on footwear to go to the living room?"

Francine couldn't help but chuckle. "They're my indoor sneakers."

"Ah. I see. Well, you can still go. That is if you don't mind me tagging along."

"I have a tiny person in my house, you really think I'd leave you out of my sight? Hope in my hand and hang on."

Francine's had returned to her ear. Moments later he was riding in the palm of her hand as she walked into the living room."

"Where is everybody?"Ash asked, and then realized the young giantess couldn't hear him. He was out of range now. If he was going to be here for a while they would have to come up with a solution to that problem. That is of course Francine was willing to help. As of now she was friendly enough. Could that change?

"Here's where you get off"

Francine's voice broke his chain of thought. He was being lowered to a pillow on the couch. He climbed off as he was told to do.

"I'll be right back. I just want to get some snacks."

He watched her go. Moments later she sat down next to him with a bowl of freshly popped popcorn. Placing a kernel bigger than him next to Ash she turned on the TV.

Ash thought Francine was being rather cool with the fact she had what was essentially a tiny Alien lose in her home. But maybe she was just trying to be friendly. As much as he was interested in what was on the Frank 2000 inch model TV, he was more interested in Francine.

He watched her take a single popped kernel between thumb and finger and deposed it into her mouth. A simple gesture, when magnified to the scale of Francine wasn't so simple. She just ate enough food to last Ash a week! He could hear the digestive processes from where he was standing. And her breathing, and the beating of her heart. Things she probably didn't even notice in her daily life.

"Is there something wrong?"

Ash Blinked. Francine had somehow picked up on the fact he'd been staring at her. He felt his cheeks get warm.

"Here, let me pick you up."

Ash found himself grasped between thumb and finger very much like the kernel of popcorn had been earlier. He imagined being held before her mouth, her mouth opening...

Wait, why was he imagining THAT?!

"Okay, so what's up?"

Rather than letting him into her ear, Francine held him close. How was he going to explain himself?

"P-please don't be weirded out, but I was mesmerized by your eating. We don't have anything as big as you where I come from. Nobody has ever seen anything as big as you eat before."

"Is that all? I thought I was making too much noise."

Ash let out a breath. At least this version of Francine was reasonable. He'd hate to get her angry.

"Would you like to see me eat something else?"

Ash's heart leaped. Was she serious? Well, why not? After all she was just demonstrating. Where was the harm in that?"

"S-Sure" said Ash. "H-How about--"
11421135.title: "to the living room"

choices: I make something out of match sticks?
114211355.content:
"WHAT?!"

"I'm sorry, that slipped out. I didn't mean actually eating me. I just wanted to see----"

"YOU WEIRDO!"

Francine took Ash away from here ear before he could explain further. She held him before her angry face for a moment before she applied pressure and he popped between her fingers.

At least that's what Ash envisioned happened in his mind's eye the moment he blurted it out. Instead all he heard was a giggle from Francine.

"I don't think you'd want me to do that. Jonah might've gotten away with it, but not you."

She took him away from here ear and stared at him with dark brown eyes. They were so dark you could barely make out here pupils. "You do look cute though. Ever heard the saying 'You're cute I could eat you up'? I have an Aunt who liked to say that."

She smiled showing teeth and made a biting motion. Ash's heart quickened as she opened her mouth and he saw the interior.

Francine giggled again "Tell you what, maybe we can figure out something later. Right now I'm want to watch TV. She placed Ash back on the pillow.

"Enjoy the show" she said and continued eating her Popcorn. Whether she meant her eating or what was on TV it was unclear. Either way, he was glad he hadn't pissed her off. He recalled the Francine from the cartoon had a temper, there was more to this version of Francine than he first thought. He wondered what else about here was different.

When she'd watched enough TV programing and had finished her snack she picked Ash up between thumb and finger once more. No more was she holding her palm out for him to climb in.

She walked into the kitchen and with one hand poured herself up a glass of water. Then she held Ash close to her face as she drank the water. Through the glass he watched as gallons of water rushed into her mouth, flowed over teeth and tongue before disappearing over the edge of the tongue with loud "Gulps"

"Enjoyed the Show?" Francine Asked with a smile.

She walked into the bedroom she shared with her older sister. "If you're going to be staying here for a while, you'll need a place to stay. So how about---"
114211355.title: "M-Me?"

1142113553.content:
At First it seemed like a good idea. Why not? After all Francine's bed was more than large enough for her and an ant sized guest. The problem was after the lights had gone out and Francine had fallen asleep. She snored. Not badly, for anyone her size trying to sleep. For Ash, it was loud and made sleep impossible.

Not that he wanted to sleep. He had too much on his mind to try even without the snoring. Ash had felt something whenever Francine held him up to her mouth, something on akin to arousal and that bothered him greatly. Cartoon or flesh and blood , Giant or not, Francine was still only eight years old. There was no way in hell he was going to become one of those he'd read about. Even though he knew he could get away with it, his conscious would not allow it. Maybe in 8 or 10 years....

8 or 10 Years? Ash could only imagine what it would be like to live in such a world for that length of time. He pictured Tom Hanks in Castaway. Yep, that would probably be about right. Would he even survive eight days much less eight years? The odds were not in his favor.

He came out from behind the pillow and gazed up at the sleeping form of Francine. He tried to envision what she would look like older. Maybe she'd look like her sister who was sleeping in the bed beside her.

Her Sister. Now she was closer to his age.

A thought came to his mind She was Asleep, would it hurt to take a closer look? Maybe have a bit of fun? Within reason of course. There would be out of bounds areas he would not go near.

He'd have to traverse the area between them and he'd have to climb up onto her bed. Then he'd have to climb back to Francine's bed.

Ash's Heart sank. That was impossible. He'd need climbing equipment for such a trek. Maybe it was something he could do later. Maybe make rope ladders, or thread ladders in this case. Maybe with Francine's help. No, that would be too much to try to explain.

"Oh I just want to climb up into your sister's bed and explore her sleeping Body." Yeah He could just imagine how that would turn out.

Meanwhile, Ash supposed he could try to get some sleep despite the noise.
1142113553.title: Behind Francine's Pillow

choices: Catherine was still awake! Abort! or not
Ash makes his way closer to her face
Ash  makes his way to her hand
Ash is too amazed to do anything
11421135534.content:
Ash stood at the base of the rope ladder that lead up to the top of Catherine's bed just behind the pillows. He had set it up there some time ago. But he had yet to climb it while she was sleeping in it. The truth was, he wasn't able to bring himself to do it.

His feelings on the subject of Catherine had been conflicted. He had planned this excursion and even looked forward to it, things had changed in the months since he arrived. Other than his longer unkempt hair. He had gotten to know her, though his observations. Her mannerisms, her personality, and he wasn't sure anymore if he wasn't sure if he could go through with the plan. Even though he wasn't going anywhere "Out of Bounds" and just wanted a closer look at her, it kinda felt like he was taking advantage of her.

Plus he didn't want to piss her off, she was a lot bigger than Francine. She might not like the idea of something tiny crawling on her.

On this evening Francine was partaking in a sleepover. She wanted to take Ash but he insisted he would be okay by himself. Catherine had gotten changed for bed and he had watched her comb her hair and crawl into bed. Being that it was warm she had only a thin bed sheet covering her. And there he was standing at the base of his thread ladder contemplating. Ash sighed. It was now or never.

He began his assent.

Upon reaching the top, Ash rested for a moment before walking out from behind Catherine's Pillow.
11421135534.title: Six Months Later

choices: Catherine brushes Ash away in her sleep
Catherine rolls over on her back
Ash makes it to her forehead without incident
Catherine wakes up just as Ash reaches the top of her head
114211355342.content:
Ash still felt conflicted as he gazed upon the sleeping form before him. It didn't feel right to be doing this without her consent in the first place, which is why he self imposed the "out of bounds" rule. At the same time, Catherine was a giant that was hundreds of feet tall so why wouldn't he get a closer look?

It should be noted that Catherine and Francine didn't quite look or sound like their cartoon counterparts. The closer he got, the more apparent that became. The clothing was the same as well as their hair styles, but the physical appearance reminded Ash of Tim Burton's Planet of the Apes. They were ape like, but not completely. As for the voices, they too were similar, but came from mouths that were structurally different than the human voice actors of his world.

Catherine lay on her side and as Ash approached her face, the exhale of her breath pushed him back while her inhale tugged him forward. Her breath smelled of mouthwash and toothpaste, which wasn't unpleasant. Her mouth was slightly open, but in the darkness and gloom of the room he couldn't make anything out, which was disappointing. Maybe another time.

He turned his attention to the thick crop of hair that was normally tied back in a ponytail. Wanting a closer look, Ash decided on the most direct rout and began to climb up Catherine's cheek. It was so surreal. He was on someone's face!
114211355342.title: Face to face

choices: Ash nodded off, wakes up and it's morning.
Ash decides it's better not to stay too long
Catherine roles over on her other side
Catherine wakes up to get a drink of water.
Catherine wakes up to go to the bathroom
1142113553422.content:
As he climbed just under the left eye he noticed a shadow, then something suddenly knocked Ash off Catherine's cheek. Something really big. He tumbled downward and came to a stop just in front of her mouth. Shaking his head, Ash looked up to see what it was that hit him. It had felt like a wall of flesh.

He hadn't been far off. Above him he saw Catherine scratching at the spot where he'd been only a moment before. A finger tip. A single fingertip had brushed him away as though he'd been nothing. Which wasn't too far from the truth. He was lucky he hadn't ended up with serious injuries.

Despite being in a deep sleep, she felt him. Guess he wasn't going to try that again. Still, there were less fun and indirect ways he could get up there.

Catherine's hot humid breath blew over him. He gazed into the darkness of her mouth and wished it was lighter in the room so he could see into it better. He looked out the single window in the room. The moon was growing. Maybe when it was full it might be bright enough. A visit for another night then.

Ash stood up and with much effort began to climb the blanket covering the teen giantess. He had been reluctant to go this rout on account of the fabric wasn't the most ideal for climbing. Maybe with metal hooks progress would've been better. As it was, he didn't have any hooks and progress was slow.

As he reached the hump of her shoulder, Ash stopped to rest. It took a great deal of effort to reach the top and the muscles in his arms and legs burned from exertion. He really should've trained more for this, but never counted on how hard it would've been. From where he sat, he gazed over across the room to where Francine slept. Then reminded himself of the time and continued his trek.

Fortunately it was all downhill from there and it wasn't long before he was in the redish forest of Catherine's hair. He followed the strands of healthy crop to her ear. An ear that was twice the size of Francine's. Like her younger sister the ear lacked a lobe. With sore muscles he climbed up inside. Warmed radiated all around him, it felt good. Maybe he could stay for a little while. Rest up and continue to explore.
1142113553422.title: Catherine brushes Ash away in her sleep

choices: Francine and Ash talk some more
1142113555.content:
The type of plant was unfamiliar to Ash, but it had leaves that grew from it's base. it would make a great place to stay, only it lacked proper shelter. This observation was also noticed by Francine.

"You're going to need shelter in case someone other than me waters it." She noted. "Ah HA! I have just the thing."

She opened a junk drawer and took out a small house. It was the kind of house you'd see in an electric train set. It was old, and the paint was worn off in places but it would do the job.

"It's funny, I bought this at a yard sale on a whim." Francine placed the house at the base of the plant, then carefully placed Ash at it's front door. "What do you think?"

Ash stepped into the house. It was a two story building that lacked an upper floor so there were was a very high ceiling. It lacked a front door and furniture and comforts of any kind. But it was a start.

He stepped out the front door. Francine had doubled in size. Ash blinked for a moment and realized she was using the magnifying lense again.

"What do you think?"

He gave her a thumbs up.

"Great! I'll get you some stuff you can use for bedding and stuff."

An hour later, and will a lot of trial and error, Ash had a bed consisting of tissue, cotton and cheese cloth. It wasn't perfect, but it was a start.
1142113555.title: Behind this plant?

choices: Get a closer look at the slippers
114212.content:
Not giving it a second thought Francine taused the "Bug" into her waste basket near her desk. She didn't care if it was hurt or not, after all it was only a bug. Putting her sneaker back on she left the room and headed down the hallway to the kitchen.

Ash was lucky to have landed on something soft. Granted it was a used tissue, but it was better than something solid. As it was He was uninjured, just a bit disoriented by being taused away like a piece of trash. Kinda degrading in away. The rim of the basket was too high for him to climb out but fortunately he didn't have too. The basket was made of a wire mesh and he simply climbed down through the huge pieces of garbage to the bottom of the basket and squeeze his way through the mesh.

"Who would’ve thought my day was going to turn out like this".

Ash noticed there were two beds in the room, if he remembered the cartoon correctly Francine had an older sister named Catherine. He couldn’t recall her age but did remember she stood a good two and a half feet taller than Francine. Ash saw a pair of slippers that gave him a pretty good guess to her scale. He looked about the bedroom and shook his head in amazement. This was nothing like the way it was described in all those online stories he had read. They had made Ash actually want to be in a situation such as this, but this wasn't a story.

His first encounter was scary but amazing at the same time. He had no idea how he got here or even how long he was going to be here or even if there was a way back. Well if he was stuck there for a while, he may as well be enjoying it. He'd have to be careful. Ash's first meeting with these giants didn't go as well as he had hoped. It was probably best to avoid direct contact for for now.

Since no one was in the room for the moment he decided to look around.
114212.title: Trashed

11422.content: Ash felt the foot lift off the ground, as it swung forward and angled upward he slide past the toes and under the ball of her foot. Ash screamed for a moment before her foot touched the ground and an equivalant of 50000 tons came down on his tiny frame. Death was instant. Within a matter of three or four steps Ash's body was reduced to a stain on Francine`s old worn sock, one of many. She went about her day without even knowing what she had accidentally done. What ever physicaly remained of his body was washed away the next time her mom did the laundry.
11422.title: She Doesn't Feel Ash

choices: The pressure stops she starts walking.
The Pressure stops and the foot leaves the sneaker
11423.content:
The toes around be flinched. He stopped. Did she feel him?

Francine was about to leave her room when she started to feel a tickling sensation in her sneaker just under her toes. She frowned, what was that? Did an ant get into her sneaker again?

Ash was starting to feel hopeful when suddenly Her toes quickly closed in around him. He managed to kick once before the grip became so tight he couldn’t move.

“No---!”

The pressure increased . Ash was pressed into the sock covered flesh. The air was pushed out of his lungs, he thought he heard a bone snap as he was being scrunched between the sock covered toes and---
11423.title: She Feels Ash, But not in a good way.

114231.content: As Francine was about to take a step she began to feel an strange sensation under her toes. Not wanting to take her shoe off to investigate, she simply scrunched her and wiggled toes a bit until the sensation had stopped. Satisfied she went about her business, not aware of what she had done or knowing that Ash's remains were being pulverized and between her socked foot and the insole of her shoe.
114231.title: Squish (ending)

choices: Francine Ignores what's in her sneaker
Francine Wiggles her toes, forcing Ash back under them.
114232.content:
He remembered playing a game once where a shrunken man ended up in someone's shoe. He remembered how envious he was of that little man.

Now Ash was in a fight for his life.

It wasn't enough that he was trapped under Francine's toes, that turned out to be a blessing because the heavy fabric of the sock kept him in place. No, what was worst was the rising, swing forward, and that the sudden impact that rattled the marrow of his bones each time she took a step.Then there was the mountain of flesh pressing down all around him each time she applied weight to the foot. Each time the air was forced out out of his lungs to be replaced with less than fresh air that was getting warmer by the moment.

Completely oblivious to what was going on in her sneaker, Francine walked out of the apartment complex where she lived with her older sister and parents and made for her bike.

For Ash the bike was slightly better as the circular motion reminded him of being on a ferris wheel. The down side was that with her sneaker tilted forward and the pressure not as bad. He took this opportunity to wiggle his way out from under the socked foot. At least on top he'd have a better chance. As he crawled out from under the toes, there was a slight twitch from the huge appendages. Did she feel Him? He was not in the best of positions if she decided to get off what he assumed was a bike. If she were to put her foot on the ground he was as good as dead!
114232.title: she starts walking.

114233.content:
Just when Ash though at any moment he would be turned into paste, the huge toes relaxed and the foot began to slide out of the sneaker.

And taking Ash along with it.

Much to his surprised, his foot had become entangled in a loose thread. As the foot left the sneaker, he hung momentarily in the air and observed the outside world before the floor rose up to meet him. Instinctively he pulled himself up to keep from crashing head first into the floor. the huge foot settled on top of him and once again he found himself under Francine's huge sock covered toes, this time however he was in a much safer location. Above him was a canopy of dirty white cloth. He wasted no time freeing his foot.

Francine peered into her sneaker and frowned. She could've sworn she'd felt something but now whatever it had been seemed to have vanished. With a shrug she put her sneaker back on. As she did so, she hadn't noticed the tiny creature that had been under her socked foot. Nor did she pay any attention to his cries for help as she left the room.

Ash, happy to be still alive but scared out of his wits, watched the young giantess thunder off. His brain was trying to grasp what his eyes was telling him. That was Francine Frensky, from a cartoon show, and she was gigantic. How the holy heck did THAT happen? If She was that big, then so was every other character on the show, including her family.

Her Family. They could show up at any minute and he was out in the open. Not that they might see him, but they could certainly step on him!

He had to act fast. His brain could figure this out later. Right now he had to---

Thud......THUD......THUD

He was too late. Someone was coming. Ash's wondered who it could be. Francine was the youngest in her family, that ment every Giant in this reality would be taller than her. And if she couldn't hear him he had zero chance of being noticed by them. The door swung opened and a colossal figure stepped into the room.
114233.title: Freedom from the sneaker.

choices: Bubby sees something on the floor
1142334.content:
"Francine? Are you still here?"

The Figure that towered over Ash was older but nevertheless a threat to his existence. He recognized the voice and it was eerie to hear it considering it belonged to someone who had passed away in his reality.

Of her height he couldn't be sure. If he were to guess, he'd probably look as insignificant as an Ant to her just as he had for Francine. Even more so.
