Cautiously peeking up, he saw a sight which, while expected, he simply couldn't believe. Towering over everything like the titans of mythology was the gigantic, purple purred, anthropomorphic skunk girl he remembered seeing from childhood cartoons... granted he didn't remember her being so big. Her hair and fur was all messy, suggesting she had recently woken up. as she looked around the room she let out a loud yawn before looking down at the slippers.

Ash quickly retreated to avoid being spotted, but of course this lead to a whole new problem as his whole world started to shift and rotate. She must have been preparing to put the slipper on.

Knowing there wasn't much time before he gained a roommate, Ash backed up and prepared to position himself so that she would hopefully not notice him. Lord knows how that would end up if she found him here. As he looked back he saw Fifi's ______ at the entrance

142.content:
'What a ride...' I thought to myself.

I was definitely not in the woods. I was still outside, but the plants that towered over me resembled blades of grass.

Wait sec, blades of grass?

Rolling over on my stomach, I slowly tried to stand up. My head was splitting. Felt like somebody had used it for a football. After staggering to my feet I took a good look at my surroundings. They looked were blades of grass all right. Twenty-foot tall blades of grass but grass nonetheless. It was like a scene straight out of Honey I shrunk the Kids. Did I shrink? Nah, that’s impossible. There has to be a logical explanation for this. Maybe I bumped my head and I’m hallucinating, or maybe I was still unconscious and I was dreaming all this.

It all felt too real to be a dream though.

Riseing above the grass there was an enourmous wooden building some distance infont of me." Higher for Hire" was the name of the building according to the sign. Where did I see that before? Well any place was better than where I was, if the outside world was now a hundred times my scale, so were the predators.

By the time I had reached the Godzilla sized front door, I had come to the decision that it was better to just accept that what I was experienceing was real rather than trying to fight my sences. The gap under the door was just big enough for me to crawl under it. Once inside I was relieved to find no one there. Either I was here early or the place was closed today.

The place was an office. That much I could tell. There must be a living quarters up above judging from the stair way. I was tempted to climb up the stairs and look around up there but realized it would take forever just to get up a single step.

The plywood floor of the office was rough showing the grains of the wood to be like trenches to me. There was a rug on the floor, a desk at the very back, a safe and a file cabinet. The rug looked like a vast purple football field spreading out in all directions. I stared up at the ceiling hundreds of feet above me. How big were the people who worked there? I was completely awestruck by the sheer magnitude of everything.

Just to be safe I decided to find somewhere to hide in case someone did show up. I didn't want to be squished underfoot.
1421.title: Enter the Building

14212.content:
The quickest way to the wall was through the rug, but as i started it soon became extremely difficult because I had to push my way though fibers that were almost as tall as I was.

'Screw this' I thought as I got way from the rug and onto the wooden floor. Sure it was harder on my feet but at least I was going much faster. As I continued running, I looked around at my gargantuan surroundings and realized that I was hardly making any ground at all. I was just too tiny. The wall up ahead didn't seem to be getting any closer. It could have been no more than a few feet away, but to me it was like a hundred meters. As I carried on running towards that wall, my place of safty, I was soon out of breath, knew I should've joined a gym.

I felt a tremor in the floor.

Then another, stronger than the first. Then another, and another becoming stronger and stronger each time. I soon began to hear a Thud accompanying the tremor. They continued, THUMP.... THUMP... THUMP... THUMP. I knew what was coming I had seen enough Godzilla movies to reconize the sound of giant footsteps. I stood there feeling the tremors grow stronger and stronger under my feet. A part of me wanted to wait and see who or what was coming another half wanted me to run like the devil was chaseing me. That part of me finally won and I started running towards the wall as fast as I could.

The Incredibly loud booms got louder and louder, the floor shook more violently. I was slightly bouncing off the floor from the tremors, and suddenly stopped, I heard the sound of a door being unlocked I stopped to see the door knob turn and the door opened.

I suddenly remembered where I had seen 'Higher for Hire' Before.
14212.title: Head for the Far wall.

142121.content:
Rebecca Cunningham stood in the doorway. She looked almost as Ash remembered her from the show, almost. She looked a real bear and was a good 500 feet tall. he normally thought such huge creatures couldn't exist but that sort of thinking wind flying out the window rather quickly.

She stepped up onto the wooden flooring of the office with a thud sending a tremor through the wood grain. Then came the other foot. Ash could feel the wooden planks give a little to her incredible weight. This time he couldn't help but stand and watch. He looked up at her face for a few seconds, her eyes focused straight ahead, and then back to her feet. That was another thing that was different about her, though the light and dark brown fur patches were still there they looked like actuall bear feet. and instead of walking around Bare Foot she wore leather sandals.

As she took a step, the heel of her back foot would rise, then her leg would swing forward. With a slap, the leather sole of her sandal would strike her foot as she lowered it. A dull, thundering boom accompanied each step. I watched transfixed as the process repeated itself.

As Ash watched her sandal-clad feet approach, He quickly developed a plan.


(So what's the plan?)

Ash wanted to try to get Rebecca's attention, so he decided to hitch a ride on one of her feet until she sat down at her desk and then maybe get her attention from there. Stupid, definetly. But a part of him was still thinking this whole thing was a dream and needed convinceing.

She took three more steps, getting closer with each step. Just as she was only one step away from him a flaw in Ash's brilliant plan suddenly struck him: How the hell was he going to get on her foot? He couldn't climb the worn leather sandal fast enough, and he sure as hell couldn't jump high enough. As luck would have it, Rebecca soon solved the problem for him.

Ash looked straight up into the air she lifted her right foot. It rose just above his body and stayed there for a few seconds. Then it she stomped her foot down so hard on the floor right beside him that he flew strait up into the air. The force was so great that it would have been about 5 feet in the air on his scale. Ash's body started to turn to left in mid air. He landed so hard he saw stars. His body finished falling over and he landed flat on his back. He could do nothing but just lay there looking up at her as she walked to her desk.

“That was worked rather well…” Ash moaned as he watched her walk past him.

Ash slowly got up so as to make his rise less painful, then turned toward the desk. At her desk, Rebecca sat going through some paperwork. He was in awe and just gazed at her for a few moments. This was going to be harder than He thought. He couldn't just run up to her and start jumping around at her feet. That would only get him killed, and there was know way to know if she could even hear him anyway. On top of that she was so massive that she could step on him before he even had time to get out of the way.

Even from where he was sitting on the floor Ash could feel a tremor each time she tapped her foot. He would have to wait for the right time. Standing up and carefully makeing his way to far wall, which is were he should've gone instead of trying that stunt, Ash sat on the floor and watched her every move. Just waiting for the right moment.
1421211.title: Plan A

choices: Hold your ground and hope for the best
The Phone rings and Rebecca returns to her desk to answer it.
14212111.content:
For the next several hours Ash watched as she placed orders while arguing with Balloo, who was an even bigger monstrosity. When he finally left to reluctantly make is deliveries, Rebecca rubbed her temples while slipping her sandals off her feet. From his position Ash could see her toes wiggle and flex from under the desk. One of many differences he had noted from the cartoon this Rebecca had actual toes and feet like a real bear though her claws were nowhere near as long.

"That' feels better," she said sighing.

Ash studied her closely. When he was younger Rebecca Cunningham was his first cartoon crush, now this flesh and blood version of the character was big enough to crush him. There was something else thought, something he couldn't put his finger on. Whatever it was, it compelled him to get closer. The idea would've normally scared the hell out of him. You don't try to get closer to Godzilla you run. Yet the desire was there.

Rebecca stood up from behind her desk and padded into another room. What was in there Ash could only guess. Maybe it was the washroom. Despite the risks Ash took this opportunity to move to a closer position. Of course to do that he would have to walk back out into the middle of the office. It wasn't something he wanted to do but it was that or stay where he was. And he was sure he could get to where he needed to go before Rebecca---

He hadn't even completed the line of thought for at very moment he heard an enormous toilet flush. The bathroom door swung open and Rebecca stepped back out. With her sandals off, if could see more of Rebecca's footpads as she walked -- and rather than walking back to her desk, she was walking straight for him!

"Shit! I knew I should have stayed where I was!"
14212111.title: Moving closer to Rebecca

choices: Get closer to her, but keep his pressance unknown
142121112.content:
BOOOOM!

Her foot came down only a foot or two from Ash. She had just missed turning the tiny human into so much jelly under her foot.

Knocked off his feet from the impact Ash looked up at her. He thought that she would immediately continue to walk back to her desk. But she was just standing there. Looking around the room. It was as if she was looking for something. No someone. Was it possible she could sense his presence? The phone ringing broke her train of thought. She walked over, sat down on her desk and answered the phone.

Ash got back to my feet and walked into the very same spot where her foot rested. The floor was still warm under his feet and he could smell the sent of lotion and foot lingering in the air. He saw movement out of the corner of my eye, Ash looked up and watched as Rebecca hung up the phone and stood up and walked around her desk to her chair and slip her sandals back on. Holding a sheet of paper, she walked outside closing the door behind her.

Ash ran straight for her desk and got there just as Rebecca walked back into the office. Under the safety of the desk, he watched her sit back down. Her right foot swung over him, the sandaled extremity was just six feet above his head .

'Okay Genius, now what?' Ash thought to himself.
142121112.title: Hold your ground and hope for the best

1421211121.content:
That sounded like the best thing to do. I couldn't keep hiding, after all, and if I was going to get squashed, I'd rather do it trying to do something, instead of just constantly running in fear for my life. So thinking, I ran towards the edge of her sandal, and looked at it. The thing was almost as tall as I was, and I'd never been in the best of shape, but I had to get up there. Luckily, Rebecca kept her foot still as I climbed onto her sandal, so I was able to get up without too much of a problem. Unluckily, as soon as I was up, she decided to move again, scooting her chair back, and tilting her foot up, causing me to go forward, and fall right between her toes, which closed around me, hard, the pressure of it feeling like it was going to pop my eyes out of my head.

Rebecca didn't stay scooted back for long though, and rolled her chair forward again, her foot becoming level, and letting me drop forward onto it. Woozy, and barely awake after that vice ride, I just flopped down onto my stomach, and lay there, rolling over after a moment or two, to look up and find she was still scooted away from the desk she'd been at, so I could now look right at the bottom of her face. Well, I could while it was still, as she suddenly started tapping her foot, and with the first backswing up it, I was sent flying, unable to scream as the wind was moving faster that my lungs could take in, so I flew a silent little bug, just to the side of her head, causing her to turn, but by the time she looked where I'd been, I was already past that point, and sailing straight towards the counter behind her desk.

On the counter, which I hadn't been able to see from the floor, were two items that would make for a soft landing, but neither looked rather pleasant. The first was a cup of coffee, still steaming, and looking rather hot, but still, softer than the wood around it. The other was an open sandwich, with one slice of bread sitting to the side, looking inviting, since it was softer, but covered with some kind of condiment that looked like it was probably sticky. Neither option was going to be fun, but deciding quickly, you aim yourself towards....
1421211121.title: Flying Lessons

choices: I slip, and am washed down her throat
14212111211.content:
Turning my body, I drifted over towards the side, and with a splash, landed in the cup of coffee. Instantly I regretted the choice, as the liquid in the cup was hot. Not scalding hot, or hot enough to peel my skin, but still plenty hot, and I let out a cry, that let the bitter stuff into my mouth, getting me into a coughing fit, that only made it harder to breath. Remembering something from an old swim class, I go limp in the water, trying not to move, as my body's natural buoyancy carries me upward, and with another splash, I breach the surface, and then sit up and take a big gulp of air.

The scene around me is one of walls. Not high ones mind, I wasn't that small, and the cup was pretty full, however, they were still higher than I could get out, and looking smooth, with no handholds, meaning I was kind of stuck. Thinking on my predicament, I felt a shudder pass through the cup, and looked upward to see Rebecca again, as she walked towards the counter, looking around. Obviously, for me, though she still likely wasn't sure what I was. Her hand was reaching down towards me, and I started to shout up towards her, but before I could cry out loudly, the cup suddenly shot upward, and I was plunged beneath the liquid again.

This time I made an effort not to breath in the coffee, and so was able to, after the movement upward stopped, and I was suddenly moving horizontally, and slammed hard into the wall of the cup. This still proved to be lucky, as I could use the wall to climb up through the liquid, and soon was out in the open again, looking up at Rebecca. In one had she was holding the cup, and staring into the sky, I could see she was holding the sandwich with the other, and I sighed in relief for not having picked that as my landing point, as she opened wide and tore a rather large chunk off it, chewing slowly, while looking around for me.

I shouted up, and the cup rose, and for a moment, I thought she might have heard me. Then I noticed I was heading towards her mouth, and I shouted again, but was drowned out as the cup tilted the instant it got to her lips, and I was having to fight a swift moving current that was flowing forward, towards her maw. It was impossible of course, and soon I was moving towards her, and within second, decided to grab one of her teeth, since it was the only solid thing I could see. So I reached out, and wrapped my hand around it as I passed, trying to pull myself towards it.
14212111211.title: The Best Part of Waking Up

choices: Ash awakens in another Cartoon World
142121112111.content:
"NO!NO! DON"T SWA--"

*GULP*

There was nothing he could've done. He was simply too small to be heard. Oh Rebecca had thought she heard something, but she'd closed her mouth and swallowed her mouthful of coffee before investigating. That decision sealed Ash's fate. Despite how hard he clawed at the lining of her esophagus, the powerful muscles rippled and forced him downward. Was this the end? Was this how he was to die? As part of a Anthropomorphic Bear's dinner? He didn't want to die, he wanted to live! He felt himself squeezed through a Valve and fell through open space before splashing in an ocean of Stomach acid, coffee and chewed sandwich. In the pitch dark and breathing in the foul air, he was sloshed about as Rebecca's Stomach began to it's work. More hot coffee and chewed sandwich rained down all around him. His skin tingled and began to burn, but mercifully he wasn't aware of anything when the real pain began.

Rebecca finished her meal and with a small burp put her thermos away and went back to sorting out the weeks deliveries. She had much to do before Baloo and Kit came back from their run.

THE END

Or....
142121112111.title: Washed down her throat

142121112112.content:
Trying to grab onto the huge tooth was like trying to get a hold onto a huge slippery rock at a beach while being tousled around in the surf. But fate had intervened. Rebecca’s tongue was moving up and down as she drank her coffee. As her tongue went up she pushed Ash onto the tooth. Thankful for the unintentional help, he knelt on his hands and knees watching as a river of coffee ran down her throat and being thankful he wasn’t going along with it.

The flow stopped as Rebecca took the cup away from her mouth, Ash suddenly realized He was in a bad spot and quickly rolled over between the tooth and the inside of her cheek as she closed her mouth, her teeth coming together with a loud clack.

In the darkness of Rebecca’s mouth, with his face pressed into the soft lining of the cheek and the hard enamel of the tooth pressing into his back Ash knew that he wasn’t safe. It was only a matter of time before she registered his presence or took another bite of her sandwich. He wondered how she would react if she did feel him, would she feel disgust, pity, curiosity, all three at the same time?

Ash's thoughts were interrupted by a loud "HMMMM?" from Rebecca's throat.

“This is it,” he thought.
142121112112.title: Hanging  on

choices: You have a conversation with Rebeca.
She falls alseep. There was something else in the coffee.
1421211121121.content: "What the... something seems wrong with this coffee. Wait... I hope this is not what what I think it is." Rebeca thought to herself. She spit you out the next moment. "Great, I hope hope she doesn't see me, or at least isn't angry," you think to yourself. "Huh, what is that that?" Rebeca thought to herself. She then lowers her head to get a better look at you. "Oh no! She's spotted me," you think. "Wait, was it you in my coffee? Well, I guess that means I wasn't drugged. That's a relief. Here, let me bring you closer to my face so we can talk," she said as she lowered her hand. You climb on it, hoping that you weren't the only unusual thing in it. If she was drugged, you would either have to hope her daughter Molly's there so you can use her to get help or come up with a plan to wake Rebeca up by yourself. She lifts you up and places you on her nose.
1421211121121.title: Rebecca feels Ash

Molly gives her mom a hug and then notices you.
14212111211211.content:
"Are you real? Can you understand me? Maybe there was something in that coffee. Or maybe I'm under too much stress. Either way, I feel like I'm seeing things," Rebeca said to herself. You climb on her head and walk to her ear and say, "Hello, my name is Ash. You're not imagining me.As for your stress, if you feel like talking about it, I'll listen as long as you don't yell."

"I guessing I'm not crazy, yet. Although having Baloo for an employee is pretty stressful. He's not only lazy and unorganized, but he's also blown several jobs and got me in serious trouble. I don't know what I'm going to do about him," she explained. "Well, if you can't dock his pay or fine him for messing up, you could offer incentives to motivate him to do better." I haven't laughed like that since I took over this business. I am guessing it's the stress of what I'm doing. It's actually nice to have someone to talk to who can understand me, " she replied.

"I'm glad to be on your good side. Anyway, you should take a few notes on the things he likes, then use that information to come up with a way to reward him for success," you suggest. "That's a strange idea, but it might be worth a try. Maybe I should give him smaller goals to work towards instead of just having him save up to pay off his plane. Thanks for the suggestion. How can I repay you?" she asked. "I could use a place to stay, if that's not too much to request. At this size, I need whatever help I can get," you reply. "Okay, I'll see what I can do. You may end up having to play with my daughter, though. She's rather young, so she might think you're a doll. I'll try to talk to her about you, maybe she'll be respectful of you," she explained. "I guess it's a small price to pay, so I'll go with it," you decided.

Later on at Rebecca's apartment...
14212111211211.title: She wants him Black & Baloo.

142121112112111.content:
"I hope you don't mind staying in here tonight." said Rebecca as she carried Ash into her bedroom.

"Not at all," replied Ash looking about the room. "I feel protected when I'm with you, as strange as that may sound. Nice bedroom you have here."

"Thank you, and that doesn't sound strange at all, at your size there are many dangers." Rebecca walked over to her Dresser and lowered her hand so Ash could climb out of it."I have to care to Molly now. That's My Daughter's name.Kit should be takeing her home now. Will you be okay here by yourself?"

"No problem."

Ash watched her walk out closeing the door behind her. Looking around he decided to kill some time by exploreing the top of the dresser. Everything had so much detail, more so than what Rebecca would probably even notice. From the wood grain in the Dresser to the strans of rope like hair in her hair brush. He looked up at various bottles of perfume and other products that towered over him. Reading the lables he reconized none of the brand names. Becided them was a framed picture of a Bear with tanned fur. Ash wondered who it could be, but he suspected it was Molly's father. A character that was never mentioned in any of the episodes he remembered watching. Course, he had to remember that this wasn't a Saturday morning TV show he was on. This situation was very real, and his coffee stained clothes comfirmed that as well as the slight burn all over his body from being in that hot coffee. Pulling his shirt up to expose his stomach he could see the redness of his skin, but it didn't look that bad. He was thankfull it had cooled down a bit and even more thankfull that Rebecca hadn't swallowed him.

Ash looked over the edge of the dresser and saw a pair of fuzzy slippers next to a stool. The biggest pair he'd ever seen. They looked very comfortable too. Maybe when Rebecca came back he could suggest sleeping in one. If not, he could always go with a matchbox with cotten. As he walked away from the edge of the Dresser, he heard and felt someone coming. The door opened and--
142121112112111.title: Rebecca brings you to her room for the night.

choices: Sleep in the same bed with you."
Explore the doll house then make my choice."
1421211121121111.content:
As the door opened, you notice Rebecca came back with doll house. "Molly was kind enough to let me use this. What are you?" she asked as she lowered her head so she could hear you better.

You answered, "I'm a human, our worlds are very similar, but the technology is more advanced in mine."

"I think I've read in the newspaper recently about Shere Kahn having some humans who are helping him. I wonder if he might have anything that could make communicating between us easier. It's not that's there anything wrong with how we communicate now, but it would be nice if I could hear you from across the room," she replied.

"I am worried about the possibility that he might take me away from you and use me for his experiments. I do hope for a chance to save him so he'll repay the debt without trying to take me away from you," you explained your concern.

"I guess I'll have to look for an oportunity to throw him a rope when he needs one. On another note, I'm taking Molly to the toy store, but I'm also going to get you clothes and I am considering getting another doll house for you to stay in. I don't want to have to rely on borrowing my daughter's doll house all the time. Also, the washing machine in the apartment building is broken and won't be repaired until next week, so we'll be going to the laundromat, too," she changed the subject.

"Have you considered asking Wild Kat to fix it?" you suggested.

"That's a good idea," she complimented, "but I get the feeling no one would take Wild Kat seriously as a mechanic because he doesn't give off the impression he's intelligent when he talks. I could talk to my landlord about that idea, though. Now that I think about it, that sounds a lot like an idea from... Could it be? You seem a lot like... Nah you couldn't be, could you?" she started muttering to herself.

"Is something is wrong?" you asked her.

"You and Molly's father seem very much a like. Like you, he was smart and knew how to put me in a good mood," she explained.

"If it's not too much to ask, I'm curious about what happened to him," you told her.

"I haven't really shared this story with anyone because I wasn't sure I was strong enough to relive that day, but with you around, I actually feel like I can. Cape Susette may seem like a good place to live, but it's not crime-free. We went to the bank to set up a fund for Molly's future when she was just over a year old. We managed to get it set up and were just about to leave when some gangsters came in to rob that bank. One of them tried to shoot me, but he shielded me. That heroic act cost him his life. I have been trying to not let his death get me down because I know he wouldn't want that," she explained.

"You still have Molly, that's one thing to be thankful for. I guess you two were the world to him," you replied.

"Yeah, you're right about both of those things. The more I talk you, the more I feel like his spirit lives on in you. I guess that's why I felt like I could tell you. Maybe it's fate that I got to meet you," she responded.

"Do you really think his spirit lives on in me?" you asked.

"I've seen some unusual things lately, so I think it's very possible. I feel like this could be the second chance I was looking for, which is why I will protect you. I do want to find out how well a date between us will go and how well you get along with Molly at some time. If things go well, I might tell you his name and marry you," she answered.

"We'll just have to see what happens," you answered trying not to get ahead of yourself at the thought of that possibility.

"If you want, I could put another pillow on the other side of the bed or arrange something else if you want to sleep in the same bed with me tonight," she offered.

You answered, "I noticed your slippers earlier and thought about sleeping in one of them for the night, but I guess I will

"Okay, just stay there for now. I'll be back in about five minutes," she said as she left the room. A few seconds later, you could hear water running, and then you start to think about things. How she lost her husband and had to raise Molly alone. You don't remember the name of any bank in the cartoon series, so you imagine Cape Suzette only has one bank. You try to think of characters from the show who might have killed him. Trader Moe is the main one who comes to mind.

As you were thinking, you heard the door handles and the water still running. You were pretty sure it was Molly and decided to remain still and act like a doll until Rebecca returns. "Mommy said she brought a friend home today. I don't see anyone here. I thought I heard her talking to someone in here," she said upon entering her mother's room. She turns her eyes toward you and curiously asks, "Where did she get that doll? Did someone give it to her? What is it? Is this why she asked for the doll house? Did she get it for me and wanted to surprise me?" Being only four years old, she had plenty of questions to ask when she saw you.

Luckily for her, her mother returned not long after she entered her room. You noticed she had a pillow and was wearing a lovely pink bathrobe. Molly asked her questions to her mother as she placed the pillow next to hers. Rebecca turned towards her daughter and answered, "I found the 'doll' while I was at work today, but he's not really a doll. His name is Ash. He's a human from another world. I asked you for the doll house to provide him with a place to stay for tonight, but I came up with another solution, so you may take it back to your room if you want. I was originally planning to keep his a pet, but I'm starting to think he might be more than that." She places her paw out and you walk on it. Then she lowers her paw to introduce you to Molly, "Molly, this is my new friend Ash. Ash, this is my daughter Molly." You stick your hand out as Molly stuck her index finger out. You shaked it saying, "Hello, nice to me you." She giggles then says, "He's cute." "I'm happy you like him. I'll let you hold him while I carry your doll house back to your room if he doesn't mind," Rebecca offered. "I don't mind," you reply. Molly picks you and places you on her shoulder as her mother picks up the doll house again.

If my theory about what Mr. Shere Kahn is up to is right, there is a chance you might be able to see them yourself," you answer. "What do you mean?" Molly asked with curiosity. "If what your mother said was true, I get the feeling he might be wanting to see if my world's technology and stories will be just as popular in this world," you replied. "I hope it is, I really want to know more about your world!" exclaimed Molly as she opened her bedroom door. You noticed she has put all her toys away neatly, most likely because Rebecca has taught her that behavior or Kit cleaned it up for her. As Rebecca placed the doll house in the corner of the room, Molly asked her, "Mommy, is okay if Ash sleeps in here tonight?" "I think it's best if we let him decide," she answered. You thought about this question. You felt sorry for Rebecca's loss, but you also thought about Molly wanting to play with you as a pet/doll and how she wants to know more about your world. "Sounds great to me!"

Dressed in his clothing and Rebecca dressed in her robe and Slippers, the bearess carried the micro human quietly into the kitchen. It was early in the morning, and Molly wouldn't be up for another hour. Placing Ash on the counter, Rebecca proceeded to turn the stove on and quietly take out a frying pan.

"Well, okay, that will work for me. Thing is, do you have any plans for Molly?" you asked.

"What do you mean?" Rebecca asked as she starts to clean up.

"Well, being the youngest of the group, she's also rather small. I wouldn't be surprised if she had a hard time seeing over the row in front of her without something to give her a boost. Not being able to watch it, she could get bored and head off towards the balcony," you point out.

Rebecca starts to think about it and then sets off to her room after she finished cleaning up. A few seconds later, she returns with a pillow in her hands and says, "I think this will work." As soon as she says that, there was a knock at the door. "That must be Baloo and Kit. I'll tell them you'll be joining us." she says as she walks towards the door and opens it.

"Are you ready to go, Becky?" Baloo asked.

"Not quite, I am bringing a date with me," Rebecca answered.

"A date? Becky, I'm sure you remember Mr. Covington. It didn't turned out well. What makes you sure this one won't end the same?" Baloo asked.

"I know I can trust him, I'll introduce you to him right now, if you want," she offers.

"Fine! I wouldn't mind knowing who he is and why you're sure you can trust him," Baloo replies. Rebecca leads him and Kit to the table where you are standing. "Is this some kind of joke?! There's no one there," Baloo says to Rebecca.

Kit notices you and says, "I'm not so sure. Take a closer look at the table, Papa Bear."

Baloo takes another look at the table and sees you, "Are you dating that little thing on the table?"

"His name is Ash, we met yesterday. I don't know why, but I feel so close to him," Rebecca explained as she picked you up and put you in her pocket.

"Okay, remind me what movie are we going to see again, Ms. Cunningham?" Kit asked. As he asked, you remember how the episode where Molly shrank began. You wondered if they will be seeing the same movie.

You hear Rebecca answer, "It's a...
142121112112111111111121.title: Go to the movies.

1421211121121111111111211.content:
Frankenstein? No way, it couldn't be.

"I'm going to get Molly ready and I'll be back in a moment."

Ash thought it over in his head, of COURSE it could be. Given the situation he was in he was willing to believe anything. And If Molly ends up shrunk like in that episode, then they were going to need his help. Sill, Ash had to remind himself that just because it happened in a cartoon he saw there was no reason for it to happen now, after all there were no tiny men in that episode, just his presence there alone might have changed things. Baloo and Kit looked at Ash curiously, and after a moment it was the large bear who broke the silence.

"So, uh, How long have you known Becky?"

"Not long, but we've become really good friends in such a short time. How about yourself?"

"Few months, since she bought my business. I kinda take care of her so if you try anything--"

"Baloo!" Rebecca snapped from another room "That's quite enough!"

"It's okay Rebecca." said Ash "And you have nothing to worry about sir. Hell hath no fury like a woman's scorn, and at my size I don't ever want to be on her bad side."

"Hmmm, said Baloo "Good point. I've been on her bad side more than once," He leaned forward and whispered "It's not a side you want to see,trust me."

"Well we better get going or we'll be late." said Rebecca walking back into the room. Looking at the clock she added "If we leave now we can get the early show."

"That reminds me, how are you going to get me into the theater? Carrying me might draw attention."

"Got that covered."

Rebecca held up a crystal locket for Ash to see. "I have This locket you can ride in. It's see through so you'll be able to watch the movie and there are holes in it so you'll be able to breath."

*******

Sitting in the locket, Ash watched the film unfold. He hated not watching a movie without popcorn. A movie experience just isn't the same without Popcorn, but being in a dark room he didn't want to risk being accidentally eaten.Even if Rebecca put a kernel on her lap, he would never be able to see the movie. As the monster made his first appearance Ash had to admit the actor who played the monster wasn't that bad. He was no Boris Karloff but he did a really good job. He also liked how this film was nothing like the Karloff movie so it was a fresh experience for him. It was cool watching a film on a screen that put the ones used in IMAX to shame. He felt eyes on him, sometimes it was Baloo giving him a glance and sometimes it was Kit.He could understand why, after all he was an alien of sorts. There was a Yelp .The locket shifted as Rebecca jumped as the monster appeared out of nowhere.

"Isn't this great Baloo?" whispered Kit. Ash looked over at the big bear. As he expected to see Baloo was crouched down under the seats.

"You're not scared, are yeah Papa Bear?"

"Uh, n-No." said Baloo. "I just uh, uh, dropped a nickle."

Kit Laughed "Ah, you big baby!"

So far the scene had been playing out exactly like the episode. Now if his suspicions were correct, Molly would be leaving right about now. Turning his head to the right and looking past the fabric of Rebecca's coat he looked over to where Molly was sitting.
1421211121121111111111211.title: Off to see Frankenstein

You couldn't focus on the rest of the movie. Molly could still end up getting shrunk. This was something you were hoping to avoid. First, you knew Molly wouldn't like the experience. Second, you knew Rebecca would be worried sick if anything happened to her. You would be doing them both a favor if you could help them avoid it. You couldn't chase her down because of your size, which meant you had to plan to keep her busy. You remember Baloo wasn't really going to be of any help to Rebecca when she assigned him to help her with paperwork, you could ask him to help keep an eye on her and keep her busy. He might be inclined to help. You could also ask Kit to help too. If all else failed, you could try telling her a story yourself. You didn't want to alarm Rebecca to this possibility if you could avoid it. You wondered where Wildcat was at during the episode, you knew that the more help you can get with keeping her mind off that place, the better. You pondered what you could possibly do to keep her busy if it came to that for a while. You stopped trying to plan this out when Rebecca asked everyone what they thought about it back in the lobby. Molly and Kit enjoyed it, Baloo claimed he just wasn't able to watch it. When she took the locket off to ask you, she noticed you were deep in thought. "What's wrong, Ash?" she asked.

"May I please speak with Baloo alone?" you ask. She hands you over to Baloo and then walks towards a corner with Molly. "I need your help with something," you explain.

"If you're wanting my advice on Becky, I am afraid I have nothing to offer," he replies.

"It's more like I'm concerned about Molly. I had a sense of Deja vu when I found out we were headed here. It grew stronger when I heard the name of the movie. I was worrying about the possibility of her running off during the movie. I feel we lucky this time, but something she said leaves me to believe that it's not over yet," you explain.

"She'll be fine," Baloo tries to reassure you.

"This isn't the first time she's done something like this, is it?" you asked. Baloo starts to think about it and remembers a few incidents like this.

"So it's happened before. Doesn't mean it could happen again any time soon," Baloo replies.

"A child's curiosity can lead to trouble. I get the feeling she might see something that looks like it was from that movie that will set it off in the near future. However, it might be a possible to keep this problem contained. If you, Kit, and I can keep her busy long enough when it is about to happen, we can keep her safe. If you can get Wildcat involved, it might help the odds. Besides, it could be a good excuse to get out of paperwork in the near future," you reply.

"Let's say you're right, how will we know know when it is going to happen?" he asks.

"If I am correct, her reason for running off is doesn't think anyone's paying attention to her. Of course, part of it is because things will probably be busy at the time with regards to important paperwork being done at Higher for Hire. I think it was something about taxes, but I can't remember the details about it offhand. However, I am sure the trigger will be a building she sees outside the window," you answer. You were hoping Baloo would help you, but you would let Rebecca know if he didn't help. You figured that she might at least take this possible problem seriously.

While part of you wanted to be able to interact with more of the world around without any trouble, another part of you actually enjoyed being tiny and having Becky take care of you. However, you decided to help anyway and make your decision later. When you heard her talking to Kit over that place, you realized you were probably going to have tell her a story. Samus Aran fighting pirates in the Metroid series might be something she would enjoy, and Metroid Prime might be a good place to start. You also thought that maybe something from the Sonic the Hedgehog series could make her not worry about what's going on there as much. The thought of the hyperactive hedgehog and his friends fighting Dr. Robotnik/Eggman might be enough to make her think that there is probably someone else out there making sure that any "evil plots" that the "mad doctor" might have are being foiled while you speak.

As Molly approached you, she seemed a little upset that Kit hadn't taken her seriously, complaining about how she believed it was because she's "small." You reply to her, "At least you're not me."

After thinking about it for a few seconds, she says, "I never thought about it like that."

"Well, now you realize how lucky you are. How about a story?"

"Sure, what do you have in mind?" she asked.

"Well, I know many stories, some of which I doubt you have heard. I do know one about a woman fights pirates and another a fast hedgehog who's always stopping this "mad doctor's" evil plans and saving his friends. Take your pick." you offer.

142121112112111111111121111212.content:
"Well, it's not really the start of her story, but it is probably one of the best installments. The story is called Metroid Prime," you answered. "Is that her name? What does she look like?" Molly asked.

"No, her name is Samus Aran, but her enemies call her the Hunter. She wears an orange suit of armor with a cannon for one arm. The suit can be upgraded with a variety of equipment. Metroid Prime is the first of a three part saga. Metroid Prime 2: Echoes and Metroid Prime 3: Corruption. As for the name, its the name of one the most dangerous creatures she had to fight." you answered.

"What makes it so dangerous? Also, does Samus have a plane?" Molly asked.

"Metroids are these things that resemble floating jellyfish that drain the life force of the victims they latch onto. The pirates try to use them as weapons, but they can't seem to control them. They also can't seem to figure out how they do it since their are no signs of injury. Surprisingly, metroids do have some beneficial capabilities like healing people who are hurt. As for her plane, well she does have a gunship, which is something like a plane. It was given to her by this race of people with highly advanced technology that took her in after her parents were killed by the pirates and trained her as a warrior. They also gave her the suit she has. As for the what the gunship can do, it can heal her along with traveling to other world. However, there's only room for one person inside it," you replied.

Upon hearing you bring that up, Kit seemed to have gained interest in the story and listen in. You imagined this might have been because he was an orphan who Baloo took in. In addition, he had a few dealings with pirates. Plus, he does have ambition to be a pilot. You figured that Samus actually fighting pirates was the icing on the cake.

You started the actual story with Samus boarding the pirates' over world base. You mentioned that there was an incident that left most of the surviving pirates injured before Samus arrived, which explained why they had trouble attacking her. You bring up the fight between Samus and this huge bug that was protected by a rotating shield. The base crashing and the confrontation between Samus and Riddley, who damaged most of her equipment while she was going through shafts to get back to her "plane" was the next part of the story you got to. 142121112112111111111121121.content:
Ash had hoped that there would be some deviations from the episode. That would've put his worries to rest. But that evening they were all at Higher for Hire. At the last minute Rebecca had remembered that there was some last minute inventory to be done, and it simply couldn't wait until tomorrow. Storm clouds could be scene developing all day, and as Ash sat in Rebecca's locket a flash of lightning lit up the sky. Baloo as usual had conked out an Rebecca's desk, the account book on his chest. Ash thought to himself that Baloo really needed to go to bed earlier than his usual bedtime. Which he speculated was probably around four in the morning.

"Baloo!"

"Huh Wha--?"

"We have to finish the inventory!"

"I am, I am!" Baloo insisted holding the book to his face.

"The account book is upside down!"

"Hey, creative accounting!" replied the Big Bear.
Shaking her head, Rebecca undid the locket from around her neck and opened it up so Ash could stretch his legs on her desk. There was a whirring sound as one of Kit's whined up toys flew over head. At least he found a way to spend the time. Ash felt like a fifth wheel. He looked up at the stairs where Molly was staring out the window at the storm. He suspected he wasn't the only one who was feeling too small. That's how she was going to get into trouble, Something about that window was familiar. Ash couldn't quite put a finger on it though.

There was another flash of lighting, Molly swatted annoyingly at Kit's toy.

"Hey!" said Kit "Watch it short stuff!"

'Yeah, that's really going to make her feel better.'Ash thought. Then Ash noticed the same thing that Kit was now noticing. Another Flash of lightning lite up a building just behind Higher for Hire. Dr. Diablo's Lab. That's what was so Familiar.

"Molly?"

"There's someone in that building."

"No," said Kit. "It's deserted."

'How very wrong you are Kit.' thought Ash.

"Uh, uh. I bet the Mad Doctor lives there." said Molly.

'That's not far from the truth.' Ash was really getting worried, but trying his best not to show it. Which wasn't hard considering no one was paying any attention to him at the moment.

"And I got the Sea Duck in my back pocket." said Kit, using the handle of a broom to retrieve his toy.

'What back pocket? You're not even wearing pants.' Thought Ash. Maybe it was a Figure of speech.

Molly sighed "When you're little no one ever listens."

This Ash knew a whole hell of a lot about. He felt sorry for Molly, it was no wonder the kid was restless what with the lack of attention from the adults. Then again, being a single parent couldn't be easy for Rebecca. He wondered how she'd be able to manage without Baloo or Kit.

"Mommy! The Mad Doctor's out there! We should go see what he's Doing."

"Not now, dear." said Rebecca looking through a stack of papers "I have work to do and you're too small to go alone."

"No I'm not," the cub insisted "I can--"

"Molly." Rebecca was using her Mother Voice "I said No. besides, its going to rain Pumpkin."

'That's not going to stop her' Ash knew Molly had a stubborn streak in her, a hereditary trait from her mother no doubt. Not to mention a strong imagination and a desire for adventure. Maybe, she'd grow up to be a treasure hunter or something. Well, it could happen.

"Uh, Rebecca." said Ash. "I sorta feel like I'm in the way, maybe I should hang out with Molly for a bit. Keep her occupied."

"Okay, if you don't feel it's too much trouble." said Rebecca as Ash climbed up into her hand.

"Nah, it's no trouble at all." said Ash. Then thought to himself 'That might come later."

"Molly, be careful with Ash. Don't Hurt him." Rebecca told her young daughter as she deposited the micro human into her hand.

"So, Molly, What do you want to do?" Ash Asked, then thought that was a very poor choice of words.

"Mommy said I can't go out..."
142121112112111111111121121.title: It was a Dark and Stormy Night.

If I couldn't see over it, I would end up going to the balcony. It turns out that the pillow didn't help and it still happened. What you know about that the guy I saw earlier?" Molly asked.

"What do mean?" you asked.

"You have some kind of power that lets you see what's going to happen. I've been considering going there myself, but I'd like to ask you first," Molly explained.

"What is going to happen to me?" Molly asked.

"If you go there, you'll end up knocking over a beehive, alerting the person who is there to something, get caught in the middle of his device while trying to get Lucy after you almost forget her in an escape attempt, and then end up as small as I am. It's something I'm trying to prevent from happening," you explain.

"He has a device that can shrink stuff? Maybe he can figure out how to use it to make you bigger," Molly pondered.

"I appreciate the fact that you are thinking about me, but don't. While he can help me if he rewires his machine, I'm not wanting to risk your safety for my sake. You hate being ignored by others because you're shorter than them, but if you ignore my warning, you'd be just as bad as them," you reminded her.

Molly thought about this. She did hate the fact that she was ignored because of her height, but she also felt sorry for you because you were much smaller than her. However, she also is starting wonder if she should take your warning seriously. You were right about what happened at the theater and she did see someone there, but could something like that exist? Since you were the only one to listen to her and take her seriously about what she saw, she felt like should do the same for you. With all of these thoughts swirling around in her head, she decided she would act on you advice. The question is what part of your advice does she take seriously and does shes act on it?

1421211121121111111111212.content:
Rebecca stuffed some paper in her jacket pocket to help you enjoy it with her and the rest of group, which did work just like the pillow for Molly. As you watched the movie you noticed there were a number of changes to reflect the way things were at the time. Among the changes were:

1.)The lawyer was a role model to the child and a close friend to the his mother who was a widow, but wasn't being a good role model and having some strains on their friendship lately (a write around to avoid divorce)
2.)The pen scene (no way to tell the color, so they went with the brand of the pen instead, this meant that the brand of the pen was written on his face instead of the word "blue"),
3.)The court case was about a young baseball player accused of breaking into a bank after hours to empty the vault over financial troubles which were brought on by bad choices. (This did insure the court case still had some symbolism, even when combined with other changes to the movie)

Pretty much everything that would have been unacceptable or impossible to pull off was edited so it would be the same movie, but set in 1940's. It did live up to the original and was just as funny, too. This did leave you wondering what was going on, since the movie was about 10 years old from your time. However, you just decided to write it off as a coincidence. For all you knew, the writer could have had a role model go bad and felt kind of betrayed by it. If that was the case, the script could have been a way of making fun of bad role models. However, you wondered if this might have caused the others to stop and think about things like being a role model.
