1421211121121111112.content:
After much thought Ash decided that he'd had a long and eventful day and he'd rather not be exhausted when Rebecca showed him what she wanted to show. She agreed though a bit disappointed, but she also understood his tiredness. Ash removed his shoes, socks and shirt but left his sweat pants on as he did need something to sleep in after all. He looked over his burns, the redness had gone down quite a bit since the last time he'd checked earlier that evening. Climbing into her hand, Rebecca carried Ash to her bed.

She had two pillows, Ash chose to sleep on one while Rebecca would use the other. Removing her Robe Rebecca climbed into bed Her head resting next to him.

"Good night Ash." she said with a pleasant smile.

Ash returned the smile "Good night, Rebecca"

But after the lights were turned off Ash remained wide awake and looking up at the ceiling. He had a lot on his mind. Was it possible for him to be the Reincarnated form of Rebecca's husband? Though he believed in the spirit world, was it possible for a spirit to travel multiple cross dimensions from this world to his? That would be something his teacher Raymond Stanz would know more about than himself. But it seemed to be more than coincidental that he appear just outside of Higher for Hire. Even the smell of Rebecca's hair was familiar to him now that he thought of it. If he were her husband in a past life, he had no memories of it. Suddenly something heavy fell landed on top of him. It startled him at first until he realized it was the tip of Rebecca's index finger. In the gloom of the bedroom he could see she was asleep, rapid eye movement told him she was dreaming and had reached up and touched him. Her touch was gentle, and she ran the tip of her finger over him for a moment or two and the finger moved to one side and rested next to him.
Try as he might after that Ash couldn't sleep. Maybe he should've took Rebecca's offer after all.
1421211121121111112.title: Go to sleep still wondering about her past.

14212111211211111121.content:
You heard a noise from the living room and wonder if Molly has gotten up past her bedtime. You decided you should at least check it out, so you got out of bed and left Rebecca's room. It was rather dark, but you could see someone was there. It was too tall to be Molly. The person who was there turned on the lights and you saw who it was: the bear from the picture. You wondered what was going on. "Come here, young lad. We need to talk," he said as held out his hand on the floor for you to climb onto. He then lifted you up and said, "I've been looking out for my wife and daughter since I died. I've been taking a backseat approach, though. One of the guys she dated was just using her, so I actually gave Molly a subtle hint to not trust him. I wanted them to move on and yet still protect them at the same time."

"I'm not trying to sound rude, but why are you telling me this?" you asked with curiosity.

"I've been wanting to find a worthy individual to protect them so I can finally move on. Someone who seemed enough like me that she'd believe was me. I couldn't find anyone close enough to replace me in this world, so I decided to look in other realities. That's why I brought you here. I was hoping I could show you what happened that day through a dream and give you my memories to make you and her both believe you're me. I have given you a few of my memories, but I guess I can't fool you now, though," he explained.

"I'm sure Rebecca might want to know about this," you suggested.

"Yes, she might, but I want her to be able to move on to a better future and not live in the past wishing I was still alive. That's why I didn't want anyone to know. I guess I can still give you some psychic powers that I managed to acquire as a ghost and my past memories. Right now, I only have Telekinesis, Telepathy, and Levitation, but you might be able to learn more that will allow you and them to become harder to kill over time. You'll know you've learned a new power if you feel dizzy very briefly. I might not be able to do anything about your size, but I can at least offer you something to help you out. There might be someone in this world who can help with that, but I have no clue where to look. Now let's get things started," he said. He snapped his fingers and you felt a little dizzy for bit, but feel fine a second later.

"Thanks, I guess you want me to use these powers to protect them." you say using your new telepathy ability.

"Yes, I do. While I'd rather that they don't know about what I've been doing, I won't stop you if you do decide to tell them about me, but you might want to use my memories to convince Rebecca that she should be with you. She hasn't told you everything about me, so feel free to use things that only she and I would know from my memories as my blessing. Also, if you are wondering, yes, I was at Higher for Hire earlier today. I was hoping to guide her to you. Anyway, I plan to watch what happens from here on out, but I will not hesitate to step in to help you if you need it. Just use your telepathy to contact me and I'll see what I can do," he explained.

"I'll do everything I can think of to protect them," you promised.

He then goes to Molly's room and whispers in her ear, "Sleep tight, my little angle. I'll be watching over you from a distance." He then goes to Rebecca's room and places you on the pillow and kisses her on the cheek. He turns to you and says, "I'm counting on you," as he fades away. After a few minutes, you fell asleep debating on whether you should tell Rebecca about her guardian angel or just pretend to be him.

The next day, you make your decision as soon as you wake up.
14212111211211111121.title: Power, a promise, and a goodbye.

142121112112111111212.content:
When Ash awoke the next morning he found Rebecca had already gotten up. He was alone in the room. How could she have snuck out of here without wakeing him? Maybe something had kept him asleep. He heard humming and the sounds of heavy but quite foot falls. He smiled as Rebecca entered the room wearing a robe and those slippers he had admired.

"Morning Ash, did you sleep well?"

"Yes," said Ash "I was dreaming."

"Oh?" Rebecca sat down on the side of the bed "About what?"

'Okay, here it goes.' thought Ash. "I was at a fair, only a local one. It was small, and you were sitting behind a booth. You know, the ones that you give a girl a couple of Dollars for a kiss?"

Rebecca nodded.

"You looked younger. Not saying you're old but you looked much younger, maybe in your teens. The price was five cents. I gave you a quarter, the only bit of money I had in my pocket. I remember your kiss to be absolutely amazeing."

Rebecca looked like she was about to get emotional.

"Are you okay? I didn't offend you, did I?"

"No, no. It's okay. It's just that...That's how I met my husband. We were highschool sweet hearts." she explained "How could you have known that?"

"I don't know." Ash lied. "I honestly don't know. Maybe I might be who you believe me to be after all."

"I hope so." said Rebecca smileing "I-I'll go make us some breakfast. I'll come get you when it's done. In the meantime feel free to look around a bit. Maybe there's something here that will jog your memory."

A few moments after Rebecca had left the room Ash sensed someone was there, turning he saw the spirit of her late Husband once again.

"Nice Job. I knew I could count on you."

"I don't like lying to her," said Ash "But I saw how happy that made her, I can't take that away from her."

"So, you'll be me then?"

"Yes. But I do feel uncomfortable about one thing though."

The spirit raised an eyebrow "What is it?"

"Well, I have a feeling there's going to be a point where we might become...intimate. And I don't feel comfortable messing with somone elses girl--"

The Spirit waved Ash off "Ash, The vow was 'Till Death Do You Part.' I'm dead so tecnically I'm not her husband anymore.You have my blessings. Besides that I can't give here what she needs."The Spirit tilted his head "Someone is coming. I'll be dropping in from time to time. So until then see you out there."

The Spirit vanished just as
142121112112111111212.title: Grant his request.

1421211121121111112121.content:
"Who were you talking to? I have seen him before, even though no one else could," a voice said from behind you. It was Molly. You have heard that very young children can see things other people can't, probably because of the innocence of youth.

After thinking about it for a few seconds, you decide to answer her question, "I'm only telling you this because I trust you to keep this a secret. He doesn't want your mom to know, but he has been watching out for you and her."

"I won't tell," she promised.

A few minutes later, Rebecca returns with some toast and bacon. "I made your favorite," she says.

"How did you know?" you asked. You knew she couldn't have known about your past life, however it suddenly hits you when she started to smile. She didn't know about YOUR past, but she did remember her husband's favorite breakfast after three years. She didn't fix a plate for you, but both she and Molly offered to share. You had a feeling both of them wanted to know more about you. Molly seems like she's might want you to tell her a story, while you get the feeling Rebecca would like to know more about what you have been up to and where you have you been since you "split ways" that day.

Before you made your choice, however, you remembered something and decided to ask about it, "Rebecca, last night called Molly 'Angel,' but don't you normally call her 'Pumpkin?' I remember someone else used to call her that."

"You're right, it was a test to see if you were who I thought you were. You passed," she answers.

"Since this is a second chance for all of us, I am considering the idea of thinking up something new to call her," you reply. "Well, go ahead, feel free to take some time to think over," she said. "By the way, which one of us would you like to share with?" she asked.
1421211121121111112121.title: A couple of tests and a child's gift.

choices: "Well, we could pay a visit to Kahn Industries."
"I wouldn't worry about it. I'm sure they know what they are doing."
14212111211211111121211.content:
"Well, If you don't mind..." Ash walked over to Rebecca's plate. It was a lower and flatter than most plates and though the lip of it was still higher than him he was able to jump up, grab a hold of it and pull himself up. Rebecca watched him amused. When she invited him to share her breakfast she didn't exactly mean it this way.

"I could've just cut a small piece off for you."

"Where's the fun in that?" said Ash with a wink. "I'll be okay, just keep an eye out for me."

"Oh, I don't know, you look kinda tasty next to the Bacon." Rebecca said with a wink.

This exchange did not go unnoticed by Molly, who was becoming very curious. This of course was typical of a child of her age. "Mommy, why is Ash in your plate?" she asked. Rebecca was suddenly at lost as to how to explain this to her daughter, fortunately Ash had come up with an interesting answer.

"We're.... just being silly." Ash explained quickly.

"Uh, yeah." said Rebecca "It's a grown up thing."

Molly's brow furrowed but accept the explanation for now and started eating her breakfast.

Ash looked up and shrugged "I'll just stay in this corner. You just have to watch where you stick that fork."

Eating Bacon a Hundred times the size of the bacon he was used to was a novice sensation for Ash, It tasted like bacon but the texture was different.

"Something the matter Ash?"

"No, just thinking. Rebecca, you said before that this Kahn guy is working with human scientist?"

"That's right. Why do ask?"

"I'm a little concerned." Ash explained. "to open a doorway to another dimension would probably require a tremendous amount of energy. And it's clear that they don't have any real control over where these doorways open. I wonder who else could've been pulled into this world against their will." he looked up at his giant hostess, "I wonder how many have been as fortunate as I."
14212111211211111121211.title: Rebecca

142121112112111111212111.content:
"Maybe it would be worth checking out. Even if there's not many humans, we could still see what's in store in terms of technology. I wonder if they are as small as you or are full size," Rebecca said.

"Well, it would be nice to see if they can get me back to normal size. Even if they can't, maybe we could see what kind of stuff they have. If they let you beta test something from my world, I'll help you with it," you reply.

"Okay, we'll stop there first. Molly's birthday is next week, which is part of the reason why I was going to take her to the toy store today. Kit also needs an idea for a science project, maybe we could pay him a visit so you may you may help him with that, too," Rebecca suggested.

"Okay, let's get going," you say.
142121112112111111212111.title: Worth investigating

choices: She offers to make a deal with him.
She asks him if he could help with your problem.
1421211121121111112121111.content:
As the three of you enter the lobby, you notice Shere Khan talking with someone. You managed to hear some of the conversation, but you were sure you missed the first part of it. "In exchange for our help in handling the reptile that you can't seem dispose of, you're offering your world's technology to us?" Khan asked as if he was making sure he fully understood the agreement he was getting into.

"Yes, that's right. All the information is available is on this device in the case, along with a little manual on how to use it. The information regarding our organization is classified, so it is password protected. The password is the name of the researcher I told you that thing killed. You're the only one who knows the password to access those files," the man says to him as he hands him a briefcase.

"Thanks, I'll be sure to remember that and take a look at it. Pleasure doing business with you and your organization, Dr. Gears," Khan said as shook the man's hand. You noticed neither of Khan nor the man called "Dr. Gears" showed any emotion during their conversation.

"Any idea what that was about?" Rebecca asked you as Dr. Gears walked past her.

"I am guessing that man was Dr. Gears from the SCP Foundation, and he's trying to get Khan to help destroy SCP-682. They're offering him advance technology in exchange for his help," you answer.

Molly asks, "What's the SCP Foundasion and why do they want to destroy 682?"

"The SCP Foundation is a secret organization who's sole purpose is to 'Secure, Contain, and Protect'. They collect strange things from their world and run test on them to understand how they work, while keeping it away from the public. SCP-682 is really dangerous, which is why they want to get rid of it. Thing is, they don't know how. They've tried all kinds of things and it always survives and has even used some of their stuff against them," you answer calmly. With your answer Molly begins to think of how her favorite radio show heroine "Danger Woman" would fight something like that.

"What do you know about that thing they are trying to destroy? It might be useful as a bargaining chip with Mr. Khan," Rebecca asked.

You tell her about it: http://www.scp-wiki.net/scp-682 and also mention that they never tried a multi-step approach to taking it down.

"Well, that explains why they want to get rid of it. Something that attacks anything it sees is really something to get rid of as fast as possible," Molly replies.

"Well, that still leaves three questions. How did they get here from your world? Why Khan Industries? And what did they give him?" Rebecca responds.

"Well, it's not how I got here, but I know they have something that acts as a gateway between worlds. It's known as SCP-826. I'm guessing the reason why they made a deal with Khan is because he can finance such a effort. As for what they gave him, I'm pretty confident it's a computer. I don't know how to describe the device to you, but I do know how to use it. I could help you use it if you think it will help you make a deal with him," you reply.

"Well, it's worth a shot," she says as she places you on her ear. as she and Molly approach the tiger.
1421211121121111112121111.title: SCP Foundation and Khan Industries

choices: But I still need to help them in order to get more." (Not done yet.)
I'll look into helping you and call you if I find anything out.."
14212111211211111121211111.content:
"Need any help?" Rebecca asked him. "Sorry, but I can't divulge the trade secrets of potential business partners," he replies. "Does 'Secure, Contain, Protect' mean anything to you?" Rebecca asks. "Like I said, 'I'm not going to divulge trade secrets of potential business partners,'" he reassured her. "No need. I have a pretty good idea what's going on, they're wanting you to have your scientists help to destroy this reptile thing they can't.In exchange, you're getting access to things that you can have reverse engineered so you can try to manufacture similar products and sell them yourself, am I right?" replied Rebecca. "What if that is the case? What would you do?" he asks. "Offer to help you out if you can help me with my problem," Rebecca offers. "Let's go to my office," he says.

The four of you go down the hall and proceed to an elevator. Mr. Khan presses the button. While waiting for it, he decides to ask Rebecca for more information,"What kind of problem do you have? Your business isn't in financial trouble, is it?" he asks. "No, my business is fine. It's something else. I'm wondering if you have access to something that make something larger. Something living, to be more exact," Rebecca answers. "I'll have to check what my researchers are working on, but I can look into what my 'business partners' have to offer if I don't have anything," he answers. Molly asks, "Mr. Khan, do you really believe what they told you about that thing?" "No, I don't believe anything they told me about that thing and what they used to try to destroy it. However, since I have seen some of the technology they have, I do know that there are potential benefits if I play along with them and offer to help them. It's why I'm going to review their files and see if I can come up with a better way to destroy it," he answers as the elevator doors open.

A few minutes later, you're in his office. You're a little nervous about the wild plants, which look like they could attack you at any minute, but you know Rebecca is looking out for you, which helps put your mind at easy. As Shere Khan got to his desk, he opened the briefcase and pulled out a very thin device, a power cord, and a manual. While Mr. Khan was reading the instruction manual on how us it, Rebecca sets it up and turns it on. Mr. Khan notices this and ask, "How did you know how to get this thing working?" Her reply is,"I just know someone who has used this kind of thing before, but he needs help, which is why I came to you." You decide to use her to teach Mr. Khan how to use the device. While doing this, you realize that you might have some limited control over things this way, but you wish could interact with things more directly. Based on what you could here, Rebecca and Molly seemed like they were impressed with the device. Mr Khan doesn't show any emotion in his voice, but does say, "It seems like this has potential.
14212111211211111121211111.title: She offers to make a deal with him.

choices: Wait and come up with a plan
142121112112111111212111112.content:
Something was wrong with Ash, Rebecca could tell. Ever since they had left Kahn Industries he'd been quite, and it was starting to other her. Much so that when they returned to Higher for Hire she had to say something.

"What's wrong Ash?"

"What makes you think something is wrong?"

"I'm a mother, I know these things. Come on, come clean with me."

Ash was quiet for a moment or two. "That device Kahn showed us, where did he get that Technology from? There's no way his company could've developed it. Not to sound egomaniac but your people are still using Vacuum tubes, you've only recently developed Radio."

"I don't know," Rebecca stood and took a folder from her business Cabinet "That company's been developing a lot of impressive devices over the years. Just a few Months ago they created a jem stone that could generate enough power is entire corporation, too bad it was stolen by pirates and lost." She opened up the folder showing Ash a news clipping she'd saved " Even if his company didn't develop that device, Kahn has been working with human scientist, so maybe they made it."

"That's just it, we don't have the technology either."

So that's what was Bothering her little friend. "Are you sure?"

"Well, it's possible they could've gotten the Technology from recovered Alien Space Ships" said Ash scratching his head "but I find that very unlikely"

"If Kahn nor you're people made that thing, who did?"

"That's the thousand dollar question. Maybe we should--"
142121112112111111212111112.title: Something's not Right.

1421211121121111112121111122.content:
"What makes you say that?" Rebecca asked.

"The SCP Foundation collects items that are anomalous in nature that they refer to as SCPs. They normally just contain and study them. It might be possible they could have found the gem and contained it. It could also be possible be possible they used some of their own contain SCPs to create it. Overall, I think the best bet would be to wait and see if anything else strange shows up before taking any action," you explained.

"You said your people couldn't create it, so how could they have done so?" Rebecca asked.

"Well, as I said, 'The SCP foundation has strange things.' They have access to a very complex clockwork machine capable of changing anything put into it in various ways. On three of the settings, it takes into account the object's purpose, the other two just disassembles or destroys it. There's also a tree that can replicate almost anything that touches it," you answer.

"Well, it seems like they could create it," she replies.

"Except the machine is a bit unpredictable, you could put something in on one setting, and get one thing, then put an identical item in on the same setting and get something else. Also, before you ask about what it does to living things, they have prohibited that kind of testing on it after some unpleasant results from a few tests," you explain.

"Okay, just curious, what else are they trying to keep contained?" Rebecca asked.

"Lots of stuff. An endless stairwell with a monster and a child pleading for help, a giant that attacks people who sees it's face, a ghost town where all living things begin fading away within a week and vanish after two weeks, rain clouds that summon ghosts, an entity that does whatever is wrote about it, and a lot of other things. Not all of them are dangerous, but too strange for the public to know about," you mentioned.

"Okay, so do what makes you think they'd trust Mr. Khan?" Rebecca asked.

"Wish I knew. Hopefully, someone's seen the error of what happened and is trying to avoid this. Anyway, it might be smarter to have someone with an inside connection to get the info on what Khan is doing. I think Baloo might know someone who would know about what's going on there," you explained.

"I'll have to ask him about it, I think he was taking Kit to the toy store, we could ask him about it there while we are getting Molly a new toy and searching for clothes for you. If not, I'll talk to him when I see him," Rebecca suggested.
1421211121121111112121111122.title: Wait and come up with a plan." you answered.

14212111211211111121211111221.content:
Rebecca made sure to ask Wildcat about fixing the washing machine at the apartment complex. He accepted since he had nothing better to do. Rebecca made sure it was okay for Wildcat to fix the machine before she dropped him off there. Wildcat gave her an estimated it would take about an hour to fix it and test it to make sure it worked.

About ten minutes later, you arrived at the toy store. Most of the toys were a lot simpler than what you're used to seeing at a toy store. Marbles, dominoes, board games, wooden and stuffed dolls, card games, coloring books, crayons, and jigsaw puzzles were among the things you saw there. Molly picked out a new doll, but was unsure what she was going to name it. You had suggested the name Jade, which she did enjoy even though it did seem a little strange to her. Rebecca also managed to find some new clothes. After paying for everything, Rebecca heads home
14212111211211111121211111221.title: Getting things done.

choices: Rebecca ask Baloo to get Kit so you can have a proper introduction.
You, Rebecca, and Molly go out to eat as a family.
142121112112111111212111112211.content: You were lucky enough to encounter Baloo on your way back home. You explained the nature of the SCP Foundation   and some of the things they are keeping contained. These included SCP-049: the Plague Doctor  , SCP-087: the Stairwell  , SCP-682: the Hard to Destroy Reptile  , and SCP-914: the Clockworks  . He had a hard time believing it at first, but you brought up Shere Kahn's power source. You explained that you believed they put a battery in SCP-914 on very fine, which resulted in the crystal being created. The origin of the crystal was a mystery to him, but he decided to consider the theory and decide if he should have Buzz keep an eye on who his getting involved with.
142121112112111111212111112211.title: but she encounters Baloo.

14212111211211111121211112.content:
"Can I ask for your help?" Rebecca asked Shere Khan.

"No," he replied with a frown on his face, "I can't discuss trade secrets that I may have received from any potential business partners."

"I wasn't talking about that!" Rebecca said sternly, "I wanted to see if you can fix a certain problem I was having."

Rebecca grabbed you from her ear and showed you to Shere Khan.

Shere Khan looked at you in interest, examining your body before looking at Rebecca "That's strange, but I may be able to help."

Shere Khan thought for a while until a certain SCP came crashing into the room. Who was that SCP?
14212111211211111121211112.title: She asks him if he could help with your problem.

choices: Molly decides to play another Game.
Molly Asks Ash to tell her a Story
142121112112111112.content:
"If you don't mind Rebecca, I'd like to spend the night with your Daughter" said Ash much to Molly's delight.

"Sure, it'll be a few hours before bed time, so why don't you two hang out for a bit." said Rebecca "I'll call you out when
Supper is ready. Oh, speaking of which, do you like Italian Ash?"

"Love it."

"Great!"

Molly reached up and picked Ash off her shoulder as her mother left the room. Holding him in the palm of her Paw/hand She looked down at the little human with a mixture of childlike awe and amazement. Holding the very tiny human was a new experience for her, it was almost like the time Kit had given her a fuzzy caterpillar to hold. Of course all the silly caterpillar wanted to do was crawl away while Ash just stood there wondering what she'd do next. Molly wondered that herself. Her four year old mind began to come up with things her and Ash could do.

Ash was of feeling a little nervous. He of course remembered the cartoon version of the Giant child holding him could be a rather handful at times, this he thought was ironic considering at his current size he was far less than a handful even for Molly.Ash thought she could almost hear the gears in the four year olds head turning as she thought of what they could do together. After a moment she smiled innocently.

"Would you like to play a game with me, Ash?" Molly asked sweetly.

"Sure," said Ash "Sounds like fun, what kind of game?"

"Catch."

Ash frowned "How are we going to do that? Do you have anything small enough to throw at you?"

"Silly, that's not the kind of catch we're going to play."

"then--Whoa!"

Ash found himself suddenly taused up into the air. He hung for a second before falling towards the hard floor only to have his fall broken by Molly's hand/Paw. He was taused up again and again being caught each time by Molly who giggled playfully. Surprisingly Ash was soon enjoying himself despite the fact that his life was literally in the hands of a child.
Even though he was landing on his back, his shoulder his stomach and his face each time he was caught he wasn't hurt because the flesh of Molly's hand/paw was really soft, like landing in a really big leathery pillow. After a few moments of this Molly caught him for the last time and decided not to throw him up into the air anymore thus ending the game. Opening her hand she looked down at Ash with a big playful grin. Ash couldn't help but take note that she had her mother's smile.

"That was fun, what should we do next?"
142121112112111112.title: Playing Catch with Molly

choices: flips the paper over and says, "Let's draw and color."
asks, "How do you play that game and how can you make a boat by folding paper?"
1421211121121111121.content:
"Do you know of anything else we can do?" Molly asked. You noticed she has a few board games. You realized you might not be able to roll dice like you normally would, but then you noticed the table in the middle of the room and an idea hit you: you might be able to roll by throwing the blocks of the table if she ever wanted to play a board game. Also on the table was some paper and crayons. You thought about trying to teach her to play Tic-Tac-Toe and how to fold paper to make different things.

"Would you please put me down on the table?" you asked Molly. She does as you requested. You open the box of crayons and pull out black, pink, and green crayons. You then grab a blank sheet of paper.

Molly noticed this and asked, "Are you wanting to draw and color something?"

"No, I was thinking we could play Tic-Tac-Toe, but if you want to draw and color something, we could do that. I could also teach you how to make things by folding paper. I remember making a boat," you reply as you draw a 3x3 grid on the paper.

After taking a few seconds to think, Molly
1421211121121111121.title: Other ideas.

14212111211211111212.content:
"Well, let's start with Tic-Tac-Toe. Players take turns drawing X's and O's in the blank squares of a 3x3. Three of the same letter in a row wins. They can be up and down, side to side, or at an angle as long as there are three in a line. However, for this one, let's just color in the squares green and pink. I'll let you go first," you explained as you drew large (to you) versions of the letters. She picks up the pink crayon and you're left with green. You let her win the first two games, but you decided to not hold back during the third one. In between rounds, she drew the grid. Overall, both of you had some fun playing a simple game.

You were about to move on to teaching her how to make stuff by folding paper when...
14212111211211111212.title: Teaching Molly a new game

14212111211211112.content: You opened the door and walked inside the dollhouse. As you took a look around, you noticed that it resembled what was the norm for a real house of the time period. During your self guided tour, you saw a kitchen, a living room, a bedroom, and a bathroom. Furniture in the house included a stove, icebox, a radio, a shower, a couch, a bed, tables, and chairs. While most of it was for decoration, they weren't a bad touch. The couch, chairs, and bed did look comfortable. Plus the dollhouse seemed like a normal sized house to you. You probably could get a good night's sleep from the dollhouse, but you thought the same might be true about the slipper from earlier. As you walked back outside, you made your choice. You tell Rebecca you want to sleep in the
14212111211211112.title: Tour of the doll house

choices: Rebecca, who is planning to take Molly to the park.
142121112112111121.content:
"It's probably best if I stay in the doll house for tonight. After all, we just met earlier today and hardly know each other," you explained. "You have a point, maybe it is too early for the two of us to be sharing the same bed," Rebecca answers. "Good nigh, Rebecca," you tell her right before you head inside and get into the bed of the doll house. "Goodnight, Ash," Rebecca tells you right before yawning, then turning off the light.

During the night, you had a dream where Rebecca and Molly some how arrived in your world. They seemed a bit lost and confused, but they were about the same size as humans. You had to show them around your house and a number of devices they hadn't seen before. Molly even wondered if there was anything like Danger Woman in your world. You did your best to help them out. Even let them stay in the guest room.

As you woke up, you had a feeling you might have to explain some things about the world you are from to them. You had to wonder if it would be easy to tell about your world. Of course, you wondered what had woken you up.
142121112112111121.title: Molly's Dollhouse and your dream.

1421211121121112.content:
"Kit Cloudkicker. Holy shit it's Kit Cloudkicker."

Indeed it was. Dressed in his Ball cap turned backwards and his shirt and sweater the young but enormous cub walked into the bedroom. What was he doing in there?

"Miz Cunningham, where did you say your purse was?"

Purse? Ash turned around. He had been standing right behind it the whole time. He turned back in time to see Kit's towering form above him, one huge hand reaching down toward him. Instinctively Ash huddled in a ball. He felt wind behind him as the purse was lifted off the dresser. He looked up again. To his amazement he'd discovered that he'd been completely unnoticed. Or so it would seem.

Kit was about to leave when something caught his eye. Something small on the dresser. He squinted, then lowered his head closer. His eyes went wide with amazement

"Wow." whispered Kit.

Ash's heart raced, he wanted to run. But if he ran it could mean his doom. But if he stayed it could also spell trouble.
1421211121121112.title: Kit

142121112112112.content:
"Mommy!"

Five year old Molly Cunningham ran up to her mother as she walked into the apartment. Rebecca knelt down as her daughter threw her arms around her. She had to keep her right hand steady as not to drop Ash. This of course did not go unnoticed by her daughter. Molly stared into her mothers palm with a child's curiosity at Ash who gave her a somewhat uneasy look.

"Mommy, what's this? Is that a doll?"

"This is Ash." Rebecca explained to her daughter, "He's going to be staying with us for a while."

Molly frowned "Mommy, I thought you were scared of bugs."

'Bugs?' Thought Ash 'She thinks I'm a Bug?!'

"Sweety, Ash isn't a bug." Rebecca explained "He's a person just like we are, just a little smaller."

Molly studied The human closely, 'Maybe not like us.' she thought 'But if Mommy says he's okay....'

Ash looked up at the Child, She was exactly as he recalled from the show, right down to the bows in her hair and the sound of her voice. He recalled how active she was in the series, and so far there was every indication that this Molly was equally active. She wanted to hold him, to play with him. He could tell. He just hoped he'd live through it.

"Can I hold him?"

Rebecca thought for a moment, then looked down at her tiny guest"Is that okay with you, Ash?"
142121112112112.title: Meeting Molly

choices: She's still asleep. Better get her to a hospital.
14212111211212.content:
Rebecca passed out. You felt like you were going to pass out too, but you weren't sure if you were both fainting for similar reasons. You fight it in hopes of finding help.

Fate was on your side. As the front door opened, you saw a young, golden bear wearing a pink dress enter. You recognized her as Rebecca's daughter, Molly. "Mommy wake up, we're still going to the pet store today, right?" she asked while trying to wake her mother up. As she did that, you leaped onto her head in hopes of helping them both. After landing, you inform Molly, "I'm glad your here. I can't wake her by myself, but I think I know why she's sleeping. With your help, we might be able to do that." "Who are you? Where are you?" she started asking questions. "My name is Ash. I'll show myself to you," you replied. You walk onto her nose, and she focuses her eyes on you. "You're kind of cute. I might ask mommy if I can keep you as a pet instead of buying one once we wake her up,"

"Okay, but how do you plan to wake her up?" you asked. Molly answered, "She told me a fairytale about a princess who fell asleep and was awaken by the kiss of a prince. Maybe you could be mommy's prince." "Okay, but if it doesn't work, I think we should use the phone to call for medical assistance," you responded. "I've never used the phone before, I wouldn't know what I'm doing. Could you help me?"

You take a look at the phone and notice it's a rotary model. "I think I know how to use this one," you reply. "So you will help me use it?" Molly asked. "Yes. You will need to know a few things: What's happened to your mother, where we are at, and what might have caused it. The answers are she fell asleep suddenly and you can't wake her up, we're at the Higher For Hire office, and there might have been something in her sandwich and coffee." you inform her. "Okay, I got it. Let's give this a try first," she said as she raised you to her mother's face. You puckered up for the kiss. As your lips meet Rebecca's...
14212111211212.title: Waking up a sleeping bear

142121112112122.content:
The kiss was actually memorable for you, but it didn't help Rebecca. She continued to sleep from the the chemicals she unknowingly consumed. Molly did as you told her and called for medical assistance. The ambulance got there in about five minutes. The paramedics took a sample of the coffee and bagged the sandwich so they can figure out what caused her to suddenly fall asleep. "Even if the coffee was decaf, it wouldn't make sense for her to fall asleep like that," you informed Molly while they were doing that. One of the paramedics came up to Molly and offered to take her to the hospital with her mother. Molly accepted the ride and all of you were in the ambulance.

Sirens gave you a headache before, but they were torture to you this time. The reason was because you were in the vehicle making all the noise. While it only took five minutes to arrive at the hospital, those five minutes of thunderous ambulance sirens really did a number on your head. As all of you entered the hospital, you had a feeling your head was about to explode if you had to endure any more loud noises.

The waiting room was empty when you arrived, which meant that Rebecca would be getting treatment faster. It also gave you time to recover from your headache. After about 15 minutes, Molly starts to get curious about you. "I've never seen anything like you before. What are you?" she asked curiously. "I'm called a 'human'," you answered. "Are there more humans around Higher for Hire?" she asked. "There might be others, but I haven't found any yet," you replied. "How about we try looking for some more later?" she suggested. "If you want to, I'll help you find them," you offered. "Great, I'll ask Kit if he wants to join us!" Molly said with excitement. A second after she said that, Kit came in. "I came from Higher for Hire. Wild Kat told me about what happened. He heard it from one of the paramedics. I suggested we set a trap for Don Karnage and his goons. It took a while, but we got it done. He stayed behind to watch over the place. We've also told Baloo what happened. I expect he'll be here soon," Kit explained. "Baloo's coming back soon!?" Molly repeated with excitement. "Yes, he's returning. He's stopping by Louie's to bring you back a banana split as a reward for knowing when something didn't seem quite right and taking action to fix it. He's getting something for your mom, too. He also offered to take you to the pet shop since you wouldn't get to go today if he didn't," Kit told her. "I'm not worried about that, I already found a pet at Higher for Hire," Molly responded. "Really? What is it?" Kit asked. Molly shows you to Kit. "WOW! I've never seen a pet like that before," exclaimed Kit. "His name is Ash. He's a human. Ash, this is my friend Kit," said Molly. You shake Kit's right index finger. "When I came in, you mentioned you wanted to ask me to join you in something. What was it?" Kit asked before forgot. "I was wondering if you might want to help me find more humans around Higher for Hire sometime," Molly suggested. "Sounds like it could be fun," he replied.

About a minute later, a nurse came out from the hallway. Since things were still rather quiet, she just spoke in a soft voice, "Molly, your mom is going to be just fine. She's awake and wants to see you." Molly and Kit follow the nurse through the hallways. She explained things to all of you, "There were two chemicals that interacted with each other in her stomach. One in her coffee, while the other was in her sandwich. They created a rather powerful fume that put her to sleep and enough of it to keep her asleep for five hours if you hadn't called us. We gave a special anti-acid to counter it and help her belch the chemicals out. They are all out now, but the anti-acid still has her belching," she explained as she escorted you to room 117, where the three of you saw Rebecca.

"Molly, I'm sorry..." Rebecca began, but was interrupted by the anti-acid and belched, "excuse me. It seems we won't be going to the pet store today." "That's okay, I found one at Higher for Hire when I was trying to ask you about taking me there later. I originally thought to wake you up with kiss from him similar to that fairytale, but after it didn't work, he suggested I call the hospital and helped me to do that," Molly explained. "Your pet helped you do that?!" Rebecca asked with a hint of surprise. Molly hands you to her mom and says, "Yes, he did. His name's Ash. Mommy, can I keep him, please?" Molly asked politely. "Yes, you can," she answers.

Just then, Baloo enters. You wonder if Rebecca would like a chance to talk to you in private without the others and ask Baloo to watch over them for a few minutes or if she'll allow them all to stay.
142121112112122.title: Going to the hospital

1421211121121221.content:
"I came as soon as I heard you were on your way here. I'm glad you're doing better, Is there anything I can do for you?" Baloo said with concern. "I want to get to know my new friend and hero a little better. May I have some time alone with him?" Rebecca requested. "Of course, but before I forget," Baloo began. He place a thermos, a bowl, and a spoon in front of her, then continued, "I got this from Louie's. After I heard you were sick, I thought I'd ask Louie for something for you. It's his twist on chicken noodle soup." "Thanks Baloo, I could really use something to eat after the sandwich and coffee put me to sleep," she said politely. "Alright, let's go to the cafeteria and get something to eat and give Beckers some time alone with her new friend," Baloo suggested as they left.

Rebecca lifts you up to get a better look at you. "I don't want to sound ungrateful," she began before being interrupted by another belch that was from the anti-acid. She then tried to sound feminine as she said "Excuse me" again. "No need to ask, I would have excused you just because I think you're beautiful," you reply. She starts to blush as she asks, "Do you really think I'm beautiful?" You nod your head. "I was just about to ask why you helped me. Was that why?" she asked. "Part of the reason. I couldn't let Molly see you like that and worry about you," you answer. "How about a date with me? I know it might not a typical date, but would you like to eat this soup with me?" she asked. You nodded again. She opens the thermos and pours the soup into the bowl.

choices: Ash is doomed to be Bear Food
14212111212.content:
I hit the slice of bread with a splatter. I ended up pretty much covered in the stuff that was spread over the bread, it didn’t resemble anything I was familiar with but it had a sweet and sour taste to it. And it was quite effective in holding me in place. Lifting myself up as much as I could, I looked about and saw that I wasn’t that far from the edge. It would be slow going but I was pretty sure I could make it to edge and get off before---

I didn’t even get the chance to finish that thought. I caught movement out of the corner of my eye. Looking up I saw Rebecca’s huge hand descending on the bread slice. Before I could even attempt to move she had flipped the slice over on top of the other slice trapping me between them. I felt the sandwich I was now a part of lift upward.

Rebecca picked up her sandwich and coffee and sat back down at her desk. As she took a big bite out of her sandwich, she looked around for what ever she had seen. It had been very small but she was sure it wasn’t a bug or any flying insect she had ever seen before. She chewed slowly, thoughtfully. Then swallowing she took a sip from her coffee cup and prepared to take another bite.

“No. No, I don’t want to die like this!”

I knew the odds weren’t in my favour, but that wasn’t going to stop me from trying. Digging my feet into the unrecognizable sandwich fill under me I pushed forward with my legs. Rebecca’s first bite missed me but I figured I wouldn’t be luck the second time.
I could hear her chewing; when her chewing stopped I knew it was time to play Russian roulette again. The muscles in my legs screamed in protest as I slowly dug my way through.

‘I’m gonna make it!’ I kept thinking to myself ‘I’m gonna make it! I’m gonna—‘

I heard Rebecca swallow.

“I’m gonna Die!” I cried out still determined to get out of the sandwich before I became a part of Rebecca forever.
14212111212.title: An Extra Ingredient

1421211122.content:
*Originaly writen by Sage. Used with permission.*

Ash intended to climb the desk she was sitting at, to get her attention by getting closer to her face, but walking around it, there was no way to do so. The fine wood grain of the desk seeming was nearly flat, even at his miniscule perspective, showing its craftsmanship. Worse, she had no phone or lamp on it, to have a cord for power that he might climb, the desk being right against a window that provided plenty of light.

Faced with these obstacles, the human resorted to crying out to her, knowing her name because, despite her size, he recognized that face, one Rebecca Cunningham. Try though he might, however, waving his arms, screaming at the top of his lungs, his voice just didn’t have the punch to reach her ears far above him, and defeated, Ash started to look around for something to help his cause of getting noticed by the giant bear woman.

Unfortunately, his only ideas were to start a fire, dangerous at his size, because if it got noticed, the first thing anyone would do was to stomp it out, and because if it didn’t get noticed, no one was likely going to come back to rescue him from the inferno of his own making. That and he had nothing on him to make such a blaze with anyway. The other plan, of just shining a light, was similarly flawed, having no flashlight or the like on him at the time. All he had was a t-shirt, and some blue jeans.

Dejectedly, Ash decided to just explore for now. Getting noticed would have to wait till he had more information, and so he set out across the floor of the room he was in. It was, despite seeming large to him at his size, actually just a closeted away space, large enough for the desk below the window, and a small filing cabinet, but little else. Worse, the door was closed, and his stature was not quite small enough to fit beneath it, meaning that until Rebecca left the room, he was trapped her with her.

It was, as he turned back towards the desk, that he noticed a pair of sandals sitting beside it. They were a shade of pink that, rather than being exactly like the suit’s jacket she wore, were instead a shade or two lighter, complimenting rather than simply being the same as her clothing. The human knew little of fashion, but it seemed to be an interesting choice,
1421211122.title: Look around some more

choices: Rebecca Feels something in her sandal
14212111222.content:
*Originaly writen by Sage. Used with permission.*

Having little else he could explore, Ash approached the sandals, and with a grunt he pulled himself atop them, standing soon on the plastic soft sole.

He didn’t know what he’d expected to see, it was just a sandal after all, but it was nice to be up off the floor for the moment, and the sole beneath him felt warm, telling him they’d only been laying there for a few minutes, as Rebecca did some paperwork probably. Of course, those few minutes, as Ash soon found out, were up. His first hint of that was a loud squeak sound, and he turned his head to find the ursine woman stretching as she pushed her chair away from the desk. His second was that her foot soon filled his sky, her pad coming directly towards him.

One might call him silly for not leaping off the sandal, or otherwise trying to escape, but really, it was more, he was a deer caught in the headlights. His brain found it impossible to process that image, of a giant paw falling towards him at speeds that made sound look slow. So he was just standing there when it slammed heavily into him, his body forced down into the plastic, roughly, but not so rough that he was broken was one might expect of such an impact.

Ash found himself trapped, as Rebecca shifted her foot forward, his body sliding along the smooth plastic of her sole, and ending up almost dead centre of her front footpad. This meant that, as she walked, the sandal didn’t let him go, and instead, he felt a sickening rising, and stomach-dropping fall, followed by massive pressure, with every step the businesswoman took. Trapped as he was, unable to even move, and barely able to breath, he had to look forward to hours pinned beneath her foot. Not that it was entirely unpleasant though, and he figured you really could get used to anything. Heck, at the end, she might even notice him.
14212111222.title: Explore the Sandal.

choices: Rebecca begins to play with something in her sandal
142121112221.content:
*Originaly writen by Sage. Used with permission.*

The steps that Rebecca took down were far enough apart that she had to lean forward every time she took one. That was no problem for her of course, as she’d been working in this office for years, and was used to it. The human trapped beneath her padded sole found the ride a bit less pleasant. Not entirely unpleasant though, considering he was having his stomach go up and down with each rise and fall of her foot, but then found himself surrounded by softness, her pad conforming around him, almost like a hug that was covering his whole body, as she walked downstairs.

The sharp rises and falls soon ended, and Ash found the ride to be less bumpy as Rebecca made it to the ground floor, and began to walk towards the big double doors. Stuck between her pad and sandal, Ash only got brief glimpses of the world outside, little flashes of light, that then vanished as he was pressed against the pad, and then smushed between it and the sandal, the two soft surfaces sandwiching him between them, making him feel like he was safe, for some reason, before he was rising again, and got another flash.

He saw only a few snap shots of the world, a business center, it had to be, one of those places where small business owners rented tiny offices to help with their start-ups.

The ride stopped for a moment, and Ash was allowed to breath, his lungs, though squashed between a giant bear lady and her footwear, were able to catch a breathe now, as he heard her melodious voice from above, trading pleasantries with some gruff voiced male that he couldn’t see. Neither was intelligible through Rebecca’s foot, though he heard her laugh, a rather calming sound, just before the ride started up again, and he found himself flattened against her sandal, before slamming into her pad, and then pressed down again.

This repeated until he was outside, the cool air that came between her paw and sandal making him feel cold as it blew against him, and made him all the more grateful that he was where he was, her paw smashing him down and covering him, keeping him warm against the chill as she walked. It was almost relaxing, really, now that he thought about it. This would make a great ride at some carnival, and he wondered if there was something like it.

Soon he stopped again, and heard the loud clack as something metallic moved over head, followed by her foot rising again. Ash got the impression of a vehicle, like a car or truck, before he was smashed down into the sandal once more, as Rebecca took the driver’s seat, and then started her ride. The roar of the engine vibrated through the human, his body rubbing against the padded sole, almost like a gentle massage, and making him "mmm" with pleasure at the feeling as he lay there, unnoticed beneath her.
142121112221.title: Rebecca goes home

choices: Rebecca Removes her Sandals at the door
1421211122212.content:
*Originaly writen by Sage. Used with permission.*

Well, made not completely unnoticed. As the car started to move, Ash felt her foot shift. At first, he thought it make be her using the foot he was on to work the pedals, but the pressure from above shifted to often for that, the pad scrunching up around him, picking him up off the sandal and holding him completely in the soft, folded flesh of it, before letting him go again, his body pressed against the sandal. It took him a few times of this to figure it out. She felt him, and probably without thinking about it, was moving her foot around him. He was trapped in some massive game of footsie with her, and oddly, he liked it.

The ride continued as Rebecca made her way through the traffic, her foot pressing down against him, and then picking him up, her voice a soft humming sometimes as she wondered what it was that she felt, but then just ignoring it. It wasn’t important after all, and it did feel good where it was, as she ran her foot over it, rubbing it into the sandal, and rolling it around her pad. It felt very good indeed.

Ash felt his body roll with the pad, the motion against the sandal a slight pinch, but not more painful than that, allowing him to enjoy the heat coming off her paw as it flowed into him. It really was like he was being embraced by her, and he was enjoying it a lot now, as she played with him, pulling him this way and that, and then pressing him down into the sandal, her "mmm" of pleasure mimicking his own, before her paw finally settled, and she turned the motor off.

Another few clicks, and Rebecca exited her car, her foot pressing him into the sandal as she rose from where she’d been sitting, and then stretched a bit, putting all her weight on her foot. That weight was massive too, and for a moment Ash thought it might make him pop like a grape. It didn’t however, and after a few moments, she stretched her arms upward, and then felt the great popping sensation as the little knots in her back worked themselves loose, and she was able to start forward again.

Beneath her, Ash was still recovering from the pressure of her entire body on his. It had been, oddly arousing, to be that dominated by her. Her whole body focused on him, without her even knowing about it. He tried to move now, squirming and wriggling, either to get her attention, or just to work himself free, the former not working, but the latter achieved, just in time to get stomped by her ankle as she moved, the back of her foot coming down on him hard, and making him stuck to it. Where it was Rebecca was going, it seemed Ash would be along for the whole ride, not that he minded much.
1421211122212.title: Rebecca begins to play with something in her sa...

14212111222121.content:
Ash felt the hug foot slide away from him as Rebecca slipped her sandals off leaving him slightly chilled from the change in temperature, He looked up and saw that she wasn't even looking in his direction and was already stepping forward to walk to another part of her apartment home. Through a window he could see that it was nearing evening and through the faded light he watched her walking away, catching glimpses of the padded soles that he'd enjoyed. He was surprised that he wanted more of that feeling of soft bumpy sole against his body. Rebecca was quite attractive, for her species. And like all females of reproduction age she was producing pheromones as her body's way of attracting a mate. These pheromones ,unknown to the micro human, had a rather potent effect on Ash. He'd been under her foot, surrounded by pheromone producing glands and her foot play with him gave him such feelings of arousal that it almost effected his judgement.

Almost. Even though he wanted to be close to her again, he knew there would be a time and a place.

Climbing off the sandal into carpet fibers that were just over his head in height, he trekked forward in the direction Rebecca went. He knew he'd feel guilty, and ashamed of himself afterwards but for now all that he had on his mind was his next chance with Rebecca.
14212111222121.title: Feelings of Desire

Ash was almost halfway across the room, up until then it had been uneventful and he spent the time planing and becoming more -eh- excited the more he thought. So it came to no surprise that it took the second or third footfall and tremor to wake him out of his daydreams. Someone was coming. As much as he wanted to it was slow going through the tall carpet fibers that only hindered his movement and speed. His only hope was that whoever it was wouldn't notice his head sticking out from among the carpet fibers.

So who was it?
142121112221212.title: Who is it?

1421211122212121.content:
Rebecca turned the corner walking to the living room, her eyes straight ahead and not noticing what was at her feet. Even if she did happen to look down, she wouldn't have noticed anything out of the ordinary. Her pace was slow, it had been a long day and all she wanted right now was to sit on her sofa for a moment before she had to turn the radio on for Danger Woman.

"NO!" Ash cried out in terror and frustration as the huge foot fell "NO, I'M NOT READY! NOOOOO!"

When Ash had traveled in Rebecca's Sandal the soft insole and the soft toe pads had protected him. This time he wasn't so lucky. This time Her unforgiving heel crashed down on top of him, instantly he was turned into nothing more than a stain. Rebecca hadn't felt a thing, didn't even notice the red speck on her heel that was washed away when she had a bath later that night. What was left of the micro human remained among the carpet fibers a few days being crushed further and further into the floor every time it was walked on by some one until there wasn't even anything left to Vacuum up.

For Ash it was almost instant. He felt the vibrations in the floor first. Then he had only a moment to look up and see a cute bear cub paw/foot coming down. Then he wasn't aware of anything at all. Young Molly never knew what she'd done, thus was never plagued by the guilt of taking a sentient life.

14212111222121222.content:
Dressed in her "Danger Woman" costume Molly came running from another part of the apartment. She hadn't looked down at what was in her path, and if she had she probably wouldn't have seen anything until it was far too late.

For Ash, she was upon him before he could even think of getting out of the way. He felt the vibrations in the floor first. Then he had only a moment to look up and see a cute bear cub paw/foot coming down.

"Molly Cunningham!"

Molly skidded to a stop as her mother called out to her. Ash cried out as well as the cub's foot settled down on top of him and pressed into the carpet. Molly was much smaller and lighter than the adults, but she was still heavy enough to reduce the micro human into nothing more than a red stain. Fortunately however Ash managed somehow to end up under her toes. He still couldn't move, and breathing was difficult. But He was thankfully still alive.

"No running in the apartment, young lady" her mother warned "You could hurt yourself."

"Yes, Mommy." said Molly.

Under Molly's foot Ash silently pleaded for the cub to get off, Rebecca, his real Goal awaited him.
14212111222121222.title: Pawed

142121112221212221.content:
The toes wiggled above him for a moment more before the Cub's foot lifted away as Molly took a step forward.

Ash gasped in relief, feeling cool air enter his lungs once more. The carpet fibers around him were flatten by the weight of Molly's foot but were slowly bouncing back to their straight form. He watched her walk away for a moment before continuing on. It was slow going, but Ash didn't seem to mind or notice. For his mind was filled with the thoughts of what awaited him. There were so many things he wanted to do, but no sense in trying to do them all at once. He still had no clue how he got there but there was also no indication that he was going back home anytime soon. Better to pace himself over the next few days.

He finally came to a massive door. A door that would've dwarfed Kong's on Skull Island. It was closed, but there was a four foot gap between the floor and the bottom of the door, easy enough to get under. He wondered what he'd find on the other side. No turning back now. With his heart racing with anticipation he made his way into the room.

There she was, the object of his desire. Her back was to him, he half expected her to turn and say "I've been waiting for you little man, what took you?" No, only in his Fantasies. Instead she was oblivious to his presence. From what Ash could see, Rebecca was--
142121112221212221.title: Continueing the Journey

1421211122212122211.content:
Rebecca hummed a little tune to herself as she folded some clothes that had been drying outside. She just loved the smell of laundry fresh off the clothes line. Little did she notice the little admirer that was making his way toward her.

Ash walked silently up to his towering object of affection with confidence. He was beneath her notice and was still for the moment so he had nothing to fear. As he inched forward his eyes fell upon Rebecca's feet which were planted firmly on the floor. Oh how he wanted to feel their amazing touch against his body, The feeling of soft leathery pads against his skin--

Suddenly without warning something big and heavy landed on Ash. He heard "Oh Darn" from above and something big wrapped around him.The next thing he knew he was lifted upward and taused about as Rebecca folded the garment with Ash caught in the folds. Damn it. he'd been so close and he blew it. Maybe this wasn't so bad, at least he could rest up before moving about that night, if he could figure out what he was trapped in.
1421211122212122211.title: Folding Laundry

Rebecca Tells her a Bedtime Story
14212111222121222112.content:
"How the hell do I get out of here?"

Ash found himself asking himself that more and more as he tried to figure out how to get out of folded Cloth. Not quite what he had planned to do that night. Exploring a Sleeping Goddess? Yeah. Crawling around in an piece of clothing? No! And it's not that easy as one would think, he'd been crawling through the folds of the fuzzy yellow fabric for over an hour after Rebecca had set it down and just when he thought that he'd made some degree of progress he'd come to yet another dead end. This time though, something about the fabric made Ash stop and look.

Something had darkened the yellow material, and he'd seen this sort of things enough times to know what had caused it to do so. A sudden realization dawned on him, if he was where he THOUGHT he was....

"Bed Time, Molly. Time to put your sleepers on."

"Oh no" Said Ash, panic boiling up inside him "No, No, No!"

He had to get out, but damn it there was no way out. He heard them approaching, Rebecca and her Daughter. There was the sound of springs and everything tilted. He was on a Bed and some one had sat down. He heard Rebecca talking to her Daughter as she undressed her for the night. He Heard the giggles from the young cub as though she'd been tickled, and then he was lifted upward. Ash tumbled and landed in the center of the boot of the sleeper, where Molly's foot would soon rest. He didn't have to wait long.

Molly's foot came into view as the leg of the Sleeper was pulled on. He had certainly felt it's weight but this was the first time he'd actually gotten a look at it. It was adorable, in a giant deadly sort of way, and moments before it was upon him the toes spread as though she was about to grab him with them. Then he was pressed up against the center pad.

This night was NOT going according to plan.
14212111222121222112.title: The Maze of Cloth

142121112221212222.content:
*Edited to add more detail.*

Molly was just about to walk to the living room when something began to tickle the bottom of her foot.

"HMMMMM?"

The toes around Ash began to wiggle, pressing him into the soft flesh. He was thankful it was soft, otherwise he'd be turned into a red smear. Still that didn't mean he liked getting the air pushed out of his lungs. He considered biting her to make her stop, but he read enough shrinking themed stories to know that biting a giant often ended in disaster. Thankfully the wiggling stopped before he was forced to try it anyway. The foot lifted away only to be replaced by pudgy fingers and closed around him and held him firmly as he was lifted skyward past furry legs and fabric to a great Eye.

"Ohhh what a funny looking bug!"

Now, Ash would've thought like most children so young Molly would be afraid of bugs. But most children are not like Molly Cunningham. She wondered what kind of a bug this was for a moment before deciding to--
142121112221212222.title: Molly Feels something under her foot

choices: Rebecca beings to play with her little foot toy
14212111222122.content:
"Mommy! Mommy!"

Rebecca smiled as her daughter ran toward her followed behind by Kit who looked tired. She hoped Molly hadn't given him too much trouble. He definitely earned his pay today. Kneeling she hugged her daughter , lifting the backs of her feet up a bit. Stuck to her sole Ash was able to breathe comfortably though the air smelled of lotion and bear sole, a smell he was beginning to get used to. Even like. He didn't stay stuck for long though as he fell back to the sandal. He didn't have time to relax as Rebecca began to stand up again. Ash had just enough time to scurry away from her heel and under what little arch the bearess had before her foot became his world once again.

"I hope Molly wasn't too much trouble Kit." said Rebecca as she reached into her purse.

"Nah, she was okay Miz Cunningham." said Kit accepting his babysitter fee. "I think I'm getting better at keeping up with her."

"See you tomorrow."

Rebecca began to walk again. Where she was going Ash had no way of knowing. He could hear her talking to someone young, he guessed it was her daughter Molly. She stopped a few times and through the mountain of sole above him he was able to make out a few words. "You go." "enjoy" "work to do"

Then more walking. Finally she stopped, the weight lifted slightly ,Ash could only guess she was sitting down. Closing his eyes he breathed in the smells around him. Why did he find them so attractive? Perhaps it was the pheromones being produced. Whatever the reason he wasn't complaining. He ran his hand over the sole above him, the texture felt bumpy but soft. Suddenly he felt the muscle under the sole twitch, then the foot began to slide backward until he was directly under her toes.
14212111222122.title: Rebecca Keeps her Sandals on.

142121112222.content:
Rebecca had only walked a few steps when she stopped suddenly. This proved to be dangerous for Ash as Rebecca's enormous body weight began to bear down on him, her soft instep pad pressed down all around him making breathing impossible. He felt his limbs go numb as the blood flow was cut off, he thought for sure his last moment of existence had come. Then the weight eased off as Rebecca's foot began to slide out of the sandal. A sigh of relief escaped his lips until a toe slid over him it pressed him into the sole of the sandal, rubbing him all over and pushing the air from his lungs. Unable to breath he quickly passed out.

"Hmm? What's this?"

The toe was gone only to be replaced by a huge thumb and forefinger moments later. Ash was aware of nothing as the tips of the two digits grasped him and lifted him upward toward Rebecca's face. Limp and unconscious he was brought closer to those dark brown eyes that studied him curiously.

"What is it? A Toy?" Rebecca asked herself "I've never seen one so small. I've never seen Kit with it, and I know I didn't buy this for Molly. I wonder how it got in my sandal."

Rebecca placed the toy in the palm of her hand so she could examine it better. For its size it was very detailed, but a bit funny looking. What kind of creature was it suppose to be? Alien maybe? She carefully touched it with the tip of her finger, it felt like it was made from a soft rubber but it also seemed to have hard parts as well. And it felt warm, probably from being under her foot.

"Well, I have things to do." said Rebecca finally "I don't have time for toys, I think I'll give it to..."

Ash stayed perfectly still as Kit held him between his fingers. As much as he wanted to get his attention, any attention, he decided against it. What if he cried out and the cub's first reaction is to drop what he's holding? The floor was hundred's of feet below. So he remained silent as Kit examined him.

'Where did this toy come from?' he thought as he looked it over. It was so small, and yet highly detailed. It had clothes. Who could make clothes that small? How did they do it? He rolled it carefully between his thumb and finder as to not break it. It didn't even feel like any toy he'd ever owned. Granted he hadn't had many in his life but it still didn't feel like any of the toys he'd handled.

'Now I know what it's like to be toyed by a Bear.' Ash though. Being rolled between thumb and finger wasn't painful but it wasn't comfortable either. Fortunately, it didn't last long as he found himself deposited into the pocket of the cub's sweater. He didn't even know the sweater had pockets. Finally able to movie, Ash looked about his new accommodations. Not much to look at. A bubble gum still in it's rapper. Some coins, and a bit of lint. Kit began to walk. Out side the pocket the world was moving fast and the wide palm of the hand swung back and forth. Ash carefully considered is options.

1423.content:
Ash heard a thud, followed by another; he felt a tremor through the ground, with each thud getting stronger than the last. With all these giant buildings Ash could only assume that someone very big was coming. It suddenly grew dark as a shadow fell over him. Turning around Ash looked up over the grass line. At first he saw nothing, then a tuff of brown hair and a baseball cap turned backwards then a face came into view. He soon found himself self looking up at the last creature he thought to see when he woke up this morning.

Kit Cloudkicker was strolling towards Higher for Hire, the grass felt pleasantly cool under his feet. Normally on a day like today he and Baloo would be making deliveries for the boss lady but she had given them both the day off, as it had been a slack week. With Baloo over at Louie’s Kit decided to have a bit of time by himself. He was totally unaware of the human only a few steps in front of him.

``Holy Shit….``

That was as bout the only thing Ash could think off saying. What else was there to say? There was a giant flesh and blood version of Kit Cloudkicker from Tailspin, right down to the ball cap sitting on top of his head. Though from what could be seen each time Kit lifted a foot to take a step, his feet were more bear like than what they were in the show. Ash quickly realized he should’ve been running instead of looking at those feet because in less than two steps they were bearing down on top of him!

Ash reflexively threw his hands up as if to hold back the tons of flesh that was hovering over his head. His eyes were closed. There was no point in looking; Ash knew he was about to become a smear on the ground. The earth shook violently and he was thrown off his feet. Coughing up some dust Ash opened his eyes. To my amazement and relief he saw that Kit had decided to sit down, his back resting up against the side of the building and his two huge feet propped up right in front of him. Dirt and other debris rained down around Ash as the cub wiggled his toes and scrunched his feet up.Sighing contently Kit removed his had placeing it beside him.

It was only then that Ash noticed the Paper bag next to him. Judging from the smell coming from the Paper bag Ash assumed it to be the cub's lunch.

So, now what to do? From what he could recall Kit had a fairly level head for a twelve year old. He’d have better chances of survival if he had his help. Climbing the giant bear cub would take too long so from what Ash could see he had three options: Climb up onto Kit's ball cap and wait for him to put it back on his head so he could get close to his ear, take the direct approach and climb into his lunch bag and get his attention when he lifted a food item to his mouth. A tad bit more dangerous but Ash figured that close to his ears Kit would be able to hear him. At least he hoped so. His other option was to get his attention by tickleing one of his feet, since he was very close to them at that moment.
1423.title: Kit Cloudkicker

To get to the most sensitive parts of the Bear's foot Ash had to climb to the tip of a blade of Grass. Covered in a layer of dirt and debris the pads of Kit's foot emanated heat and a distinct Earthy smell. Feeling confident from this reaction Ash held nothing back, useing both hands to tickle the huge pad before him.

Two things happened. One, Kit laughed loudly. Two, Kit's foot Kicked forward sending him flying back. Hitting the ground and going for a tumble before stopping, Ash felt the Earth shake as the cub stood up. Rolling on his back he looked up at Kit, from the look on his face it was clear he was not amused. His eyes darted about looking for whatever had tickled him and finally his gaze fell upon Ash.

"AH HA!" said Kit with an angry look on his face."So you're the little bug who ticked me! I hate getting my feet tickled! Well I'll make sure you'll never tickle me again!"

With that Kit lifted the very foot that moments before Ash was tickling and prepared to stomp him into the dirt.

"Wildcat, I'm glad you're here. I came across an interesting creature today. I thought it was a bug at first, but it seems way too intelligent to be one. I tried to crush it four times and it avoided my foot each time, almost like it knew what was going to happen. Do you have anything I could use to get a better look at it without hurting it?" Ash heard Kit ask. He was glad Kit was doing what he said he would. It might be a chance for him to communicate with the cub, he just wish he could remember who Wildcat was. The name sounded familiar somehow.

He didn't have to wait too long to remember. A voice that sounded like a grownup with a childish mind answered, "Sure, Kit. I have a magnifying glass and a device to amply sound from tiny things from a foot away, which is handy for listening for loose parts. I suppose it could come in handy if it can speak our language." It came back to him. Wildcat was a lion and team's mechanic. He might not sound intelligent, but he was great at building and fixing things. You wouldn't be surprised if he built the sound amplifying device himself. Maybe he could help you become a bit taller if you asked.

"Great, I could use them both! I get this feeling whatever it is can understand speech. I threatened to stomp it four times, and it didn't give up until I told it I would. 142323.content:
His foot hovered over the bug, a quick stomp and it would be over. But Kit couldn’t bring himself to do it. The bug looked so pitiful cowering like that. He could almost hear it pleading for its life.

‘Ah shucks’ he thought. ‘I’m not a bully.’

He lowered his foot. It probably wasn’t even the bug’s fault. Got to close with its feelers maybe. He shouldn’t have reacted that way even though he really did hate to be tickled. Kit crouched down to get a better look at the bug. He blinked. Something wasn’t right. He got down lower so that he was nose to nose with the bug. This bug wore clothes. This Bug wore CLOTHES!


Ash had thought for sure it had been the end. Out of fear he’d curled into a fetal position and waited for the end. A rather undignified way to die, when you think about it. Something heavy touched the ground next to him followed by movement. Then he felt hot moist air blow over him. He opened his eyes. Kit was staring directly at him.

He was so close Ash could’ve reached out and touched him. He pushed himself up on the backs of his elbows and watched as he was studied intently.

To be honest, Ash didn’t know what Kit was thinking or what he’d do next. He could’ve easily crushed him moments before and had chosen not to. That didn’t mean he couldn’t still do it. Ash decided to try something. He stood up and waved a greeting.

Kit pulled back in surprise. This wasn’t a bug at all. As incredible as it seemed this was a tiny person. And only Kit knew about it. He looked about to make sure he wasn’t seen and waved back. Then he slowly extended a hand toward the tiny.

Sweet!" he thought extremely excited as the Webbed Wonder was his all time favorite super hero maybe he could meet him face to face and get his autograph first hand but that was for later now he had to find some help since this was New York set in the mighty Marvel Universe he had plenty of choices to choose from: The Fantastic Four,The Avengers etc where should he start? But before he could think to move a inch a huge shadow appeared over him and a giant hand reached down and plucked him up Ash fearfully squinted his eyes to see the face of....

Running through the hard floor you finally reach the large object and as you saw it you finally know what this room actually is This large room where you are is really just a bedroom because the object you saw is a humongous Arabic bed You noticed that someone seems to be sleeping on it who ever it is judging by what you are right now you can that this giant person is capable of smashing you like an insect You can hear the person snoring quietly and by the feminine-like snore you heard You can tell that this person might be female
