As she was about to give a close look at you You suddenly heard a voice calling for her and in less than five seconds she immediately puts her gold necklace on completely forgetting about you As this happens you almost got thrown out of the necklace but you hold on as Jasmine quickly slides it down her neck and runs off

The necklace was a little slippery for you to climb on atop of and since Jasmine is already rushing down the halls it makes it a bit harder for you to hold on but you managed to made it on top of her necklace

You sat down on the golden necklace while grabbing on ether sides and watch the view from it as Jasmine goes to whatever she's going for Despite being safe you still going to need help since you'll probably fall from the necklace You look up at high up at Jasmine's face apparently not looking down at you right now but you could however climb up her neck and reach her ear to communicate with her but unfortunately that seems to proven to be even more risker than at your current state so maybe you could simply wait for her to stop before you could do something
1431321122.title: Holding on

1431322.content:
You woke up in what you believed was a display case. Looking around, you notice hieroglyphs on the wall, floor, and cat statues around the room. You also notice ominous artifacts like daggers in other display cases. You felt like you were on display in the Egyptian Wing of a Gothic History Museum.

"It's about time you woke up. I found you out cold while looking for inspiration on a scheme to take down those fools who oppose me," a feminine voice says.You turn towards the source of voice and start to feel uneasy when you see a cat woman with black fur, black hair, and a red skirt. "I could have killed you if I wanted, but you might be more useful to me alive. I want to know how you ended up that size. If you prove your worth to me, I'll take you on as a partner and look out for you," she says as walks towards the display case. She then puts her hand in and grabs you. "So tell me, how did you get that small?" she asked in a whisper.

"That's just it, I don't remember any of it. I was just out for a walk in the forest. Next thing I know, I woke up here," you answer.

"Well then, do you have anything else to say that might benefit us both?" she asks.
1431322.title: Mirage

choices: It's happening in a few hours. (Not much time to get to know Mirage.)
It's tomorrow. (Spend some time with Mirage.)
14313221.content:
"Agrabah is hosting a party. I would like to kill the fun," Mirage informed you. "I might have an idea if you're willing to give me the benefit of the doubt. We'll have to work together, though," you tell her. "With my luck at attacking Agrabah, I suppose I'll give you a chance," she says.

"You'll need me at full size. It's best to separate a lock and key until they're ready to be used. We'll also need two flasks, some alcohol, water, and fruit punch," you explained. "What are you going to do with that stuff?" she asks you.

"You're going to have to seem nice for a bit. That's to get the punch in. You'll also have to give the Captain of the Royal Guard the flask with the water. You'll understand why after I finish explaining everything," you tell her.

"Okay, there's no evil for me. I'm not sure where this is going," Mirage says with a hint of doubt. "A big part of it is misdirection. Because you have a reputation of causing trouble, you're most likely to be stopped. This is where I come in. While they're keeping an eye on you, I'll be the one to taint the punch with the alcohol. Afterward, I will run into the captain and pull the old switcheroo on him so he takes the fall. If all goes according to plan, the party will get out of control and result in no more parties being held in the palace at the very least,” you explained.

“I see, it seems you have a dark side. The Royal Guard's fall from grace would be a nice bonus,” Mirage comments. “It gets better, from what I understand, the Captain of the Royal Guard doesn't see eye to eye with Aladdin. I think you can guess who he's likely to blame,” you explain to her.

“Your plan is actually more promising than I originally though. I'd prefer more destructive measures, though,” Mirage says. “I don't drink alcohol, but I do know it's effects. It is pretty flammable. In addition, drunks are a bit more unpredictable. More likely to do something they wouldn't normally do and even reveal their own secrets,” you tell her.

“If I restore you to normal height, it will only be temporary. Of course, if this plan works, I'll be willing to take care of you out of respect for your talent. Depending on the level of success, I may actually reward you for it.” Mirage informs you. “So when is the party?” you asked.
14313221.title: You had an idea.

1431331.content:
He was inside a school hallway.

Nothing odd about it, just a regular hallway. Ash looked confused as he swore there would have been something odd about his predicament. He looked around for a bit, the hallways were nicely kept, the walls were decorated with school announcements and projects, and the classrooms seemed to be fine with students. He took a sigh of relief as he was glad he was not anywhere dangerous or in some strange place. Still it did mark the question why the bright light, or whatever it was, brought him here. It seemed to be an awful lot of trouble just to send him to school.

Then again he still wasn't sure if this was the school he attended, or the right grade regardless. Nevertheless, Ash didn't have any more time to think as he felt a tap on the back of his shirt. Turning he was greeted with a girl with brown hair, a yellow headband, matching shirt-with a red skirt over it-socks and brown loafers. Ash didn't say anything as the girl spoke, "Uh...are you lost?"

It took a few seconds for Ash to answer as he was a bit mesmerized, "Uhm....kinda of..." He responded as he was still confused at what was going on.

"Well do you need any help?" The girl asked extending a hand, "I'm Phoebe by the way."

Ash shook her hand as he introduced himself, "I'm Ash...I'm....new here.." Telling a little white lie, as he wasn't technically wrong either.

"Nice to meet you, new you say?" Phoebe said interested, "Does that mean your the new kid our class has been hearing about?"

"Uh..sure, absolutely," Ash responded friendly, as it was a way to get some answers, or at least mingle for a bit.

"Excellent, follow me," Phoebe clapped her hands as she lead the way to her homeroom class. "You know I don't blame you, this school is pretty big for new students, but once you get used to it, you can find your way around."

"I'll be sure to do that," Ash responded as he was trying to keep the conversation going. It was still strange he was here, but it was also better to follow Phoebe then wander around the halls and possibly getting into trouble. This way, he was at least protected.

"And here we are!" Phoebe opened the door as she introduced Ash to the rest of her classmates. Immediately Ash took in the fairly small class, up to six students if he counted himself, and the really bizarre decorations around the place. Skeletons, dinosaurs, the periodic table of elements hanged like a flag, and some class pets here and there. What he took notice however was that the classroom, or teacher, was keen on teaching more about science over any other subject. Strange, but doable.

"Hi there," a kid with a red cap and a green shirt, with a red R on it, greeted Ash as he shook hand, "Name's Ralphie, class athlete and future NFL player."

"I'm Ash," Ash responded as the kid seemed to be friendly at least. "Guess I'm the new kid then, and future classmate. Hopefully." He added meekly which only made Ralphie laugh. "Of course you are gonna be, why else would you be here?"

"No reason," Ash gulped as Ralphie slung an arm around his shoulder.

"Come on I'll show you to the rest of the class." Ralphie pushed Ash until they met up with an asian girl, wearing a red coat with a pink undershirt, who was busy with a phone in her hands. "Ehm, Wanda meet Ash."

She looked up as she waved at him, "Hey Ash, Wanda here. Hope you can stomach most of the class lessons. Unlike Arnold."

"Hey," A kid with glasses, orange hair, and a white and yellow striped shirt interjected as he stood up from his chair, "It's not my fault I get...nervous about the trips sometimes."

"What does he mean by that?" Ash asked.

"Oh you'll soon find out eventually," Ralphie said, "Kind of hard to explain when Ms. Frizzle isn't around."

"Well to be fair she isn't the most conventional teacher either," an African American girl wearing a magenta and light violet sweater appeared next to Ralphie as she introduced, "I'm Keesha, nice to meet you."

"Likewise," Ash responded as he leaned forward to shake Keesha's hand, "So this...Ms. Frizzle is....quite radical?"

"Well.....you could say that. Kind of hard to place a specific word after all the field trips we've been with her."

"Huh," Ash whispered as he thought of that. Wonder what she meant by that.

"Anyway," Ralphie broke the silence, "There's still three people left for you to meet." Turning Ash around, to face another African American kid, who seemed he was drawing, "Over there is Tim."

"Hiya!" Tim looked up as he continued to go on his work, quite concentrated on it as well.

"Over there," Ralphie pointed to a girl with blonde pigtails, and a purple sweater, reading a very heavy scientific book. "Is Dorothy Ann, or D.A., for short."

"Hello, sorry for being quiet, but my research is very important right now," She waved without moving away from the book as she continued to read, almost ignoring Ash if it weren't for her comment.

"And finally, Carlos," Ralphie almost groaned as a kid with a blue sweater, sat with his arms crossed.

"Hi, nice to meet you. Don't want to step on anything but, you seem to be a little out of place."

"Uh..." Ash was starting to get a bit nervous, as he was scared if anyone knew he wasn't truly from here. However he had no time to explain as Carlos interrupted him, "Could say that your... foreign?"

Ash was dumb founded by what he said, while the rest of the class groaned.

"You'll have to forgive him, he's a bit of a ..... joker," Phoebe informed Ash.

"That's right, and all I need is my Harley next to me!" Carlos nudged at Dorothy. "In your dreams Carlos."

Phew, that was one Ash dodged. For a second his heart was gonna explode. Still he had to admit that wherever he was, it could have been a lot worse. Taking a seat next to Phoebe, the front door of the room opened as I very odd teacher walked in.

Her hair was orange, yet it was...well.....a frizzle-as it was tight up in a bum with some strands standing here and there. She wore a dark blue dress with some decorations on it, that Ash really couldn't see from his position. She had a lizard across her shoulders as she let sit on her desk as she spoke with a very eccentric voice, "Good Morning Class!"
1431331.title: The Magic School Bus

choices: Shrink the class entirely in one go
Shrink one student at a time
14313311.content:
"Good Morning, Ms. Frizzle," The whole class responded as she had their undivided attention, even from those who were too busy to look at Ash before.

"I hope you all have had a good rest and have bright faces, for today we get to learn about our wonderful world through science!" Ms. Frizzle, as he had come to learn, continued to explain as she moved eccentrically in front of the classroom. Immediately she spotted Ash as she literally jumped in front of him. "Ah, you must be the newcomer, welcome to our humble adobe!"

"Yes, indeed I am!" Ash played along with the rouse as Ms. Frizzle invaded his personal space. He had to admit though, she was a very fine lady. She seemed nice, and well...she did look good, however, he couldn't get ahead-he really couldn't judge a book by its cover.

"Good!," clapping her hands together, "I see you got well acquainted with the class already."

"Sure did," Ralphie said.

"Quite exemplary if I may say," D.A added.

"Excellent, you'll be a fine addition to my class, young...."

"Ash."

"Ash, hmmmmm odd name, but as science has proved, odd things are the basis of discovery!"

"Good to know," Ash gulped in relief as he was interrupted once more by the Redheaded Fritz.

"Now class today's lesson involves much difference from the usual view of your regular everyday basis!"

"Oh no," groaned Arnold, but Ash just ignored it.

"What do you mean by that, Ms. Frizzle?" Keesha asked.

"Well, think about it. At your current state, you think of all the things accustomed to your liking and to your proportions, but what if it were different?" This intrigued the class as most of them seemed excited to find out what their teacher was trying to imply.

"Meaning?" Wanda asked.

"Proportion, obviously," Tim added.

"Right you are Tim, and with proportion comes perspective, and perspective can change your whole view of the world." Ms Frizzle added as a twinkle appeared in her eye. She winked at her lizard as it was busy rummaging behind the desk, looking for something.

"So by changing our perspective, we would see everything else differently?" Wanda continued.

"Exactly!"

"But according to my research, that's scientifically impossible. Perspective, or even proportions, of a person can't be changed," D.A added, "Even if you wanted to."

"Never say never Dorothy Ann," Ms. Frizzle interjected as her lizard found a strange gun/antenna device and launched at her hands.

"Does this mean?" Ralphie asked eagerly.

"It's time to take chances," she said her oh so famous line as she twirled the device around, "make mistakes and get messy!"

Everyone cheered, as Ash looked confused and excited, while Arnold seemed scared.

"Aren't you excited?" Phoebe asked Ash.

"Why?" Ash seemed more confused.

"Because we're going on a field trip!"

"What now?"

"Yeah," Phoebe said with an almost, duh, effect in her voice.

"But how?"

"Well with Ms. Frizzle's Porta-shrinker of course!"

"Wait what?" Ash was about to ask even more, as he was cut off by the Frizzle.

"Now...how to go around about this?" She said as her class was in front of her.
14313311.title: Continue with this storyline

choices: They were the size of ants
143133111.content:
Ms. Frizzle was adjusting her dials as the rest of the class was excited, all for Ash and Arnold. Ash was nervous as he didn't know what he had gotten himself into, he thought there was going to be a normal lecture, a test, and then done. This was not in part of his plans!

"Oh I knew I should have stayed home," Arnold whined as his anxiety started to flare a bit.

"What's gonna happen?" Ash asked him.

"That's the problem, I don't know!" Arnold responded, "But all I know is that it's going to be bad!"

Before they continued to chat, Ms. Frizzle had finished her set up and now was aiming for her students. "Alright class, It's Showtime!" Before they could do anything, she had pulled trigger as a strange beam spread among them.

The timing was almost instantaneous as one minute the whole class was facing Ms. Frizzle and the next they were in some strange white plain.

"Where are we?" Phoebe asked.

"I can't be sure," Wanda added, "It's all so....white and.." she was cut off as they all felt a massive tremor coming from out of nowhere.

"What was th-" Ash asked, only for they to feel it again.

"Hey was it me, or did that one feel stronger?" Phoebe asked scared.

Another tremor, and this time louder and stronger as they were thrown off their feet.

"No, it definitely is!" Tim shouted.

They were thrown around once more, as a darkness fell on them. "Hey who turned off the lights?" Carlos asked.

"Uhmm...Carlos...." Wanda gulped as she turned her friend, "I think....she did..."

They looked up and up and up, and up, and up, until they're necks were craned enough, but it wasn't enough. A huge violet heel stood next to them, as another slowly made it's way towards them, landing next to them, creating the earth shattering quake once more. Connected to it, where Ms. Frizzle's long legs, covered by the the massive sheet of her dress as she squatted down, squinting to see where her class was.

"I THINK I MAY HAVE OVERDONE IT A BIT!" Her voice boomed down below, as everyone covered their ears. Their excitement had gone to fear, but they were still hopeful that their teacher would still be the same. "AH THERE YOU ARE CLASS! ENJOYING THE NEW SIGHTS ON PERSPECTIVE?!" She laughed, sounding like an evil laugh more than her usual giddy one.

The class stood up, trying to get a sense of how diminutive they were at the moment.
143133111.title: Shrink the class entirely in one go

choices: Ms. Frizzle decides to take a few steps around her class
Ms. Frizzle suddenly slips off her shoes
1431331111.content:
Ash was freaking out however, granted everyone was as well but him especially more. This was far, far, far from what he considered normal but even then, he should have seen it coming, the portal wasn't just gonna drop him and leave him be. It had to throw even more crazy into the mix.

Nevertheless, the children stood up as their gargantuan teacher had stood still to allow them to move. They soon realized that the white plain, was the school tiles on the floor, it was a start. From then on they compared themselves to her heels. Giant was an understatement at this point, they were massive! As big as a cruise liner if they were to compared. This only added to they're stature, as they feel smaller now than before.

"Who knew the Frizz would do something like this?" Wanda whispered.

"Never thought she was one for..." Arnold gulped, "...shrinking students."

"Well we have been small before, just...never at this size, and...with her...only..." Phoebe added as she was shaking a bit.

"Oh come on guys, it's not that bad," Ralphie added as he was feeling adventurous and wanted to explore more. "Come on, let's see what else we can find at this view!" Running ahead to the other side of the Frizzle's shoe.

"If you say so," Wanda yelled as she chased after him.

Meanwhile, Tim, Carlos, and Dorothy Ann were still trying to find an exact size that they were around. "Never thought we be at the short end of the heel," Carlos said unattended.

"I would normally groan, but this time you're right," Dorothy said as they looked up towards the massive heel that seemed to never end. "Theoretically, this shouldn't be possible, then again, Ms. Frizzle has defied science and its laws dozens of times...yet I can never get used to it!"

"We've been Frizzled," Tim added, "Big time." Giving an unintentional pun.

"More like Massive," Carlos interjected. Nevertheless, as the children walked near her, Ms. Frizzle couldn't help but have a smile on her face. Sure she loved being a teacher but as any person, she did have her secrets. Since a child she has had an affinity towards....well size change to be exact. She couldn't explain why, but she was in love with it. Even after her years of teaching science and studying it, she could never figure it out what attracted her so much towards the subject but it

With that knowledge, it would explain why the bus could magically shrink down to microscopic size, and the portable shrink ray that she carried around. However, she never really had a chance to use to their fullest, until Ash appeared. She knew he wasn't from around here, and not just location but dimension all together. Why? Well, learning science and creating earth shattering discoveries gave you a thing or two to pick up about people. Still, she did see this as an opportunity to shrink him to small size, her class was just a....added by product towards her desire.

Looking down even more unto them, she couldn't really resist playing with her tiny pupils. Hurting them would not be a problem however; she wouldn't be able to live with herself if she did do something such horrible. Thus her science helped her in that. Shrunken down to where their molecules became more compact, thus more resistant, to almost anything. She had experimented before, so she was sure of that. But the question now was, what would be her first choice of playtime?
1431331111.title: They were the size of ants

choices: Phoebe Terese standing right over him
Wanda Li walking straight in his direction
14313312.content: The story's sort of similar to the last one yes Ash is stuck in a school building but he's also incredibly tiny wondering why of all places he would be transported at a school,a grade school as a matter of fact he realized looking around in awe at all the giant sized kids' drawings and artwork on the hallway walls and such "Okay I'm supposed to be in a cartoon series but which one? There must be thousands...." As he began slowly wandering around but at a mere two inches of height it would no doubt take nearly a month or two just to make it to one of the classroom doors standing a hundred or a thousand feet away but he started running anyway towards the nearest doorway all the while still pondering where he could possibly be until another glance upwards at one of the enormous child drawings gave him the answer he was looking for as he stopped "Hey hold up a group of elementary children probably in third grade or second,a small green lizard or frankly a chameleon and a female teacher with a wild,cheery expression standing behind a school bus with eyes and a mouth.....this can't be but there's no other explanation that....." Ash knew he was in the now giant world of the cartoon series the Magic School Bus no stranger to the show having watched it a few times whenever it was on the TLC Channel or Discovery Kids Channel(long before it was changed) though he was clearly disappointed that he couldn't have been transported into a well cooler more older kids' show at least he wouldn't be alone for long as the kids here were incredibly friendly and were bound to help him out in any case soon after a few hours of walking it was taking forever to make it to that open classroom door Ash's legs were getting really sore and he had to stop just to catch his breath and rest for a while there was the sudden sounds of earth quaking footsteps each one sounded like loud cracks of thunder echoing all around Ash's location and twice he was knocked to his feet before fearfully getting the nerve to look up at the titanic form of

143133121.title: Phoebe Terese standing right over him

1431332.content: Sorry running low on ideas aren't we?
1431332.title: Other

14313323.content:
Ash looks around, noticing he is a giant bedroom but whose? Looking around he sees a laptop on a desk and looks at the screen. The laptop was on and he couldn't believe his eyes, the screenshowed a picture of Jake Long turning into a dragon. Ash was in Jake's T.V. show! Not sure how, but Ash knew that Jake was a protecter of magical creatures. So perhaps he could protect you, even though your a shrunken human.

The door opens up, unknown to Ash, and Jake walks in listening to music on his phone. Jake looks down to see a small creature in front of his desk 'What is that? Huh, WHAT, that's a human no way! How did he get so small? Well maybe he's some sort of magical creature too. Only one way to find out.'

Ash is about to turn around and find someone to help him, when he id suddenly lifted off the ground and brought to Jake's face. "Yo little man, how'd you get in my room? Where did you come from? Ash eventually awoke from his comatose state. His head hurt so much, it felt like had been hit by a truck. About have of his body was still asleep. So he stood up and wiggled himself around to fully wake the rest of his body up. As he did so, his vision was just coming back. As his eyes focused, he couldn't believe what he saw.

It looked like a regular, 3 person sofa. But to Ash, it was about 100 feet tall, at least compared to him. He then decided to scan the room, to see if his fears were true. He turned and he saw even more various, gigantic objects. It looked as though there were chairs, that stood as tall as the mighty oaks that were used to make them. There was a television set, in which the screen would be even bigger than a jumbo tron in Time Square. And Ash looked down to see a wooden floor, with cracks that measured about 2 tiny feet apart.

Ash began to seriously freak out by now. "What the hell's going on?!" he demanded out loud. "Where the hell am I?! Why am I so............ small?" He had to accept the fact that he didn't just land in a giant's house, but that he had shrunk, and ended up landing here........ where ever "here" is.

All of a sudden, Ash was reminded quickly why everything is so big:

boom...... Boom......... BOOM......... BOOM..........

It was made for BIG people. The floor quaked with every step the giant took. Ash could barely stand with the vibrations in the floor. Until he noticed the door, that stood like a skyscraper, had a shadow creep up from the other side. The shadow though, didn't look like a normal human. Then again, a normal human wouldn't be hundreds of feet tall. But from what Ash could tell, the figure seemed to have....... big, pointy ears. Almost like a..... cat.

The door creaked open, with a low, moaning creak. And Ash got the full look of the giant creature. It indeed was a humongous, anthropomorphic cat.


Who did he see stomping his way?

1451.content:
Ash had no way to know it but the being that towered over the tree line wasn't even fully-grown.

Barefoot completely without clothing and standing on two legs the bear cub was coming straight for him. he did what anyone in his situation would do-- he panicked and started running. Sure it was futile but don't tell that to someone who has a 300-foot Furry Grizzly Bear cub walking toward him. Ash wasn't even watching where he was running, nor did he care. A huge dark shadow fell over him. A second later the sudden blast of displaced air and the impact tremor of the furry foot touching down just beside him knocked the micro human to the ground.

Coughing dust Ash looked on as the cub continued walking. He'd been complete beneath the giant creature's notice. Perhaps it was a good thing, but he had a feeling that it was not. He continued to watch until the cub stopped in front of a mountain size rock and promptly sat down on top of it.
'Now that's something to see.' thought Ash. 'A mountain sitting on top of a mountain.'

The Bear cub sat, looking a little sad, the micro human wondered why. As Ash studied the cub it suddenly dawned on him that he somehow knew this being, and when he heard
the cub sigh he suddenly recognized him.

"Little Bear."

Well, not exactly little. As fantastic as it was, he'd been somehow brought to this strange world where Fictional Characters were real and he was incredibly tiny. Or were they just incredibly large? He had know way of knowing. It made some degree of sense as to why the cub was looking so sad. If he recalled the show there were times that his friends did go away. Whether it was the end of the summer, or hibernation. Standing back up and dusting himself off he decided to get a closer look. Naturally, he was frighten. But if this Little Bear was anything like his cartoon counterpart then He knew in his heart that there was nothing to fear. Providing he could get this Giant's attention. Eventually he found himself standing in a bare patch of dusty ground looking up at the towering Cub. Little Bear's head was tilted toward the ground, this was good. Maybe when he started yelling he'd hear and see him. He took a deep breath, he almost didn't have the nerve to cry out.

"Hey! Hey!"

Little Bear's Eyes went wide. Sitting up straight he looked about, trying to find who had spoken to him "Who said that?"

"I Did! Down here!"

Little Bear Looked down at his feet, it took a moment for the Young Cub to find the Human but when he did he smiled in amazement. He reached down with one furry hand. Ash had to steel himself to keep from running away. Huge clawed fingers closed around him in a surprisingly gentle grip and carefully lifted him upward.
1451.title: The Giant Bear Cub

You impacted with a harsh sound and lost conscience, if only for a few seconds. When you woke up, you found that you had landed on the rock that Little Bear was sitting on. His fur must've softened your fall in some way because that fall should've killed you.

Your mind shifted focus back to Little Bear. He was no longer sitting on the rock but instead bended over the grass, butt sticking up in the air.
"Where did he go?" Little Bear muttered to himself. Apparently he was looking for you. You tried calling Little Bear's name again several times but this time he didn't hear you.

"Oh, well. I guess he ran away" Little Bear said as he began to sit down again. You looked up to see Little Bear was about to sit down on top of you and even when his rear was sticking up in the air you could still smell it.

You yell Little Bear's name once again, as loud as you can.
14511.title: Stuck

choices: Reaches down to scratch his butt.
Plucks you off and brings you to his face.
145111.content:
You yell the bear's name again and again but Little Bear doesn't seem to notice you. He's completely given up on searching for you and his butt is now descending towards you at an incredible speed. You put your hands up as if to defend yourself from the land mass of an ass that's five times bigger than you.

Little Bear sits back down on his rock, dejected that he couldn't find the human. Little Bear couldn't help thinking that Ash ran away because he didn't like Little Bear. Little Bear shifted foward, putting his head in his hands As he did, he swore he had felt something underneath him. Something that wasn't there before. Little Bear stood up again expecting to see something on the rock but there wasn't anything there. Odd. What could that object that he felt underneath his butt had been then.

How embarrassing. This is the only thing you can think as you find yourself stuck in a rather precarious position. First, Little Bear sits on you, putting the entirety of his weight on top of you. Then, Little Bear decides to stand up again but not before putting enough pressure on you to get yourself stuck in the soft flesh of Little Bear's behind. And now, you are stuck to the Bear's butt cheek as he scans the rock for signs of your existence. Your face is still wedged in his flesh giving you little to no breathing room. The air that you do breath in reeks, but how well can you expect a bear cub to clean himself.

Pressed against Little Bear's flesh and fur, you struggle as hard as you can to release yourself from the prison to no avail.
However, your struggles do seem to get a reaction from Little Bear as he...
145111.title: Too close for comfort

14512.content:
"Are you a Goblin?"

"N-No. I'm a human."

The cub's head tilted to the right. "Human? Funny, Emily's human and she's not tiny."

"It's a little hard to explain," said Ash. Knowing it would be even harder to explain to the cub how he already knew his name he decided to act like he did not. "What's you're name?"

"Little Bear. What's yours?"

"Ash. Um, Pardon me but it seems to me that you don't sound very old"

"I'm six years old"

Six. Only Six years old and already a giant. He wondered how much more of a giant were his parents.

"I'm really glad to meet you Little Bear, it's really scary being alone and this small. I could've been eaten by a bird or a spider."

"Do you have a place to stay?" Asked Little Bear.

"No, I have nowhere to go. No home to do to, no place to rest my head at night."

"I'll take you to my home you can live with me"

"Wait I--" Ash stopped. As much as this whole situation was freaking him out, the cub had a point. He looked into Little Bear's huge, dark, hopeful eyes "Alright, I'll stay with you. If it's okay with you're parents" he finally said. "You do have a mother and father?"

Little Bear smiled. Happy to have meet a new friend, even happier to have that friend staying with him. Ash felt himself rising upward as the cub stood up and stepped away from the rock. "Would you like to play a Game with me, or maybe you want to see my room."
14512.title: Meeting Little Bear

choices: "I'm not sure, where do you think?"
"How about  in your bed? There's plenty of room."
145121.content:
"I'd like to see your room" said Ash "It must be enormous."

With a broad smile Little Bear began walking. He covered a great deal of distance, much more than Ash thought he would. Within a minute or two they were approaching a familiar stucco, timber, plaster, and brick house. Ash saw smoke coming from the chimney. One or both of Little Bear's parents were there, Ash was more than a bit nervous. He was just getting use to The young grizzly's size. How would he react to seeing one twice that size or bigger?

As They stepped into the door both his parents were there to greet them. His mother wore a a pink shirt and a blue skirt with a white apron, his father a blue suit with a purple tie. Both towered high above Ash even from the height Little Bear was holding him. They both looked at him with curious looks on their faces.

"What's that you have there Little Bear?" Asked Mother Bear

"This is Ash, He's a human."

"I've never seen a human so small" said Father Bear as he bent lower to get a better look at Ash.

"It's a long story. Y-you'll have to excuse my sometimes odd behavior" said Ash "I'm a little nervous"

"That's understandable. Being so tiny" Said Mother Bear, she looked at Ash with wonder but gave him a warm smile. "Do you live around here?"

"No mame. I'm not sure how I got here and your son has suggested I....Live here. However if you feel otherwise--"

"Nonsense." Mother Bear said with the wave of her hand/paw. "You can stay here as long as you like."

"We're glad to see our son meeting new people." Father Bear added. "This time of the year most of his friends are away until the summer."

"Lets go to my room" said Little Bear as he took Ash toward a closed door.

"Be careful playing with your new friend. You wouldn't want to hurt him" He heard his mother called out.

"I will."

Did that just happen? They were pretty calm about the whole thing. But Ash figured they though he was too small to really couldn't do anything harmful even if he wanted to. Mother Bear seemed to have a curious interest in him, he found himself curious about her as well. Little Bear brought Ash into his bedroom, which despite it's size was pretty much like any kid's bedroom. A dresser on the left, a big bed and nightstand near the widow and a shelf and toy box in the corner.

"You could home thousands of people in this room." said Ash in amazement.

"Where would you like to sleep tonight?" asked Little Bear.

Ash looked about the room. "Hmmmmm...."
145121.title: Meet the parents

1451211.content:
Little Bear looked about his bedroom. He considered in his young mind what would be a good place for his little friend to sleep. He remembered the day he tried to find a place for No Feet and ruled out his Toy box, high shelf and Dresser drawer. But there was a spot in his night stand. A little shelf. It had plenty of space but didn't look very comfortable. Then he was struck with an idea. He carefully placed Ash on the shelf.

"I have an Idea. I'll be right back,"

Little Bear left and a moment later returned with a slipper. It was pink, well worn, but looked comfortable and warm.

Ash eyed it curiously "Who owns the slipper, Little Bear?"

"It belongs to Mother Bear." the cub explained.

"Won't she need it?"

"Not until winter. We can make you a better bed later."

"Well, any port in a storm I guess. Let me take a look inside."

Climbing up into the Slipper the first thing Ash noticed was the smell. It wasn't strong, clearly it hadn't been worn in a very long time but it was there nonetheless. Overall, the more he thought about it, It really wasn't that bad. It certainly didn't smell like human oder, it was much more earthly. Lite only by the light coming from the opening he could see clearly where the cloth sole was worn in the places where Mother Bear's foot had settled into the slipper. He wondered what it would be like to be in here with such a massive foot. Getting down on his hands and knees Ash lifted up a bit a fabric that had been worn free from the sole. Though still attached to the slipper at one end it was big enough to crawl under it. This didn't look to be such a bad place to spend the night at all.

"Well? What do you think?" Asked Little Bear.

"It'll do just fine." Ash called out.
1451211.title: Little Bear's choice

14512111.content:
Tucked under the cloth that made up the sole of the slipper Ash was having trouble sleeping. Not because of his accommodations, It was surprisingly comfortable. The Earthy smell of the interior wasn't that bad either as the Slipper hadn't been worn for some time. It was just one of those nights when his brain was too active to sleep. If he were home he'd just brew a cup of herbal tea to relax himself but that wasn't the case. Thoughts of how he got there, the creatures who were once fictional cartoon characters now flesh and blood with paws large enough to crush a house with a single step. That was just Little Bear, his parents could crush several houses at once. He obsessed over that more than anything, if he ever got back there was no way in hell anyone would believe his crazy story without hard evidence. At best it would be looked upon as fan fiction.

But wait, of course!

Ash crawled out from under the flap of fabric and searched the pockets of his jacket. He found his cellphone (No service obviously) and his Go-Pro. The heavy duty camera was fully charged with an empty SD card, he'd planned to use it but in all the excitement he'd forgotten he had it.

'Now, what to do next..' he thought to himself. He wasn't really tired and at the moment all the Giants were asleep, no risk of getting stepped on of he decided to go anywhere and explore. Still, he wasn't sure about the lighting. While the moon was bright enough to illuminate the interior of Little Bear's room he was concerned about the quality of the pictures even though the camera had a light/flash.
14512111.title: Later that Night

14512112.content:
Ash looked out the window of his home built by Father Bear. The well insulated and well stocked shelter sat on Little Bear's dresser and from what he could see out the window of the cub's bedroom it was beginning to snow heavy. he also noticed the wind had started to pick up. A winter storm was approaching. In his bed, Little Bear slept in deep hibernation. in another part of the House, so were Mother and Father Bear. They weren't always in this state, unlike their counterparts in Ash's world they only slept half the winter and only go into Hibernation sometime after the Winter Solstice celebration, their equivalent to Christmas.

Ash, being human, could not hibernate. He was well stocked with food and water, but the biggest problem was combating boredom. For the first week or so he remained in the warm confines of his home, but after that he needed to find ways to entertain himself. So he started to venture out into Little Bear's bedroom. The First trip didn't go so well. Without a fire in the fireplace the temperature of the Bear's home had dropped, not too cold for the Bears but for a small creature like Ash it was like stepping into a freezer and he wore clothes meant for Summer, not winter. He learned his lesson after that and fashioned a poncho out of some warm material Mother Bear had given him to use as a Blanket. This made the trips more bearable.

To get down from the dresser, a staircase had been build. Similar to a fire escape it was a rather long climb back up to the top but under the circumstances it was the best that could be done. Likewise there was also a string ladder that was attached to Little Bear`s bed so he could climb up there if he wanted to. There was also one attached to Mother and Father Bear`s bed, it been put there by Mother Bear. Some nights when Father Bear was away and she sat up reading he`d visit and the two would talk. Sometimes if their talks went too long and the hour grew late Mother Bear would invite Ash to sleep with her, pointing out that there was more than enough room for both. Standing in his home and lost in thought, Ash admitted to himself that there had been nights when he`d been tempted to explore the sleeping Giantess. Out of respect he never did, he didn't want to destroy a friendship and more importantly he followed the Golden Rule :Don`t mess with another man`s woman.

'Welp,' Ash thought to Himself 'Time for another walk'

Putting on his poncho and tying a piece of sting around his waist, he stepped out onto the dresser.

"Where to today." he said to Himself.
14512112.title: Winter Solitude

145121121.content:
Today, he decided it was time to visit the bear cub. He hadn't done it in a while and he thought he'd check up on a few things. the Biggest issue during the construction of the house he lived in was heat. A fire simply wasn't an option. Even a Candle lit in the center of the dwelling would not last the whole winter. Ash devised a method where heated air radiating from the mattress under Little Bear could be brought into the home through a pipe from the Mattress to a hole in the center of the floor. Though the bears knew nothing of thermal heating, Ash assured them it would work. It worked better than he'd hoped, though the dresser had to be moved close enough to the bed so the pipe wasn't too long. This also made it easy for Ash to make his way onto Little Bear's bed if needed.

A rope bridge stretched the chasm between the dresser and the bed. It had been made by both Ash and Little Bear in case the micro human wanted to visit. Course the times he did, the cub was in deep hibernation and was not aware of him. But that was was just fine, after all deep sleep was very important to a growing cub's development. Ash had noted that the cub had grown slightly bigger than he'd visited last.

Outside the wind had begun to pick up. It was really snowing heavy now, and once he was over the bridge to the bed Ash made headed for the sleeping Giant. As he climbed up over the top of the blanket covered cub he made his way to where his head stuck out from underneath and slipped into the fur; thankful for the warmth that surrounded him. He'd started to catch a chill. Little Bear rarely changed positions and today he was on his side. Making his way down from the shoulder, along the collar bone, along the jawline, he ventured out into the cold air again to look up into the cub's face. No matter how many times he did this, the site of a Sleeping Giant Bear Cub never got old. Today, Little Bear's mouth Hung open slightly. Hot moist air blew out upon Ash with every breath.

An idea came to mind. One a few weeks ago he'd never consider. The word hot tub came to him. Now the concept of climbing into the mouth of a sleeping Bear Cub wasn't without risk, but the feeling of hot fluid on his skin was very tempting. Course he would have to stay within the safety zone of Little Bear's fur until he could dry off clothes and all otherwise he'd freeze to death before he made it back to his home.
145121121.title: The sleeping Giant.

1451211211.content:
Another chill wind blew past my small frame and my mind was made up. 'Ok this is risky but I'll be somewhere warm and comfy.' With my mind set, I began to strip, setting your clothes nearby so I could grab them sooner, except for my underwear. Then climbing back up on little bear until I reach his mouth and looking inside.

Little Bear exhaled and warm breath washer over me causing me to shiver in delight. Looking inside, his mouth was big for me to fit inside snugly. His tongue was big, thick and looked like a spongy bed. Sharp, young baby teeth, glistening with saliva, were very white. After staring for another minute I began to climb into the bears mouth.

Once my foot pressed into Little Bear's tongue, I let out a slight moan at the warmth, covering my foot and continued to climb inside. After entering, I then laid down and embraced the warmth of the heat from the small cubs inner body. Saliva washed over me as I laid there.

I was very comfy and discovered my eyes beginning to droop. While I was sleepy, I was also taking a risk. Little Bear may be asleep, but his sub-conscious may react to the foreign object in his mouth. Either I could stay and sleep in a very warm place and risk getting swallowed or climb out and live for another day.
1451211211.title: Climb into Little Bear's Mouth

145121122.content: Yeah, I know. Another Choice Chapter. Can't be helped.
145121122.title: Other Choice

choices: He wants Ash to tell him a story.
He has a Thorn in his Foot/paw
14512113.content:
From his home Ash looked out into the world he could never be a part of.

He had moved from Mother Bear's slipper since the time he'd arrived. His home was a wooden boat placed in a flower pot with green leafed plants towering above it like great trees. This was done on purpose. In the early weeks Ash had been plagued with dreams, mostly bad upon discussion with Little Bear's parents it was determined his dreams might have been the result of his brain trying to process the concept of everything being so big. To combat this, He needed some form of Normality. That's where the boat came into play. And whenever Mother Bear watered the plants in the pot, it sounded like rain roaring off the roof. It did remind him of the story of the Great flood each time she did it though.

The interior of the Boat was a one room structure with a pile of rags for a bed and not much else. Well, it wasn't like the tools were available for the giants Bears to build anything with great detail. It was the best that could be done given the nature of his size and he didn't complain. It did the job and it had given his brain a chance to adjust.

Then there was the problem of clothing.

He only had the clothes on his back, and as much as he cleaned his clothes in water provided he knew they would not last him. The big problem was the cloth the Giants used for their clothing was too thick and too heavy. With some trial and error cheese cloth turned out to be the best option. On this day he was wearing a cheese cloth toga with a thread tied around his waist for a belt.

He spent his days within the confine of Little Bear's bedroom except when in the presence of Little Bear or Mother Bear. In those instances he was transported from one part of the house to another. When it came to world that existed beyond the house, he dared not go.Not only could he easily get lost in the wilderness beyond, but there were countless predatory insects and arachnids who would make a quick meal out of the micro human. For those reasons alone staying inside suited Ash just fine.

It wasn't like he was bored, There was never a dull moment when it came to the giant bear cub , his parents, or his friends who would come over. He had to admit, it was uncomfortable at times to be stared at but at the same time he couldn't really blame them.

Looking through the bedroom window he watched Little Bear playing among the fallen leaves. He wondered what month they were in. The pumpkins in the garden were turning orange, so based upon that he calculated that it had to be at least October. Damn, he was going to miss out on Halloween. Well, the Halloween he knew anyway. The Bears had a tradition that was similar which involved costumes and was very much like Halloween, but it was it's own thing as well. Well, if he couldn't be home for his Halloween, maybe he could introduce a bit of it here.

He'd think about it later. He noticed drops of rain splashing against the glass of the window and he knew Little Bear would be inside soon. No doubt the Cub would want to play for a bit, or he might want Ash to tell him a story. He watched as Little Bear left his field of vision. A few moments later the cub bounded into the room.
14512113.title: A few Months Later

choices: The thorn came free and he tumbled down to Little Bear's Toes
The Thorn came free and the Foot jerked violently
The Thorn remained stuck. Have to try again.
145121133.content:
As Little Bear entered the room, Ash noticed the look of pain on his face and the limp.

"What's wrong?"

"There's a splinter in my foot."

Thirty seconds later Little Bear was on his bed laying on his stomach and Ash was walking over the surface of his central Pad looking for a splinter. Of course this wasn't the first time he had been this close to the Cub's foot/paw. Ash had examined the extremity a few times since he'd arrived. After all, it wasn't often the opportunity to examine a Bear's paw this close comes every day. Though he did have a thing for paws/feet, the previous explorations were purely scientific in nature.

Little Bear and his parents were not like other animals because they walked upright. The average Bear that he knew of could never do that for extended periods of time. The Muscle and skeletal structure simply couldn't keep the animal upright and supporting the bulk it's body. But here was a different story. Here there was a definite and noticeable difference. Even though the toes were still like a Bear, the overall shape of the rest of the foot resembled a human's. He wished he could get an X-Ray machine so he could get a good look at the structure of the Bone's and Muscles but if there were an X-ray machine big enough for to do the Job the radiation would most likely kill everything within a mile radius.

"Found it" Ash announced.

Embedded in the brownish pad almost completely was a thorn, about an inch in diameter. The tissue surrounding it was swollen and dark red as the body reacted to this intruder. Enough of the thorn was above the pad to allow Ash to get a hold of it. Grasping with Both hands he got ready to pull the foreign object clear of the Pad.

"On a count of three. One.....Two.....THREE!!"

Ash pulled with all his might. Then...
145121133.title: Dr Ash to the rescue.

1451212.content:
Later that night Ash found himself laying next to Little Bear staring up at the ceiling. While he was comfortable enough next to the bear cub's pillow there was one factor he hadn't considered.

Little Bear's snoring.

Oh to normal ears it wouldn't be an issue, in fact it would've been hardly noticeable to anyone in the room. For Ash it was a different matter. There was no way he was going to get any sleep.

"It was a good idea at the time," he said quietly to himself.

Ash got to his feet. Maybe some exercise would tire him out so much that it wouldn't matter. Ash looked at the living mountain under the covers and how the shape of his body made the terrain on the bed. It didn't look to Ash like the cub was going to move any time soon. Maybe a good hike was just what the doctor ordered.

Thinking for a moment, Ash decided to head--
1451212.title: Bunking up with Little Bear

145122.content:
"So, Little Bear, what kind of games do you normally do?"

The Cub thought for a moment "Well, there's tag..."

"Can't do that one," said Ash You'll catch me every time and I'll never be able to catch you."

"Then there's Hide and seek..."

"Same thing, I can hide in places you'll never find me and it'll take me forever to try to find you...Unless we change it up a bit."

"Change it?"

"Yeah. We play hide and seek only I do the Hiding and you'll have to look for me. But Just so we don't make it too hard for you to find me I'll tell you the spot where I'll go but not exactly."

"I think I know what you mean. " said Little Bear "So where will you hide first?"

"I was thinking hiding somewhere on you."

The cub raised an eyebrow in interest "On Me?"

"Yeah, I mean from where I'm standing your fur is like a forest. It would be easy enough to hide."Ash walked across Little Bear's Palm pad."Did you feel that?"

"Barely. Okay, Let's play! Here, I'll lay down for you."

Little Bear Laid down on this Back in the tall grass, then with great gentleness deposited Ash on his chest, and immediately lost him in a thick tuff of fur. 'This might actually work' he though.

"Okay, now how high up can you count?"

"Twenty. But I'll countdown slowly."

That didn't give Ash much time, but he liked a challenge."Okay, when ever your ready."

Little Bear closed his eyes. "One..........Two........."
145122.title: A new twist on Hide and Seek

choices: Take a chance and keep going.
1451221.content:
"...Three.........Four.........Five.........."
Ash made for one one spot where he thought He might have a chance to win, that being Near Little Bear's head. Preferably on his head but he wasn't sure if he could make it up the length of the cub's neck. He noted the rather thick tuff of fur covering Little Bear's Chest. He was completely covered in fur of course, but it was the fur at his chest that seemed the thickest and longest. This also made it exceptionally harder to get through without giving away his position. It was actually really strange to be treking through a forest of brown strands of fur while the "Ground" rose and fell, not to mention the Cub's voice vibrating through as well.

By the time Ash had crossed the area that he assumed to be the Sternum, the cub was already up to ten. He wasn't sure if he had enough time to make it to the Cub's head. If he ran, he could give himself away, it would be very easy for him to lay flat on the warm skin of Little Bear's chest and waited for the time to run out.
1451221.title: Going North

choices: Mother Bear shows up wondering what Little Bear is doing.
1451222.content:
"...Three.........Four.........Five.........."

Ash made his way what he he assumed was south. Traveling down the length of Little Bear's Chest was more difficult than he thought it would be. Not only did he had to go through the thick fur but he also had to deal with the surface rising and falling with every inhale and exhale. It was like being on a boat during rough seas. He even lost his balance once or twice. He was certain the cub could feel his movements but then he wasn't overly concerned about winning either.

The rising and falling subsided telling Ash he'd finally reached the expanse of Little Bear's Stomach. The rise and fall was replaced with gurgling noises from beneath him. Deep Beyond his fur, skin and muscle the cub's digestive system was at work breaking down his breakfast or whatever it was he'd eaten last.

".......Nine.....Ten.....Eleven...."

Running out of time, he'd better hurry this up. Ash moved quicker, occasionally hearing a giggle. He didn't want to get caught right away so he forced himself to slow down just a little bit. Suddenly he came upon what he could only describe as a crater of sorts. A Belly Button? He didn't think Bear's had one. Well whether they had one or not Little Bear certainly did, and it made for a perfect hiding place.

....Seventeen.....Eighteen.....
1451222.title: Head towards his feet

14512221.content:
With no time to continue downward, Ash jumped into the fur lined crater. To say that there was a bit of a smell would be an understatement. Unless you were one of those whose button was inside out(?) it would be difficult indeed to keep perfectly clean. Well, he was only Hiding in the Belly Button, not living in there. Though that would make for a rather silly children's story.

"....Nineteen....Twenty!! Ready or not...." Little Bear paused for a moment. What was the appropriate phrase when someone was hiding on you? He couldn't say 'Here I come' because he was already there.

"...Here comes my hand!"

Ash sat perfectly still. Even though he was farther away he could still hear the rhythmic Thump of the heart somewhere North. He didn't dare look upward but he could hear and sense tree trunk like fingers parting fur as Little Bear searched for him. There was a chance Little Bear did know which direction he went given the number of small giggles he heard come from the cub. Then again, maybe he just might win.

Then a shadow fell over him, this time he did allow himself to look upward. Hovering above his spot was a huge hand/paw. It looked as though he'd lost the game.
14512221.title: Ash Quickly jumbs in.

145123.content:
"Before we do do anything, could I ask you a question? Where am I? What is this place?"

Little Bear seemed amused by Ash's question "We are in a Forest."

"I know but--" Suddenly something floated past Ash's head "What was that?"

Little Bear giggled "That's a leaf. You don't have leaves where you come from?"

"Not THAT big." Ash looked all the way down to the ground thankful that the cub had a firm grip on him. Sure he was immoble but at least he didn't have to worry about falling. He spotted the leaf near Little Bear's feet/paws, a maple leaf that had turned reddish brown. Looking about he noticed other trees that had leaves changing colors and falling away. It was fall here, but where Ash came from it had been summer and he'd dressed for summer. He'd begun to notice the chill in the air and was glad for the warm pads that pressed against him. Looking around some more he noticed a house off to the distance. Thought it was far away it was still big enough to make out the stucco, wood, plaster, and brick. He could also make out a garden and clothes line with various articles of clothing hanging from it.

"Is that your home?"

"Yes."

"Could we play in there? I feel a little cold.|"

"Okay."

Little Bear placed Ash in the palm of his hand/paw. Huge clawed fingers curled around him leaveing him in almost total darkness with the exception of a few beams of light that seeped in between the fingers. Then everything began to sway back and forth as Little Bear begain to walk. Ash listen to the footfalls amazed at how quickly the cub seemed to be move dispite his size. Most Giants he remembered reading about were always slow and lumbersome but not this cub who seemed to covering a great deal of ground in just a short time.

After a few minutes, there was a pause in the movement he heard the sound of a door opening. Three steps Forward. The door closeing. More footsteps. Another pause. A door opening. Three steps forward. A door closing. Then the fingers lifted away from him. Ash Blinked for a moment, then stood and looked about.

It was a room fit for a giant, no doubt about it. You could fit a small town in such a room, or most of it.

"Incredible." Ash muttered to himself.

"Would you like to play now?"

"Sure, Little Bear." said Ash "What would you like to play?"

Now It didn't occur to Ash that Little Bear might suggest something dangerous, after all the cartoon version of the cub was gentle like. But this was a flesh and blood being, one that might think and act differently and not consider the danger.

"Okay, how about--"
145123.title: "Tell me more about this place."

choices: "Do you want to play Monster Bear some more?"
1451231.content:
"Monster Bear? How do you play that?"

Little Bear lowered Ash to the wooden floor by his feet. The tiny human gazed upward and had to crane his neck backwards to look into Little Bear's eyes.

"Like this!"

To Ash's surprise he watched as the cub lifted one colossal paw/foot and slammed it down so close to the tiny human that the displaced air and tremor knocked him to the wooden floor. Ash looked up, stunned. What was the cub doing?!

Little Bear giggled "Better Run."

The Cub didn't have to tell him twice. At once he was up and running as fast as he could, but even he knew that wouldn't be enough. Not even an Olympic gold winning sprinter would be fast enough to out run such a giant. With a single stride Little Bear was upon him, his foot/paw slamming down on the other side of him. This time he was somewhat ready and didn't go off his feet.He stumbled but did not fall. He ran again, and after a few minutes Little Bear's other foot/Paw slammed down. This time Ash fell to his knees and got back up. He was loosing steam, he wasn't sure how much longer he could run. Finally he stumbled and fell on his face.He rolled over and looked up.

Little Bear held one Paw/foot over him. He had to admit, with the smooth brown leathery pads the cub's paw/foot looked quite cute. He looked up into the cub's face and wondered how he could be so cruel. Then he saw Little Bear smile, wink, and lowered the paw down on top of him.

It was not as he expected. He had thought there would be a moment of crushing weight, maybe pain and then nothing. What happened was that the leathery pad of of his toes lightly touched down on top of him. Ash looked up, studying the dermal surface for a moment before touching it. It had a soft texture to it, surprisingly so for a giant that walked about without shoes.

"Grrrrr! Got yah Bug!"

Little Bear lifted his paw away and crouched down on his knees "I hope I didn't scare you."

"I thought you were really going to step on me."

"Of course not, I was only playing. I do this with No Feet all the time. Did you like it?"

Did he like it? Well now that he knew that the cub was indeed not a homicidal terror he had to admit that it had been fun. Exhausting but fun.

"Yeah. Yeah I did."
1451231.title: "Monster Bear."

choices: Ash notices something stuck between Little Bear's Teeth.
1451232.content:
"Dentist? I just have to look at your teeth, right?"

The cub nodded.

"Okay. I think that's doable. *Clear's throat* Well, then, Step into my office. Oh, wait. You already have. Well, I'm afraid I misplaced my Dentist chair, so we'll have to make do with the Dentist Bed."

As Little Bear climbed up onto his bed and lay down, Ash couldn't help but feel a number of emotions. Nervousness, uneasiness, some excitement to be sure. He'd played the game before of course when he was younger, but not on this scale. The cub lowered his paw/hand to his chest and after sliding off the hand and making his way though a forest of brown fur the Micro Human stood a few feet away from the largest mouth he'd seen. Up to this point.

"Um, okay. Say Ah"

"AHHHHHH"

The great maw opened wide and a blast of humid air shot forth with enough force to blow his clothing back. He felt droplets of saliva on his bare skin. And for a moment he stood there staring into a mouth that could've swallowed him whole as easily as one could swallow a raisin.

"Well, everything look's okay to me."

Little Bear frowned slightly "That's not how you do it. You need to climb inside."

It took Ash a brief moment to recover from seeing a huge mouth produce words as close as he had been before it registered in his brain what Little Bear had said. Climb inside? Could he trust such a young cub to be that careful?Then again, there were probably people out there who would kill to get this opportunity.

"Okay, but I have to take some clothes off. I don't want to get them wet."

That, and he didn't want to get them ruined. He wasn't sure how his shoes would do getting soaked in saliva. They were waterproof but Saliva was more than just water. A minute later he had removed everything but his jean shorts and underwear. He wanted to keep a level of decency after all. Of course he's be shortless when he had to dry them but he was sure his he could cover himself up with his shirt.

"Okay, I'm ready."

Once more the maw opened wide. Ash climbed up the chin and up onto the dark bottom lip. He remembered watching a video of a Grizzly Bear eating a Go-Pro. The anatomy of the mouth before him was similar, but thankfully Little Bear's teeth were much cleaner and whiter. They were also small, sort of. They were all baby teeth. Baby teeth that towered over him but baby teeth all the same. Ash stood up on Little Bear's Bottom Lip, took one step on a lower tooth and landed with a splat face first on the tip of his tongue. So much for that graceful entrance.

As Little Bear lay there he felt the little human enter his mouth and was determined to be as careful as he could. He didn't want to hurt him, and even though he didn't know anything about digestion he didn't want to accidentally swallow him either. If he had, he didn't know how to get him out. Unbeknownst to him, his body was already reacting to the foreign body in his mouth. The moment Ash splat down on his tongue, the thousands of taste buds registered the saltiness of his bare skin and decided he was food. Saliva glands under the expanse of Tongue began to produce more Saliva. At some point, he was going to have to swallow, or druel on himself.

Ash, of course, was oblivious to all this as he crawled his way up the length of Little Bear's tongue toward one of his back Molars. Standing wasn't an option, every time he tried his feet would slide out from under him. It was a shame, he thought, that he didn't have a high definition video camera with him. If he ever got back home he could've sold the footage to National Geographic.

Suddenly
1451232.title: "Dentist."

14512322.content:
Little bear couldn't stand the taste Ash and closes his mouth, trapping the human in darkness. Ash was wondering what was going on, when the light was replaced by darkness. Then he heard what he was afraid of.

GULP, all the saliva that was built up, that he didn't know about was swallowed. But hr was carried along and Ash's legs were caught in Little Bear's throat. Ash called out to Little Bear, telling him to let Ash out but GULP, he was then trapped up to his waist and he heard MMMMMHH. Little Bear was enjoyong this!

"Little Bear please let me out." But Ash's words fell on deaf ears, GULP another swallow and Ash was in Little Bears throat. The muscle's of the throat were kneading and massaging him as he traveled down the throat, if Ash wasn't heading towards his stomach, Ash might've enjoyed himself. A final GULP sent Ash to Little Bear's stomach, hr began to sweat from the heat and banged on Little Bear's stomach, "PLEASE, LET ME OUT, I DON'T WANT TO DIE!"

For Little Bear he realized what he had done, but Ash beating the inside of his stomach felt So Good. And he still had the taste of Ash still lingered on his tongue, he then heard Ash's voice to let him out. Little Bear then decided to...
14512322.title: Little Bear Swallows

145123222.content:
"I'm sorry Ash, you tasted so good. I'm not gonna let you out. Think of it this way, you'll always be with me." Ash was horrified when he heard Little Bear's response and began to cry, BUURP. Most of the air was suddenly rushed out as Little Bear burped. And Ash hoped he would pass out to avoid the pain.

No such luck, after about 5 minutes, Little Bear's stomach began to fill up and and knead Ash's body, his body was battered and bruised by the ravaged beating. Ash knew digestion began when he felt his flesh begin to burn, Ash cried out in pain and hoped it would all be over soon, instead he was slowly digested away. Spending his last 10 minutes being digested alive, with his last breath he let out one final scream and died.

Little Bear knew Ash was gone, since he couldn't feel the human moving anymore. Little Bear saw Ash's shirt and hid it away. Keeeping it to remind him of his friend who would stay with him forever, unaware that Ash was in agony for his final moments. The next day Little Bear went about his life with his friend forever tucked inside and lived Happily Ever After.
For Ash though it was
145123222.title: Leave Ash inside

choices: Little Bear Suddenly Swallows (Ash is pinned between tongue and teeth)
Ash climbs out of Little Bear's Mouth
14512323.content:
Something caught Ash's eye. Something red and shiny. Something between two large Molars near the throat. Carefully he slithered on his belly towards it. The texture of the tongue combined with the saliva produced a unique sensation. It was difficult to describe the feeling, almost like being licked by a German Shepard or some other big dog, only scaled up. It wasn't accurate, but as close as he could get to what it felt like. As he got closer to the Object he realized it was a camera.

His heart skipped a beat. How did a camera end up in Little Bear's mouth? Had he eaten someone? A stupid question. It was obvious that he must have. But was he knowing, or unknowing? Ash looked at the way the camera had been lodged in between the Molars. It was battered, but it didn't look to be in not too bad a shape. It also looked to have been deliberately lodged in there. As though someone had slid past and shoved it in there as he or she went. The lens of the camera was pointed toward Little Bear's throat. As though someone wanted the last moments to be filmed.

Curiouser and Curiouser

Ash dislodged the camera and slipped it into his slimy pants. He would examine it later. He slid his way back up to the tip of Little Bear's tongue. As he did so he admired the view from inside the organic cave. He thought at first that he was the only one who had ever seen this sight, but quickly remembered the camera. There was no point in letting on that He had found anything. He didn't want to upset the cub, so instead he would keep it to himself. For the moment.
14512323.title: A discovery between Little Bear's Teeth

145123233.content:
Ash cleaned up the camera the best he could using his shirt. So much for keeping it clean. He sat in the moonlight. His Shorts and underwear drying. This of course left him in the nude, but he made sure Little Bear was Asleep before stripping. He didn't know how good the cubs eyes were to pick up the little details of his anatomy, and even if he couldn't Ash didn't feel comfortable about wandering about like Austin Powers.

The Camera wasn't like most cameras he'd seen before. It was built rugged so it could take the punishment. It wouldn't have surprised Ash if the casing was made of of magnesium like the military grade laptops he had read about. The paint was chipped away and worn but it looked to be in working order. Experimentally, he pressed the on button.

To his surprise the back screen lit up with the camera's brand logo. It still worked. More interesting than that, the battery looked to be half charged. Maybe there was a timer set up so it would automatically shut off after a while.

The camera had dozens of pictures as well as video. The first pictures were of dogs like German Shepards, more specifically their open mouths. A lot of close ups. Then there were pictures of this world. Pictures of Little Bear's home, the interior, pictures of him and his family eating. Close ups of their open maws as they were about to eat something. This person, whoever he or she was, certainly had an obsession with mouths.

'No,' thought Ash as it suddenly dawned on him. 'Not mouths . VORE'

Vore, the desire to be eaten. While he enjoyed exploring the interior of Little Bear's mouth Ash certainly didn't like the idea of being swallowed and dissolved. But he knew some people would relish the thought of fulfilling that fantasy. But could someone really take it that far? To willingly get himself eaten knowing that it could mean death? The answer of course was yes, but why the cub? Why not his mother or father?

The Answer was in the videos he began to watch.
145123233.title: Later That night (Camera examination)

1451232331.content:
Andy held the camera to eye level and spoke into it.

"My Name is Andy Hawkins. Twenty four hours ago I was driving home from a camping trip when something amazing happened. As of this moment I am no longer on Planet Earth."

He panned the Camera way from his face and around his surroundings. He was surrounded by huge blades of grass and wild flowers "Grass doesn't grow this big on Earth. That's not the only thing that's big around here. I just saw a Butterfly fly overhead, It must've had a wingspan of forty feet at least!!"

He pointed the camera to his car. What was left of his car. 1996 Ford Escort lay on it's wheels, it's frame bent and the airbags deployed. "The car's totaled so I'm going to salvage what I can. I--"

Rumble

"What was that?"

RUMBLE

"The ground is shaking, I've seen Jurassic Park enough times to know what that could be"

It got Dark as the shadow of something large blocked out the sun. Instinctively Andy pointed his camera skyward as a huge Bear leisurely stepped over him and continued on his way. Another twenty feet and he might've been crushed under one padded heel.

"Holy Shit!!! Did I get that on Camera?!!" I gotta check....Holy Shit!!"

Andy played back the video he had just recorded and paused it. It was a Bear, a Gigantic bear that walked on two legs. Holy shit that had been close. And yet, it was exhilarating. Not at all scary. How tall was it? Two, three,four hundred feet? Putting the camera in his pocket he climbed up a flower stem until he could see over the grass. The Bear was walking toward a house. A huge stucco, wood, plaster, and brick house. It took a moment for his mind to register what he was looking at. Then he quickly climbed back down to the ground. Opened the rear hatch of the car and started to collect his stuff together. He couldn't carry everything, but he'd come back later.
1451232331.title: Andy's video Diary Part one.

14512323311.content:
"Okay, It's been a few days so here's your update"

Andy panned the Camera "I've set up a base of operations inside a bedroom wall. I pulled out the seats of my car to make a bed, it's not bad to sleep on. I've got my camping equipment setup so I have some lights. I'm using the batteries sparingly until I can get the solar panel rigged up. I've stripped all the wiring out of the car so I should have enough to run to the outside. I've also set up a water collector outside, the morning dew is like nothing I've seen before. Food is an issue. There wasn't much left after my camping trip, I wasn't counting on this happening. But It's not a problem I can't solve."

Andy walked down the length of the wall interior. He heard voices that got louder as he got closer. He approached a crack in the wall and stuck his head and camera out into the room on the other side.

"There's three Giants living here. The one I followed here was just a child. Look at the size of the mother and father."

He zoomed in on the Bears as they were having their Breakfast. He focused on the one dressed in pink shirt and blue skirt with a white apron. "Look at how much food they are eating." He zoomed in on her mouth, he kept the camera steady as she opened her mouth to take in a mouthful of food "Look at the size of that mouth!! I bet if I were in her meal she would easily swallow me whole without even noticing!"

He stopped for a moment and though to himself "Yeah, she wouldn't know at all." He moved the camera to the other giants pausing and focusing on their mouths as they ate.

"It's like a dream come true."
14512323311.title: Andy's video Diary Part Two.

choices: Andy's video Diary Part Three Four.
145123233111.content:
"Day five. I just saw a Giant Girl."

Andy sat on his bed, listening to the playtime that was going on beyond the wall. It had been completely unexpected. Up until this point he never would've guessed that there would be humanoid life in this world but there it was. He stood up and pointed the camera out of the thin door he'd just made in the wall.

"She's Taller than the Bear cub. From what I've been able to Gather her name is Emily. She's probably not much older than 7. Maybe? I cant tell."

He watched as the cub and the girl played together as though it was the most natural thing to do. He had to remind himself that here in this place it was the most natural thing to do. Emily was dressed in a blue knee-length dress with short, puffy light blue sleeves and a dark blue-green trim. She also wore dark blue-green striped socks with a light blue headband and brown ankle-length boots She smiled and laughed. Andy panned the camera up to zoom in on her face.

"Despite her size, she looks like a normal healthy Human girl. Cute too."

He zoomed in on her laughing mouth noting how her teeth were unblemished. All baby teeth of course. He held the camera for a few minutes to record how her tongue rose and fell as she laughed, then turned back to the interior of his camp. He wasn't even sure why he had recorded her. Out of habit he supposed. He'd been doing a lot of mouth recording in the last few days.

He turned the camera away from the playing giants and pointed it toward a makeshift table. "I've been working on something." He held up a length of makeshift rope. "I've got almost enough to climb onto a bed. I need to get a closer look at theme. The Zoom on this camera can only do so much. The Grappling hook is almost ready too. Maybe another few weeks. Doesn't matter. I have all the time in the world. "

He panned to a Solar Panel "Setting up the Solar power tomorrow. If It works I'll be able to review some of this footage on my laptop. I haven't been using it on account I don't want to kill the battery. Better shut this off too, just in case."

Andy pointed the camera to his face.

"I'll record another entry in a few days."
145123233111.title: Andy's video Diary Part Three

1451232331111.content:
"Hey hey! Check it out!"

Andy filmed the lighting he'd rigged up around his camp. He had pulled out the headlights from his car and had hooked them up to the car battery. Also connected to the battery was a converter he had bought to charge his laptop while he'd been camping.

"Solar panel has been working perfectly. I can charge my stuff by day and use it at night. McGyver would be proud." He pulled the carpeting away from his doorway to look out into the Bedroom beyond. "Speaking of Night, it's night time here. Late too, around twelve. Little Bear is Asleep. Yeah, that's his name. The Girl called him that. I wonder if that's his real name or just a nickname? When he grows up will they still call him Little Bear? I'm thinking way too much."

He walked over to where he had his rope and the grappling hook he had made from parts of his car jack ."I'm all set to go up. I'm setting my camera to night vision so shouldn't be noticed."

Andy collected his gear and stepped out into the vast bedroom.

It was the first time he had gone out into the open, oddly enough he wasn't afraid. Cautious, Yes, but not afraid. Putting together a lighting system and rigging up a way to charge his batteries would've seemed foolish and a waste of time had anyone knew what his intentions were, why go though all that trouble if he was planning to get himself killed? Andy however would not be the one to rush into it. If he had only one shot at this he was going to make it the best, and that meant careful planning and scouting. Which was why he was about to scale Little Bear's bed.

He stood at the foot of the bed listening to the cub's deep breathing. Confident that he was asleep, Andy uncoiled the rope he had made and held the hook. He swung it a few times and let it go in an upward arc. It took him several tries before the hook hooked into the fabric of the blanket. Not quite as high as he had hoped, but high enough. It took him longer than he had expected to scale the side of the bed, especially since he had to climb the rest of the way without a rope. He panted and sat at the edge until he could catch his breath before making his way toward Little Bear's Head.

What a sight to beheld.

Andy remembered seeing a Humpback Whale while on a boat tour and he thought the fifty foot long mammal would be the most impressive thing he would ever see up close. That was nothing compared to this creature that wasn't done growing. Little Bear slept on his back and the human's heart raced in his chest as he climbed up onto the sleeping giant.

He stood before Little Bear's face and was disappointed at first that his mouth wasn't open. Then, as though on cue, The cub Opened his mouth wide as he yawned in his sleep.
