Immediately, Andy began to take picture after picture even as the vacuum effect of the cub breathing in threatened to suck him into the very Maw he was admiring. The flash of the camera illuminated the interior with every picture revealing detail that he never would've dreamed possible. Then it was over, Little Bear's mouth was closed once again. For a moment Andy just stood there. He could've jumped right in at that moment. It would've been so easy, he would've achieved what others like him would only dream about.

Suddenly, Little Bear's nostrils twitched. Then Flared as he smelled something. It took only a moment for Andy to realize the Cub was smelling him! He guessed he really hadn't been keeping up with his hygiene like he should've been in the last week or so. He backed away and hurried back to his rope before his sent woke the Cub up.

Back at base camp he reviewed the video and photographs he took. He paused at one perfectly shot photo of the interior of Little Bear's Mouth. He traced the ridges of the upper pallet and stared down a throat that seemed to go one forever, and wished he had some way to post it online. Well, online back home. If the guys at the forums would've loved to have seen this one. If they could see him now. They would be so jealous at the very idea that he had the opportunity to live out a life long fantasy.

Andy looked about at his hard work. Some of them would've wondered why would he even bother to go though all of this if he was just going get himself ....you know. The answer was simple, he needed the right time. The right opportunity. He only had one shot at this. Until that opportunity came, he had to live. Who knows? Maybe someone else could benefit from his hard work.
1451232331111.title: Andy's video Diary Part  Four.

14512323311111.content:
"It's Day...whatever. "

Andy spoke into his camera feverishly. He was unkempt and in need of a shave. None of that mattered to him. In the time since he had climbed up the cub's bed and taken the pictures things had turned for the worst. A spider had gotten into his base of operations and had made itself at home. He had managed to kill it but had decided to move to a better spot. In the process of moving he lost almost everything. He had waited until they were out of the house to make his move, what he hadn't counted on was one of them coming back.

He had moved his laptop and blankets to the new spot and was in the process of dragging over the rest in a makeshift cart when the door opened and the Mother walked in. He had just barely managed to dive into a crack in the floor before the colossal foot came down. There was an earth shaking THUD and a crunch. And just as quick as that most of what he had was crushed and pulverized. Without a means to charge his laptop and camera he had been using both sparingly.

"Things haven't been going well for me, lost my stuff. I won't go into why, I don't have enough power to go into details. That's not important. I think today's the day. I heard them planning a picnic, and the Mother's been baking a pie. That's how I'm going to do it. I'm going to use the last of the power in my laptop to charge my camera. Not saying anyone will ever find it but whoever wants it it's yours. Maybe you'll make a documentary out of it."

* * * *

"Welcome Back. I made it"

Andy panned the camera around. He was standing on a colossal cherry pie. Above him like a canopy was the checkered cloth keeping the pie warm.

"A bit tricky, but I made it just in time. I'm in a basket and it's being carried. So for those of you watching at home, I'm going to jump into this pie. One of the three are going to have an extra intermediate in their slice and it doesn't matter to me which one. "

Andy walked to the center of the pie and held it up to his face one last time.

"I'm leaving the Camera right here. I'm not taking it with me. Maybe it'll avoid being crushed between teeth and maybe it won't. Maybe someone will find it, far fetched I know but then a few weeks ago so was this."

* * *

That was it. No last words. Andy had placed the camera still recording down on the pie and walked off. The last sight of him was jumping into the pie filling. What was recorded after was the pie being sliced up, followed by a fork and a shot of the inside of little Bear's mouth before the camera became lodged where Ash had found it as the chewing began. He could hear Little Bear moan "MMMMMMM" and the recording ended.

"Well Andy, I hope you got what you wanted" said Ash. He shut the camera off. He wondered who Ate Andy.
14512323311111.title: Andy's video Diary Part Five

145123233111111.content:
Andy lay up to his neck in the hot and sticky filling of the pie. Above him the cloth had yet to be uncovered. Scattered among the cherries were his clothes. He wanted to feel everything that the giants had to offer. His heart pounded in anticipation. Then the cloth was lifted away, and then came the colossal blade of a knife as the pie was divided. The slice he was in was placed on a plate and then lifted toward a face.

Yes! It was the mother!

Her dark brown eyes were looking down toward him, but not at him. Her focused was on the pie she held in one hand. Then Andy saw a flash of silver as the fork came into view. Andy was a bit disappointed that as the fork dug into the pie and lifted it's first mouth full that he was not on it. He watched it disappear between black lips. Mother Bear smiled and chewed slowly. Somewhere beyond his field of vision he heard the cub go "MMMMM" Andy turned his attention back to the Mother in time to hear her swallow. He couldn't wait to be apart of her.

The fork came again. This time it buried itself behind Andy, he heard and felt crust give away and he was lifted upward. This was it! The Mother Bear's face grew larger in his field of vision, and then her mouth opened to receive Andy. It was a mouth that was twice the size of the cubs. Large enough to swallow twenty humans the size of Andy. The tongue dipped in anticipation as the fork with it's payload passed the threshold that was the lower lip and teeth. Andy took it all in, bathed in it's glory. Then it all became dark as the mouth closed.

He heard the fork scrap against teeth as he was pulled from the mouth, the bit of pie lay momentarily in the center of the tongue before chewing began. Aided by the occasional slivers of light between lips and teeth, Andy quickly made his way to the surface of the tongue even as it pushed pie between molars. He fell upon the tongue even as everything was turned to pulp. He pressed himself into it, burying his face among the taste buds. The pulp that was once pie built around and on top of him but he didn't care, the tongue felt amazing against his skin. He didn't want it to end.

Then there was a loud GULP and he was pushed downward.
145123233111111.title: Mother Bear

1451234.content:
As Ash looked about this vast bedroom something caught his eye. “Little Bear, what is that? Up there on the shelf.”

The cub turned in the direction the micro human was pointing. “That’s a boat Father Bear gave me. Would you like to see it?”

Without waiting for an answer, Little Bear reached up and grasped the wooden sailing vessel with one hand/paw. With carefulness not expected from a creature on his size he placed it down in front of Ash. Ash could tell right away that this wasn’t an ordinary wooden toy.

”Where did he find this?”

”He said it came up in his net. I don’t remember what he called it-“

“Schooner. It’s a schooner”

The mast, sails, and rigging were gone but there was no mistaking it. The wood was old but he could make out her name carved into a plank .It was called the Alice May. A sea faring vessel made by human hands, and had ended up in this strange land much like he did. Walking around the ship Ash didn't see any holes in the hull that might've caused it to sink, but compared to the scale of waves normally faced by such a crewed boat even a calm sea would’ve swamped the schooner.

“Could you help me aboard?”

Ash grasped the Extended a clawed fingertip and held tightly as he was lifted and deposited onto the deck. He was pleasantly surprised to find the wooden planks still strong enough to support his weight. It was in remarkable condition, all things considering. Little Bear watched Ash walk across the deck with great curiosity. He had imagined what it might be like to walk the decks himself but it was another matter to see someone actually do it.

Ash came across the hatch that allowed access to the interior. The hatch itself was long gone leaving the square hole and a stairway. He looked over his shoulder at the dark brown eyes that watched him before descending.

As he looked about he breathed a sigh of relief, there were no bleached white bones of the crew. Nor anything else for that matter. This part of the vessel was completely empty aside from some rope and bare bunks. It seemed that when she sank the contents were completely flushed out. There were two doors, one on opposite sides of the ship. He may find something there.
1451234.title: The Alice May

14513.content:
Pressed between two huge and warm leathery pads, Ash looked passed the claws into the face of Little Bear. He remembered a Movie once where a girl was being held by a giant Gorilla and she was screaming "Don't eat me!" The thought it was stupid, after all it wasn't like the big ape could understand her, and panic wasn't going to help her situation. Now, he looked up at the face and noted how big the cub's mouth was, no wonder she was screaming that. Unlike the actress, he was trying his best to keep his cool. No sense in making an embarrassing fuss if he didn't have too.

For a creature whose fingers were at least twenty feet long, his grip wasn't as bad as one would think. It was tight, but he could breath. He just couldn't move. Then the fingers loosened and with a yelp he slipped between them only to fall into the waiting palm pad. This was o Little Bear could get a better look at him. The creature was small. Not much bigger than a beetle. But it looked like a human.

Ash felt the hand/paw he was on rise up closer to The cub's face, the huge nostrils flared as he sniffed at the human. The gust of suction tugged at his clothes. He did this as second time, a third.Did Little Bear find his aroma pleasant? No, it was most likely he was picking up his sent. A bear’s sense of smell is 7 times better than a blood hound’s or 2,100 times better than a human. They also have an excellent senses of hearing, which is probably why The cub could hear him.

Little Bear's head tilted to one side, much like a confused dog. The creature smelled like a human too. Ash wondered what he was going to do next?
14513.title: Little Bear  Examines  the strange creature.

choices: Ash gets licked up into Little Bear's Mouth
Mother Bear calls out to Little Bear (Supper time)
145131.content:
Ash looked up at the cub, trying to determine what he was going to do. He had a strange look on his face, as though he were debating what to do, then he saw the dark lips part. It looked as though he really would be eaten. His heart pounded in his chest as the mouth opened and drew closer. He breath quickened, he was sure this would be his end. A scream was rising in his throat but he forced it down. If he was to die, he would die with dignity.

The Tip of the tongue slipped out from between those lips like some huge serpent. It pressed him into the center pad of the palm and molded around him. Where his skin was bare, he could feel the taste buds tingle as they registered his particular flavor. When the tongue lifted away, Ash was covered in a thick layer of saliva.

'I've been slimed!' he thought to himself.

Little Bear pondered the taste of the tiny creature before him. A bit salty, But there was no doubt it was human, it looked like a human, it felt like a human, it smelled like a human, and tasted like a human. Who would've guessed that time he licked Emily on a dare would be useful. But where did he come from? Perhaps he should ask.

He looked about to make sure he wasn't being observed, then he lowered his face closer and whispered "Hello."

'Great.' Ash though as he wiped his face clean 'After covering me in goo NOW he wants to talk.' Well, there was no point in being hostile. After all, he wasn't the one who could crush him with one finger.

"Hello yourself," said Ash.

"I hope I didn't scare you."

"Scare me? Of course not." sure he'd been scared out of his wits, but no point in letting the cub know that.

"My name is Little Bear. Do you have a name?"

"My name is Ash, and you are the biggest Little Bear I've ever seem."

That confused the cub for a moment, until he realized he was a giant compared to the tiny. The more he thought of it, EVERYTHING was giant to him.

"Where do you come from? I've never seen anyone as small as you before. "

"Far away. I just woke up here."

"You are all alone?"

"Yes,"

"I could take you home."

Ash chucked "I'm sure you could, But I think it's too far for even you. I wouldn't even know which way to go." he shook the Saliva from his hands "I've really gotten myself in a mess this time. By the way, why did you taste me?"

"I wanted to be sure you were human. Sorry about that."

"Nah, it's fine. It's just not something that happens every day. Actually, once I got over my fear I thought it was kinda fun."

This made Little Bear think for a moment, the tiny human thought it was fun?

"Do you want me to do it again?"

Ash could tell from the look on the cub's face that he wanted to play. Playing with a mountain with fur could be dangerous. Then again, it wasn't like he had anything better to do at the moment. Heck, when was he ever going to get a chance like this again?

"You don't have any friends around here do you?"

Little Bear shook his head.

"Neither do I. So, lets play."

With that , the cub gave Ash another lick. This time more playfully. Then he licked him a third time.
145131.title: Taste test

choices: Let Little Bear take him out of his Mouth
1451311.content:
SLURP

Ash suddenly found himself in a dark, wet, humid place. It didn't take long though to figure out where he was. The Lower jaw dropped and rose, the tongue taused him about, and light illuminated the interior as Little Bear spoke.

"Oops. Sorry."

The vocal sound rose up behind him and vibrated through the mouth as the syllables were formed. It was as though Ash was getting an unexpected lesson in anatomy. As he sat on the tip of the tongue it started to slide forward out of the mouth and clawed fingers came into view ready to retrieve him. He almost didn't want to leave just yet. As dangerous as it might get inside a giant Cub's mouth, he couldn't help but find the situation kinda amazing. It was like something out of some interactive museum exhibit.
1451311.title: Ash gets licked up into Little Bear's Mouth

choices: "Is that your Mother walking this way?"
14513111.content:
Little Bear extended his tongue and plucked the human off the tip between his fingers, he had hoped his new friend wouldn't be too angry with him for being more than a little enthusiastic. He hoped he wouldn't get shouted at, even though in retrospect he could simply squeeze and silence the human forever. If he were of that cruel nature, which he wasn't. So he was unprepared for what Ash said next.

"That was amazing!"

"Huh?"

"Well, a bit scary at first, but afterwards Amazing!"

Little Bear gave the human a puzzled look, he had been sure the tiny would have been scared. Especially when he considered that a single tooth was twice as big as the human he was holding. That puzzlement had not gone unnoticed by Ash.

"Little Bear, I was in a Mouth. Your Mouth. No human has ever been in a Bear's Mouth before. A hand, maybe a face, but never a whole body! And certainly no Mouth as big as yours. I'm not saying you're a big mouth or anything but for your size compared to me, it's big."

The cub tilted his head in thought. When he thought about it that way, he could see what Ash was talking about.

"But weren't you afraid I'd Eat you?"

"If you had wanted me as a snack then I would've been afraid. Scared out of my wits even. But you made sure I stayed in one spot way from your teeth, which are very clean by the way, and nowhere near the back of your throat."

Little Bear thought for a moment "Do you want to go back in?"

Ash shook the gooy Saliva from his arm "Maybe later when I'm dried up a bit. I don't want to catch a chill. Hey, why don't you show me around the place?"

"Okay, where do you want to go?"

Ash looked about in the directions he could see, "Hmmm, how about...."
14513111.title: Let Little Bear take him out of his Mouth

choices: STand there waiting to be squashed
Emily spies something on the ground in front of her
1452.content: Ash stared up at the massive form of a little girl seven years old with brown hair carrying a doll in a red bonnet she called Lucy dressed strangely in a red and black striped bathing suit her feet huge how does he get her attention?
1452.title: Emily

14521.content:
Emily walked quickly along the dirt road, well as quickly as one could barefoot. Fortunately it had rained a little that day and the dust of the road was a bit softer than usual. Had she been there a few moments earlier she would've seen a flash of light just a few feet in front of her. But she'd seen nothing and wanted to meet up with her friends before it got too late.

Meanwhile, directly in her path, Ash stared in disbelief at the approaching Giant child. In his mind he refused to believe what he was seeing and he tried to rationalizes what he was seeing. 'It's a Dream' he told himself 'You're dreaming Ash, this is all a dream.' Even as the massive footfalls caused the ground to shake, even as the child's shadow fell over him, even as a cute but massive foot swung forward and began to descend upon him, he continued to repeat it was a dream until the very last moment. By then, it was too late. The last thing he saw was a dirty wrinkly sole and then it was pressing down all around him, pressing him into the muddy soil, pushing all the air out of his lungs.
14521.title: It's not Real. It's not Real.....

145211.content: At the last nanosecond of Ash's Existence, he acknowledged that what he was feeling was very real. But by then, it was too late to do anything. Even though the mud oozed around him, it did little to save him as his body was pulverized all at once. As Emily's foot lifted away, the muck was already filling in the imprint left behind covering his body. He would've appreciated the fact that at least he was getting a somewhat decent burial. Still, he was without a marker and without anyone to mourn him. No one would ever know that he had even lived. Sometime later while walking back, Little Bear walked in the very same spot, pressing his remains down even further.
145211.title: He's Dead Jim

145212.content:
There pain, and then there's steppedonbyagiantlittlegirl pain.Nothing like 25,000 pounds of flesh to wake you up to the insanity of this reality. If it had not been for the mud, he would've been past. Speaking of mud, it had been compressed all around him. If it had dried he doubted he would've had the strength to free himself. As it was, it took all of his efforts to free himself from the mucky tomb. After an hour he did manage to free himself at the cost of his shirt and shoes. Standing barefoot he looked up as the moon rose up over the lip of the footprint. Climbing out of the footprint in the moon lite night proved to be difficult because of the slippery mixture of the mud, but once out of it he sat down and pondered his next course of action.

Off in the distance was a glow, not unlike the one made by a lamp in the window of a house. He could make it but bare foot and tiny it would take half the night or longer. His only other option was to camp out here and try to make his way in this new world in the morning.
145212.title: Ash awakens hours later (Night Time)

choices: Emily stands up and heads toward Ash
1452121.content:
Ash woke up shivering. Despite his make shift shelter it had been a cold night. Had he the proper resources he might have been able to make a fire to keep him warm but he thought better of it since the glow could have attracted predators.

He hurt all over. A reminder of his current reality. Climbing out of his hastily created bush camp he peered out into the world. He could see the cabin much clearer than he had the night before. He could see smoke coming out from the chimney, and could smell something cooking as well. Bread maybe, or pancakes.

Yeah, pancakes maybe fifty feet across.

Ash looked at the cabin some more, then made up his mind while he drank dew water off a leaf. He knew it was dangerous to go there, but he also knew it was even more dangerous where he was. If the sun didn't burn him up, the awakening predators would.

It took hours to get there. By then the smell of food was gone. There was the chance of crums though so all wasn't lost. If he missed out on breakfast, he could always try for dinner or supper.

He approached the great door and noticed the gap underneath. It was quite wide, almost wide enough for him to walk under without hunching over. It would make the cabin drafty during winter unless something was placed under the door. Ash gave one last departing look to the outside world and walked under the door. Inside was a sight like something out of Jack and the beanstalk or Honey I shrunk the Kids. It was almost overwhelming.

He noticed a wooden staircase that lead up to the upper level of the cabin. Instinctively he knew that was where the Giant version of Emily slept. Something told him that if he was to make himself a home within this giant place that's where he had to be. Trouble was, there was no way he could climb the stairs. Like it or not he would have to hitch a ride.

He looked about. To his amazement Emily was on the floor near the couch playing with her doll. He could hide in a pocket and get climb off when the time was right. His only other option was Tutu the Dog who was sleeping in her usual spot at the fireplace.
1452121.title: That morning

choices: Forget the Plan, come up with something else
1452122.content:
Ash had never known fear like what he was feeling at that moment. Not only from the Huge structure he was walking toward, but also from the sounds all around him. It was an instinctive fear. A fear not felt since a million years in evolutionary history. Despite not wanting to feel this fear, it helped him quicken his pace despite the soreness of his bare feet or the pain he felt all over.

He approached the great door and noticed the gap underneath. It was quite wide, almost wide enough for him to walk under without hunching over. It would make the cabin drafty during winter unless something was placed under the door. Ash gave one last departing look to the darkness and walked under the door. Inside was a sight like something out of Jack and the beanstalk or Honey I shrunk the Kids.

Ash suddenly heard humming. It sounded like it was coming from a closed door. If his guess was right, that door would lead to the room that had the light. Ash could see the glow of ambers in a fireplace. The fire was going down but not out, and it illuminated everything in a reddish glow. It was just enough to light his way. With great caution he approached the door, at this point he could not only hear but feel the footsteps being made by whoever was on the other side of the door.

'No turning back now' he thought and walked under the door and into the room.

It was her, the one who planted him into the mud with a single step. There was no doubt that the girl who towered hundreds of feet above his head was Emily, though there were some differences considering he was looking at a three dimensional being and not two dimensional one. Even from where he stood near the door he could see the weave that made up the nightgown she wore,Every hair on her head, the dermal swirl pattern on the bottoms of her bare feet as she walked. It was not what he'd expected. Everything wasn't just big, it was scaled up, It was like seeing in high definition. For a moment he thought about running toward her shouting and waving his arms, but he reconsidered. He was in no shape for running and there was a very good chance She might not look down. The hard wooden floor would be far less forgiving than the Mud if her foot was to fall upon him this time.

He watched her blow out the candle and in the darkness he heard her climb into the big wooden bed. He in tern spent the first few hours looking for a place to spend the night, which he finally did in the closet.

Over the course of the next few days Ash spent his time gathering what food he could find and finding materials he could use. All the while observing Emily. Not in a voyeuristic sort of way, but to find out more about her, whether she was like her cartoon counterpart. He found out that more or less she was. He also noticed that she didn't look down when she walked, more that once he observed her stepping on an ant that had made it's way into the house. Ash wondered how she avoided some of the nastier things she could be stepping in.

By week's end , Ash decided he knew enough about her to try to get closer and get her attention. During the week he had gathered enough materials to construct a crude grappling hook made from the spiny shells of insects and a length of red thread to use for climbing. He knew the rope itself wouldn't be long enough to get him very far, but he figured it was long enough to hook the edge of her dress, or the edge of a blanket. For the rest of the journey he had crafted climbing hooks from the same material he used for the grappling hook.

Now he just had to decide, should be try to climb her while she was moving about or should he just climb the bed and wait for her.
1452122.title: Head for the light

14521221.content:
The next day Ash waited under the dresser for Emily to show up. He had studied her habits enough to figure out that she always stopped in front of the dresser for a few moments to collect her doll. He had to admit it was a small window of opportunity. He didn't have to wait long as he saw her booted feet approaching. As soon as she stopped moving he ran out from under the dresser, spun the grappling hook and released it upwards toward the hem of her dress.

He Missed.

"Shit" he muttered as he coiled up the thread to try again. Time was running out. He tried again. This time the hook stuck firm. Without giving a test tug to see if the hook would stay, he Immediately started climbing the thread, and not a moment too soon as Emily was on the movie again. He held on tight as the thread swayed back and forth with every step. The whole thing had been a lot simpler in his head, to heck with climbing he was just barely managing to hang on for dear life!

Completely oblivious of the pearl she was causing ,Emily walked toward the front door of the cabin.

It was only when the 7 year old stopped to look at a bird in a tree did Ash have the chance to climb up the thread. His muscles burned with fatigue, but he couldn't stop until he was at least on the hem of the dress. Once he was there, he took the climbing hooks that he had hanging around his neck and slipped them onto his forearms. Emily was soon on the move again, but this time he was in a more comfortable position. Climbing was still almost near impossible, and Gods forbid it if she decided to skip, but he slowly inched his way upward. By the time Emily had reached her destination, the home of her friend Little Bear, he had managed to climb almost to her waist. Not bad considering her movement and the fact she was a good four hundred feet tall by Ash's scale. He was exhausted though, his muscles were almost like rubber. He wasn't an athlete by any stretch, and he was lucky to have made it as far as he had. If it were not for the hooks hooking into the thick weave of the dress, he doubted he'd have done it at all.

Now, without having to deal with the sway of Emily's Legs, it would be better. But, now which direction should he take? Should he go around the back of her, or her front?

1452122111.title: She's looking right at him!

choices: Make you ride in my boot
let my friend play with you
14521221111.content:
"Well then" Emily said as she held Ash between thumb and finger "If you won't grant me my wishes, then by the rules that makes you Mine."

A chill ran though Ash "What do you mean?"

"I mean" Emily brought Ash closer to her face "You're mine. To do with as I please. Oh I'm going to have soooo much fun with you. "

No. This wasn't supposed to happen. She was supposed to be nice and willing to help him. This Emily saw Ash as a playing. A pet. This was a mistake, he should have stayed as far away as possible. He should've stayed hidden, or found someone else to get help from.

"Don't worry. I'll be nice." Emily broke his train of thought. "But if you break the rules, and make me Angry...."

To prove her point she began to apply pressure. Ash let out a sound that sounded not unlike a squeak as the air was forced out of his lungs and he felt his body begin to compress. Then the pressure was gone. Emily had made it clear what would happen if he got her angry. Maybe even worst things could happen.

"P-Please." Ash gasped "N-no more."

"Don't tell ME what I can't do."Emily growled. If Ash could've cowered he would have. Then her expression softened "But I think you've learned your first lesson."

She gently rubbed Ash between her thumb and finger. She had once grasped a beetle like she held the tiny person, it had felt hard and ridged while Ash felt kinda squishy. Truth be told, she really wasn't being mean on purpose. She just wanted this little fairy to grant her the wishes as were the rules. She might be a little rough and maybe frighten him but all in the goal of getting her wishes.

"I was on my way to my friend's house, but now that I have you I think I'll---"
14521221111.title: Emily's New Pet

14521221112.content:
"Prove it."

Ash Blinked "What?"

"Prove to me that you're really a tiny human."

"Prove it? Look at me! Here--" Ash removed his shirt and turned around "Do you see any wings?"

Emily squinted "No."

"There see? Human!"

"You could be magically hiding your wings!"

"I'm not magically hiding anything! Hey!" Ash watched as Emily picked up his discarded shirt between her thumb and finger " Give me that back!"

"Not until you prove you are human" said Emily with a smirk waving the tiny piece of fabric between her fingers.

This was going nowhere. No matter how much Ash tried to offer proof, the 7 year old had a way of turning it around. He was starting to loose his patience, but he had to keep reminding himself that loosing his patience with a 300 foot tall or more giant child probably wasn't the best thing to do. Not to mention Emily was growing equally impatient.

"Okay then, If you are really, really Human, how did you get on my shoulder if you didn't fly and land?"

"I climbed."

"You climbed. All the way up to my shoulder? Prove that!"

"Well, I used these." Ash held up the hooks he had made "And my grappling Hook is probably still hooked onto the seam of your dress."

Emily looked down and noticed the tiny hook and thread. She grasped it between her fingers and studied it. Would this finally be enough to convince her that he was Human?

"W-What?!"

Without saying another word Emily angrily kicked her boots off and placed a bewildered Ash on the floor. He couldn't believe it, was she really going to step on him for the sake of a few silly wishes that he couldn't even grant in the first place? He got his answer sooner than he wanted as Emily lifted a foot over him. He looked about for a means to escape, to get away from this crazy kid and her crazy talk about wishes. There was none.

"Give me my WISHES!"

"I can't grant wi--"

She didn't give him the chance to finish. Her foot was down upon him before he had the chance to even make a scream. The weight of the clothed damp appendage pressed him to the floor and held him fast. Emily felt him pinned under the ball of her foot. Her intent was not to hurt him but to frighten him into giving her what was rightfully hers. After all, those were the rules and she had caught him fair and square. Any fairy who didn't hold to that agreement was a dishonest fairy, and she was going to get those wishes out of him whether he felt like giving them to her or not. This notion that he was a tiny human was nonsense to her 7 year old mind.

The only thing she had managed to do was to terrify the tiny human. Ash hadn't realized what it was like to be on the receiving end of a foot step. He promised himself if he ever got out of this he'd never so much as step on an ant. If he got out of this, which was starting to become highly unlikely. He could barely breath and what's worst, it seemed as though she was applying more weight to the foot, whether consciously or unconsciously Ash had no idea.

"Well? Are you going to give me what's mine?"

Ash could barely make a sound that was loud enough to be heard.

14521221112221.content:
You don't know fear until you've seen something like a mountain falling on you. That's exactly what happened to Ash, only it was a mountain of flesh and bone dressed in a blue dress. If it wasn't for a split second decision on his part to fall on his back there was little doubt that he would've been crumpled up like an accordion of blood and gore.

Not that his current situation was any better for him. He had Who knows how many tons of Emily on top of him and if it wasn't for a fold in her dress there would've have been any breathing room. If you call your chest rising a fraction of it's full capacity breathing. It was horrible!

He heard Emily saying something but he couldn't make out what it was, it was all muffled. He would've tried to scream out a reply if he could get a full breath of Air.

Emily sat on her bed with a smirk on her face. Serves him right for not granting her what she wanted. Of course, she was also being very careful not to put her full weight on the little guy, she might've been only 7 years old but she knew that too much weight would crush him. She learned that lesson the hard way one day when she sat in the grass and crushed a beetle. It left a messy spot on her Dress and it looked like it wouldn't ever come out no matter how many times she scrubbed it in the brook. When she felt enough time had passed, she stood up.

Ash coughed and gasped in relief as he was able to get a full breath of air into his oxygen starved lungs. When the stars had disappeared from his vision, his view was replaced by Emily's face.

"Now, about those wishes you said you would grant me..."

Ash groaned, how the hell was he going to get out of this? He had agreed to grant her what she wanted and he had no way of doing it. But if he didn't agree, who knows what else she'd do to him? Worst yet, what would she do to him if he didn't deliver?

14521221113.content:
Ash suddenly felt the grip around him loosen as Emily let him drop into her palm. He was about to say something when he noticed the look on Emily's Face. It was a look that made his blood run cold. As he was about to find out, he really shouldn't have angered someone as big as Emily.

Emily looked down at him, her brow frowned, her cheeks getting red. The fingers of the hand he was in began to curl Menacingly.

"Grant me my wish, NOW!"

If there was one thing Emily lacked, or at least this version of her, it was patience. She waited long enough and she would wait no longer.

"P-please!" begged Ash, clearly terrified "I can't grant wishes! I just wanted---"

That was all he managed to say before the hand closed into a fist.

At first he was safe in a pocket with only slivers of light shining through cracks between fingers, but soon flesh began to press in all around him making movement impossible. Worst yet, Emily was slowly increasing the pressure. He didn't know off hand the grip strength of the average seven year old, but he figured at his size it was more than enough to cause him physical harm.

Emily looked at her closed fist angrily. How dare he not grant her a wish? She caught him fair and square! She was too mad to realize whether she was hurting the tiny creature or not. She didn't realize she was literally squeezing the life out of Ash.

He couldn't breath, air escaped his lungs but he couldn't breath in. Stars filled his vision as the flesh pressed harder and harder all around him. He thought for certain his rib cage would collapse and he'd hear the sounds of his own bones breaking before he died. As it turned out, it looked as though he wouldn't be conscious long enough to experience his final moments as he began to black out.

14521222.content:
Nah, climbing a moving mountain would be harder than he thought it would be. Not to mention extremely dangerous. He doubted even experienced climbers would attempt it. So he went with the much safer option, and as he scaled the side of the heavy blanket that covered the bed he was sure he'd made the better choice. Not that it was any less dangerous. It was a vertical climb almost from the very beginning. If it were not for his primitive climbing tools he doubted he would've been able to do it at all. Once or twice he'd come close to falling to his death and would have had it not been for the hooks clinging to the fabric of the blanket.

He was never so glad when he finally reached the top. He rolled over on his back gasping for breath. To think, he had wanted to climb Emily, what the hell had he been thinking?!

Ash had just managed to catch his breath when he heard and felt footsteps. From the sound of it, he could tell it was more than one. The door opened and Emily entered, but she wasn't alone. Emily and Little Bear walked across the room and sat on the bed, completely unaware of the Tiny human near her pillows.

"What do you want to do now?"

"How about we Jump on the Bed?"

"Okay."

"No! No, Not Okay!" Ash cried out, but his voice was too small to be heard by the two young Giants.

"I'll take my shoes off, and you dust off your Paws." said Emily slipping off her shoes. Moments later she was standing in sock feet on her bed.

"Ready?"

"Ready!"

With that, they started jumping. For a young child jumping on a bed can be a lot of fun, but not so much fun if there was a bug size person at your feet. Ash had no control of anything as he was bounced about in what he thought was a 10 on the rector scale. He didn't even have control over which direction he was going. One moment he was bouncing closer to Emily's socked feet and other times he was heading toward Little Bear's paws. If they didn't stop soon, he was going to get crushed under one or the other.

14521223.content:
As it turned out, Ash couldn't being himself to do either one. To be truthful climbing a giant or the giant's bed was a good idea in theory but it was frightful to execute. Not to mention life threatening. So Instead he put aside his climbing tools and decided to focus on surviving until a better time.

Days turned into weeks, and weeks turned into months. In that time he had struggled to stay alive. Searching for the essentials was a constant problem. To avoid getting stepped on he had resorted to foraging at night. Finding enough crumbs to eat wasn't a problem, bringing these chunks back to his shelter was.He could only gather food so many times due to the distance between the kitchen and his shelter. He did consider setting up a second shelter closer to his food source but there were no suitable locations. Collecting water was another problem that had to be solved. Without a bucket or something to collect water in he had to drink when he could and when the time was right. As a result he had gone for a day or more without a drink of water. A dangerous thing to do, which was made even more dangerous by the fact he had to climb up to the window via the curtain and drink the condensation from the window pane.

One thing he noted, while the cartoon Emily remained seven years old eternal, the giant Emily did not. In the time he had been there Ash witnessed from afar the celebration of her eighth Birthday. She was growing too. He'd noticed that as well. Maybe more so due to his stature.

All the while he kept his presence a secret, and probably would've continued to do so were it not for the change in the seasons.

He had noticed at first that it was getting colder in the nights. Almost freezing.Then when he looked out the window one early morning to drink the condensation off the window pane Ash noticed the change in the color of the leaves on a maple tree near the house. A sudden realization chilled him to the bone. It was Summer when he was transported to this world, The change in the leaves indicated fall was beginning . After that would be Winter. A winter here would be devastating to someone of Ash's size. It would be like witnessing the Ice Age. With temperatures he wouldn't be able to handle with his lack of winter clothing.

The plan he'd put off for so long raised it's head. Ready or not, he had to get a Giant's attention.

Emily stopped, feeling movement from inside her suit. Reaching in she carefully removed Ash from the inside of her suit. "There you are. What were you doing in my belly button?"

"Who are you talking to, Emily?"

Ash turned and saw a young bear cub approach. His heart began to race as Emily lowered her hand for the cub to get a better look at him.

"Little Bear, I'd like you to meet Ash."

The Cub Addressed as Little Bear eyed Ash couriously "Is he a Goblin?"

"A Goblin? No, I don't think I am." said Ash looking into Little Bear's face "And for a Name like Little Bear you don't look very little to me."

"No, I guess none of us are." said Emily "Ash isn't from around here. He tried to explain but I didn't understand it all."

"Of course not," said Ash "You're just a little--I mean young girl. It would take a few more years of growing up to understand."

"Ash. Is it okay if I hold you?"

"Sure."

Little Bear extended a hand/paw. Then with much carefullness Ash climbed down from Emily's hand into the centre of the wide paw pad.

"Aren't you afraid of hights? I know I would be if I were climbing so high off the ground." said Emily.

"It's not the Height that bothers me." Ash explained. "It's the falling and hitting the ground part. Especially hitting the ground."

"You're so small I can barely feel you," said Little Bear "You don't weight anything at all."

"Good idea, It shouldn't take too long."

Little Bear placed Ash on the Dresser near the window, the warm of the sun was a little hot for his liking but at least he knew his clothes would dry quickly. He removed his clothes and spread them out, keeping only his Boxers on. They would have to dry on him. He didn't feel comfortable walking about in his birthday suit. Though Little Bear had no such reservations.

"Well, while we are waiting for them to dry, do you have any ideas on what we can do to spend the time?"

Indeed Little Bear did have a few ideas, one especially came to mind but he was nervous to ask.

"How about."
14522111111221111.title: Little Bear's Bedroom

choices: Ash Grabs Hold of Mother Bear's fur and ends up caught between her fingers
Ash manages to stay on Little Bear's head.
145221111112212.content:
Ash thought it over for a minute " Sounds like a good idea."

Little Bear lifted his hand/paw up to his ear, grabbing onto the long strands of reddish brown fur. Climbing up past the ear turned out to be not that hard at all,it helped when there were plenty of things to grab hold of and help along the way. The cub patiently waited for Ash to make his way to the thickest stuff of fur on the top of his head before deciding to move forward and turn the knob of the door.

"Ready?"

"Ready."

There was a great groan as the huge wooden door was pushed open. Looking up from out of the tuff of fur Ash looked on as Little Bear stepped into the house. Fortunately he had a good grip on some strands if fur when the cub took his first steps into the house, otherwise he would've toppled forward and rolled down the length of his muzzle. Maybe even fallen off his nose. The cub had only made a few steps into the home when he was greeted by his mother. Mother Bear was a true giant compared to Little Bear who only stood just at her waist. The Cub's head tilted back as he gazed up at his mother.

"Hello Little Bear. Had fun with Emily today?"

Ash held on tightly to keep from sliding backward down the back of the Cub's neck. He looked up and his breath caught in his throat as Mother Bear lifted her Hand. A hand bigger than Little Bear's and Emily's combined. It hovered overhead for a seconded or two, then it was upon him. Huge claw tipped fingers gently ran through the thick tuff of fur on Little Bear's head, a gesture she'd done a hundred times before. Fur and fur collided among the pillars of flesh and bone and in his attempts to try to stay on Little Bear's head Ash was unsure as to who's fur he was grabbing hold of.
145221111112212.title: Rideing on top of Little Bear

choices: Climb up to Mother Bear's Ear
1452211111122121.content:
It had taken only a moment for Ash to realize he'd grabbed the wrong fur.

His ears popped as he accelerated upward and away from Little Bear's head. With Earth shaking footfalls Mother Bear began to walk forward. Then came the swaying motion of her arm, the back and forth motion making it extremely hard for Ash to hang on. He felt like a mountain climber suddenly finding himself in the middle of an earthquake. As tired as his hands were getting from holding on so tightly a fall from his current height would be fatal, even if he survived he'd break every bone in his body and most likely be finished off by one perfectly placed foot fall.

"P--Please stop walking!" he cried out in a loud voice. Well, as loud a voice as he could muster.

Mother Bear walked through the home humming a little tune to herself. She didn't hear the cries of her tiny passenger clinging to her finger, nor did she even feel him. If she had she would've shown him some mercy and allowed him to ride in her huge palm. Instead she walked on to the living room and sat in her favorite chair as was her custom when the daily chores were finished. Some days she'd knit, but today she decided to read a book she hadn't read in some time.

Relieved to be finally not moving, Ash looked about at his surroundings. The title of the book held in the hand he clung to was "Gulliver's Travels". Appropriate. Well, he saw two course of actions. He could climb down Mother Bear's long Dress to the Floor and find Little Bear, or he could climb upward to Mother Bear's ear and make himself known. He wasn't too excited about that one as he really wanted to avoid the Adults for now simply because their size scared him more than the Children. Little too late for that one though.
1452211111122121.title: Mother Bear's Passanger

14522111111221212.content:
Climbing down may have been easier but still didn't make it any less dangerous for Ash. He still had to contend with Gravity for one thing, and although he had planned to slide down the incline made by Mother Bear's dress it turned out not to be practical as the huge weaves of material wasn't smooth and didn't really feel good bumping against his backside. At least it made it easier to climb as the material made perfect hand and foot holds.

It was a good thing too that he'd had some experience in mountain climbing, though he'd never tried a climb of this height without equipment. As much as he didn't want too, he forced himself to look down so he could see which way was best to climb down from this giant lap. He looked upward, Mother Bear was still reading away, it was then he noticed the name of the writer off the book. Odd, the Title clearly said "Gulliver's Travels" but the author wasn't Jonathan Swift. It was an Author he'd never heard of before. Ash wondered in this world who Had written "20,000 leagues Under the Sea"?

There was a sudden movement and the leg that was under the long dress shifted. Ash looked down and saw Mother Bear's foot sticking out from under the edge of the Dress. It was right where Ash had planned to climb to the floor. This complicated matters as now He had to either find another rout around which would take time or risk making his way over Mother Bear's foot to the floor.
14522111111221212.title: Going Down

145221111112212122.content:
As he reached the edge where fabric met fur, Ash considered what he was about to do for the hundredth time. Was he really ready to do this? Not really but what real choice did he have?

"Here Goes nothing," he said quietly before jumping in among the thick strands of fur.

He immediately didn't know where he was. As the fur went well over his head. Despite being on a foot he was please it had a much more earthy smell to it. A pleasant warmth radiate upwards from the fleshy surface he was standing on. He was convinced that it could be snowing and he'd be quite toasty among the fur. He crept quietly and carefully through the fur as to not draw attention or cause an itch that would be in need of a scratch. He still wasn't sure where he was but he figured he'd eventually come out some---

Ash suddenly lost his footing as he expectantly found himself sliding down a sharp incline, but his side was cut short as two mounds of fur and flesh closed in around him on his left and on his right. with most of his body held firmly between these hills of flesh, Ash suddenly realized where he'd slipped in between Mother Bear's toes and were now caught between them. Whether his slide had triggered a conscious or unconscious response he had no way of knowing. Even though he was being held by powerful digits he hadn't been harmed and he stayed motionless, hoping she'd let him go.

That simple wiggle only tightened its grip onto him, who couldn’t even move a finger as he finds himself pressed up into the base of that warm canyon. 1452211111122211112.title: Its closed no way to escape

14522111111222111122.content:
‘Just a few more steps.’ Ash thought, ‘ A few more steps and —‘

“Emily, who are you talking to?”

Ash looked up toward the source of the voice, but all he saw was the leathery sole of a woman’s shoe before it came down upon him with a thundering BOOM.

“Oh, no one Granny.” Said Emily.

“Funny, I thought for sure I heard you talking with someone.” The older woman said as she tapped the foot Ash was under.

“I….I was talking to Lucy.” Emily quickly explained.

“Oh, I see. Well supper will be ready in a bit. I’ll leave you to your playing.”

The moment her grandmother left the room, Emily rushed to the spot where Ash had vanished under her Grandmother’s shoe. She didn’t want to see what she thought she would find, but she had to know.

Ash was sitting on the floor, his whole body visibly shaking. It was as though the world was coming toan end. He had been spared from death because Grandmother’s shoe had a heel lift. The full reality of the situation had hit him hard. If he had been standing a few feet more forward….

“Ash?”

Emily’s voice broke through the fear. He looked up at her, into her concerned face.

“Ash? Are okay?”

“I-I think I soiled myself.”

* * *

“Emily, I just can’t!”

“There’s nothing to be ashamed of. You have to get cleaned up.”

Ash was hiding behind a book, much like Adam Hiding from his creator, and he was wearing as much clothing. Which was none. Emily had convinced him that his clothes had to be cleaned, but she was having a very difficult time convincing him he needed a bath. She didn’t understand what the big deal was. Everyone Bathes.

“Emily, it is simply not appropriate for me to be naked in front of a lady.” Ash explained. “It’s not gentleman like.”

Truthfully, it wasn’t appropriate for Ash to be naked in front of a 7 year old girl. No matter that she was about four hundred feet tall.

Emily folded arms. “It’s not like I don’t know what Boys have. If you'er worried about that, You’re so small I can’t even see yours.”

‘Oh that makes things SOOOO much better.’ Thought Ash. Then he said “Where did You learn about that?”

“Granny told me. She thought I should know. Now come on, the water is getting cold.”

“Why can’t you bring the water here?”

“I’ll spill it.”

Ash doubted that very much. There was a moment of Silence. Then Emily said “What If I closed my eyes?”

“What?”

Emily repeated “What if I closed my eyes? I’ll pick you up between my fingers with my eyes closed and open them when I put you in the water. You’ll still be covered up.

He didn’t like the idea, but it was better than arguing. “Okay. Let’s do that.”

Emily lowered her hand down. As promised she closed her eyes. When she felt Ash touch the tip of her index finger she carefully closed her thumb and index finger together and opened her eyes. Held securely, and with his dignity intact, she lifted Ash up to eye level.

For Ash the sensation of his bare skin against scaled up dermal ridges of Emily's fingertips was different to say the least. Despite being covered up by the two walls of flesh he was never so glad when he slipped between them into the thimble of soapy water.

"I don't know about your undergarments but i'm sure you're pants and shirt are clean." they just need to dry."

A few moments later Ash was as clean as he could get without a proper bath towel. Grasping the thimble between her fingers she carefully emptied the water out of it and dumped Ash into a white handkerchief where she quickly covered him up with it.

"That wasn't so bad, was it?'" Emily addressed the cloth in her cupped hand.

"What do you mean?"

"Well, look at how big my legs are compared to yours." Ash explained "You'll have no trouble tagging me but I'll never be able to catch you."

The prospect of a story got the giant girl's interest. "What kind of stories do you know?"

"Well, I know such Fair tales of Jack and the Beanstalk, the two little pigs plus one--"

1452211111122211123.content:
*Edit* For those who want to watch the Story teller Episode this chapter is based on:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZYYXVe8i...

Ash decided to go way back to his younger days, to a certain TV show he used to watch. There was one episode he fondly remembered.

"...The Heartless Giant."

"No, I've never heard of it."

"Well, get comfortable,and I'll tell you the tale."

Emily lay on her stomach on her bed with Ash cupped in her hands. When he was certain she was ready, he began.

"On the whole, there's absolutely no need to be frightened by Giants. Giants are gentle souls, perfectly harmless, and very affectionate. Unless, of course, the Giant has no heart in his body. Think of all kinds of unpleasant things and add Giant to them and that's what you get when a Giant has no heart. Such a Giant once terrorized a county in the far north of the world, near the very top. He'd hidden his heart. It gave him too much trouble, all those Giant Feelings, too much pain. In its place was a wasps' nest. About to swarm.

"This Heartless Giant could shake a man and shuffle his wits. He could crack a skull with his fist like a walnut. And frequently did. Until, at last, the old King of that country, as good as the Giant was bad, trapped him in a giant trap and locked him in a cell. And there he would've remained, had it not been for a little boy. A young prince named Leo."

He continued while Emily listened with great interest how the Giant had tricked Leo into getting the keys to his prison, how his two brothers had gone out to find the giant and never returned. How he himself had gone look for his friend the Heartless Giant, how he had mended a bird, saved a fish and befriended a wolf. How he had come across the Giant's house with a garden filled with people turned to stone by the Giant, how he'd found his brothers among those who were now stone. How he had tricked the giant into revealing where his heart was, and how he retrieved it. And what had happened when Leo's brother, upon being restored to flesh and blood, had killed the giant by crushing the egg that had held the Giant's Heart.

"Where the Giant fell a hill grew. And in time, when much was forgotten, when many Kings had come and gone, the place was still known as the Hill of the Heartless Giant."

"But, he would've changed that Giant." said Emily, a little sad "He would've been kind,"

"Yes, cruel. " said Ash " Prince Leo lived to be a great age, became King, had forty-two grandchildren, and told them all that tale. But in his story the Giant got back his heart and made amends for all his wrongs. Because, you see, despite all that took place, a little boy once met a Giant and they became friends."

Ash looked out the distant window,"It's getting dark. I would imagine it's almost bed time for you."

Emily nodded, Then Asked
1452211111122211123.title: The Heartless Giant

145221111112221112321.content:
"What the Heck?"

How long he'd been asleep, Ash had no clue. But the next thing he knew there was a super loud rumble in his ear along with a powerful gust of hot humid air. Ash shook the cobwebs of sleep away in time for another loud rumble and powerful gust. It took him a few moments to realize what was going on.

Who would've thought a kid could snore that loud? It was like standing next to a jet engine with a cold. As his eyes adjusted he could see Emily had turned in her sleep and was now sleeping in an awkward position. Her mouth Hung open lightly and from there a rumble erupted rhythmicly . He shook his head. There was no way he was going to sleep like this. Anybody who had ever awaken to loud snoring would tell you how difficult it is to try to get back to sleep to that noise. Imagine trying to go back to sleep when the person snoring is bigger than King Kong? Down right impossible.

He thought about hiding under the pillow but decided against it as the idea of Emily rolling over on the spot he was under did not hold much appeal.Perhaps it would be better if he were to try a different place on the bed other than that side of the pillow? That could work. Anything was better than where he was.

Ash surveyed the bed. The way he saw it, he had two options. He could go the long way around and avoid Emily's sleeping form, or he could simply climb over her head to the other side of the pillow. That was the quickest route, but also the most dangerous. Should he cause an itch Emily might scratch. Or worst, Swatt.

145221111112221112322.content:
How long he'd been asleep he had no way of knowing, nor did he know how long he'd been trapped. But He'd awoken abruptly to find himself pressed up against cloth and flesh buy the slightly sweaty palm of Emily's hand. He didn't realize what it was at first because waking up like that had been disorienting. But a quick touch and feeling dermal ridges confirmed where he was. The sound of breathing and the rumble of a heart beat also told him that Emily had him pressed against her chest as she slept on her back. Just how he'd slept though that he had no idea.

The Hand above him heavily pinned him to Emily's chest. She didn't seem to be holding him in place intentionally but simply by the shear weight of a hand that had a palm that was twenty feet across. The air was getting thick as he exhaled, that and the weight of the hand making it hard to breath. Worst still, he didn't have much room as far as movement goes. In fact he was pretty much rendered immobile. His clothes were getting damp from the moistness of the palm. The moisture he knew was a combination of sweat and oils that produced finger prints. He was going to need to wash his clothes at some point, providing he could get out of this.

He had to get out from under her hand. But how? He couldn't really do much other than move a hand and turn his head. When he did that his face was pressed into the flesh of Emily's palm. And then it came to his mind, maybe he could tickle her palm enough to get her to move it off him. It was his only option, if he stayed under this mountain of flesh he was going to smother to death. He had a hand to tickle, but he also had another option. He remembered when he was kids putting his hand over his cousin's mouth. His reaction was to lick the palm of his hand which grossed him out. It could work.

He decided to do both. With his free hand Ash tickled the palm while he proceeded to lick at the palm above him. He noted that Emily's skin had a salty taste from the sweat, and an unusual texture to it. Though he didn't think his affords were effective at first, it did eventually have an effect. The hand began to move.

1452211111122211123223.title: Emily wakes up

145221111112221112323.content:
Ash was walking across a a white and very cold wasteland. He didn't have any idea how he got there, all he new was that he was freezing. It was as bad as that time he'd gone through the ice over lake Crystal when he was younger. He wrapped his arms around himself and walked to try to keep warm, but despite his efforts he was shivering uncontrollably.

The landscape was barren, completely deprived of life, except for him. Not even vegetation. Everything was white, and yet oddly enough the air smelled sweet. Like Vanilla. That should've given him a clue as to where he was, but he was too cold to think straight. All he wanted to do was find or build some kind of shelter and to get warm before ----

"MMMMMMMMMMMMMM"

The sound was so loud that even the very air vibrated violently. By all rights his eardrums should've exploded from the volume. He was bounced about and landed on his back. As he gazed up he was overwhelmed by the sense of Awe and absolute terror.

Emily's face filled the sky above him.

It was as though he were looking into the face of a god. The look on her face was one of glee and enjoyment. He suddenly realized by he had been smelling Vanilla. In his mind he imagined Emily with an Ice cream cone in her hand, holding it to her mouth, anticipating that first lick.

Ash saw the mouth begin to open, a blast of immense heat instantly warmed him but also melted the landscape around him. He sunk in surface, but was too awestruck to try to escape. Even if he could, escape was be impossible. He saw the great tongue extend past white teeth. As it grew closer he could see saliva run between every mountainous taste like rivers.The tip impacted hundreds of miles away but the "Ground" beneath was lifted up from under him. He felt himself being lifted way and the mouth grew larger and larger he was riding the tip of the tongue towards his doom. He screamed futilely as the tongue slipped back between Mountainous teeth.

Then everything grew dark.

He sat up and looked about. It was still dark, but after a moment he remembered where he was. Beside him Emily slept quietly. Her breath blew in his face in humid burst. He ran his hands through his hair. That was one hell of a nightmare. He knew it must have his brain's way of trying to process the idea of giants hundreds of feet tall, It didn't change how vivid it had been. Is this what it was going to be like for him? How many more such dreams would he have before he stopped having him.

Maybe instead of being afraid in his dream he should force himself to feel other emotions instead of fear.

He lay back down and stared up at a ceiling that was too dark for him to see. After awhile he closed his eyes and went back to sleep.

1452211111122211123232.title: The next morning

14522111111222111232322.content:
It was becoming increasingly clear to Ash that Emily wasn't going to give up her insistence, so he decided that rather than have this continue he would just tell her.

"It's not you that I'm Afraid of. It's what I dreamed about you that I fear."

And so he told her his dream in every vivid detail. When he had finished, he paused to give Emily a chance to process it. At first she was going to blurt out that she would never hurt him and would never eat him, but then she realized in her child's mind that she probably could. If she wasn't careful and not paying attention, AND if her friend had ended up in her food, an accident could happen. Certainly if he were a size of a speck of dust.

"But it's just a dream, right?" she finally said "I mean, I wouldn't hurt you."

"I know you wouldn't. Not intentionally." agreed Ash "But that's not it. They say that dreams are the mind's way of sorting out what you experience when you are awake. I'm seeing things that I've never seen before. I've had nightmares before, some very Bad, but nothing like this. I felt everything as if I was really there. No, I'm not afraid of you. You remind me of the dream, and then I get to wondering if my dreams are going to get worst before I'm used to everything."

Emily understood. She remembered having a bad dream and not wanting to go back to sleep, nor did she want to sleep the next night for fear the bad dream would start off right where it left off when she woke up. That's when she remembered what her grandmother had told her.

"Ash, I think I might be able to help you."

Ash raised and eyebrow "Help?"

Emily nodded. " When I had a bad dream and was afraid of having another one, my grandmother told me that my dreams were mine and mine alone. If I tried really hard I could make them into anything I wanted them to be. So the next time I had a bad dream I found I could changed it."

Ash considered the idea for a moment. Why not give it a try? The worst that could happen would be that it wouldn't work.

"Okay, I'll try it tonight, in the meantime though what are we going to do today?"

Emily lowered her head toward Ash slowly so she wouldn't frighten him and puckered her lips. Before he could protest again her lips pressed down on him, and then around him. His lower body pressing into her bottom lip while his head and chest pressed into her upper lip. The embrace was but for a moment and she pulled away.

Emily giggled "Sorry, I couldn't resist."

"It's okay Emily," said Ash, feeling his cheeks get hot. "It actually wasn't as bad as I thought it would be."

"Goodnight, I'll see you tomorrow." Closing up the Doll house, the young girl walked blew out the candle and climbed into bed.

Ash lay in the bed listening as Emily fell asleep. Thankfully she wasn't a snorer or he'd never get any sleep. Not that he really could. As much as he wanted to, he didn't sleep right away. His mind was still processing the events of the day. Never did he think that something this extraordinary could happen to him, but truth be told he secretly longed for it. He'd wanted something like this to happen all his life. As Ash finally began to drift off to sleep he decided not to waste the opportunity.

The Huge eye that stared back at him freaked Ash out momentarily until he realized where he was. There was a rumble and the wall moved away to reveal Emily's concerned face.

"Are you okay? I heard you screaming.

"Uh, Yeah. I'm fine. Just a bad dream." Ash ran his hand through damp hair, then paused. "Wait, you heard me from all the way over to your bed?"

"Well, no." Emily explained "It's morning and I was just about to wake you up. Ash, are you sure you're Okay?"

"I'm fine Emily, really I am." Truthfully though, the dream did bother him. It had been very vivid. Not since he was much younger and had suffered from Night Terrors had he had a dream as real as that one. But he felt it was best not to make her worry and kept it to himself.

"I have to go and Have breakfast. I'll bring something back for you."

Ash stayed in bed until Emily had walked out of the room. Then pulled back the covers. He was relieved to find the dampness he felt was only sweat. He'd been surprised that he had such a dream, but then maybe he shouldn't have. After all he'd been surrounded by Giants since yesterday. Getting dressed quickly he sat and waited for Emily to return. He looked out the window, from his advantage point he could see out through Emily's bedroom window at the dirt road/trail ran in front of the cabin. Someone was walking up the road.

14522111111222112112.content:
"Huh? Wh---"

It took a moment for Ash to remember where he was, his young but Giant friend was still asleep in her bed across the room. Looking out the window of the bedroom he could see the sun was just starting to rise over the horizon. Well, since he was up, he may as well stay up. climbing out of the bed and putting his pants and shoes back on, he reflected on his Nightmare.

What had brought it on? Any number of things for sure. Maybe it was his brain trying to process the impossible, maybe it was something left over from an age when giant things really were trying to eat you. The more he thought about it though, the more he found the concept stimulating. If he had a digestive proof environmental suit and a camera he could get some amazing Discovery channel worthy footage. He could even sell the footage to Discovery. They could Call the special "Eaten Alive".

"Nah, that would never work." said Ash shaking his head. "I'd probably chicken out at the last minute."

Still, the idea of being in a mouth that big was interesting. Who could say they were in something that big and lived? Too bad he didn't have a camera.

Wait a minute, he did!

Ash reached into his pocket and took out his Go-Pro. He had planned to take pictures with it but with all the craziness going on he'd totally forgot he had it. Even had a fully battery charge. Maybe something to think about later. Right now, he had other things to think about. Like the possibility of maybe not going home again. That was a possibility. After all, what happened to him might've been a freak incident that might never happen again, even if it did there was no guarantee whatever sent him here could send him to his proper world. The number of realities out there could be infinite.

So he'd have to just get used to being without technology, electricity, and dependence. Especially dependence. At the moment there was very little he could do for himself. As far as getting food and such he'd have to rely on Emily. In a way, the situation reminded him of the land of Brobdingnag from Gulliver's Travels. Maybe he could write about it, or have someone else write it for him.

Well, now that he was up, what to do?

"Okay, do you want to do it now?"

"No, no. I can't just yell 'Geronimo' and Dive down your throat. There's so much that needs to be worked out first." Ash explained.

He could see the relief in Emily's face as he said this. He could tell she wasn't completely sold on the idea and decided it was best to do baby steps and ease her into doing this rather than having a situation where she'd be incredibly nervous and potentially fatal mistakes could be made. Even if she backed out, it was possible he could try Little Bear or one of the other animals like Duck.

"We have to think of ways of not only getting into you, but also to get back out. We also need to come up with the best way to swallow me. Should we try water or maybe a dip in honey?"

"I think I know how you could get out." said Emily musing "Before I lived here I heard of a boy named Timmy who fell down an dried well. They lowered someone down on a rope to get him."

"Thread!" sad Ash "That might do it. It would have to be strong though."

"Grandmother has strong thread."

"Okay, we'll try that. Maybe we should do a test run first. Maybe swallow a berry tied to the thread and see what happens. There's another thing we should decide on. should we try it before or after you've eaten."

Emily frowned "I don't understand"

"Well, it's going to smell in there." Ash explained. "Just wondering if it'll smell worst if you've eaten."

"Oh"

"Speaking of eating maybe you should get some breakfast. I'll be okay here until you get back."

"Okay." Emily climbed off the bed and started to the door, but then she stopped and turned back toward Ash.

14522111111222112112111121.content:
Ash thought to himself 'Emily is still super nervous. I've got to get her to relax.'

"Uh, Emily?"

"Yes?"

"Why don't we have a bit of fun first before I take the plunge?"

Emily frowned "What kind of fun?"

"How about...." Ash looked at Emily's Breakfast "I ride on your spoon?"

"But I need my spoon."

"Not in it, on it. Like this."

Ash walked over to the huge wooden utensil and clambered up onto the spot where the handle was attached to the rest of the spoon. "See? A front row seat."

Emily wasn't sure what this Front row seat business was all about but this sounded like fun."Okay, hang on tight."

Emily picked up the spoon and lifted it to eye level to make sure Ash had a good hold and lowered the spoon toward her bowl of porridge. For the micro sized human it was like riding a roller coaster. He felt his stomach sink downward as the spoon rose up again with it's first load. This was the moment where Ash figured he'd panic or be cool as a cucumber.

When Emily opened her mouth for the first time, he was neither one.

She had held him close as she spoke and he'd gotten quick glimpses inside, but now he was getting a full view of the interior. This was something nobody had ever seen before that that scale. Imagine the mouth of an average child scaled up to 15 feet wide. Imagine that mouth opened wide and accelerating toward you and closing just a foot from where you are sitting. Imagine as that same child held that spoon stationary as she chewed and swallowed enough food to feed a family and then some for a month. By the time She had finished the bowl, Emily was quite relaxed and even smiling at this little ride she was giving her little friend. Maybe this wouldn't be so bad after all.

"I guess it's time." she said.

"Good a time as any." said Ash "Pass me the end of the thread , please."

Climbing into the palm of her hand, Ash tied a climbers harness around his waist. It had been a few years since he'd done one but the thread was as flexible as any rope he'd used. This would keep him firmly attached to the thread while keeping his hands free.

"Now ,what would be the best way to get swallowed?"

Emily thought for a moment, then said:

1452211111122211211211112111.content:
What acceleration! That wasn't expected. It was a good thing he had held his breath as he was sent on his way down because is was surrounded by the milk. Then there was a sudden jolt and liquid splashed down all around him and past him. He took a deep breath of foul air and knew right away where he was. Taking out the pin light attached to his key ring he clicked it and shined the light around.

Inside the stomach was chaos. The walls flexed and churned the chewed contents of Emily's Breakfast. She had swallowed air as she ate so there was a breathable atmosphere, though the smell wasn't exactly pleasant. Knowing he did not have time to waste, Ash began taking pictures. Not particularly focusing on which area of the chamber. Looking down he watched as the milk mixed in with the the dissolving sludge that was once been Emily's Breakfast.
He was thankful to have tied that harness, had he only been holding onto the rope he was certain he would've lost his grip as he'd was rushed along by the milky rapids.

He felt the thread tug upward. Looked Emily wasn't willing to keep him in there any longer than she had to, not that it mattered as it was really becoming more volatile in her stomach. To stay any longer would risk permanent injury. As his back pressed up against the slimy valve that let him in, it looked as though it wouldn't open. There was a tug by Emily, but it didn't look like he was going to be able to get through. Then he heard the roar of liquid above him. Thinking quickly he closed his eyes tightly and held his breath as gallons of milk came down on top of him. It was enough to open the valve to let him through. Going upward the walls of the esophagus tried to send him back down, but as before the muscles in the tube could not flex tight enough to force him back down. He saw light as he was once again in her throat

"Sorry about that." Emily's voice was all around him and light flickered as her mouth formed words. A moment later Ash was back into Emily's mouth. He took one more picture before he was raised away from her mouth and lowered into her palm.

"Are you okay?"

"Fine. Nice thinking using that milk."

"Well, when I couldn't pull you up I thought it would be better if I tried drinking some more rather than Hurting you. Are you sure you are okay?"

"Yeah, I got a bit of milk in my ears and up my nose but I'm okay."

"Ash please don't ask me to do that again."

"I won't. I got more photographs than I needed."

"Okay, I'll put you--"
1452211111122211211211112111.title: GERONIMO!!

145221111112221121121111212.content:
"Okay, but first just dip me in that milk you have. It'll be easier for you to swallow me wet rather than dry."

With the other end of the Thread tied securely to her finger, Emily did as she was instructed. Swinging by the end of the thread and the strap of the Go-Pro secured to his wrist, Ash took the plunge.

"OOOOHHHH AHHHHH!!"

"What?"

"C-Cold!"

He was glad Emily hadn't decided on this as a way of getting him into her stomach, and he was glad he didn't stay in the milk for very long. Emily tilted her head and held Ash just above her lips.

"See you in a bit." said Ash. " Give me to a count of forty and bring me up."

Emily said nothing, but nodded. She took a breath and opened her mouth. There were flecks and bits of porridge on her tongue because she had just finished her breakfast. Her mouth was still salivating more than it would when she wasn't eating. Had he wore glasses, Emily's hot breath would've fogged them up. As he was lowered into her mouth, he took the first picture. He took a second picture when he reached the back of her throat near her tonsils, the flash illuminate the tunnel that was her esophagus. Then it got dark as Emily closed her mouth. He clicked on the little pin light that was attached to his key ring. His heart pounded in his chest. This was it. He was going down in history as the first unofficial endonaught.

Time slowed, for a moment he thought Emily wouldn't do it. Then the back of her tongue pressed him against her pallet, Then--

GULP
