He felt the thread tug upward. Emily's count was faster than his, not that it mattered as it was becoming more volatile in her stomach. As his back pressed up against the valve that let him in, it looked as though it wouldn't open. Then there was a blast of foul air as Emily burped. It forced just enough air to open the valve enough to let him through. Going upward the walls of the esophagus tried to send him back down, but as before the muscles in the tube could not flex tight enough to force him back down. He saw light as he was once again in her throat, a moment later Ash was back into Emily's mouth. He took one more picture before he was raised away from her mouth and lowered into her palm.

"Are you okay?"

"Perfectly fine. I took some really good photographs."

"I wish I could see them."

"I wish I could show you. Boy , was it ever hot in there. Good to breath fresh air too."

"Ash please don't ask me to do that again."

"I won't. You better get those dishes back before your grandmother starts to wonder."

"Okay, I'll put you--"
1452211111122211211211112121.title: Going Down

14522111111222112112111122.content:
"I...I still don't know if this is such a good idea Ash." Emily admits with a great sense of worry in her voice. "I-if you get hurt...I-I would feel terrible about what could happen to you." she stammer as her eyes gaze solely down on her plate.

Ash looks up at her feeling a twinge of guilt over just how concerned she was towards her. in fact even he was beginning to have second thoughts about this crazy idea as well. "you might be right Emily." he says while slowly nodding his head up at her. "it might be risky...but...this is a once in a lifetime opportunity to voyage into the depths of a human being." he says truthfully as Emily gazes down at him with nervous eyes. "despite how dangerous it might sound...I'm sure nothing bad will happen." Ash says while trying his best to muster a smile. As much as it pained him to try and use the assuring tactics on Emily, it seemed like there really wasn't any other way of her going on with this plan. "I trust you Emily." he says with a serious tone. "and I'm sure nothing bad will happen at all."

Emily, still being concerned about the outcomes that could possibly occur remains silent momentarily. "w-well...alright Ash." she says with a small sigh and nod of her head. "i'll let you go inside my stomach. "but please..." she says with pleading yet worried eyes. "please be safe inside me...and try not to do anything risky."

Ash nods his head to the response as Emily slowly lowers the ball of yarn and ties a section of it on the middle section of her index finger. Once it was secured, she slowly lowers the other end towards Ash as he grasps it within his hands. With great care, Ash wraps the thread about his lower torso securely before tightening it up. "ready when you are Emily." he says in a rather enthusiastic voice causing Emily to muster a small chuckle.

"so...how should you enter inside me?" she asks curiously.

14522111111222112113.content:
Ash sat up and darted about in the darkness. It took a few moments for him to remember where he was, and once he'd done that he lay back down in his make shift bed.

That was one vivid dream he'd had. The last time he had such a dream was 9 and had watched A Nightmare on Elm Street. It had seemed so real, and yet not quite right. Emily's Animal friends and certainly done him no harm, especially Little Bear. He remembered the yellow stained teeth the cub had in his dream, but from what he saw when they had met his teeth were white.

Why had he dreamed such a thing? Ash thought about it for a moment, then concluded it must've been his brain attempting to process the events of that day. Seeing Giants and interacting with them. Why they had appeared as evil in the dream was something he couldn't figure out.

There was probably no explanation.

Ash closed his eyes, the dream fading away. Outside the doll house he could hear Emily breathing deeply as she slept. He wondered what she thought of all this. A tiny person no bigger than a bug sleeping in her doll house. He was surprised she'd been able to sleep. One would think she'd be too excited to sleep given the circumstances. He thought about making his way over to where she slept, but thought better of it. It was pitch dark in the room outside the dollhouse. Without a flashlight travel would be far too dangerous. So instead he rolled over on his side and tried to get back to sleep. It took a while, but finally he was able to drift back to dreamland. This time he didn't dream of giants out to eat him.

The Moment Ash landed on the slick and Bumpy muscle , his fate was sealed.

Emily's tongue immediately registered the foreign slightly salty taste of Ash's exposed skin. A moment later, she subconsciously decided she liked it. In her dream she was sucking on a lump salt taffy just like the kind her grandmother had made once. For the tiny person in her mouth the suction was terrifying, only because Emily had no idea what she was doing to poor Ash.

Try as he might, he couldn't cry out. Every time he tried to get enough breath in him to yell, the tongue would press him up into the roof of the mouth ; his face completely covered. GULP

1452211111122211223.content:
It was still Dark when Ash woke up. Puzzled, he checked his watched. It was almost eight in the morning. maybe it was a time zone difference. That, or the days and nights were longer there. That wouldn't have surprised him if that turned out to be true.

Climbing out of the over sized toy bed, he looked across the room to where Emily slept. Damn, she was big. Not in an obese sort of way. She was Big. Three, four hundred feet from head to toe, and only seven years old. What would she look like when she reached Fourteen? Or Twenty? She would be godlike to anyone like him.

He sighed, there was a chance he'd be around here long enough to see her grow up. Since he didn't know how he go there it was only logical to assume leaving would be just as hard. So until that time, he'd do what must do. Maybe even have some fun along the way.

First things first though. He had to relieve himself.

Then it occurred to him. Emily hadn't provided him with a means to go to the bathroom. He left the dollhouse and looked about. Crap, what was he to do? The only thing he could do. He figured that his sprinkle of pee was so minute to be noticed, so he walked to the edge of the dresser facing the wall and promptly relieved himself. He felt like a real jerk for doing it, but it's not like he had any other choice. He elected to never tell Emily.

Speaking of which, she was still sleeping in her bed. Clutching her doll and dreaming.For some reason he felt compelled to go over there. To climb up onto the Emily's bed and get a closer look. He didn't think there was any harm with that. All he had to do was climb down the dresser, walk the length of the floor and climb up onto the bed.

Just as the tiny man was at least a quarter of a I have across the room,ready to head back into his makeshift new house there was a incredibly loud yawn coming from the titanic seven year old in the bed and Ash whirled around at the sight of Emily slowly starting to blink herself awake,stretch slightly and pick up her doll then sleepily looking around her eyes finally landed upon him.

"Huh? Ash? What are you doing out of the doll house?" She asked curiously.

"Oh er You know it's really early in the morning and looks like it's going to be a nice day outside so I thought I just..." Ash began thinking what a incredibly lame and dumb cover up story he had just come up with! All to try and avoid thinking about what he just did behind right behind her dresser! He hoped Emily wasn't about to take a whiff of air but fortunately she was seemly still half asleep and sat up in the bed looking him over.

"I know exactly what you mean Ash! It does look like it's going to be such a nice day outside(as the sun was already beginning to raise and the sky was a pure solid blue,not a single cloud in the sky out the window)." As she finally stood up and got out of bed and slowly walked over to him.

"So what exactly do you have planned for today Emily?" He asked staring up at the gigantic kid as she shrugged.

"Well after I wash up and get dressed,I was planning on meeting Little Bear and his friends down at the steam so we can go fishing...but....." As she paused briefly thinking hard she had indeed been spending a lot of time with her best non-human friend lately and not enough with the incredible tiny person she had found a few days ago.

"It's not really fair that I haven't spending a lot of time with my new friend. Maybe I should cancel my plans with Little Bear and spend the entire day with Ash instead." She thought to herself until Ash was calling her name and she snapped back to reality.

"Huh? What did you say Ash?"

"I said I'm willing to go with you with your friends Emily,actually to tell the truth I never really gone fishing before so....who knows it might be fun." He replied.

"Are you okay? You kind of zoned out of there for a while." As he gave her a odd glance.

"Z-Zoned out? What's that mean?" She arched a eyebrow puzzled.

"It means you really weren't paying attention to what I was saying." He replied.

"Oh...well Ash,as much as I'd love to take you fishing with Little Bear and the rest of my friends...I was hoping you'd be willing to spend the whole day with me,just the two of us doing whatever you want." Emily unable to help herself blurted out looking down at him with a strong wave of affection she couldn't help it,he was so cute looking to her!

"Wow? Really? You'd rather spend the day with me instead of your friends?"

"Yes of course! I want to Ash! I practically visit or play with Little Bear and everyone else everyday almost, he won't mind if I skip one day to spend with my new friend!" Emily said beaming down at him. "So how about it? What do you think Ash?" She asked eagerly.

"Well okay if that's what you want. So what do you want to do first Emily?" He asked as she giggled and carefully picked him up.

"Well I was actually hoping......"
14522111111222112233.title: Emily wakes up before Ash makes it across the f...

145221111112221122332.content:
"Sure." said Ash "Get cleaned up and I'll tell you what I can. Oh and Emily?"

"Yes?"

"We need to talk about having a place for me to go."

Emily frowned, "Go?"

"You know, Go."

"Go....OH! You mean GO. I'm sorry, Ash. I never thought about that. Do you have to go now?"

"No, I'm fine, See you in a bit."

A short time later, Emily was settled down on the floor of her room while Ash sat in the palm of her hand telling her what his world was like. You'd think that was easy, but not so easy as you might think. For one thing, he couldn't tell her about computers, or space travel as it would've been hard for her to grasp and even harder for Ash to explain. But he told her of Cities, the animals and people who lived in the country, of how the animals in his world didn't speak like the ones in her world. He told her about the restaurants, food chains, indoor plumbing. Hospitals. The tallest buildings in his world that would be small compared to the height of her grandmother's house.

"I'll say this much, Emily. "said Ash as he finished. "The eyes of my friends would pop out of there heads if they could see what I'm seeing in your world."

"I would love to see your world, Ash." said Emily "But I know that would be too scary for your people. To see a Giant, my size suddenly appear...."

Ash, nodded "You are wise, despite your age. But you're right of course. If a Giant suddenly appeared in out mists the results would be panic and fear. I felt it too. I'm just glad you and your friends are the friendly kind of Giant. Imagine if you were the kind of giant from my old big blue book of fairy tales."

Emily looked to her left, remembering "Be he live or be he dead, I'll grind his bones to make my bread" She looked at Ash and lifted her palm closer as if to appraised him, then concluded " You wouldn't make much bread"

Ash Laughed "Lucky for me"

"Speaking of Bread, I could use some right about now. How about you wait here while I get some?"

"Sure."

Emily placed her hand on her Dresser and Ash climbed off. "Be right back" she said, then left the room.

Ash watched her go. This was going to be interesting. He'd never seen Emily eat before and from the size of her she could eat enough food to satisfy an army. He just imagined what it would be like to see teeth bigger than him pulverize that much food. Guess he wouldn't have long to wait.
145221111112221122332.title: Tales of a far away land

choices: Informed Little Bear and his parents about Ash's fears and predicament
Keeps silent about it,they would talk more later.
1452211111122211223324.content:
A bit later Emily returned with not just a simple slice of bread to share with her tiny friend but a entire sandwich!

"Sorry it took me so long Ash," Ahe said as she sat the peanut butter and jelly sandwich on a glass plate of course on her dresser. "But I knew you wouldn't be satisfied with a simple slice of bread. So I decided a personal favorite snack of mine would be more suitable for the both of us!"

"Really? You like PB &J too? Far out me too!" Ash blurted out unable to help himself.

"PB &J? What's that mean?" The 7 year old arched a eyebrow eerily confused.

"Oh it's another way for people in my timeline to pronounce peanut butter and jelly sandwiches Emily." He quickly explained.

"Oh,. She muttered as she easily began pulling apart bits of the sandwich in really small bite size pieces for him. "I never heard of that before:PB &J...it is a bit easier to say than just peanut butter and jelly sandwiches all the time! And that other word 'Far Out' what does that one mean?" As she began taking bites out of her own sandwich.

"Uh it's just another saying for really neat or fascinating." Ash shrugged as he began gulping down the food like he hadn't eaten in days which for his part was mostly true ever since he was first transported to this gigantic world.

"Hey don't eat so fast like that! You'll make yourself sick!" Emily said urgently as the tiny boy suddenly looked ashamed of his actions and muttered.

"Oh yeah..sorry,it's been a few days since I had anything to eat!"

Once they finished up Emily was about to take the now empty plate back downstairs when she turned back around to look at him.

"Ash,how would you like to meet my friend Little Bear? I was planning to meet him and his parents down by the stream for some fishing." As he looked up bewildered and a bit scared.

"Meet your friend,the bear cub? A-are you sure that's a good idea?" He stammered over his own words.

"Of course it is. You don't have to be afraid of Little Bear Ash,or his parents,they're not like the real live bears in your world. They're all very friendly." Emily said smiling as she paused for a bit.

"So you say Emily,but you don't really know wild animals' instincts do you? I mean sure they may seem friendly and pleasant to you right now but where I come from and in most parts of the world bears even trained ones or those kept in captivity are known to attack humans...." Ash tried his best to explain to the giant girl but she merely shook her head.

"Little Bear and his parents aren't like those wild bears Ash,they'll never attack humans or try to eat them. I've been friends with him for two years now and he's never hurt or had any urge to attack me or any of our other animal friends like Hen,Duck,Cat or Owl. You have absolutely nothing to worry about." As she reached down and carefully picked him up and headed down the stairs informing her grandmother where she was going.

A bit later the two of them arrived to the small stream where dozens of fish were leaping out of the clear,sparkling blue water and Ash's eyes widened as he saw the three gigantic family of bears standing on the edge of the small grassy hill,the smallest one unlike his parents who were strangely fully dressed in convincing human attire clothing didn't have on any clothes at all.

"Oh there Little Bear and his parents now!" Emily announced happily. " Come on I'll introduce you Ash." As she practically ran over to where they were and Ash's fears were suddenly intensified as he saw just how utterly enormous they really were.

"If this were the Real World all of them Emily included were technically be like Godzilla to my world's population.....but those bears...." There was just something uneasy he felt about them even as they politely and pleasantly greeted the little girl with Little Bear standing on his hind legs and hugging her then Adh began to slowly think maybe he was just being paranoided about the whole thing,as Emily stated there was nothing dangerous about these family of bears.

"It's good to see you too Father and Mother Bear!" Emily was saying before she suddenly remembered the tiny boy she was holding onto and pulled Ash in front of them as expected all their eyes widened a bit.

"Oh I just remembered this is my new friend Ash everyone, Ash this is my best friend Little Bear and his parents Mother and Father Bear."

"Oh my...Emily what is that you're holding?" Father Bear asked curiously as he slowly leaned in closer and the tiny boy actually shrank back a bit in fear at those sharp teeth of his.

"Well Father Bear,Ash is a human like I am but...he's small,really small." Emily said.

"Oh dear how did he get like this? Was he possibly born this way?" Mother Bear asked looking confused.

"No I don't think so. According to him he said he traveled from his world somehow and winded up in ours. I really don't understand it myself but I believe what he's saying is true." Emily explained smiling at him sunnily.

"Can I please hold him Emily?" Little Bear asked leaning forward.

"Sure but be careful Little Bear." Emily said as much to his shock Ash was passed to the bear cub it felt like to him standing on the world's softest pillow as the giant bear's hand was surprisingly soft and warm just like Emily's was and for some reason he felt quite relaxed.

"He's so tiny Emily,are you certain he's not a goblin of some kind from the forest?" Little Bear asked curiously.

"No I believe he said he's from the Real World wherever that is and according to him if any of us were to go there with him all of us were be literal 'giants' compared to the people there. But he's also a very nice person Little Bear and we have been having a lot of fun together for the past few days haven't we Ash?" She beamed happily at the tiny boy.

"Well pleased to meet you Ash," Mother Bear said bowing politely though he didn't understand why she would actually bow to him like that,apparently being incredibly generous and polite was absolutely important to these people in this world.

"Any friend of Emily's is a friend of ours." Father Bear chimed. "Would you two like to join us in a fine day of fishing? I thought we should be enough to catch enough for tonight's supper." As he brought out a old fashioned fishing pole.

"Oh yes we'd love to!" Emily blurted out happily before Ash could think to say anything after a bit of nothing but fishing in the steam Emily soon noticed her tiny friend's sudden mood change and decided to......
1452211111122211223324.title: Emily and Ash visit Little Bear (Not home, Ash ...

choices: They Cook the Fish at the stream
Emily and Ash spend the Night at the Bear's house
Emily And Ash return to her Grandmothers House

14522111111222112233242.content:
Ash was less than pleased about going down to the stream to fish, considering he was small enough to be the bate. He was more uneasy though at the fact that he'd be around Giants of such size and power, especially when they happen to be Grizzly bears. On his world they were apex predators. Here, they appeared to be more civilized. He had to remind himself of what Emily had told them about this family of Ursula. If she said they wouldn't harm him, that would be good enough for now. He just had to keep himself in check that's all. No point in ruining everyone else day over his paranoia.

What Father Bear had called a stream, Ash called a river. One of the Big rivers. Like the Mississippi. What colossal fish could be living in waters like that?

Ash found out some minutes later as Father Bear bated the hook and sat on a big rock. Ash watched from Little Bear`s Hand/Paw. No sooner had the hook and it's bate entered the water that it was quickly yanked out again with a fish. Father Bear had thrown it back, deeming it "Too Small" . Too Small? The last time Ash saw a fish that big Captain Ahab was hanging off the side of it!

Father Bear lowered the hook again, this time when he felt the line tug and he pulled the hook out of the water there was a fish he was satisfied with. This one was twice as big as the one he had thrown back. Ash looked at the water. There was no way in heck he was going swimming in there. Not a chance.

Ash had become so fascinated by the fishing that he gradually got over his paranoia and began to enjoy himself. As he sat and observed this Bear family, he couldn't help but wonder 'He's wearing clothes, she's wearing clothes, why is Little Bear in his Birthday suit? Is it a cultural thing?' He saw no privates but he knew the cub had to have them. Somewhere. Hidden by thick fur. Maybe that's why he could get away with it.

Another splash and another colossal fish. That was Five so far. Six if you counted the one that was thrown back.

145221111112221122333.content:
"Maybe we could play a favorite game of mine." She said suddenly.

"Certainly what kind?" Ash asked eagerly. As she began thinking.

"Well how about hide and seek or tag..oh I know maybe Mother May I..." Before the tiny boy gently interrupted her.

"Yeah to tell the truth Emily,those types of games would be a bit too difficult for me...think about it with hide and seek there could be about a million places I could hide and you'll never be able to find me,as for tag well look how big you are compared to me." Ash said but he didn't need to say anymore as she understood and stood up.

"Oh I never realized that. Okay then Ash I'll let you choose what we can play." She replied.

"Er...well maybe we could play...no not video games that sort of technology hasn't been invented yet...no Hopscotch either far too dangerous...she might step on me...gee this is hard!" He moaned angrily.

"It's alright Ash,you don't need to be upset but wait I have a idea...hold on for a bit!" As she leaped up and quickly ran out of the room a minute or two later she returned carrying a small box and beaming.

"What's in there?" He asked as she set it down in front of him on the floor.

"You'll see!" And opened it up Ash was utterly disappointed to find it was completely filled with clothes all fitted in his teensy tiny size or at least her doll Lucy's own height and frowned.

"Doll clothes?" He couldn't help but express his disgust at his gigantic host.

"You want to play dress up?" As she frowned and shook her head.

"No not really these aren't really doll clothes Ash,they're actually made for all my toy soldiers." Emily explained as she went over to her toy chest and pulled out a bunch of wooden soldiers all in Royal British attire like the ones you'd see guarding the Palace of London.

"Y-you collect toy soldiers? B-but you're a girl?" As he nearly burst out laughing but stopped at her stern expression.

"Yeah so? There's nothing wrong with me wanting to play with toy soldiers is there Ash?" She pouted folding her arms and giving him a angry stare.

"No I guess not okay so what exactly do you want to do with all these soldiers and me?" He asked curiously there had to be over thirty or more wooden soldiers in all,she must have liked collecting them as every single one of them was in perfect condition not a single scratch or tear on any of their clothing.

"Oh you'll love this Ash....I have been playing this game for days now and oh I almost forgot......." As she went over to same place where the doll house was at and brought down a huge plastic castle setting it on the floor beside him.

"A toy castle....so...so you want to play....Knights or King and Queens...." He quickly caught on as she excitedly nodded.

"Yes I always enjoyed pretending my toy soldiers are heroic knights protecting the castle from the evil dragon,Lucy is the princess and I'm the Royal Queen and ruler of the land of course." She said merrily as she opened up the castle showing him the various parts like the outside moat,the dining area,the dungeons and throne room with two actual removable throne like chairs,there was even a small Round Table at the center.

"Okay and where do I fit in with all this?" He asked but wished he hadn't said it as she quickly reached into the small box she brought into the room pulling out a small purple outfit designed for a king or prince,it came completed with a small golden crown and staff.

"Oh don't tell me. I'm going to be the-gulp King?" He swallowed hard as she nodded excitedly even more.

"Yep you guessed right! Giggle so Ash would this be a game you might be interested in?" As she looked hopeful and he slowly nodded.

"Well yeah I guess so."

"Hooray! Oh good thank you Ash,okay first thing you need to properly attired and dressed like a king and since I'm already wearing a dress,all I need is...." As she pulled out a small silver plastic crown from her toy chest.

"There now I'm Queen Emily,Ruler of the Magical Kingdom and this is Princess Lucy,the most beautiful person(besides me) in the land." As she picked up her treasured doll and sat her on a small stool.

"Uh Ash aren't you going to get dressed? You're supposed to be the king after all." She said looking at him with a sweet grin.

"Oh er okay...." As he went behind the enormous bed to change and came back thinking he looked utterly ridiculous in this stupid doll's outfit.

"Oh you look so cute dressed like that!" The giant girl gushed unable to control herself as soon as she laid her eyes upon him.

"Er thank you...okay so now what?" He asked as she suddenly picked him up and set him in one of the plastic throne like chairs in the tiny throne room and one by one began setting the numerous toy soldiers and other plastic and wooden doll people around various spots in the castle.

"Okay now we're almost finished." She announced happily.

"Okay so what happens now?" Ash asked unable to sit properly in the stone hard throne so that his legs were sticking halfway out of the seat and his back was already aching from leaning too hard against the back of the chair.

"Oh I almost forgot again...you need to read the Royal degree to send out your best knights to slay the dragon!" Emily said handing him a tiny piece of paper with some equally tiny handwriting on it,he could tell it was hers as he saw her almost perfect type of writing before,for a mere 7 years old she certainly was way ahead of most kids in his timeline.

"Sure I'll read it and send out...hold on where's the dragon at?" He asked looking around.

"Ohh! I completely forgot that too! Hold on for a minute Ash!" As Emily jumped up and again raced out of the room as he just sat there literally unable to move as he was virtually stuck in that position and sighed.

A few minutes later Emily came back with....

14522111111222113.content:
“Dolls? Sure. “ said Ash. Emily walked over to a cupboard. Instead of the large doll he was expecting, he was astonished to see tiny figures held between her fingers. As she placed them down before him, Ash’s astonishment grew.

“Emily, do you know what these are?”

“They’re Dolls. Aren’t they?”

“No. Well, that’s not what they were originally intended for anyway.” Ash bent closer to examine the ‘Dolls’. “Emily, these are Department Store Mannequins.”

Emily frowned in confusion. She knew what a Store was, but the other….. “What’s a Mannequin?”

“Do you know what a store is, Emily?”

She nodded.

“Well, some stores use these people shaped statues to sell the latest clothing. They put the cloths on the statue and when a customer walks by one of these they can see what the clothing looks like worn. If they like the clothes they go in and buy it. “

Ash noted that the clothes on the Mannequins were several decades out of date. Most likely from the mid to late 1980s, judging from the bright neon material.

“Emily, where did you find these?”

“In a tree stump ,just behind the house. Do you want to see?”

“I would at that. But it’s getting late, maybe tomorrow. In the meantime. Let’s play. Um, Emily, what kind of play to you have with these Mannequins?"

Emily Smiled.

"Oh I never knew that but yes I like to pretend I'm a giant to these man...mann.....doll things!" Emily said "Would you like to play along Ash?"

145221111112221132111.content:
It was at that moment Ash realized he had F**ked up. He knew she wouldn't have seen the cartoon but he'd assumed Emily had heard the story or read the story in a big book of fairy tales like he had when he was younger. He should've known better than to assume because now Emily was angry at him. The last thing he wanted to deal with was an angry giant. He had to defuse the situation fast.

"You n-never heard the story?"

Emily Blinked, that got her attention. "What Story?"

"The Brave Little Tailor." Said Ash "Also sometimes Called Seven in One Blow. You never heard of it?"

Emily shook her head.

"I'm terribly sorry, Emily. If I had known I wouldn't have tied your feet up."

"That's okay." The young giantess replied as she removed the thread from around her feet. She was still annoyed at what happened but at least she wasn't angry. She could forgive an honest mistake. "Can you tell me the story?"

"Sure."

Emily picked Ash off the floor and held him in her cupped palm. Then she got comfortable on her bed. Ash sat in her hand and began to tell the story as he remembered it from the mickey mouse cartoon and what he could make up as he went.

"In a land far from here there was a kingdom ruled by a King who was a wise and noble ruler. All was well in this kingdom until one day a man road to the castle bringing news that soon brought the whole kingdom in a state of panic and terror. A Giant was approaching the kingdom.

"Now ,for the most part, giants do not tend to be inherently evil. Oh you do have the occasional ones who would grind men's bones to make bread but that was a rare thing among Giants. The problem is that giants are so huge that oftentimes they trod through and leave destruction in their footprints. They don't mean to , it's simply a case of being in the wrong place at the wrong time. The Giant that approached this kingdom was one of the biggest."

Are there a lot of people there?" She began asking various questions throwing Ash off track so that he forgot what he was talking about

"Er yeah it was glorious in all its splendors and quite a lot of people lived there. But in this kingdom happened to be ruled by a wise King." "Yes indeed." Agreed Father Bear who also wore medieval clothes with a golden crown on his head "If none of the knights are able to stop this giant then I fear for the safety of the kingdom itself and its citizens......" He paused and glanced out the open window to all the citizens talking worriedly to each other(several of Emily's other animal friends including Cat,Duck,Hen and even No-Feet were among the human citizens)

"To make matters worse I also fear for our son Prince Little Bear(looking at the bear cub playing with his toys)." Father Bear exclaimed "If these attacks continue he may not have a kingdom to rule when he comes of age."

"Is there anyone left in the kingdom who can challenge this giant?" Mother Bear asked

"I-I don't think so Your Highness." Owl said worriedly "Everyone else is far too much afraid to even step out of their homes much less out of the castle gates."

"Meanwhile high in a lone tower there lived a young boy named Ash(dressed in peasant clothing blue baggy trousers and a courset complete with a small hat with a feather in it)happened to be a very talented tailor,able to sew practically any type of clothing or anything together at this very moment he was busy trying to sew a pair of socks but was getting annoying by seven or so flies buzzing around and grabbing a nearby fly swatter WHAM! With one single swing he squashed every single one of them and getting excited over his triumph he began racing downstairs into the streets yelling his head off.

"I DID IT!" He cried

"Did what?" Cat asked confused

"I KILLED SEVEN GIANT FL....." Ash began but was interrupted

"Seven Giants? You-You managed to defeat seven Giants?" Another citizen asked

"Well yes. Seven gigantic fli......."

"Did you hear he managed to defeat seven Giants! We must tell the King and Queen at once!" As the crowds grabbed Ash hoisting him on their shoulders and practically carried him straight to the palace.

Once at the palace a horribly confused Ash was told of the dire situation

"But your Majesty you don't understand I killed only seven giant fli......" He began but was again interrupted

"And for that you're just the young champion we're looking for! If you succeed in ridding us of this awful giant......." Father Bear said

"Then any treasure you'd like in the royal treasure vault will be yours." Mother Bear said

"Yes but......" Ash tried explained

"Very good now on with your peril-less journey then and good luck!" Prince Little Bear said speaking up at last

"Umm thank you your Young Majesty-To-Be. But....ohh never mind." Ash had no choice but to go through with this as he was handed practically nothing,no weapons,no sword,shield or even spear only his trusty sewing needle and thread and his own guts to face off against this giant and was waved out of the kingdom to the castle gates by a cheering crowd

"Good Luck Brave Tailor!" Hen and Duck cried

As the castle gates slammed behind him Ash continued his journey towards the countryside while moaning to himself

"I only killed seven giant house flies. I never faced a actual giant!"

As he slowly continued......
1452211111122211321111.title: Emily listens envisioning Ash and her Friends a...

14522111111222113211112.content:
'Defeat a Giant. Sure, nooooo problem. I only have an oversize needle, thread and scissors.' Ash looked at the items questionably 'Why did they give me these and not a sword and sheild?'

The scout had pointed the approach of the Giant before he left the castle. So, with no other option, he began to walk in that direction. Word had spread of both the Giant and of Ash who had slain Seven in one Blow. He met many people as they abandoned their homes and were heading to the castle with their worldly possessions. Some viewed him with hope. Others didn't see anything that was even remotely impressive. But all greeted him and wished him luck.

Luck? He was going to need a Miracle!

He walked for most of the day and finally rested at an abandoned farm house. It was nothing Fancy. A house, a Bail of hay, and a wagon filled with Pumpkins. He sat on the step and pondered what he was going to do. How to you even slay a giant? He had only heard of someone doing that once, and that involved a giant beanstalk. Nah, that would never work. No beanstalk. He hadn't been sitting for very long before he started to notice a tremor in the ground. He blinked. The tremor was growing stronger.

Stronger

Stronger

STRONGER

It was getting dark, but it was still the afternoon. A feeling of Dread fell over him. He knew what it was. He stood and looked about.

It was the giant. No question about it. The darkness was its shadow.Ash blinked. It was a Girl. Well that was unexpected. He expected a brute with a beard like the kind he had read about. With a single step she flattened out a Hill, with two more she displaced the water of a pond. It was clear she was heading in his direction. With the ground heaving about him, Ash staggered and looked for a place to hide. He was not prepared whatsoever to do battle with a creature of that magnitude!

He had three options, none of them were good. The wagon of pumpkins, the bale of hay and the farm house. He had to make a decision fast. Another two steps and the giant would be upon him!
14522111111222113211112.title: Nothing happens yet.

choices: Right into the Mouth of the Giant
Off the hand and onto the Giant's clothes
145221111112221132111122.content:
Now Ash never really considered himself a coward. But he didn't think standing out in the open a good idea either, so he scrambled up onto the cart and hid among the pumpkins. He couldn't see what was going on, but he could hear and feel the earth shake and the cart bouncing with every footstep. Then a new sound. Groaning of wooden timbers strained to the limit. All seemed suspiciously quiet for a brief moment. Then he heard something that made the hair on the back of his neck stand up and his face went pale.

"Food"

The cart was heaved up ward and tuned upside down. Ash came tumbling out, Pumpkins and all, into the fleshy palm of the Giant. He was still buried under all that fruit, so she still hadn't seen him. A fat pile of good that was going to do him though he knew what was coming. Why did he have to announce that he had killed seven flies in one blow? He'd be home now drinking coffee instead of being moments away from being eaten by a giant.

He felt the hand rise upward. Ash stuck his head out to see what he knew was happening. If he was going to face death, he might as well stare it in the face.

The Giant's face filled his entire view. The mouth opened wide to accept the treat of Pumpkin and Ash. Over the teeth and past the gums look out Stomach here comes Ash. Crushed into paste by Giant teeth and swallowed. Not exactly how he expected to leave the world.

He looked up into the eyes of the Giant, that's when he noticed they were closed. His heart leaped. There might still be a chance. If he could leap off just in time. He had not time to waste, the hand had already begun to tilt and pumpkins were starting their role into the great mouth like blue berries.

Ash Jumped up and leaped
145221111112221132111122.title: The Pumpkin wagon

choices: He leaped out of the mouth
The mouth closes quickly and he is swallowed
A torrent of water floods the mouth (The Giant is drinking the well water)
1452211111122211321111221.content:
Ash landed face first onto the tip of the Giant tongue and slid down it's length until coming to a stop just a foot or two from the back of the throat. He found himself staring down into the slimy dark abyss that was the Giant's throat.

"What a twist of fate" he thought as Pumpkins rained down on top of him "yesterday a tailor with a promising carrier, today a snack."

Then it grew dark as the mouth closed, and the chewing began. Around him pumpkins were reduced to pulp under the relentless jaws of death while outside the Giant smiled contently. For Ash, it was all he could do the avoid the huge teeth. As the tongue pushed him onto them he would roll away as quickly as he could seconds before he could be turned into jelly. Was it possible this Giant felt not? No, she knew. That or she felt something but didn't care.

He was suddenly pinned to the roof of the mouth and his ears popped as the giant swallowed with a loud gulp. Then the blinding light appeared again and the process repeated itself as more pumpkins rained down on top of him. He wanted to cry out, but pulped pumpkin would fill his mouth. He didn't know how much longer he could survive the onslaught.

*Hiccup*

Light momentarily lit the interior and he was bounced up and down on the tongue.

*Hiccup*

It happened a second time.

*Hiccup**Hiccup*

It interested Ash to know even Giants got the Hiccups. Not that it helped the situation but at least she wasn't chewing anymore. After thinking for a moment he decided that the next time she opened her mouth he would jump out. He didn't care where he landed so long as he was out of that mouth.

At that moment the mouth began to open wide. This was it. It was now or never. He scrambled forward--
1452211111122211321111221.title: Right into the Mouth of the Giant

choices: The giant feels the pounding and  manages to spit him out
14522111111222113211112212.content:
"Ahhhhhhhhhhh........." The young Giantess opened her mouth wide as Ash sought to escape this-was-his chance to get away from this monstrous child but the moment passed as quickly as she opened her mouth the giant closed it and Ash came so close to ramming head first into her sparkling white teeth and let out a scream as she tilted her head back

"Oh...Oh no! OH NO,OH NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!!" He screamed trying to fight the current of gravity but in this case the giant proved to be victorious as he was helplessly thrown towards the back of her throat then made the long plummet all the way down into the unforgiving pit that was her stomach.


Ash slowly opened his eyes and was in awe and at the same time terrified of his surroundings it certainly resembled a real live stomach and though he really couldn't see a thing as it was pitch dark he could hear the loud gurgling of the giant's belly and hoped he was nowhere near a pool of deadly stomach acid

"This is the absolute worst thing to ever happen to me! Why did I have to open my big mouth?" He scolded himself how in the world was he going to get out of a giant girl's stomach much less manage to prevent her from destroying the town? As he pondered this Ash heard the giant girl talking to herself.

"Ahhhh all that food certainly was yummy but it felt like I swallowed something else....."

"You sure did!" Ash thought "Wait tha-that's it! I'll give her a bad stomach ache!" And immediately started feeling around the slimy walls and began pounding them as hard as he could with both fists at once.....
14522111111222113211112212.title: The mouth closes quickly and he is swallowed

145221111112221132111122122.content:
"That's a terrible story!" exclaimed Emily.

"Terrible?"

"The Tailor died!"

"Who said anything about him dying?" said Ash " He was swallowed, but he was very much alive and intended to stay that way. Lady luck was on his side."


Inside the Belly of the Giant Ash wondered just how he'd gotten himself into this mess and how the heck he was going to get himself out of it. He struck a match and in the illumination of the tiny flame he looked about at his surroundings. He'd never known the inside of a stomach before, but if he could imagine it this is what it would look like. Slimy wrinkly pink walls with a floor that was littered with chewed food stuff in a growing foul liquid bile. Instinctively he crawled away from the liquid. He wasn't sure what it was but he knew it was bad.

"Ow!"

The match went out, burning his fingertips. He had to get out. Even if it were possible he didn't want to live in a stomach. He did the only thing he could think to do. With Both hands he began pounding on the nearest wall.

Outside the stomach the Giant was about to finish off the wagon of pumpkins when she began to feel a queer sensation in her stomach. It was a tickling feeling. Something was alive in her stomach. She rubbed her stomach. whatever it was, it was determined to keep up this annoyance. That wouldn't do at all. She opened her mouth wide and began to gulp down air.

In side the stomach, Ash's ears suddenly popped as the air pressure changed. What was the Giant doing? Then it suddenly occurred to him. Of course! it was something that he'd done countless times when he drank beer. She was about to----


BEALCH!!!!!!

Suddenly he was thrown upward and there was blinding light. He didn't fall for long though and landing into something that felt soft and had a strange texture to it. His eyes were still not adjusted to the light but somehow he knew exactly where he'd landed.

The Giant had him in the palm of her hand. What was she going to do to him?
145221111112221132111122122.title: Belched out

1452211111122211321111221221.content:
"So what did the tailor do?"

"What did he do? What could he do? He took out the only weapon that was given to him."


An oversize needle. Seriously? They couldn't give him a sword? The tailor branded it in front of him the best he could. The reaction from the giant was one of surprise. Then she started to giggle. Then the giggle became a full belly laugh.

This was humiliating. But he had to admit the whole situation was absurd. She was being threatened by a tiny with a sewing needle. She laughed as she began to back up and was laughing so much that she failed to see the cord of Clothesline behind her.


"What happened next is still questionable as the tailor had been unconscious from the fall--"

Emily frowned "He fell?"

"Well, the Giant did."


This enormous Giant, this unstoppable juggernaut, In a fit of laughter, was tripped up by a flimsy clothesline. She fell backwards and crashed to the earth. When the tailor came too, the Giant was still unconscious. And giggling periodically. A week later and the situation hadn't changed. By this time though heavy chains bound the giant.

Not that it mattered, after all the slightest twitch on her part and she would've snapped the chains easily. They were more for the villager's piece of mind rather than restraining a Giant.


"So what happened?" Asked Emily. "What happened to the Tailor, and The Giant?"

"The Giant still sleeps." Said Ash " And when a Giant sleeps, it's best to let them lay. As for the Tailor, he was given the reward promised to him, and then he high tailed it out of town. He never wanted to be asked to fight another Giant and the next time he killed seven flys in one blow he kept his mouth shut. The End. Better now?"

Emily nodded. 'Good,' Though Ash ' The last thing I need is an angry Giant'

"That was a wonderful Story" said Emily "Can--"
1452211111122211321111221221.title: Be Nice

choices: Climb into her shoe so she can't find him
Create a blockage of sorts so she can't pass
He's got nothing and lets her destroy the whole town
14522111111222113211112212212.content:
"Hmmmmmm well let's play Giant some more." Emily said happily.

"Huh why?" Ash asked "I thought you were getting a little tired of that game or something."

"I never said I was tired of it Ash,it was pretty fun. But that story with the Tailor and the Giant gave me a few ideas so let's play Giant some more." As the 7 year old got back up and began setting up the colorful big blocks she 'playfully' knocked over during her rampage of the town from before then turned back to him.

"Okay Ash I'm going to walk through the town again and try to wreck everything and you try and stop me again but this time you're going to have to get a little creative in how to stop me from destroying the town." Emily said proudly.


"What do you mean by that?" Ash asked confused.

"You know besides trying to tripme again,try and think of another way to keep me from destroying the town." She said standing to her full height and gestured him to stand in the usual spot where he was before and began slowly marching towards the town of tiny dolls and colorful blocks while Ash pondered how to stop this playful and sweet giant.

So what does he do?
14522111111222113211112212212.title: we play Giant some more?

choices: Later in the evening (Another story to tell)
145221111112221132111122123.content:
The Tailor blindly moved about trying to find a way out of the slimy hell he had found himself in. More and more pumpkin remnants rained down around him. He felt the giant get up and walk, and it wasn't long before more pulped food fell upon him. Grain, corn, melons.

He cried out, but none could hear him. He pounded against the walls of the stomach with all his might but still he was ignored as more and more food stuff hell around him. He raked at the walls with his fingernails, he screams, he begged, he swore. But it was hopeless.

There were gurgling sounds around him as he slumped down defeated and exhausted. He was finding it hard to think straight. Maybe he should just rest for a moment....


"So what happened to the Tailor?" Asked Emily.

"Well, I won't go into details, but he never escaped the Giant's stomach. He... Became apart of her."

"That's...That's just Horrible!" Emily exclaimed. "I've never heard of a story ending that way."

"Well, it wasn't exactly The End."

Emily Blinked.

"In his own way, the Tailor did stop the Giant. You see, this giant could not eat meat. Pumpkins, corn, that sort of stuff was fine. But meat made the giant fall into a deep sleep. After a while, a mountain formed over her and it was named "The Mountain of the Sleeping Giant." Though gone, the Brave Tailor wasn't forgotten. A statue was made in his honor and was placed in the town square where it still stands today. Ready to play some more?"

Emily nodded enthusiastically.

"I promise I won't trip you up this time."
145221111112221132111122123.title: Ash is slowly disgusted

choices: Just stood there until she asked why
Makes a attempt to try at least
1452211111122211321111221232.content:
"Actually Ash I was hoping we could play a different kind of game." Emily announced suddenly looking incredibly sad and less thrilled since he told her the 'Brave Little Tailor' story.

"Why? Are you bored with it? I thought you were having fun?" He arched a eyebrow

"Well to tell the truth I was up to that point until I heard the part of the story where the giant almost stepped on the tailor and then ate him.....and....."

Her voice trailed off as she turned away Ash wondered why she was acting so sad and pathetic previously she was almost annoying slap happy a few minutes ago but then he supposed if he was around her age and had just heard a story like that maybe it would freak him out too.

"Er okay we can play another game if you want Emily so what did you want to play?" He agreed

"Ohh we can play Hide and Seek!" Emily's sadden state vanished just as quickly as it came on and her expression changed to happy again

"That seems a little too dangerous for me there are maybe dozens of places I can hide and you'll probably never find me not to mention how could I catch you if I ran after you?" He pointed out

"Ohh okay then well what about Hop Scotch?" Emily suggested

"Ummm that's a good one but you will need some chalk to draw on the floor...."

"I mean we can go outside to play it Ash we certainly can't play it in here." She replied getting up and going over to her toy chest to pick out some colorful chalk a few minutes later the two of them were out in the sunny cloudless wooded area near her grandmother's cottage and he watched as she carefully drew a enormous box in the ground with pink chalk filling it in with several tiny blocks each one with the numbers 1-10 then she stepped back to admire her handy work.

"Well what do you think?" She asked her tiny companion

"Very nice you're very good at staying in the lines!" He joked

"Giggle Thank you! Okay did you want to go first or did you want me to?" She politely asked

"I think it's better for you go first Emily I never really played Hop Scotch much as a kid....it's more of a...." He paused briefly but she seemed to understand

"Er okay then I understand I'll go first then....." As she carefully stepped onto the first two blocks titled 1 and 2 then with precise careful timing and graceful movement she managed to practically skip through all the blocks without tripping or missing even one then she made her way back beaming at him as she came to a complete stop.

"That was pretty good! You have some very graceful movement Emily!" He said amazed

"What does that mean?" She asked curiously

"Uh it means you have perfect balance I think you're able to effortlessly move through narrow or tight spots without falling." He explained

"Ohhh thank you for saying that Ash that was very nice. Anyway it's your turn now I'm sure you'll do great come on I want to see how well you do." She encouraged

This was the moment he was sort of dreading how was he at his incredibly marble like size going to get all the way through this pink square without falling and try and impress his gigantic care taker at the same time? He certainly didn't want to look like a coward in front of her but at the same time he was strangely nervous and fearful that he would fall on his face flat if he tried to make as much as a tiny hop so he.........
1452211111122211321111221232.title: They play a different game

choices: Emily comes up with another game
Emily takes Ash outside for some air
14522111111222113211112212322.content:
Ash breathed deeply and Hopped.

It wasn't impressive. His hop might've been a quarter of an inch if that. He was still in the first block. He looked up at Emily and shrugged. "I tried."

Emily rubbed her chin thoughtfully. It hadn't occurred to her before but the problem was clear, Hop Scotch blocks were far too big. She would have to make it smaller then, but then she wouldn't be able to use it.

"I know!"

Emily walked to her dresser and took out a pencil and a sheet of paper. Then as tiny as she could she drew out the Hop Scotch blocks and placed the paper onto the floor.

"There. I have mine, and you have yours."

Ash climbed up onto the sheet of paper and walked toward the drawn blocks. They were still big, but it was more manageable. He gave it a try. Granted he wasn't as agile as Emily and he did mess up on his first try. But for a first try it wasn't too bad. Emily clapped approvingly.

"Bravo!"

Ash took a Bow.

And that's how they spent the morning. Each taking turns playing Hop Scotch. They tried hoping at the same time but it didn't do to well as Emily hopping resulted in Ash getting bounced off the floor. The only time when you could describe Hop Scotch as an extreme sport. By the end of it all, Ash was exhausted. It was just hard for a young guy five foot eight to keep up with a kid that was four hundred feet or more and still growing.

He had to admit though that it had been a very interesting experience. One of many he suspected he would have.
14522111111222113211112212322.title: Makes a attempt to try at least

What's life like where you come from Ash?
Care to head down to the lake to cool off a bit?
145221111112221132111122123222.content:
"Hmmmm well that was a rather fun game but it's a bit stuffy in here isn't it Ash? Let's go outside for a bit." Emily suggested as she stood up first putting up her pencils and crayons then turned to look at the tiny man at her feet.

"Yeah I agree it is pretty humid in this room,I sure wish you guys have air conditioner back then." As he tried fanning himself with a small piece of paper even smaller than him on the floor.

"Air Conditioner? What's that?" The giant child asked arching a eyebrow.

"A machine that lets out very cold air to help keep people cool during the summer." Was your short reply.

"Oh well come on let's go outside,hold on first I need to get Lucy." As she bent over scooping up her treasured doll then gently picked up Ash in her free hand and walked out the door.



Once downstairs Emily informed her grandmother where she was going before practically skipping out the front door.

"Okay but remember to come back in time for supper!"
Her grandmother called after her once outside Emily stopped to a steady,slow walk admiring the singing birds,cloudless sunny nice day and of course beautiful scenery that even you who didn't really care much for the outdoors,had to admit was pretty impressive finally following a pleasant walk through the woods the 7 year old was resting peacefully under a huge maple tree.

"Ah it's such a nice day isn't it?" She said happily to you in her lap.

"Yeah I guess." You replied then a certain question appeared in your mind and you asked her about her parents.


"So how come you live all the way out here with your grandmother?"

"Huh?" Emily was straightening her doll's bonnet when you asked this particular question and stared down at you.

"I said why is it that you live all the way out here with only your grandmother Emily? Why aren't you with your parents?" You ask again.

"Well I do live with my parents Ash,I just happen to come here during the summer to stay with my grandmother and parts of the winter as well but I do return to the big city with my mom and dad to go back to school." She explained looking down at him with a bit of a frown. "Why did you ask that question for?"

"Just wondering that's all. I just never saw them that's all." Ash shrugged then looking down at him it was her turn to ask a specific question which was.................
145221111112221132111122123222.title: Emily takes Ash outside for some air

145221111112221132112.content:
"Why? So I can do THIS"

Emily looked at the tiny person with a puzzled expression as Ash ran and climbed up onto the exposed soles of her feet. Then it became clear what he had in mind as He scurried up to the ball of her right foot and began tickling. He hadn't been sure whether or not the young Giantess would even feel it at first, but her reaction was immediate as the foot began to rock.

Well, rock might not be the right term. It was like riding a huge bronco. He was bounced about on the huge sole while above he could hear giant giggling. He tried to hold on. He tried to grasp a crease or a fold in the flesh of the sole only for it to smooth out as Emily flexed her foot. He noted to himself that he really hadn't though the whole plan through. At least, he though, he wasn't getting hurt.

Ash bounced and rolled down the length of the ball of the foot finally landing among Emily's toes. They immediately closed around him, holding him in a smothering but gentle embrace.

"So, you thought you could defeat me by tickling me?" said Emily as she calmly unwrapped the thread from around her lower legs."Naughty little tailor."

Once she had freed her ankles, she calmly plucked Ash out from her toes. She grasped him by the back of his shirt and held him up at eye level. One huge eye focused on Ash. Looking closely he could see the veins in the eye quiver as blood rushed through them.

"Now, what shall be your punishment?"
145221111112221132112.title: She was completely fine

choices: "It's time to play another story" (Ash's choice)
1452211111122211321122.content:
Emily carefully dropped Ash into the palm of her hand "Now I'll crush you to paste!!"

Before Ash could object, Emily then placed her left hand over her right and began to make a grinding motion, all the while keeping Ash safe in the cup of her palm. The sound of flesh rubbing against flesh was louder than Ash would've thought, but should've been expected. After all, Emily's palms were probably twenty feet across.

"You know, I don't need two hands to crush a tiny tailor."

The canopy of flesh was lifted away and chubby fingers curled around him as she closed her hand into a fist. He found himself trapped in a fold of flesh in the palm of Emily's hand. Little or no light shown though the cracks between her fingers. To add to the effect, he began to struggle which caused Emily to giggle. If she was really serious about crushing him, Ash knew she could do so easily without effort. He was thankfully she was only playing.

"Now that you've been thoroughly crushed, I think...."
1452211111122211321122.title: Emily "Crushes" Ash

choices: Ready or not, here she comes
1452211111122211323.content:
"Emily?"

Emily turned and saw her grandmother standing in the doorway. Ash froze and remained as still as the mannequins around him.

"Yes, Granny?"

"Are you going to be playing Giant again?"

"Yes"

"It sounded like an elephant up here the last time you played. Maybe you should take your boots off, It'll be much quieter."

'Take off her boots?' thought Ash.

When her grandmother left the room Emily pulled her boots off and stood looking at her socked feet for a moment. The socks could make things slippery. She remembered slipping and bumping her head a while ago. He had a big knot on her head and she didn't want to go through that again. As Ash watched she removed her socks as well.

It was probably the first time Ash actually looked at her feet. Oh there was a fleeting gimps when he was trying to get her attention, but that was different. They were pale, like the rest of her. Nails cut and clean. Toes round and smooth. the toughness of age had not yet taken hold. Cute.

Then there was the smell.

He didn't want to embarrass her, but there was a distinct Oder that he could smell from where he was standing. Not her fault of course, her boots didn't allow for ventilation. No matter, the smell would fade gradually as her feet dried out.
1452211111122211323.title: Emily's grandmother interrupts the fun

145221111112221133.content:
The Stump didn't look that old ,maybe only a few years. But it did have a menacing feel to it. Ash climbed down from the giant girl’s hand and approached a large gap in the stump. It looked all the world like something out of An Indiana Jones movie.

‘Only the penitent man will pass.’ He thought, then out loud “Where did you find them? Just out here? “

Emily nodded holding Lucy tight “Be careful.”

“I will.” Ash too out the pin light he had on his key chain. As he walked deeper the little light revealed a great many things. The ground was littered with items, most were still recognizable though rusted into ruin. The Big surprise though was what he found just a little farther ahead. A wall of metal and concrete.

It took Ash only a moment to realize he was looking at a building. Buried under the roots of the tree. There was a huge hole where the wall hard partially collapsed. He carefully stepped inside and looked around.

“It’s a Mall.”

The floor was uneven, as well as the ceiling. But what shops he could see looked intact. Items shelved and on display waiting for customers that would never come. Something caught his eye. A newspaper on the floor. It was a newspaper. More importantly it was a Newspaper from his home town. It was dated 1987.

Suddenly it hit him. Of Course! This must’ve been the Babel Mall. They said it had been swallowed up by a freak sink hole. It must’ve appeared among the roots of the tree and was only disturbed when someone cut the tree down. He looked at the stores through the glass barriers that were not broken. Beyond the glass wall was like a time capsule. Everything was preserved.

Maybe there was something here he could find useful.
145221111112221133.title: The next morning

choices: "I want to explore the Mall some more."
"Lets look around some more, see what else we can find."
1452211111122211331.content:
"What did you see?" Emily Asked as Ash emerged from the stump.

"It's unbelievable." said Ash "There's a whole mall down in there. More or less."

Emily frowned "What's a mall?"

Oops. Ash had been so excited about his find that he'd forgotten Emily wasn't familiar with such concepts." A mall is a building that has a bunch of stores in them. Clothing, food, tools, Books. Toys, stuff like that." He looked back into the stump "It's from my world. It disappeared years ago! This is where it ended up. Emily, do you realize what this means?"

Emily shrugged as if to admit she had no idea.

Ash patiently explained "I'm not the first one to come here to your world. This has happened before! Who knows how may people could've come here over the years." He paused for a moment, then asked "Emily, how long has your Grandmother lived in these parts?"

"Not long. A couple of years." Emily answered "She grew tired of the City and moved out to the country."

"I see. I was hoping to learn some local history."

1452211111122211332.title: Explore some more

14522111111222113322.content:
“You won’t believe what I’ve found!” Said Ash. “There’s a lot of stuff I can use!”

“Really?” said Emily, her interest peaked “Like what?”

“There’s a lot of clothes down here!” Ash’s voice called out. “ They are not in style anymore more but I’ve got a whole wardrobe! There are tools! I-THERE’S A BED DOWN HERE!! I GOT MY OWN BED!”

Hours later he and Emily were sorting out what he had found. He didn’t take everything he had found. Not all areas of the mall were perfectly preserved. Some places didn't stand the test of time and decayed badly. But there was enough so that he had the essentials.

In addition to the 80’s style clothing and a bed, he was able to find camping equipment; sleeping bags , backpacks, portable stove with propane cylinders. There were flashlights, but after so many years almost every pack of batteries he found was corroded and leaking. Except for maybe the rechargeable. If he could figure out how to charge them he’d be okay. He made a note to himself to check out the radioshack the next time he went back in.

Then there was the chair and a collection of dated books and magazines. All in all, he had enough to make sure he lived comfortably for a while. All he needed was a place to keep them.

Emily provided that solution by helping him build a cabin. Well, a Box made from twigs and held together with glue. But if you live in it that makes it a cabin. It had two floors. The upper floor was his living area, while down below he kept his supplies. It wasn’t exactly what he called perfect but for the moment he could call it home.

The best part of it was that it was portable. Well, portable when Emily picked it up.

Fast Forward

"A giant lizard who attacks cities? Ohhh he sounds very....mean!" She frowned

"Movie?"

Ash pointed towards where her right hand was Emily bent down and nodded "That's called a movie theater and although it's completely ruined now we use it to watch...Er what you might think of as 'moving pictures' on a big screen thing there have been many movies or motion pictures over the years some are about romance,,others about the past,the future,horror,science fiction even cartoons basically movies can be about anything." Ash explained

"Ohh it sounds very wonderful and fasicnating!" Emily exclaimed happily "I wish I were your size so we could watch one."

"Yeah but like I said the theater's mostly caved in so even I wouldn't be able to enter without something falling on top of me." Ash reassured her though Emily's expression became gloomy and disappointed she quickly got over it and stood up to her full height she practically resembled a life size take on the Statue of Liberty to him

"Oh okay but do you have everything you need for your cottage Ash?"

"Yeah I should think so thank you very much for helping me build it." He replied as he walked back over it

"You're welcome." She smiled as she bent down again getting on her hands and knees watching as he entered inside.

14522111112211212.content:
Despite Emily's best efforts, Ash wasn't swimming very well. The Fault wasn't in Emily's ability to show him proper technique but in Physics. He was tiny compared to her and the environment around them, and very light. So light in fact that he was barely breaking the surface tension of the water. If he were lighter he could've stood on it.

Realizing that things just were not working out very well, Emily scooped Ash out of the water with cupped hands. Ash found himself laying on shiny wet skin as the water drained out between her fingertips. He gazed up into Emily's face. For both of them it was a surreal moment. Both had read the tale of Lemuel Gulliver, and at that moment it was as though a Lilliputian was meeting Glumdalclitch of Brobdingnag. Her breath warmed his shivering body as she rose up out of the water and made her way back to dry land.

"I guess Swimming didn't go so well," said Ash.

"It's okay," said Emily as she sat back under the tree "You did your best. Are you cold?"

"Freezing. I've never felt this cold coming out of water before."

Emily closed her hands together and put her thumbs apart just enough so she could look at Ash. The results were immediate. With her palms radiating heat it didn't take long for the chill to leave the micro's body. It occurred to her then that the tiny person was completely at her mercy. He was Her little man.

Ash noticed Emily's thoughtful gaze "Is everything okay?"

"Oh! E-Everything is fine. I was just thinking"

"About what?"

1452211111221121231.content:
Ash looked up at Emily's anticipating eyes. He was wondering just what he was feeling towards this young Giantess. Certainly not on the same level of intimacy or attraction like you would find with husbands and wives or girlfriends and boyfriends, or any combination such. Perhaps if she were older.

So what was it?

There was a friendship developing, that much was certain. An unusual one to say the least but a friendship nonetheless. One that's course of direction would be determined by what he said next. He could tell that she was hoping that he would say he had a crush on her too. Maybe he did. Deep down inside somewhere. If it made her happy, then a little half truth couldn't hurt.

"Yeah, I guess I do have a Crush on you Emily--"

Ash hadn't gotten the words out of his mouth before he heard a loud squeal of delight and Emily's lips were upon him.

Getting kissed by a three or four hundred foot young girl isn't an experience one forgets. Ash Suddenly found himself pinned to Emily's palm by the warm soft flesh that was molding around his body. His upper half was pressed into her soft upper lip while his lower limbs were pressed firmly into her bottom lip. There he stayed for what seemed like minutes and his ears popped as there was suction and a Smacking sound. Her warm breath gusted down upon him and her mouth hovered over him for a moment in a childish toothy grin. He though maybe he might be kissed again, but after a moment Emily pulled her face away.

"Well," Ash gasped "That was certainly different. I've been kissed before, but not like that."

Emily giggled and, stood up carefully.Then, picking up Lucy, she started to walk.

"Where are we going?"Asked Ash

14522111112211212311.content:
As Emily thundered toward home with Ash held in her cupped hand, the tiny human gazed up into the face of this young giantess. It was amazing the level of detail one really could see, it was as though the world had been magnified and everything was in clear definition.

Her complexion was clear. The hair that hung around her head were like thick strands of rope as were her eyebrows and eyelashes. Her eyes. He could see pulsating veins in the corners that were about as thick as one of his fingers. Speaking of fingers, or more specifically the palm he was sitting in, his own fingers easily fit between the swirly dermal ridges that laced across the palm and fingers.

Unbeknownst to Ash, Emily headed for home, thinking of the fun she was going to have with her new little friend. A friend she would keep a secrete from everyone. Not yet anyway. Maybe one day when the time was right she would show him to Little Bear, but for now No one must know about him. Oh what games she would play!

Emily opened the Door to the cabin and looked about. Not a sign of her Grandmother. She crept into her bedroom and set Ash on her bed.

"I think I ought to change out of this." She said "Will you be okay by yourself?"

"I think so." said Ash. "If anyone comes I'll hide behind your pillow."

Emily picked up some clothes and announced "Be Right Back."

Some one might find it odd that Emily would change in another room, but not to Ash. He understood completely. After all, it just wasn't lady like nor was it proper for Emily to change in front of him. Even if she had, being a decent human being Ash would've waiting behind the pillow until the okay was given.

While he waited, he looked about the room. Immediately he realized that this was not the bedroom he remembered from the cartoon. There were changes. He expected that. He wasn't, after all, in the cartoon but in a gigantic interpretation of that cartoon. There would be differences.

When Emily returned she was wearing
14522111112211212311.title: "Home"

145221111122112123113.content:
Emily was wearing a red dress that went to her ankles like the Blue one Ash remembered her cartoon counterpart wore. She also wore a black vest with pockets.

"What do you think?" she asked spinning around "Do you like it?"

"Yeah, it's really nice Emily." Said Ash. No harm in being honest.

"Thank you." she said "I have Sandals that match."

Sandals. Something else that was different. The Cartoon Emily wore only those heavy looking boots/shoes, and she only wore that one blue dress. He always thought that if they had showed her closet in the cartoon you would've seen four or more pairs of the exact same suit.

Emily walked over and at first it looked as though she was about to hop onto the bed. Then she thought better and sat on the floor, her hands on either side of Ash.

"Are you hungry?"

Ash nodded. He had no idea how long it had been since he had eaten last but now he was starving.

"I have candy. Jelly babies."

"Sounds good to me"

It was a bit unnerving to be the same size as a candy jelly baby, so you can imagine Ash's uneasiness when the Jelly Baby given to him was a bit bigger than he was. Well, at least he'd have a supply for a while. He broke off a piece. Definitely not something he'd eat for a normal meal, not unless he wanted to deal with a case of sugar diabetes. For now, it was something to fill the gap.

Speaking of gaps, he watched as Emily taused five of the candied jellies into her mouth. Five candies, each bigger than him, now in the process of being chewed into a pulp and swallowed. Emily noticed Ash looking.

"Is everything okay?" she asked, her breath smelling of strawberry or something along those lines.

"Oh, yeah everything is fine. It's just that I just saw you eat five pieces of candy bigger than me. I thought that was kinda amazing. "

"Oh." said Emily nudging the candy she had given Ash to one side with her finger. She smiled "Do you want a closer look?"

Ash swallowed "How close do you have in mind?"

" I was thinking...."

145221111122112123123.content:
"Well, no there are no talking animals." said Ash. "Well, not unless you count parrots that only repeat what you tell them. The only time you will ever see taking animals is in made up stories. Speaking of made up...."

"Yes?"

Okay, how was Ash going to tell her she was a fictional character where he came from? Clearly she wasn't fictional in this world, the fact he was sitting in her palm and looking up at her face was proof of that. Maybe he could tell her the truth without revealing everything. It might weird her out a bit, but it was the chance he'd have to take.

"There's a series of Books about a little girl named Emily, and she has friends named Duck, Owl, Cat, Hen, and Little Bear."

Emily's eyes widen "Really?"

"Yeah, and the way she is described matches you. Right down to the way you wear your hair. Of course, she's not Gigantic like you are."

"So...I'm just a story in your world?"

"Well, that little girl in the story isn't real. But you sure are." said Ash feeling the dermal swirl pattern of Emily's palm. "Who knows? Maybe I'm not real in this world. Maybe I'm just a character in a story too."

"It's still a bit strange, you know?" said Emily. "I mean, somebody writing a story about me and yet not me? Does she act like me?"

"You know, I can't really say for sure." Ash mused "I haven't observed you long enough to know for sure if she acts like you."

Emily frowned "Observed?"

"Oh sorry, It means I haven't watched you enough."

"Oh."

'Did that come off the wrong way?' though Ash. If so, Emily hadn't noticed. Instead she had an expression of amusement on her face mixed with something else that he couldn't quite make out. Like she was lost in thought. Speaking of which.....

"Emily, where are we?"

Emily looked about. She had been so caught up with listening to Ash tell her about the Fictional Emily that she hadn't noticed where she was going. She paused, looked about and finally said.

14522111112211212312321.content:
Ash felt a vibration from inside his pocket. No way, it couldn't be---

He pulled out his phone, it was a text message. He opened the folder. It was from his buddy Scott Inquiring if he'd seen that flash of light earlier and asking where he was. If he had text back exactly where he was his buddy would've thought he was drinking.

"It's my phone."

Emily frowned "What's a Phone?"

"It's a communication machine." Ash explained. I can talk with other people though this, but it shouldn't be able to work here."

"Why not?"

"Phones send out signals to other people with phones. It's like when you open a very, very little crevice in the lantern. Like a thread of the spider, only it's invisible. So without other people like me here, this shouldn't be able to work." He didn't want to even try to explain satellite transmissions to the young child who probably only barely knew how to read, so he tried to make the concept of cellular phone tech as simple as he could."The only way this could work would be if---"

His heart leaped in his chest. Could it be that simple?

"---If there was a gateway of sorts to my world, and I was getting the signal from there! Emily, if I could find it I could go home!"

"So, how are you going to find this Gateway?"Asked Emily.

Ash thought for a moment. According to the display, the cellphone signal was weak. It only made sense then that the stronger he got to the source, the stronger the signal.

"I can use my phone." Ash held up the tiny device for Emily to see "It should be able to lead us to it like a divining rod to water."

Emily stood up and held Ash outward "A brave adventure then! Which way to we go?"

Ash held the phone up and moved it in different directions until the signal began to get stronger, then he pointed"That Way!"

Emily began to walk in the direction Ash instructed. As she did so, she began to have mixed feelings. This was indeed a grand adventure and naturally she wanted to help her new friend find his way home. It would also mean she might not see him again. She wanted to tell Ash this, but she didn't feel that the time was right. For now, she would be silent. As she walked, and Ash instructed her, she began to notice that the direction she was going was an all too familiar one to her. And why shouldn't it be familiar? After all it was a place she knew, though she never would've guessed in a million years that a gateway to a land where people were tiny existed there.

She found herself walking up behind
