14522111112211212312321211.content:
"Ash!"

The Moment he was spotted by the Giant child he was scooped up. Being much smaller than she appeared to be in her own reality, Ash was much more of a handful. In fact the palms of her hands that were once vast plains were now two feet wide. The fingers were equally smaller, but no less powerful By now he was used to being lifted into the air, but this time he could see more of Emily's face. The feeling was mutual as the child examined her friend thoughtfully.

"So that's what your face looks like." She said "I could only make out your eyes and mouth before."

"I was just about to say the same." said Ash "This close all I used to be able to see was your eye, or your mouth."

Emily giggled, then looked about. "So this is where you live?" she looked down at a metal object with wheels "Is that an Automobile?"

Ash looked down "Yes it is."

"Ash, who is your Giant friend?"

Ash glanced down and watched a familiar face approaching. "Not that any of us wouldn't recognize her anyway."

"Scott! I got your Text!" said Ash "Oh, Emily this is my best friend, Scott. Scott this is Emily of Bear Country."

Scott Waved "Ash, we've got a big problem here. You know she can't remain here in this world."

Emily Frowned "I don't understand. I'm not mean, I won't hurt anyone. I promise."

"It's not that, Emily," Said Ash.

"Kid, there are people in this world of ours who would do great harm upon you." Scott Explained. "You might have friendly intentions but that doesn't mean people might not try to hurt you out of fear or hate."

"Besides that," Ash added "It's going to be very hard to find clothing in your size, or collect enough food for you. Then there's other things you may need. Like a place to go to the bathroom or to bath. And what about your Grandmother, or Little Bear? What will happen with they can't find you?" He looked past Emily to the space behind her. He could see a shimmer of distortion in the air. "The portal is still open. You can still go home."

"But," Emily began to speak. But she had to admit, if only to herself, that Ash and his friend was right. Her eyes began to tear up "I don't want to leave without you."

Ash knew he had a decision to make, one that would chance the course of his life. Emily would not leave without him, and they were running out of time to convince her to go. Armed police might show up at any moment, worst still the portal could close behind Emily leaving her to a possible fate worst than death. He closed his eyes, and made his decision.

"Scott, go to my home and bring me my mobile home and the following things. And hurry."

Less than twenty minutes later, Ash's one man camper was at Emily's feet and Ash was putting in the last of what he hoped would be what was necessary to live in a Giant world. Scott looked at Ash and shook his head.

"You are really going to go though with this?"

"It's the only way, Scott. If she remains here with us, she'll be hunted by those who will want to study her. Do who knows what to her. Despite her great height, she's still a seven year old child. I can't let anything like that happen to her."

"You'll be different in her world. Alone."

"I will not be alone." Ash looked up at Emily. "I will have companionship of a different kind."

At that moment sirens could be heard from a distance. "We'd better hurry. Emily! Pick up my new home as soon as I'm inside!"

Scott grabbed Ash's arm in a firm grip, he looked back to his friend.

"Take care of yourself over there."

Ash nodded and stepped into the camper.

He locked the door and sat down on a chair among items that were thrown together in haste. He saw Emily's hands press against the windows on either side of the structure and he felt everything lift into the air. Emily turned and stepped back through the portal just as police and military arrived. there was a flash and the portal was gone. All that remained that indicated that a giant had been there was the footprints made in the asphalt.

"Take care of yourself" Scott whispered and turned to face the bewildered authority figures. In the days to come, videos captured by cellphone cameras were uploaded to social media. All were immediately debunked as fraud, because something like that was just impossible. Only those who were witness to it know the real truth, and it mattered not that others didn't believe. The great footprints pressed into the road were chopped out and put on display as a tourist attraction.

But what became of Ash when he arrived back to the world of Little Bear? Well, much to Ash's surprise he wasn't as tiny as he had been when he first arrived, though still very small compared to the world around him. Ash figured it had something to do with the fact he was inside his camper.
14522111112211212312321211.title: Emily Can't Stay

1452211111221121231232122.content:
Emily looked about, her disorientation passed. Before her was a doll size buildings, and staring up at here were doll size people. Some where holding objects up at her that she didn't recognize, others were pointing and speaking to each other in disbelief and astonishment, while others were slowly backing away as though the slightest movement on her part would cause them to run for the hills.

"Alright, everyone Calm Down!!"

That was Ash's voice. she looked about for him and found him addressing the crowd.

"Yes she's big, but she's also a 7 year old Girl, so don't do anything stupid and make this any worst than it is! She hasn't done anything and She's not going to hurt anybody."

"How do you know she won't?"

"You want proof?"

Ash looked up at Emily. "Emily, if you could be so kind as to demonstrate how harmless you are."

Emily smiled and reached down. The sudden movement caused the people around her to back away, all except Ash who stood and waited as Emily's hand closed around him. While not as small as he appeared to her before, he was a comfortable handful. to the young giantess he appeared to be three inches tall. More or less.

There was a gasp and the sound of awe as she lifted Ash to her face. The child examined her friend thoughtfully.

"So that's what your face looks like." She said "I could only make out your eyes and mouth before."

"I was just about to say the same." said Ash "This close all I used to be able to see was your eye, or your mouth."

Emily giggled, then looked about. "So this is where you live?" she looked about.

"What do you think."

Emily sniffed the air. "The Air smells bad."

"Yeah, that's from the smoke coming out of the Automobiles down there." Ash pointed down to a silver Chevy

"Air feels thinner too."

"It's not as thick and rich as the air you're used to, Emily." Ash explained. "There hasn't been anything close to your size around here in millions of years."

"Ash, who is your Giant friend?"

Ash glanced down and watched a familiar face approaching. "Not that any of us wouldn't recognize her anyway."

"Scott! I got your Text!" said Ash "Oh, Emily this is my best friend, Scott. Scott this is Emily of Bear Country."

"Bear Country? Ash is this who I think it is?"

Ash nodded "It is. Well, an uncanny facsimile at least."

Scott looked up at the Giant before him. "Well, I guess the scientist were wrong when they said nothing this size could live."

"Trust me Scott, They have been wrong about A LOT of Things."

Emily sat on the ground still holding Ash in her hand. As she did, the people began to lose their fear of this giant and slowly gathered around her. Her presence did of course raise concerns, concerns even Emily had to admit she herself had also considered. Taking care of Ash would've been easy in world. She could've made his life relatively comfortable with just a doll house. In her case, Just to gather enough food for her would be challenging. Not to mention clothing. She couldn't wear a Bathing suit all the time. She would get cold. Then there was her friends, her Grandmother. No. Staying here forever just wouldn't do. But a visit certainly couldn't hurt.

Just then

"I just want to look around for a bit Ash everything looks so amazing! Not at all like in my world! Oh what are those things?" She was pointing straight at a street filled with fast-food joints MacDonald's,Burger King,KFC and such "What are those buildings called?"

"They're known as fast-food places or restaurants Emily,people go to them for food or get a quick bite to eat but I don't think it's such a good idea for you to try and eat anything just yet."

Emily frowned a bit as she clutches her stomach "Why not Ash? I am getting a bit hungry." Ash's own stomach lurched over this was what he feared the most and carefully had to explain

"Well that's sort of the problem Emily being that you're so big your appetite may be a bit too much for this town's population in other words(he noticed her bewildered face)you might end up eating this town out of all it's food supply and that's not a good thing sweetie!" Emily blushed at the last comment he gave her as she glanced at the numerous food stores

"I know I figured that but......Ash I'm hungry!" She certainly did look it as her stomach gave another rumbling sound

"Can't it wait Emily until the end of the tour of the town?" Ash begged but Emily's reply was......

145221111122112123123212232.content:
Continuing the tour of the town did two things. It allowed Ash to show here things she'd never seen before. But more importantly it allowed the fast food joints and other places to gather enough food to feed the young Giantess. The food bill would be costly, but they figured not as costly should she be the kind to throw a giant property damaging tantrum. Of course such a tantrum was beneath Emily. As her Grandmother told her, such a display was un-lady like.

Emily found herself in what Ash called a Play Ground. There were children there as well as concerned parents. Feeling a little tired, she sat down with her shins tucked underneath her. As the children gathered around her she mused that she must've looked as though she had climbed down from some beanstalk. In fact as she introduced herself one little kid, a bit younger than Emily, did ask if she had done just that and inquired where the beanstalk was. To which she smiled and played along with child. After all, the real explanation was hard for even Emily to grasp so there was no point in confusing anyone.

A smell came to Emily's nostrils. Food. But she couldn't really tell what kind of food, it was a mixture of aromas.A moment later one of the mechanical constructs, Ash had called it a flat bed truck, drove into the park and came to a stop in front of her. On the back was a back yard swimming pool filled with everything from cheese burgers to cooked rice and all things in between. Emily carefully sat Ash down and after thanking everyone for the food, contemplated how to eat it. There were no forks or spoons big enough for her hands. So she would have to use her fingers whether it was un-lady like or not. She at least did so in a polite manner, taking only small portions at a time, rather than trying to shovel it in all at once. The mixture of foods gave everything an unusual flavor but not at all distasteful.

As she ate her meal, she felt something, lots of somethings, touching the soles of her feet that were sticking out from under her. Hands. Little hands. She turned and saw several children had gathered around curiously and were touching the soles of her feet, feeling the dirty skin with it's wrinkles and over sized dermal swirls. Mothers whispered for their children to be careful not to tickle her, and when one child tried to climb up he was taken way by his concerned Mother. Years later that young boy would point to this moment in his life for his thing for feet.

Emily turned back to her meal, all things considering she probably would've been just as curious.

The meal wasn't near enough to fill her. But she dared not ask for more, she knew that to gather the food they had given her must have been a challenge. So she thanked them, wiped her hands clean in her bathing suit and picked Ash up.
145221111122112123123212232.title: Feeding Emily

1452211111221121231232122322.content:
Ash sat vigilantly as Emily lay sleeping. After her meal she had grown drowsy and was currently taking a nap. Ash stood by making sure nothing was going to happen to her. He wasn't the only one there. By this point the local police had been involved and they too were keeping guard. They didn't understand how a giant kid could be sleeping in the middle of a park but they certainly understood the importance of keeping this a secret for as long as possible. A near impossible task in this day and age where everyone had a camera in their phone. Ash was worried, Emily simply didn't understand the gravity of the situation. Thoughts of her in a cage somewhere with scientists poking and prodding her came to mind.

He looked at her peaceful face, noticing the rapid eye movement. She was dreaming. 'What could she be dreaming about?' he wondered.

Emily was holding Ash's hand as they walked through the Mall. In her dream anyway. Ash was taking here to see one of those moving picture shows he had told her about. Of course, in her dream, the Mall didn't exactly look accurate. She had only seen one from the outside and her mind recreated it as Ash had described it to her. Since she had only her own experiences to rely on, the results was a Mall interior that looked like something that would've been made a century earlier. Plaster and Wallpaper instead of gyprock, oil lamps instead of electric lights. Even the food they got from the refreshment stand was from Emily's own memory. They had been watching a silent vintage interpretation of Star Wars (Which resembled the Trip to the Moon * more than the George Lucas Film), when she was abruptly awaken.

*https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_FrdVdKl...

14522111112211212312321223231.content:
"Ash? Where are you?"

"He's gone back to the spot you appeared in."

Emily turned in the direction where she heard the voice. There standing near a Tree was, to her perspective, a little man. He wore a worn black leather Jacket. He was bearded, and wore spectacles.

"Who are you?"

"My name is Shawn." said the man. "Don't worry, he asked me to keep an eye on you while he was gone. He wanted to check to see if that portal door was still there and he didn't want to leave you alone."

"You Know Ash well?"

"Ashley and I go way back." said Shawn smiling "I'm the only one who calls him that, and he would've trusted nobody but me to look after you while you were asleep. He's very concerned about you."

"Concerned?"

"Yeah, I guess a lot of us are. You might think this world is a nice place to visit, but trust me you don't want to live here."

Emily didn't say anything, but silently she agreed. Sleeping outside when it was warm is one thing, sleeping outside when it was cold is quite the other. Even Gulliver in the land of Lilliput knew he couldn't stay there forever. She mused if what had happened to her, was the same thing that happened to old Gulliver. She was starting to think so.

"Do you know you talk in your sleep?"

Emily Blinked. She hadn't known that "What did I say?"

"From what I was able to make sense out of you apparently dreamed that your friends were here with you. That caused some fear and concerned from some of us who were listening. I mean, the idea of having more than one giant walking around kinda scares people. I'm sure you'd feel the same if suddenly giant's appeared where you live."

She was about to reply when she noticed Ash running towards her. He looked concerned. He stopped beside Shawn and had to let himself rest a full minute before he could say anything.

"I just got back from the Portal" He panted. "It's still open from what I can tell, but--"

1452211111221121232.content:
This was probably the single hardest thing Ash had ever had to do in a very long time. He really didn't know how Emily was going to react and the last thing he wanted to do was hurt her. She was looking down at him. Her hair dripped with water. She was expecting his answer.

"Emily..."

"Yes?"

"I'm sorry. I'm very, very, sorry. As much as I like you....I don't have the same feelings toward you that you have toward me."

The reaction to this revelation was both expected and unexpected. Tears began to swell in the young Giantess eyes. Ash immediately realized she had been crushed by what he'd told her. Suddenly the palm he sat on tilted sideways and he slid/ tumbled off the edge to the ground below. Blades of grass broke his fall to the ground below, if they hadn't he had no doubt he would've been seriously hurt. Emily stood up as he lay there on his back, the wind knocked out of him. She looked down upon him, tears were already falling. She had an expression of anger and disappointment. She could've done anything at this point. ANYTHING. There was nothing Ash could've done had she decided to hurt him. Instead, she stomped away leaving Ash behind.

"E-Emily!" Ash managed to gasp out "Wait! C-come back...don't leave...."

He watched her stomp away, disappearing over the horizon. He was alone. His one contact in this strange world, the one person who might've helped him was gone.

Ash painfully stood up and surveyed his surroundings. What the hell was he going to do now? He regretted what he had said to her, but it had been the truth. The truth had hurt her, and that had cost him dearly.

But still simply talking to himself couldn't erase the fact that he just drove away the only person in this gigantic,strange cartoon world who could possibly help him as he stood there collecting his thoughts and wondering where he was going to sleep for the night Ash at first didn't see the huge shadow appearing over him nor did he feel the enormous digits of the hand that reached down unexpectedly scooping him up .

it was only until he looked up at the face of his captor did he realize it was Emily but the sweet childlike wonder ad kindness she displayed earlier to him was gone now she bore a serious frowning,disappointed stony expression and she had a small glass jar in her other hand! Ash's air supply was already beginning to run out as he struggled to breathe why couldn't she punch air holes in this thing?

"I can see that but Emily you have to understand can you imagine what it would look like? I mean a tiny teenager like me and a gigantic 7 year old like you in a(gulp) relationship? It would feel weird people and by people I mean all your animal friends will talk and what about your grandmother....."

But Emily still wasn't listening she was truly in love with him he could tell right off the bat,the look in her eyes when she first found him and watched over him and she screamed out

"And why should that matter? they don't have to know Ash! It can be our little secret please? Pretty please?" But again Ash had to let her down gently swallowing hard

"Sorry Emily I really am but....no!" Then that stony face turned into pure anger and she almost dropped him on the ground as she folded her arms and turned in the opposite direction fuming

"Well then since you want to be that way you're not coming out of there until you say you like me Ash! And that's final!"

"She honestly,truly is in love with me! How can I make her see reason?" He thought not longer concerned about air supply when he realized he had just broken his new giant friend's heart?

"Well have you given it some thought? Do you like me or not Ash?"

145221111122112123233.content:
"Times Up! Do you have anything to say?"

Ash was speechless, with the air growing thinner and thinner He literally couldn't say anything to save his life. Emily wouldn't wait any longer for an answer. She removed the cover of the Jar. In it's place she placed cheese cloth held in place by string.

"You'll just have to stay in there then." she said coldly.

"Emily--"

His world went sideways as the hand holding the jar went to Emily's side. Then it began to sway back and forth as she started to walk. He was glad to be able to breath, but at the same time he wondered just what was going to happen next? He looked at the palm and fingers that were pressed against the glass of the jar. She could've done much worst to him. Instead she had only taken him prisoner.That's not saying she still couldn't do something to him, but if she had wanted him dead she would've kept the cover on the jar and let him suffocate to death. He forced that image out of his mind as he didn't want to dwell on it.

Emily headed towards her house, still fuming. But not wanting anybody to know about Ash, she decided not to show it. She wiped away her tears and composed herself. Not an easy task considering her age. But her efforts were fruitful. She walked past her grandmother who took no notice to the jar she'd been holding and headed for her bedroom. She placed the jar on her dresser and glared angrily at Ash.

"I'll be back. I might consider feeding you when I get back." With that she stormed off.

Ash sat defeated. What they said was true. Hell hath no fury like a woman's scorn.

14522111112212.content:
"Emily! Emily, Please Come Back!!"

Ash waved and shouted, but it was no use. The young girl simply couldn't hear him from that distance away. He watched her walk out of his line of site and the sound of her footsteps faded away. He was alone, lost in a world that was familiar to him and yet completely Alien. He knew he wouldn't be able to survive on his own, there were too many things that could get him killed. And yet, there was a part of him that had for many years had wished for something like this to happen every day. But what he'd wished was different than what he was experiencing now. What good was there to be Tiny without Giants to interact with?

But what could he do about it? He could hope for Emily to come back this way but in all this grass he'd be hopelessly unnoticeable. He'd just about given up hope when he felt the ground shake again.

His heart leaped in his chest! Someone was coming! But he couldn't see who from his place among the grass. He looked about and spied a flower. Quickly, he began to climb, faster than he ever though he could. He'd just made it to the top and thown himself into the middle of the flower in time to see another creature he recognized.

Little Bear walked down the worn path and as he was turning the corner past an old oak tree he noticed a flower growing by itself among the tall grass. A thought came to mind. Reaching down he picked the Flower.

"What a pretty flower. I think I'll give it to---"

The cub walked swiftly for a creature of his size, over a what seemed to Ash like a vast distance until he finally came across his Mother hanging laundry from a clothes line. The micro human's heart skipped a beat before racing like crazy. Mother Bear was enormous, bigger than Emily and Little Bear put together. As the cub approached his mother she only got bigger.

"Hello Little Bear."

"Hello. I picked this for you."

Mother Bear reached down and grasped the stem of the flower between huge fingers and lifted it skyward toward her face. If he hadn't been hidden among the pollen there was a chance that Ash might've been seen. As it was though, she buried her nose among the peddles of the flower and sniffed deeply. As she did so, the powerful suction pulled pollen toward twin Nasal passages and Ash along with it.

Ash's fall came to an abrupt end when he landed among the white feathers of Duck's Back. When he regained his senses Ash was thankful to be still Alive, taking note of the oily substance covering his body.

'Of course!' he thought 'Duck feathers are covered in a fine layer of oil so they are waterproof and helps buoyancy when out in the water.'

And what huge feathers they were. He could easily have used one to build a raft. The more he studied them the more fascinated he was by the complexity of each feather, details that could only be seen with a magnifying glass. Duck suddenly shifted her position and Ash slid deeper among the feathers. Looking upward he wondered if he'd been noticed. nothing, He heard Emily's Voice. As she began to tell them about the tiny person she met she suddenly became alarmed when she realized he was not where she had placed him.

"Maybe he was a goblin." said Little Bear. "They do disappear like that."

"Maybe, but he wasn't dressed like one." said Emily. "I wonder where he could've gone to."

"Who knows Emily." said Cat.

"Maybe we could look for him?" suggested Owl.

"I gotta go guys." said Duck rising to her feet. "It's been a lot of fun."

"You're not going to help us look?" asked Emily.

"I would but I'm just too tired." Duck explained "See you tomorrow."

"By Duck."

With that the the domestic duck turned and headed for home, unaware of her tiny passenger. For Ash the experience of riding an enormous duck was akin to riding a brontosaurus or some other long neck dinosaur. Sitting facing the back he watched Duck's tail feathers move back and forth as she walked. Emily and the others continued their search for him and receded in the distance until he could no longer see them past the tall reeds and grass. He heard Duck yawn high above him, she really did sound tired.

'Maybe it's what she ate' he mused. Often after eating a big meal he too felt drowsy.

Duck continued on her way to her nest without incident, nor did she even feel the weight of her passenger who rested between her shoulder blades. It wasn't until she had hopped over a small puddle did she feel a tickling sensation. Looking over her shoulders she noticed something moving among her feathers. Ash struggled to upright himself after suddenly being sent for a ride when Duck had become airborne for a moment. When he'd finally regained his footing he looked up in time to see Duck's approaching head.

1452211121.content:
Ash ran as fast and as hard as he could but there was just no way he could keep up with Emily. The Child's stride was simply too great. Stopping to catch his breath he gasped as he watched her walk away.

"Okay," he thought. "Now what?"

With no other plan of action the micro human decided the best course of action would be to simply follow Emily's footprints, which were deep in the damp soil of the trail. He walked over to one of the footprints. At it's deepest it looked to be at least eight feet. Scratching his head, Ash did the math. He wasn't that good so he did his calculations on the ground. Now he didn't have exact measurements but more or less at her guessed height of four hundred feet Emily had a hundred and fifty five foot stride, which explained why he couldn't keep up with her.

He looked up at the sky. Shielding his eyes he looked at the position of the sun, he was no boyscout but he guessed it was at least afternoon. He could hear laughter and play in the distance. That was his destination, Though he didn't know for sure if he'd reach them while there was still daylight, worst case scenario he'd have to spend the night in this scaled up world were even an ant would be a predator. He set off towards the sounds.Though he walked for hours he made discouragingly little progress. The sun was beginning to set when he stopped to rest. His feet ached and he was very thirsty. Sitting on the ground he started to think that he would actually have to spend the night when heard the sounds of laughter and giggles. It sounded like it was growing louder and Louder. The ground began to vibrate, it looked like he wouldn't have to go any further.

"Hey! Hey! Down--"

Whatever Emily was looking at it, it wasn't Ash. The seven year old stepped over him like he wasn't there and kept walking. Ash considered running after her but decided against it. Her stride was just too great, there was no way he'd be able to keep up. Talk about Irony, he was too small to keep up with a child. Now what was he going to do? He sat down on a rock and pondered his next move. On his own, he had no chance. If the childern were giants so where the spiders and other predators. So, he needed a safe place to be. Or safe considering the circumstances. He stood up and looked about. It was hard to tell which way to go given all the high vegatation. Finding the tallest flower he climbed up until he was high enough to see what was going on.

To his left he could see Emily with her furry Friends includeing the Grizzly cub named Little Bear, that name seemed not very appropreate given how much smaller he was to them. To his right was a house. Smoke from the chimney told him that there was someone there. Someone who would be much bigger than the kids.

14522212.content:
"Hey! Hey! DOWN HERE!"

No good. Ash couldn't yelled until he lost his voice and at this distance he'd never be heard. Getting closer was the only option. Only problem with that plan was Emily and her friends were playing about. Even from as far way as he was Ash could feel the tremors from each footfall. If he tried to get closer now he risked becoming paste in someones footprint. He didn't like the thought of that at all. No, there had to be another way, he just needed to find it. Not far from Emily and her Friends Ash saw his opportunity. Sitting in the shade of an oak tree was a Picnic basket. Beside that neatly folded was a checkerboard patterned blanket. And resting beside the basket was Emily's doll. What was it called? Lucy, yes, he remembered now. Lucy was the doll's name. And if he managed to get there in time he could climb up onto the doll and wait for Emily to pick it up. Or he could climb into the basket and wait in there.

No time to start like the present. The trek to the basket was a slow progress as he had to maneuver his way over and through thick vegetation. Occasionally he came across a foot print and track left by Emily and her animal friends. It reminded him of how big this world was, and how dangerous it was as well. The sooner he got help, or the very least a ride to someplace safe, the better his chances of survival. Finally he reached his destination and after thinking for a moment he decided to:

14522212223.content:
Little Bear took a bite out of his sandwich. A simple act. But when you are the one trapped in that sandwich, It's pretty damn terrifying. The sound of teeth through bread, the way the world seemed to shake as the mouthful was ripped away. Ash didn't want to die this way, he didn't want to die at all. So with futile determination he doubled his efforts to free himself of the sticky mess he found himself in.

A lot harder than you'd think. It was like being trapped in Tar. No wonder people would use Honey to trap ants. Once you got into it, it was impossible to get out. Not that he wouldn't try all the same.

Hot honey smelling breath blew over him, he didn't look up but he knew without seeing that the Bear Cub had taken another bite. He didn't have to look up to know the Cub's mouth was getting closer. If he hadn't been taking his time and enjoying the sandwich Ash would've been inside the belly of the Cub long ago. Panic was boiling up within him and Ash was doing everything he could to force it down. If he panicked he was done for.

He had managed to free his arms when a shadow began to fall over him. This time he did look up, though he knew what he'd see.

Little Bear's eyes were closed as he brought his half eaten sandwich to his mouth. Maybe if he had glanced down he might've seen something. Maybe. The mouth opened wide. It was a mouth that was twice as deep as a human mouth and filled with bone crushing teeth bigger than the tiny speck of a human. The tongue wiggled in anticipation still covered in remnants of the previous two mouthfuls. The Abyss that was the cubs throat seemed to open wider as though to welcome Ash.

Then, Little Bear bit down.

"Well, no sense staying here."

As he walked through the forest of grass and flowers Ash couldn't help but be reminded of the Planet Dagobah from Star Wars. He expected Yoda to show up any minute saying, "help you I can.... Yes.....Yes.....Teach you the Force, I will"

He was taking it all in when he began to notice something. It started when Ash felt a slight vibration through his shoes. At first it was a bare murmur, a subtle movement. But with every passing occurrence it increased in volume and intensity. Then, a long way away, a low, dull rumble from the north.He looked about, trying to figure out what was happening, wondering where there was a safe place to ride out the quake. He turned to the north. I didn't see anything at first, but the noise was getting louder.

And louder.

And louder.

"Something Big is coming," he said aloud."But What?"

As if to answer his question, something rose up over the Grass.

And then, in a moment that will live forever in Ash's memory, he saw her. She loomed above the trees like a rising mountain. A Bear furry of phenomenal size, dress in a pink shirt and a blue skirt with a white apron. She was enormous, and totally oblivious to his presence as she walked forward in his direction meandering through the trees.

Her strides were enormous. The ground heaved with every step she took. The landscape around him shook with the force of her passage.Ash stared in dumbstruck awe as she approached, her bare furry feet crushing everything in her path. When he realized his danger, he ran. The ground shook with the impact of her giant steps. behind him he could hear her humming a plesant tune completey unaware of the danger she was causeing. He had to dodge and weave as he navigated the uneven ground . She was of course under no such limitations. "SHIT!"

The huge clawed toes spread out slightly and curled upward as the foot began to lower down. It would be over in an instant, he knew it. He just wished he`d had time to prepare for it. Then it was upon him, pushing him down into the uneven soil, the air pushed out of his lungs as the full weight of the bearess began to settle down on top of him. 145222212.content:
Ash dove into a dip in the ground just as the enormous foot was about to touch down. The earth shook tremendously after the titan foot slammed into the ground. A huge dust cloud came up and he opened his eyes. Her foot had just missed him. Ash watched carefully as her claw tipped toes splayed as her foot tipped forward and her heel lifted, rising back into the air for the next step. Dirt and debris rained down all around him as she walked away. Ash stood up, checking to see if he still had clean underwear. In his mind saw himself right in the middle of a gargantuan crater of a footprint, crushed and forgotten. An idea came into his mind. He had often fantasized about something like this happening, How often does one get to live out that Fantasy?

Ash could tell the the giant bearess was also heading for the house and followed her. He couldn't keep up with her of course, but he easily followed the footprints she left behind. A few hours later, he was standing before the House. Ash got a lump in his throat and swallowed hard knowing that before him was the one thing that could allow him to experience his deepest fantasy; to be shrunk down to a tiny size and explore a whole new world!

As he drew nearer to his destination many thoughts went through Ash's mind. He had to admit, He'd always had a curiosity for wanting to view the world from the floor up, like a bug might do before ultimate getting squished by a giant foot. He couldn't say he enjoyed the though of getting killed in such a way - He really was not big on getting killed - but he thought it would be an incredible experience to view the world from that perspective.

Ash had no idea how she was going to react to his appearance if she saw him. She was an incredible Macro Furry. If he was unable to get her attention she could easily crush him under foot before she even knew he was there. If he got squashed here it would be for real and he would die for real. Ash had a good idea how big she was and she was fully capable of doing permanent damage to his body. On the other hand, if he somehow survive this, it would have been an unforgettable adventure. Ash also began to wonder what would happen if she did see him. How would she react to him being so small, what would she do. Ash began to try to imagine how she was going to look like and what it would be like to sit in her huge palm. Ash was afraid and strangely excited at the same time.

Suddenly there was a huge groan as the door swung open.
145222212.title: Got out of the way just in time

1452222121.content:
A different Bear, a male wearing a blue suit with a purple tie and brown shoes stepped out the door, one huge foot swung over head. Ash dove for the safety of the step as it came down where he'd been standing moments before. Damn, That's the second close call in a matter of hours, He didn't want to try for three.

"I'll be back in about a Month." Ash heard him tell his wife. He felt the step shudder as she stepped out to say her good bys.

"Have a safe trip dear," she said kissing him. She stood there for a few moments watching him walk away. Looking up Ash could see her right foot hanging halfway over the edge of the step. She tapped her foot once and flexed her toes all the while not even aware of the tiny human admireing the brownish pads of her toes and instep. Finally she turned and went back inside.

So, Father Bear would be gone for a while. That meant she'd be alone. Now Ash wasn't looking to deliberately do anything nasty or whatnot, but he had a strong urge to check her out upclose. What harm could be caused by a little expedition? No one would even know he'd been there. But first he had to get inside. That was a bit of a challange. But aside from the top of the step which had been worn smooth, the rest of the step was rough enough to have enough hand and foot holds for him to climb. Thank goodness there was only one step to deal with. The door had a crack under it just wide enough to allow Ash to squeeze his way under it and into the house.

Ash didn't see her, but he did see an opened door and beyond that was a bedroom. The bed looked to be a king size, so he guessed that was the master bedroom. Ash was about to make his way over there when he smelled food coming from another part of the house. It suddenly occured to him that he hadn't eaten in a while.
1452222121.title: Father Bear

14522221211.content:
Food could wait for now, he could always look for something to eat in the cover of night. Course, getting across to the bedroom wasn't as easy as simply walking across. Ash had quite a distance to walk. On top of all that the floor was made up of boards that ran horizontal with a two foot gap between them so he had to jump across each one. Combine that with the constant fear of some giant anthropomorphic bear showing up and threatening to step on him and you're not having a fun time.

Fortunately, from what Ash could here, the remaining occupants of the home were in the kitchen and remained there until he'd completed his journey across the expanse of the floor boards to the bedroom door.He'd never guessed he would've had that kind of luck. Gasping for breath with a rather bad stitch in his side, he gazed into the interior of the bedroom and from what he saw it looked as though it belonged to---

Walking over floor boards was a bit of a challenge. Traveling over the wood grain wasn't a problem but getting over the gaps between took a running leap in places, Fortunately if he missed and fell it was only five feet deep with dust and other stuff on the bottom. Finding the kitchen wasn't hard as all he had to do was follow the sent of what was being cooked. Stepping through a vast opened door, Ash found himself finally in the kitchen. He saw Mother Bear standing in front of an old wood stove preparing a meal. And someone else. A cub was also sitting at the table, unlike the Mother this new Bear wasn't wearing clothing, That seemed odd. Why was she fully clothed while he was in his birthday suit? Maybe the cub wasn't old enough for anything to be showing through the thick fur. Well, he could think about that later. Right now he needed food.

Looking about Ash saw a cupboard slightly opened near where Mother Bear was cooking what smelt like Oatmeal. Inside the cupboard was a cloth bag that was slightly open. Assume that the bag contained uncooked oatmeal he headed of the cupboard. Taking the Direct route was a huge risk, if Mother Bear happened to turn around and saw something scurrying across her kitchen floor there was no telling what she'd do. He didn't recall much about her but she didn't have a problem with snakes, bugs might be another matter. But he didn't want to waste time going the long way so praying to whatever deity happen to be listening he made his way as quickly as he could. Once he'd made it to the cupboard he rested for a moment before using the wood grain of the cupboard to climb up inside it. Thankfully it was the bottom shelf or he would never of made it that far. Another moments rest and he was climbing up the side of the cloth bag. Not looking at the contents Ash flipped himself over the top of the bag and landed inside.

On top of a mound of sugar.

"Sugar? Damn." he muttered to himself. Well, it would give him quick energy but not much in the way of sustenance.

Meanwhile Mother Bear took the pot of oatmeal away from the stove and served it up into two bowls for herself and Little Bear. Setting the bowels on the table she noticed the glass sugar dish was empty. Walking back to the cupboard she took out the bag of sugar and a couple of spoons. Returning to the table, she sat the bag down. Then, without looking inside, she opened the bag up all the way and proceeded to:
14522221212.title: Kitchen Adventure

145222212121.content:
Mother Bear poured out roughly two table spoons of sugar into Little Bear's Bowl of Oatmeal. Taking his spoon she stirred the grains of sugar into the warm oatmeal and gave the spoon back to the cub who hungrily began to eat his breakfast. After having fallen into hot oatmeal and having tons of sugar dumped on top of him and then being buried alive in the oats it took every bit of effort by Ash to crawl and dig his way up to the surface even as the oatmeal was eaten all around him. Reaching upward with a hand he was relieved when it broke the surface. That relief turned into fear as he felt himself lifted upward. Still fighting the grip of the oatmeal he managed to get his head up out of the oat meal in time to gaze into Little Bear's opening mouth.

Despite only having seconds to cry out Ash found himself not being able to and stared at the open mouth as it got closer and closer. Saliva dripped from Carnivorous and Omnivorous teeth, the tongue extended out slightly with bits of Oatmeal still sticking to it, and a throat that seemed to open up bigger as though inviting him. The wooden spoon slid over teeth and Ash was engulfed in Darkness. Feeling the spoon being withdrawn under him, he was then pushed upward and about by the cub's tongue. Because it was oatmeal there was little chewing involved. He'd been spared from being grounded into bits between Little Bear's teeth, but there was nothing to prevent his approaching doom. He felt himself sliding backwards towards the Throat and the tongue lifted up toward the roof of the mouth.

*GULP*

He slid head first into the cub's esophagus, muscles rippled and pushed him along with the oatmeal. He could hear the beating of a heart and the bellows of air breathing in and out from massive lungs. Eventually he had arrived and was pushed out into open space. He fell, landing on his back on a pile of partially chewed oatmeal. The smell was horrible. This was a place were very few organisms would call home. In the pitch darkness Ash fumbled for the little light he had on his key ring. The little pinpoint of light illuminated the Organic chamber he was in. The walls of the stomach were in motion, already moving food about into rising pools of digestive juices. What a horrible death he was facing, He couldn't believe he was brought to this reality to become part of a growing Bear Cub's breakfast.
145222212121.title: Part of a Growing Cub's Meal

choices: Ash's POV trapped in the stomach
1452222121212.content: As the bear cub swallowed the last of his delicious oatmeal unaware of the tiny human now trapped in his stomach for Ash this was the ultimate nightmare beyond anything he had before
1452222121212.title: Little Bear continues his meal

choices: It's too Late. Ash is Digested
Ash makes it back on the Oatmeal
14522221212122.content:
Ash Cried out for help but to No Avail as more partially chewed oatmeal dropped in from above and the Stomach walls began to churn as it detected food. Had he been wearing a protective suit he'd of thought the whole process of traveling through the bear's digestive track to be quite fascinating. But that wasn't the case. What air was in the stomach was foul and getting harder to breath. For the moment he was safe on top of a hill of oatmeal but as the digestive juices began to build the fluid levels began to rise. With his little pin light he could see the oatmeal dissolve under the surface of the digestive juices. He knew he was on borrowed time. He had only moments left before he was dissolved and mixed with the oatmeal sludge that would be broken down and eventually become a part of Little Bear.

He saw his fate laid out before him, and he didn't want to accept it.

The Oatmeal had stopped falling, but oddly Ash could still hear gulps as though the cub was still swallowing. And they were quick gulps as though he were---

A torrential flood of Milk rushed in from above, the white cold liquid rained down upon him washing him off the hill of oatmeal he'd been couching on and into the digestive fluids. The Milk However had momentarily Neutralized the corrosive stomach acids, maybe enough to allow Ash to climb back up on the oatmeal for Safety.
14522221212122.title: Ttrapped in the stomach

choices: Stand there and see who it is
1452222122.content:
A bear cup, completely unclothed, stepped out the door, one huge foot swung over head. Ash dove for the safety of the step as it came down where he'd been standing moments before. Damn, That's the second close call in a matter of hours, He didn't want to try for three.

"Have fun with Emily, Little bear." Ash heard the mother tell her cub. He felt the step shudder as she stepped out to say her good by."And be home before Dark."

"I will," said the cub addressed as Little Bear as he thundered away. How could something that big move like that. More importantly, why was he naked while his mother wore clothes? Too young to show anything maybe? He'd think about it later.

She stood there for a few moments watching him walk away. Looking up Ash could see her right foot hanging halfway over the edge of the step. She tapped her foot once and flexed her toes all the while not even aware of the tiny human admiring the brownish pads of her toes and instep. Finally she turned and went back inside.

Now Ash wasn't looking to deliberately do anything nasty or whatnot, but he had a strong urge to check her out up close. What harm could be caused by a little expedition? No one would even know he'd been there. But first he had to get inside. With every journey the first step is often the Hardest and in Ash's case there was no exception. The First step had been worn smooth, but the rest were just rough enough to have hand and foot holds for him to climb. Thank goodness there was only two steps to deal with. If there had been more he might've given up.

The door had a crack under it just wide enough to allow Ash to squeeze his way under it and into the house. Ash didn't see her, but he did see an opened door and beyond that was a living room of sorts. Good a place to investigate as any.

It had taken him literately hours to cross the expanse of floor to the vast living room. The building sized furniture made him think he was on the set of the Honey I Shrunk the Kids remake. He was just crossing over the top of a rug when he felt a tremor through the floor.

Then another, stronger than the first. Then another, and another becoming stronger and stronger each time. He knew it wasn't the cub, so it had to be Mother Bear. He soon began to hear a Thuds and the sound of floorboards groaning under the weight of something big. He wanted to run, but his own curiosity was getting the best of him.
1452222122.title: Not so Little Bear

choices: Mother Bear spots something on the floor
14522221221.content:
Mother Bear walked into the living room. It had been a long day and with Father Bear out fishing and Little bear outside playing all she wanted was a little time to herself. A nice relaxing rest on the couch would do her good. As she walked toward the couch completely unaware of the little creature that was standing there looking up at her with awe. Nor was she aware of the danger she was causing. Even though this was the third time he'd seen the giant bearess the sight never got old. Everything was telling him that this was impossible. According to everything he'd been told and learned, A creature that huge should not, could not, exist but here she was.

Walking straight for him.

He blinked, suddenly realizing his error. He'd been so caught up watching Mother bear that I hadn't noticed she was looking straight ahead and not on what or who she was about to step on.

He made a dash for the safety of the couch but the tremors caused by each huge footstep made running difficult. Suddenly, as if his luck was any good to begin with, his foot hooked on the rug and he fell forward. By the time he began to lift himself up off the floor, the massive furry foot was already hovering above him.
14522221221.title: Mother Bear Returns

choices: We can go to the couch and you rub my feet
145222212211.content:
She look down and saw you so she picked you up and look at you close to see what you are then she ask your name so you tell her that your name is Ash she smiled and said "Nice to meet you my name is May Bear but little bear's friends cell me Mother Bear because they think I'm he's mother."

"So your not he's mother?" you ask.

"Nope i'm really he's older sister."

" His older sister?"

She nodded and told you everything, that there mom and dad died and that she and her twin brother tom ( Father Bear) to keep everyone to think they are Little Bear's mom and dad until they are ready tell them.

You ask her "Why tell me this?"

"Well you look like someone i can trust, and I think you're cute" she said with a blush.

You blush too and ask "What should we do while your brother's away?"

she think about it and said........
145222212211.title: Not Mother Bear?

145222212212.content:
They say time slows down at the last moments of life.

Time seemed to slow down for Ash as he stared up at the foot above him. He could see every speck of dust, every hair, every wrinkle in the broad brown leathery pads. The Heel made contact with the floor, sending a vibration through the floor. Like a warm mountain of flesh the broad pad on the ball of the foot was on top of him. For a millisecond it felt comforting, then pad pressed down around him. The weight became unbearable for the fragile skeleton trying to support it. He heard and felt bones snap as more weight was applied and then--

SQUISH.

Mother Bear felt something sticky and wet under her foot. Lifting it off the floor she saw she had crushed an odd bug under her foot.

"That's the third one this week," she muttered "I hope we don't have an infestation."

Taking a piece of tissue from her pocket she wiped the remains off the rug and her foot. What was left of Ash was burned in the fireplace. The tissue was placed on top of the burning wood, in a small way at least he'd been given a proper cremation.
145222212212.title: Crushed underfoot

choices: Try to get Mother Bear's attention
Leave her alone for now. Explore the house
14522221222.content:
Mother Bear walked into the living room. It had been a long day and with Father Bear out fishing and Little bear outside playing all she wanted was a little time to herself. A nice relaxing rest on the couch would do her good. As she walked toward the couch completely unaware of the little creature that was standing there looking up at her with awe. Nor was she aware of the creature running under the couch as she was about to step onto the rug.

FOOOM!

A Huge foot came down just seconds after Ash he ran under the couch. A moment later there was a loud groan as Mother Bear Settled down onto the couch.

That had been too close. If he'd stayed out in the open instead of hiding---No, He didn't even want to think about it. For the moment he was safe, and on the plus side he hadn't soiled his underwear. It suddenly occurred to Ash that he remembered very little about these characters. It had been a long time since he'd had read those books, and he only vaguely recalled the show. Did any of them have a fear of small creatures like bugs or mice? Did they own a Cat? Damn it, he just couldn't remember. How the hell did did get here in the first place? More importantly, how was he going to get back home? Would he ever get back?

Oh well, when life gives you lemons, you make lemonade. And this was a unique situation. It wasn't every day this sort of thing happened and who knows it might even be enjoyable if he was lucky. One thing he was sure of, he couldn't very well stay under the couch. While it was safe for now that could change, especially if someone decided to vacuum under there. Ash looked toward the door Mamma entered through. Beyond that was the rest of the house, and more potential danger but also a better chance for finding food and shelter.

Ash stuck his head out and looked up at the Giant above him. A very real danger, and she wouldn't be the only one in this house. '

It would be easier for me if I had help' he thought, 'If I wanted to I could try to get her attention, but is that a good Idea?'
14522221222.title: Hideing from Mother Bear

145222212221.content: to do that you first clam up the couch so you did it toke you hours to get up there but you made it and when you got there you see that she was......
145222212221.title: Try to get Mother Bear's attention

145222212222.content:
Ash walked out from under the back of the couch making his way to the door along the wall. He soon began to hear heavy breathing from the couch. Had she fallen asleep? If that was the case maybe his luck was holding up. He really didn't want to be moving about with Bearzilla walking around. All the while, was amazed at the scale of just this one room. You could house hundreds of people in there.

Finally, he made it to the door. Damn, the place was bigger than he thought it would be. This certainly wasn't going to be easy. He could see a Doorway on his left and on his right I could see a kitchen. He suddenly heard the front door open and close.

THOOM, THOOM, THOOM

Little Bear had returned and, Because Ash's luck hadn't been all that great lately, he wasn't looking down at the floor either.

THOOM!

Just missing him, Little Bear ran into the living room and woke up Mother Bear. They were talking about something but at that point Ash really didn't care. How come these guys didn't look down when they walked? Then he realized that hardly anybody he knew ever did. That's how people end up walking of stuff like broken glass, or a boards with a nails in them, or Dog do do. The two Giants walked past him and into the kitchen, completely unaware of him. That may have been an advantage, for the moment he needed to stay out of sight until he knew more about these giant creatures.

He was hungry but going to the kitchen now was a bad Idea. If he wanted to fill his stomach he'd have to wait until night while they were asleep. Till then he would need a place to hide. He had two options, Check out the mystery room on his left or hide somewhere in the living room.
145222212222.title: Explore the house

choices: The Meal is finished, they all get up and leave the table
The risk is too high, better to search for food later
The door swings open, Emily is Back
1452222123.content:
Ash tucked up against the step as a huge leather shoe swung overhead and struck the ground with an earth shaking thud that made him loose his balance. He would've fallen had he not been so close to the first step. For a moment he couldn't tell who or what it was as it was too close and all he could see when he looked up was a leg and a bellow of fabric like a colossal tent. Not exactly enough for a positive ID. But as the foot lifted and the individual began to move farther away Ash could see more of the body.

"It's the girl...."

Now dressed in her blue knee-length dress and brown ankle-length boots, the giant known as Emily was walking away from the house at a pace that would've been impossible to keep up had he tried to follow her. It had been hours since he'd first encountered her when she was dressed in her bathing suit. Even though he hadn't seen her come back the way she had came it was most likely that she had come here taking a different road. He watched her as she walked beyond his field of vision and was brought back to reality by the sound of someone closing the door.

Damn, if he had been quick enough he might've been inside the house by now. Then he looked at the steps and thought otherwise. He'd be almost halfway up the first step if he was lucky before that door closed. Just as well, he supposed. Ash examined the wooden steps. They were rough with plenty of hand and foot holds. That would make accent easier. There was no time but the present.

Climbing isn't as easy as it is in the movies. You see macho men climbing up the sides of cliffs as though they had the abilities of a Spider. The reality, as Ash was starting to figure out, was that it's tiresome. By the time he reached the top of that first step his muscles ached from use. Thank the maker he didn't have to deal with more than one.

The sun was beginning to set as he approached the door. As he had hoped there was a gap just wide enough to crawl under and into the interior beyond. This was it. Any thoughts he might've had regarding turning back were pointless now. No doubt there were night time terrors that would just love to have him for a meal and he had not allowed himself the opportunity to set up a shelter. This is what he had wanted all his life. He took one more deep breath and dipped under the door.

Voices is what greeted him as he came out from under the door. He found himself in the kitchen. At the table were three Giants. Mountains with fur. The Bear he'd encountered earlier , a second dressed in a suit (no doubt her husband or mate) and a cub who was talking about what he'd done today. They sat at the table eating their evening meal of what looked like cooked fish.

Cooked fish. Ash could smell it from where he was standing. He hadn't eaten all day and the smell made his mouth water. of course it was up on a table beyond his reach. Still, there might be scraps falling to the floor below. Could he dare chance it?
1452222123.title: It's the Girl (Emily)

choices: Ash is Eaten by Little Bear
14522221234.content:
Ash had been preoccupied with the meal the Giant Bear's were enjoying, so much so that when he notice the floor was shaking it was too late.

There was a knock at the door.

"Come in."

The door swung open and Emily stepped into the house. Under one arm she held her Doll, over her other shoulder was a knapsack containing her bedclothes and a few goodies. Little Bear left the table to greet her and show here where to put her stuff, while the Parents of the Cub finished their meal and and in tern collected their dishes and after depositing all in the sink , followed the two young children. Leaving only the Cub's unfinished meal on the table.

But what had happened to Ash, you might wonder?

He hadn't been struck with the door, not exactly. As that immense door swung forward there was a huge displacement of Air. Being so light in that enviroment, Ash had been propelled forward and up. Tumbling though the air he'd passed over Little Bear's head as the cub approached his friend, his downward arc sent him toward the table. The odds of where he landed had to be a million to one, nevertheless he had landed smack dab in the middle of Little Bear's unfinished supper. More precisely, he'd landed into the interior of the half eaten fish though a hole made by a fork.

It had taken him a few moments to recover. When he did though, Ash couldn't believe his luck! Up through the hole, he saw the giant parents of the cub stand up. Taking their plates they had walked out of his field of vision. After a moment he felt their footfalls receded to another part of the house. It was only then that Ash began to feed. The fish was delicious, though the flesh itself was of a different texture as he was eating muscle fibers much larger than he normally would.

Meanwhile, Emily was removing her nighty from her knapsack when Mother Bear informed her cub that he had to finish his supper before the two did anything else.

Little Bear groaned, "I'm not that hungry."

"I'll help you finish it." Emily volunteered.

Little Bear looked at his mother who nodded approvingly. The fish would not go to waste at least. The pair ran past Mother Bear who just smiled and shook her head. The energy of youth.

Ash had halfway shoved a piece of fish into his mouth when he felt the tremors and heard the giggles and voices of children. A shadow fell over the hole. Gazing out from it Ash found himself face to face with the Cub. He was looking down and holding a fork in his hand. A moment later the face of the Girl appeared. She too held a fork. A moment later the fish shook as the forks were drove into the fish and came away with chunks of fish.

Ash began to panic. What was he going to do? He had only planned to enjoy the meal, not be part of it! He saw an opening, the mouth of the fish was opened in a gasp for water that never came. There was no way these two would eat the head of the fish. The prongs of a fork sliced down just behind him and Ash let out a startled cry that was unheard by the two giant children. He didn't wait to watch the chunk of fish rise way but immediately began crawling through the emptied cavity of the fish to freedom.
14522221234.title: Like Jonah and the Whale.

choices: Ash makes a Jump for Emily
Ash makes a Jump For Little Bear
Ash Climbs onto Emily's hand as she carries the dish to the sink
Ash Climbs onto Little Bear's hand/paw as he carries the dish to the sink
145222212341.content:
Ash crawled though the cooked fish while all around him chunks were being taken away by two young giants and devoured. If he was unlucky he'd be apart of their meal. The laces on one of his sneakers hooked on a bone.

"You've got to be feck'n kidding me!"

Almost panicking he tugged and tugged to free his foot. He ended up yanking foot out of his sneaker and had just made it clear in time before prongs of a silver fork sliced through the flesh of the fish where he'd just been. A moment later that portion ,along with his sneaker, was gone.

He didn't wait around to find out who ate his sneaker, Ash kept on moving. Gasping for breath he finally made it to the head of the fish. He stuck his head out from the toothy mouth and looked about.

The two young giants had almost completely eaten the fish. Ash began to think what he should do next. He didn't want to remain on the plate, the remains of the meal might be scrapped out a window for some animal to eat or scrapped into a trash can. And he didn't want to spend the night on the table unable to get down. That left hitching a ride on one of the two young giants. Sure. Walk up to them, polity introduce yourself and ask for a lift. Not likely. They didn't hear him screaming in the fish, they wouldn't hear him now.

He'd have to either make a running jump off the table onto them before they moved or climb up onto a hand when one of them grabbed the plate to put it away.

He didn't have much time.
145222212341.title: Ash Makes it to Safety

choices: Ash ends up in Little Bear's hand/paw
Ash ends up in Emily's hand
As is stuck to a gummy in Little Bear's hand/paw
Ash is stuck to a Gummy in Emily's hand
1452222123411.content:
This was insane. He had to be insane. Here he was hundreds of feet off the ground about to jump to a moving object. This sort of thing only worked in the Movies! Wishing he still had his other shoe for traction he leaped off the plate he made a dash for the giant girl. If this crazy stunt worked and he lived, he would be hanging onto the cloth of her dress at around her diaphragm. Running as fast as he could he waited until he was just at the edge of the table to jump.

It didn't go as well as he hoped.

Ash found out the hard way that he was a lousy jumper without a spring board. He missed his target but continued his arc toward toward the Giant Emily as she watched Little Bear leave the table with the plate. Ash had missed his target but still slammed into the cloth of her dress about twenty feet or more from his intended target.

Then he started to slide.

The fabric of Emily's dress was like rope weaved together. There was nothing he could grab hold of. At that same moment Emily was beginning to move to follow Little Bear. As she did so, the front pocket on her dress opened up slightly. Just enough to allow a tiny human to slide right in.

The wind was knocked out of Ash when he landed. He gasped and looked around in confusion. He had landed in a pocket. He could tell that, but he had also landed in something else. The walls were brown and reminded him of fiberglass. Of course! It was paper! He had landed in a brown paper bag, and on top of what looked like old fashioned gummy candy. Strawberry from the smell of them. Hell of a way to break a fall.

The world outside was moving. As the girl walked the fold of the pocket would open and he would see glimpses of her face high above. As he made a move to get to a sitting position, Ash noticed how sticky the gummy candy was. Probably left in the warmth of this pocket for too long.

Suddenly it seemed as though Ash was in an Earthquake. The contents of the bag, that included him, were bounced about. He was half buried under the gummy candy by the time it was over. Then the hand reached into the pocket.

Dressed in her night gown, Emily pulled out the bag of gummy candy she'd been saving. They were getting a little sticky so they had to be eaten, she decided to share.

"Would you like a Jelly Baby?" She Asked Little Bear.

"Jelly w-what?" The cub looked almost horrified.

Emily giggled "They're not REAL babies, silly. They're candy." She dumped a couple into her hand to show him "See?"

"Oh!" Little Bear held out his hand/paw
1452222123411.title: Ash makes a Jump for Emily

choices: Grab onto Emily's tongue and swing himself out
Yell as loud as he can,maybe she'll hear him
14522221234114.content:
As he flew through the air Ash was endlessly flinging his arms like a windmill unable to control his movement.

"Ahhh when is this going to end?" He screamed to no one in particular,not that anyone would be able to hear him anyway being the only two people around were at least a hundred feet bigger than him!

Finally the wild ride ended as he crash landed on something incredibly soft fearfully the small boy looked up and realized he was stuck to something huge,gooey and red?

"What th-what is this glue?" He thought as he tried pulling himself to freedom but upon getting a closer look,he saw much to his horror this was a giant red piece of candy!

"A huge piece of candy? What the hell is this...Oh NO....." Ash moaned as he realized he was slowly moving upwards towards the giant girl's mouth.

"Don't tell me....AHHHHHHHHHHH................" Ash began screaming at the top of his lungs as the giant seven year old was opening her mouth wide!

"Pl..please...little girl...Noooo..D-don't eat me!!" he screamed struggling even more to pull himself free but similar to taffy or super hard glue,he was literally stuck,almost embedded into the darn piece of gummi bear or whatever it was but of course his pleas fell on deaf ears.

"Hey did you hear something?" Little Bear asked peaking up his ears.

"No why?" Asked his human friend arching a eyebrow as she prepared to put the sugary,tasty treat into her mouth.

"I-I thought I heard something...a voice..a really tiny voice coming from somewhere." The bear cub muttered as he stopped easting and looked around bewildered.

"I didn't hear anything Little Bear, it was probably a little cricket or something nearby." Emily replied as she opened up her mouth further and now Ash was really panicking,here he was stuck on some gummi piece of candy about to be devoured by a giant little girl!

"Man this has been one weird day." He moaned watching as Emily's mouth got closer and closer...

How will he get out of this one?
14522221234114.title: Ash is stuck to a Gummy in Emily's hand

choices: Ash makes his way up Little bear to his head (Little Bear feel's an itch)
Emily starts to tickle Little Bear
Ash pauses to watch them eat.
1452222123412.content:
This was insane. He had to be insane. Here he was hundreds of feet off the ground about to jump to a moving object. This sort of thing only worked in the Movies! Since he couldn't get proper traction with just one shoe, Ash elected to throw the other one away and make a run for it barefoot. Diving off the plate he made a dash for the bear cub. If this crazy stunt worked and he lived, he would be hanging onto fur at around his chest. Running as fast as he could he waited until he was just at the edge of the table to jump.

It didn't go as well as he hoped.

Ash found out the hard way that he was a lousy jumper without a spring board. He missed his target but continued his arc toward Little Bear. At that moment, the Cub decided to climb off the chair. As he began to do so, the huge body shifted toward Ash and he was able to grab fur. He though his arm was going to be wrenched out of it's socket and he almost lost his grip, but he managed to cling to the strands of fur. Instead of his intended Target, the fur on his chest, Ash found himself hanging just above where the cub's belly button should be. He could hear gurgling as the cub began to digest his meal of fish. He wondered if his other shoe was in there somewhere floating about in a lake of digestive fluids.

Little bear grasped the plate with both hands/paws and walked over to the sink followed by the girl Emily. With every foot fall Ash's grip became weaker. It wasn't just the tremor that he could feel even where he hung, gravity was pulling him down just as strong here as it would've been if he were hanging off a cliff back home. His hands were beginning to cramp and tire.

After depositing what was left of the fish into the waste basket and placing the plate into the sink, the two young giants made their way to the bedroom. Little Bear climbed up into his bed while Emily went behind an erected curtain to change into her night gown. So far as he lay there, halfway under the covers, he wasn't aware of the ant size human that was resting near his belly button. Ash was certainly thankful not to be hanging anymore. He hoped he would not have to do that sort of thing very often.

"Would you like a Jelly Baby?"

Ash looked up and beyond the skyline of fur. Emily was dressed in her night gown and holding a paper bag. "Would you like a Jelly Baby". Now where did he hear that before?

"Jelly w-what?" The cub looked almost horrified. Ash was confused by this reaction until he heard the girl giggle

"They're not REAL babies, silly. They're candy." She dumped a couple into her hand to show him "See?"

"Oh!" Little Bear held out his hand/paw. Ash watched as the girl dumped a handful of the sweet candy into the hand/paw and watched the two friends from different species consume them with great enjoyment. He couldn't stay where he was though. He had to movie on and get somebody's attention. If possible
1452222123412.title: The Jump to Little Bear

145222212342.content:
Suddenly thick silver prongs came down on either side of his waist, pinning him. a moment later he was being lifted into the air along with a chunk of fish. Ash soon found himself staring at a smiling mouth. Emily held the fork just in front of her face but she wasn't looking at it . Her attention was on her friend the bear cub. If she had been looking there was a chance she might've noticed the tiny figure pinned and struggling on the end of her fork, though she wouldn't be able to hear his cries of terror just as she couldn't hear them now.

Ash screamed and pleaded but his cries fell on ears that were not senssitive enough to hear him . The mouth opened wide revealing a pefect set of baby teeth. The tongue, covered in bits of fish, lowered revealing more of the throat. Ash screamed out one last cry of "Nooooo---" before he was plunged into the mouth and enveloped in darkness.

Emily chewed happily, this was a really good fish. Then she paused for a moment as she bit into something, it tasted different than the fish. She shrugged and continued chewing happily.

Mercifully, Ash's end came quickly as he'd been crushed between up and lower molars. His remains were pulverised and mixed with the chewed fish before it was swallowed. where it was processed along with everything else Emily had eaten that day. What could be used by her body was stored in her cells becoming a part of her.

For Ash, the Story as reached
145222212342.title: Eaten by Emily

145222212343.content:
Suddenly thick silver prongs came down on either side of his waist, pinning him. a moment later he was being lifted into the air along with a chunk of fish. Ash soon found himself staring at a furry mouth. Little Bear held the fork just in front of his face but he wasn't looking at it . His attention was on his friend the Human called Emily. If he had been looking there was a chance he might've noticed the tiny figure pinned and struggling on the end of his fork, with his more sensitive hearing he might've even heard his cries of terror had they not been drowned out by Emily's giggles.

Ash screamed and pleaded but his cries fell on ears that could not hear him . Then mouth opened wide revealing a perfect set predatory teeth. The tongue, covered in bits of fish, lowered revealing more of the throat. Humid breath blasted him and Ash screamed out one last cry of "Nooooo---" before he was plunged into the mouth and enveloped in darkness.

Little Bear chewed with enthusiasm, this was a really good fish. He hadn't paused from his chewing even as his tongue registered a taste that was not of the same flavor of the fish. He might have if it had been more substantial but it was quickly dissipated as it mixed with the chewed fish and forgotten entirely as he lifted the next fork load of fish to his mouth.

Mercifully, Ash's end came quickly as he'd been crushed between up and lower molars. His remains were pulverized and mixed with the chewed fish before it was swallowed. where it was processed along with everything else Little Bear had eaten that day. What could be used by his body was stored in her cells becoming a part of him as he grew.

She was fast too, faster than anything that big had any right to be.Within moments her feet were crashing down around him and then she was past him making her way down the path. If there was any lingering doubt in Ash's mind that this wasn't happening, it was erased after that close encounter. He watched her for a while. It didn't look to him that she was going far, in fact he could hear loud splashing as though someone was swimming or frolicking in water.
