Ash though he knew it was useless and even futile began racing after the young giant seven year old yelling "Umm excuse me Little Girl? I(pant,pant) need help...please!"

As Emily was far too big as her foot steps move further and further from him finally he was forced to stop and catch his breath sighing

"It's no use I'm far too darn small even the local ant would have better luck than me getting attention from a giant girl like her!" He moaned but it turned out fate was in his favor after all as Emily suddenly stopped and turned around

"Whoops I forgot to bring something to the picnic.better go back if I hurry I may be able to make it just in the nick of time!"

As she began walking towards him again Ash brightened "Great! She's coming back now's my chance! EXCUSE ME LITTLE GIRL HEY,HEY DOWN HERE PLEASE!"

Just as she's about to step right on top of him Emily's foot pauses in midair and she peeks down curiously as her huge face bent forward Ash had to shut his eyes just to keep from being blind by both the glaring sun and her awesomeness once her eyes laid upon him a loud prolonged gasp could be heard from the seven year old as Emily whispered
145231.title: Follow Emily

1452311.content:
Ash was nearly close to having a serious stroke and he was having difficultly trying to move his legs which felt like jelly but thankfully Emily bent down just close enough to carefully stare at him in the face he shrank back in horror as her face resembled the largest billboard he had ever seen

"Oh my what are you?" She gushed excitedly Ash began shivering and crying out in fear

"Please-please don't hurt...." But as if she was able to read the rest of his words the giantess little girl calmly reassured him

"There's no need to be afraid I won't hurt you! I'm just curious I have never seen a goblin that size before! My name's Emily." She introduced herself

"Ash,my name's Ash." He replied feeling a less afraid as he realized there wasn't anything about her he should be scared of unless she was a evil,ruthless child who enjoyed stomping the mess out of bugs which he doubted she was

"Well then Ash would you mind if I picked you up? It's a bit difficult to see you from all the way down there!" She confessed he nodded and very carefully she reached down with a hand the size of a ten story building and with her index finger and thumb each the size of tree trunks she gently picked him up and slowly brought him towards her face her soft brown eyes widening in wonder as she studied him

"You're really small for a goblin Ash and I must say your clothes are very strange!"

"I'm not exactly a goblin nor am I any type of supernatural creature." He admitted

"Oh! You're a human? Bu...but how did you get that way?" She asked bringing him closer to her face he could see every inch of her youthful face,every soon to be freckle she may have once she was older

"It's a bit hard to explain Emily but I'll try and tell you the whole story later on but for now I really need to rest,being at this tiny size takes a toll on your legs! It seems I have been walking over 100 miles." As he started panting like crazy and struggled to catch his breath

"Oh my! You must be so exhausted!" She gasped out loud "I was going on a picnic at the lake with all my friends but you're more important! I'm sure they wouldn't mind if I skip out just this once come on I'll take you back to my grandmother's house so you can rest for a while!" As she turned direction from Hop Frog Pond to head back to her house along the way the two of you encountered someone else who happened to be.......
1452311.title: "Oh my are you for real? A tiny person?"

1452312.content:
The look on Emily's face was not the one he had hoped for nor expected. What he saw was a look of disgust, and what she had said sent a chill down his spine.

Before Ash could protest that he wasn't a Bug, a shadow fell over him as Emily's foot blocked out the sun. As a cute but massive foot began to descend upon him, he cried out once before the dirty wrinkly sole was pressed down all around him, pressing him into the muddy soil, pushing all the air out of his lungs. Even though the mud oozed around him, it did little to save him as his body was pulverized all at once.

Emily felt a little "pop" under the ball of her foot. Quite satisfied she had killed the offending creature she gave her foot one twist as she heading back home to get what she had forgotten. The smear that had once been Ash remained on her sole until she went swimming where it was washed off.
1452312.title: Stupid bug go squish

choices: They get up and leave (heading right for him)
Little Bear  gets up to leave
145232.content:
There was no point in running after her, with her strides it was impossible. Besides, he needed a plan. Yelling alone wouldn't get Emily's attention, he was too small to be heard from the ground. He'd have to get to ear level. Easier said than done. He was sure he couldn't climb past her ankles, so she'd have to be laying down. If he had a mirror or something reflective he could try to use it to signal her but that was something he didn't have, and that would only work if she was looking down.

This was going to be a lot harder than he'd first thought.

He listened to the laughter, it didn't seem that far away and he could distinctly hear two voices. If one was Emily, Ash had to assume the other was Little Bear. Bear's have more sensitive ears than humans.

He followed the crater-like footprints for an hours, by the time he arrived there were no more sounds of splashing or laughter. He feared they may have gone off somewhere else and started to regret not running after Emily earlier. However, to his relief, both Emily and her furry friend were still around. Off in the distance he saw them laying side by side under the shade of a tree looking up into the sky and pointing to clouds. He hoped they wouldn't get up before he got there.
145232.title: Stay put for now

1452321.content:
Ash was exhausted by the time he made it to Emily and Little Bear. It was the most walking/running he'd ever done. He just hoped he had time to get their attention. The first thing he saw rising over the grass line was two sets of feet, Emily's and Little Bear's. Emily's soles were slightly dirty, Ash noted the short toes and low arch. Little Bear's were slightly bigger and wider, a flat brownish pad that extended from the ball to the heel with toe pads that ended with claws.

Well, now this presented Ash with an alternative to yelling into their ears. He could try to tickle one of them, they'd have to look to see what was causing it. If that didn't work he could always go back to his first idea.

Ash decides to simply stroke the huge wrinkled foot with both hands with all his might Emily simply lets out a low laugh and wiggles her foot nearly kicking the tiny boy away

"Something's bothering my foot." He hears Emily said to her furry friend

"What's wrong with it? Does it hurt?" Little Bear asks concernedly

"No it just kind of itches but it's okay it's not bothering me that much."

Ash decides this is going no where so looking around he sees a blade of grass small enough for him to grab onto "Let's see if this can make her giggle a lot more!" As he starts to gently stroke the side of the seven year old's foot this time around he gets a more direct response

"Oh he,he,he.cut it out Little Bear!" Emily cries out suddenly the bear cub looks up confused

"Cut what out? What are you saying Emily?" Ash continued his ticklish assault on the giant girl's foot increasing his simple strokes to flat out foot tickling Emily couldn't stand it anymore and burst out laughing

"Aha,ha,ha,ha,ha cut it out I mean it Little Bear!"

"I'm not doing anything!" Her friend protests bewildered

"Yes you can(giggle)you're tickling my foot(giggle)ha,ha,ha,ha stop it!"

"No I'm not! How can I be tickling your foot of both of my hands are by my side right here?" He asks still Emily laughed even louder as Ash tries with all his might to force her to

"Come on just look down already! All this frustrated tickling on a person's foot I'd look down to see what the commotion was please just look down!"

Finally the girl leaps up tired of the ticklish torment to her poor foot her face is pale and a little angry Ash immediately stops waiting for her reaction

"LITTTLE BEAR!" She cries as her friend also gets up

"Emily honest I'm not doing it! I'm not!"

She looks angrily at him for a minute or two then said "Okay if it wasn't you then something or someone was tickling my foot!" She said looking down at last, but her eyes passes right over Ash still holding the blade of grass limply at his side

"Maybe it was a blade of grass or a field mouse or something." Little Bear suggests

"Maybe but I'm not certain I thought I heard a small voice though." Emily replied one finger in her chin thinking hard

"What did it sound like?" The bear cub asked as they prepared to leave

"If I could have guessed human." She muttered

Little Bear frowned at the thought "That would be incredibly unlikely. you and your grandmother are the only humans around here there's hardly any in Bear Country."

"I know but it's what I heard I know it!" Emily insisted as Ash tired of all this second hand guessing decided to go to Plan B which was
1452321112.title: Leap down all the way to her foot

choices: Little Bear turned his body to face Emily (Foot play/wrestle)
145232112.content:
Ash made his way through the forest of grass until he came upon a wall of brown leather. He had arrived at the heel of Little Bear's right foot. It was a good seventy feet straight up and for the moment it was motionless. He hoped to change that. Looking about he picked up a piece of grass.

"Here it goes." he said to himself and started tickling.

He had expected some reaction, but instead there was no reaction at all. Frowning, he tickled a little more intensely. Nothing, not even a toe twitch. The cub and his friend continued to point to clouds and make out shapes as though he wasn't even there. What in Blazes was going on? Curiously, Ash reached out and touched the great pad. It felt like leather and had some give to it but not much. It didn't appear calloused but he could tell the skin at the heal was quite thick. Of Course! Little Bear walked without shoes all the time, it was only natural that his foot pads were less than sensitive. He kicked himself for not realizing sooner. He was going to abandon the idea when a though occurred. He backed away from the foot until he could see all of it.

The pad stretched the whole length of the foot, and he could tell in some areas there were places that were of a lighter shade of brown, places where the foot did not make contact with the ground on a daily basis. There were enough wrinkles and ridges to making climbing possible. Ash ran back to the foot, placed the piece of grass in his mouth and began to climb.

You'd think Little Bear would've noticed or felt something out of the ordinary, but he was either completely oblivious or just didn't care. Climbing straight up wasn't an easy job, but luckily Ash had some experience with vertical mountain climbing. Not much, but enough. He was right about the area of the ball of the foot when--
145232112.title: Failed Attempt

choices: Into her mouth while its still open uh oh!

"Hey Emily before you go how about one more game?"

the girl stopped briefly smiling "Sure I got just enough time what kind?"

The bear cub slyly grinned(If you could call a mouthful of razor sharp teeth a grin) Ash tried to pull himself from the thick layer of fur but he was too entangled "Oh maybe a foot wrestling game where we wrestle each other with our feet!"

A confused glance formed from Emily as he could tell she was slowly processing this then a smile broke out on her face as she once more sat down in the cool grass

"Okay sure it sounds like fun put your feet up Little Bear and let's see who wins!" As the bear cub raised his foot(the same one Ash unfortunately happened to be entangled in)towards the seven year old's own slightly dirty yet cute foot they began to lock toes together. For Ash this was hell as he never understood foot wrestling,thumb wrestling maybe but not when people used their feet and his worst nightmare came true:

The Greyish flesh of the main pad and the tanned flesh of the ball of the foot molded around him as he found himself submerged between two children's feet unable to move or breathe.

"Ohhh you're cheating Emily! Your toes are longer than mine and I keep forgetting you have five toes,I got only four no fair!" Little Bear whined while Emily giggled

"Am Not! You have sharp claws on the bottom of your toes Little Bear you're winning!"

as the two friends laughed playfully Ash found himself turning blue and almost stretchy like taffy. Wiggling toes maneuvered him into places against his will. How did they not feel him? Finally after a few more rounds it seemed neither could overpower the other so they agreed to a draw as they got up Little Bear kicked out his foot sending Ash flying right into Emily he screamed fearfully ignoring the two children's words as they departed

"Same time tomorrow then Emily?" Not noticing the tiny figure flying at almost 60 mph towards her.

she replied "Yeah! Wouldn't miss it see you tomorrow Little Bear!" just as Ash lands right

Unfortunately wishes don't always come true do they? He thought

"Oh no they are getting up!"

As indeed Emily and Little Bear still laughing at oddly shaped clouds were getting to their feet

"Well we better get going Little Bear it's really late." The girl said as both began walking straight towards him

"Okay I'll walk you home Emily." The bear cub said "

It was bad enough one giant's footstep could cause massive craters and tremors but now there were two and that meant double the earthquakes and triple the craters Ash had major difficulty just trying to stay rooted on the ground

"Uh oh!" He thought as the clawed and fleshy feet came closer and closer and he had to make a decision fast! "Got to climb one of them but which one,which one?" He said frantically.
1452322.title: They get up and leave (heading right for him)

choices: Ash Slips off Little Bear's foot
Little Bear starts walking again before Ash could get off.
14523221.content:
With barely no time to think, Ash made a desperate grab at Little Bear's Furry foot as it crashed down only a few feet from him. Not wasting any time he scrambled aboard just as the foot swung forward for another step.

Had he chose to make a grab for Emily's foot he doubted he would've been able to hang on for any length of time. He didn't know what was worst, the thundering impact with the ground with every footfall, or the swinging forward of the foot with every step.Both were a strain on his arms and hands. Especially his hands as they were cramping up from holding so tightly to the thick strands of brown fur. All the same though, it was a very interesting experience to say the least. Though he would've preferred this ride to end soon.

He couldn't tell which direction Little Bear or Emily were headed as he was laying prone on his stomach facing Little Bear's ankle, and turning his head that much was an impossibility. Eventually though the two young giants did come to a stop, and not a moment too soon. Any longer and his hands wouldn't have lasted.

"Thanks for walking me home, Little Bear"

"I'll see you tomorrow. Bye Emily."
14523221.title: Furry Paw Ride.

choices: Ash Slips under Little Bear's paw./Foot (ending)
Little Bear feels Something between his toes
Little Bear Enters the house and Ash slips off
145232212.content:
Little Bear continued his walk down the dirt path. The sun was starting to set behind him casting an elongated shadow before him. Still, he wasn't worried about not getting home before dark as his home was just over the hill. Mother Bear would be waiting for him and would enquirer him on his day with Emily at the pond. While to the observer his strides were slow (as there was no need to rush), to his tiny passenger it appeared as though the bear cub was crossing a great distance. With every foot fall it grew harder and harder for him to hold on.

Worst yet, Ash soon realized that with every footfall he was slipping further and further down to the great furred toes. There was still a chance he could hang on long enough for Little Bear to eventually stop and he could get off this crazy ride. Then again, if he couldn't hang on...He didn't to think about that.

As much as he didn't want to think about it, it wasn't going to make the reality of the situation go way. Despite his best efforts, Ash continued to slid further and further down towards his inevitable fate. Little Bear was only two steps away from the Back door of his house when Ash's lower torso slipped between two toes. With his Arms quivering and his muscles feeling like Jelly, the tiny human was powerless to stop what would happen next. If anything did happen.
145232212.title: Rough Ride

choices: Mother Bear crouches down to get a closer look
The Kettle squeals (the water is boiled)
1452322123.content:
Little Bear had taken two, maybe three, steps into the house before he lost his little passenger. When his foot/paw landed on the floor the little human slipped completely between his toes and landed on the floor. The cub didn't feel it, and therefore didn't notice it. He simply lifted his foot and continued on his way to the bedroom.

Ash lay on his back, gasping, his eyes closed and his arms burning from being overworked. He was going to be feeling it for a few days at least. When his head stopped spinning, he opened his eyes and looked about. He was in the kitchen area. Man, the scale of everything was staggering. It was like being in a city but you were the only one who lived there. He rolled over on his back and tried to get to his feet, his body wouldn't allow it. Despite being out in the open and despite the extreme danger, his muscles were still too exhausted to support his frame. whether he liked it or not, He had to wait.

That's when he heard the first thundering foot falls and the tremor through the floor.

"You've got to be kidding me." Ash said to himself. He tried to get up again but to no avail. Well if he couldn't stand then he'd crawl. That was the plan until he saw her.

If he had thought before that Emily was the biggest being he'd ever seen (As she was much taller than Little Bear) her height and size was dwarfed three times over by the living mountain that stepped into the room.

"Mother Bear," whispered Ash.

It was her, no mistake. Mother Bear in her pink shirt, blue skirt and white apron. Mother Bear, who had walked into the kitchen from another part of the house and was now shaking Ash's world with every foot fall. He didn't know where she was going, but he knew it was way too dangerous to be out in the open like he was. Even though his muscles protested, he forced himself to crawl to the only safe place he could get to. The closest wall.

While he was doing that, Mother Bear had made her way to the stove and was currently boiling a kettle for tea. She had just taken her cup down from the cupboard and had opened up he jar of tea, when something caught her eye. A little something.

Ash thought for a brief moment that there was a chance he was going to make it, then he heard and felt the foot falls approaching and stopped dead. A dark shadow fell over him and with a deep and pronounced feeling of dread, he rolled over on his back and looked up.

She was looking down at him, and Ash knew he was at her mercy. He couldn't run, even if he was well rested there was no way in hell he could outrun her. Her carton counterpart was kind, he hoped this giantess was the same in that regard.
1452322123.title: Uh Oh, Mother Bear

choices: They had come to Little Bear's house
14523222.content:
Ash realized he's on Emily's foot and as expected it was incredibly slippery, not that Ash was surprised as it was hot as blazes and human feet often were sweaty and unpleasant but still what other choice did he have? As he held on for dear life as the huge foot rose up in way too slow motion like from the Matrix

"Whoa horsey!" Ash thought as it felt like being on the world's fastest and biggest roller coaster.

then the foot went back down as he held onto the field of flesh his nails biting into the girl's very skin but fortunately Emily couldn't feel a thing as she was busy chatting to Little Bear as the sun went down

"Maybe this isn't so bad if I can keep this up without her noticing me It will be smooth sailing!"

After hours of nothing but being fling up and down the two friends finally stopped as Ash breathed a sigh of relief he was partially exhausted by this uncomfortable ride but lest it was over at long last once he detached himself from the giantess' sweaty foot he saw
14523222.title: Emily

145233.content: Who else could we see heading in that direction as well? Or heading the opposite direction?
145233.title: So, who shows up?

1452332.content:
Rusty Bear, younger brother of Father Bear causally walked up the Path from the lake. He was on his way to visit is Brother and his family. He had met his nephew at the lake, but promised to stick around until he returned from playing. It had rained a few days before and the road was still a bit muddy. No matter. The cool mud felt good against the pads of his feet.

A living mountain in the form of a grizzly bear was approaching Ash. The colossus walked on two legs. He, Ash assumed "He", wore overalls, and had a red handkerchief around his neck. He wasn't lumbering but walked as though the weight of gravity affected him no more than Ash, which was impossible for something that big. The ground beneath him shifted with each approaching step of the colossus. Instinctively, Ash ran even though his brain was telling him it was futile. His tiny legs were no match for the bear's stride.

Rusty hummed a tune as he walked, unaware that his shadow was falling upon a speck running for his life. Nor was he aware that a single footstep on his part would end that life.

He was moments from Death, He knew it. Already a shadow was falling on him. Desperately he thought 'what could he do'? He couldn't outrun the colossus, what other options did he have other than coming to a complete stop and waiting for the inevitable?

In one desperate act, Ash--
1452332.title: shadow of the colossus

14523323.content:
He didn't have a hope of getting away, but Ash never gave up. Not even when dirt and debris started raining down upon him.

Rusty hummed his tune. His eyes never glanced to the road below. If he had, he might have seen something small scurrying a step away from him. He might have even placed his foot down somewhere else to avoid stepping on the tiny thing that was running for its life. But he didn't glance down, and one colossal foot swung forward and began it's decent.

It took seconds for the wide heel to impact the ground knocking the tiny human off his feet. and less than that for the rest of the foot to follow suit. the vast main pad of the sole fell upon Ash driving him with an incredible weight into the mud.

It was the last thing he was aware of before he was aware of nothing at all. His body was instantly turned into a jelly that was partially in the mud and partially oozing into the dermal surface of the great pad. There it stayed. Becoming thinner and thinner with every step until there was nothing left.

Rusty walked on, humming to himself as he approached his brother's home. Never knowing he had extinguished a life under his broad foot.
14523323.title: Too Late

choices: Emily arrives at the lake before Ash could do anything
Emily feels something against her chest
14524.content:
As the giant child near Ash, he was about to yell out to her when suddenly the Doll she was carrying slipped from her hands. With a loud earth shaking thud it landed very close to the micro human, almost on top of him. Thinking quickly, Ash ran up to the doll and grabbed the cloth of it's dress just as Emily picked it back up.

Ash let out a yelp as he was suddenly accelerated upward. He had grabbed on just in time, If he hadn't gotten a good grip there was no doubt in his mind the he would've fallen to his death. Emily looked over her doll to see if it was dirty or damaged, overlooking the tiny fellow human hanging off the doll's dress. Satisfied that all was well. she held the Doll close to her and continued walking. Ash was pressed up against the young girl just at her diaphragm. He could hear the bellows of lungs filling with air and the sound of the powerful heart pounding behind it's cage of ribs. Ash looked up into the face of the Child. She was oblivious of the hitch hiker she'd picked up.

What would he do next? He could climb up further on the doll, or climb up the child. That would be harder. The bathing suit she wore would only allow him to climb up to her shoulder where as he had no such limit for the doll. After thinking it over, he made his decision.
14524.title: Lucy

1453.content:
He saw them approaching and his mind nearly went into a state of shock. Everything told him that the Gigantic creatures could not exist but there they were not only existing but approaching at a great speed and causing the Ground to shake with every foot fall. There were three of them. One wore a blue suit with a purple tie and brown shoes, the other slightly shorter than the first wore a pink shirt and a blue skirt with a white apron and carried a wicker basket under one arm. The last one, half the size of the second one, wore nothing at all but carried a folded checkerboard sheet.

Father Bear.

Mother Bear.

Little Bear.

"You've got to be kidding me." Ash muttered under his breath. He debated whether to run or not but decided against it. No matter how fast he ran, he knew they could walk faster and without any effort. So he decided instead to stand,scared out of his wits, and watch as the drew nearer and nearer. For a moment it looked as though one of them would pulverize him into paste under their feet but they slowed down and came to a stop. They looked down at him and made a circle around him. At first it seemed like they were preparing to capture him. Then Father Bear spoke.

"This looks like a good spot. Lets set up here."

Moments later the sheet was unfolded and dropped right down on top of Ash. Protected in a wrinkle in the Fabric he ducked and hit the ground as everything shook. Then there were other tremors as objects were placed down all around him. Not wanting to be under the sheet longer than needed the micro human made his way through the wrinkle of fabric, following it as though he were traveling through a long tunnel. He turned a corner and saw daylight. Running straight for it he almost bumped into the giant that sat at his exit. Ash stood and gazed upward in amazement at:
1453.title: The Family Picnic

14531.content:
Wearing a blue suit with a purple tie and brown shoes, Father Bear had chosen to sit with his back resting against a tree. The spot where they had chosen had been used several times before and where the picnic blanket was spread out the grass was not as tall as the grass in the surrounding area. As he watched Mother Bear unpack the food and drink, he noticed a small creature by his left hand/paw.

"Hmmm, Looks like we got a Bug at our picnic." said Father Bear. Then he started to stand "Don't worry, I'll get rid of it."

Ash stood watching as with an earth shaking rumble this mountain of a Grizzly Bear stood and nonchalantly began to lift a leather shoe wearing foot. Snapping out of his mesmerism, he cried out and started to run, aiming for the thick growth of grass so the murderous bear couldn't find him. But it may have already been too late. For even as he ran, the Dark shadow shaped like a shoe was already falling over him.
14531.title: Father Bear

choices: Ash landed inside Father Bear's shoe
Ash landed on the waist of Father Bear's pants
145311.content:
Ash was never the most fit person, but seeing the shoe of a gigantic bear descending on to him really gave in an adrenaline rush. He ran faster than ever before but it still didn't seem like enough to get away from the shoe. It was descending at astronomical speeds.

The shoe slammed on the ground and ,although Father Bear couldn't see it, missed Ash completely. Ash was sent flying through the air from the impact of the shoe. During his flight, he could see all three of the bears faces as he flipped through the air.

Suddenly, Ash landed with a heavy impact but from where he landed, he rather would've been crushed by a bear.
145311.title: Rough landing
